00183 int32_t OTCron::__trans_refill_amount       = 500;      // The number of transaction numbers Cron will grab for itself, when it gets low, before each round.
00184 int32_t OTCron::__cron_ms_between_process   = 10000;    // The number of milliseconds (ideally) between each "Cron Process" event.
00185 int32_t OTCron::__cron_max_items_per_nym    = 10; // The maximum number of cron items any given Nym can have active at the same time.

00255 // Todo: Might set ALL of these to false (so you're FORCED to set them true
00256 // in the server.cfg file.) This way you're also assured that the right data
00257 // folder was found, before you start unlocking the server messages!
00258 //
00259 
00260 // For NYM_IS_ALLOWED() to evaluate to TRUE, either the boolean value itself is set to true
00261 // (meaning, "YES any Nym is allowed..") OR (it only continues if that part fails) if the
00262 // override Nym's ID matches to the Nym ID passed in (as a const char *).
00263 //
00264 #define NYM_IS_ALLOWED(SZ_NYM_ID, BOOL_VAR_NAME)    ((OTServer::BOOL_VAR_NAME) ||  \
00265                                                     ((OTServer::GetOverrideNymID().size() > 0) && \
00266                                                      (0 == OTServer::GetOverrideNymID().compare((SZ_NYM_ID)))))
00267 
00268 // ------------------------------------------------------------
00269 // PERMISSIONS
00270 #define OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(BOOL_VAR_NAME) \
00271 { \
00272     const char * pNymAllowedIDStr   = theMessage.m_strNymID.Get(); \
00273     const char * pActionNameStr     = theMessage.m_strCommand.Get(); \
00274     \
00275     if (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(pNymAllowedIDStr, BOOL_VAR_NAME)) \
00276     { \
00277         OTLog::vOutput(0, "Nym %s attempted an action (%s), but based on server configuration, he's not allowed.\n", \
00278                        pNymAllowedIDStr, pActionNameStr); \
00279         return false; \
00280     } \
00281 }

00285 
00286 
00287 void OTServer::ActivateCron()
00288 {
00289     OTLog::vOutput(1, "OTServer::ActivateCron: %s \n", m_Cron.ActivateCron() ? "(STARTED)" : "FAILED");
00290 }
00291 
00292 
00298 void OTServer::ProcessCron()
00299 {
00300     if (!m_Cron.IsActivated())
00301         return;
00302 
00303     bool bAddedNumbers = false;
00304 
00305     // Cron requires transaction numbers in order to process.
00306     // So every time before I call Cron.Process(), I make sure to replenish first.
00307     while (m_Cron.GetTransactionCount() < OTCron::GetCronRefillAmount())
00308     {
00309         int64_t lTransNum = 0;
00310         bool bSuccess = IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lTransNum, false); // bStoreTheNumber = false
00311 
00312         if (bSuccess)
00313         {
00314             m_Cron.AddTransactionNumber(lTransNum);
00315             bAddedNumbers = true;
00316         }
00317         else
00318             break;
00319     }
00320 
00321     if (bAddedNumbers)
00322     {
00323         m_Cron.SaveCron();
00324     }
00325 
00326     m_Cron.ProcessCronItems(); // This needs to be called regularly for trades, markets, payment plans, etc to process.
00327 
00328 
00329     // NOTE:  TODO:  OTHER RE-OCCURRING SERVER FUNCTIONS CAN GO HERE AS WELL!!
00330     //
00331     // Such as sweeping server accounts after expiration dates, etc.
00332 
00333 }
00334 
00335 
00336 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00337 
00338 
00339 const OTPseudonym & OTServer::GetServerNym() const
00340 {
00341     return m_nymServer;
00342 }
00343 
00344 // Server stores a map of BASKET_ID to BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID.
00345 bool OTServer::AddBasketAccountID(const OTIdentifier & BASKET_ID, const OTIdentifier & BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID,
00346                                   const OTIdentifier & BASKET_CONTRACT_ID)
00347 {
00348     OTIdentifier theBasketAcctID;
00349 
00350     if (LookupBasketAccountID(BASKET_ID, theBasketAcctID))
00351     {
00352         OTLog::Output(0, "User attempted to add Basket that already exists.\n");
00353         return false;
00354     }
00355 
00356     OTString strBasketID(BASKET_ID), strBasketAcctID(BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID), strBasketContractID(BASKET_CONTRACT_ID);
00357 
00358     m_mapBaskets[strBasketID.Get()]                 = strBasketAcctID.Get();
00359     m_mapBasketContracts[strBasketContractID.Get()] = strBasketAcctID.Get();
00360 
00361     return true;
00362 }
00363 
00366 bool OTServer::VerifyBasketAccountID(const OTIdentifier & BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID)
00367 {
00368     // Server stores a map of BASKET_ID to BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID. Let's iterate through that map...
00369     FOR_EACH(mapOfBaskets, m_mapBaskets)
00370     {
00371         OTString strBasketAcctID    = (*it).second.c_str();
00372 
00373         OTIdentifier id_BASKET_ACCT(strBasketAcctID);
00374 
00375         if (BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID == id_BASKET_ACCT) // if the basket Acct ID passed in matches this one...
00376         {
00377             return true;
00378         }
00379     }
00380     return false;
00381 }
00382 
00385 bool OTServer::LookupBasketAccountIDByContractID(const OTIdentifier & BASKET_CONTRACT_ID, OTIdentifier & BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID)
00386 {
00387     // Server stores a map of BASKET_ID to BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID. Let's iterate through that map...
00388     FOR_EACH(mapOfBaskets, m_mapBasketContracts)
00389     {
00390         OTString strBasketContractID    = (*it).first.c_str();
00391         OTString strBasketAcctID        = (*it).second.c_str();
00392 
00393         OTIdentifier id_BASKET_CONTRACT(strBasketContractID), id_BASKET_ACCT(strBasketAcctID);
00394 
00395         if (BASKET_CONTRACT_ID == id_BASKET_CONTRACT) // if the basket contract ID passed in matches this one...
00396         {
00397             BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID = id_BASKET_ACCT;
00398             return true;
00399         }
00400     }
00401     return false;
00402 }
00403 
00404 
00407 bool OTServer::LookupBasketContractIDByAccountID(const OTIdentifier & BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID, OTIdentifier & BASKET_CONTRACT_ID)
00408 {
00409     // Server stores a map of BASKET_ID to BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID. Let's iterate through that map...
00410     FOR_EACH(mapOfBaskets, m_mapBasketContracts)
00411     {
00412         OTString strBasketContractID    = (*it).first.c_str();
00413         OTString strBasketAcctID        = (*it).second.c_str();
00414 
00415         OTIdentifier id_BASKET_CONTRACT(strBasketContractID), id_BASKET_ACCT(strBasketAcctID);
00416 
00417         if (BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID == id_BASKET_ACCT) // if the basket contract ID passed in matches this one...
00418         {
00419             BASKET_CONTRACT_ID = id_BASKET_CONTRACT;
00420             return true;
00421         }
00422     }
00423     return false;
00424 }
00425 
00426 
00429 bool OTServer::LookupBasketAccountID(const OTIdentifier & BASKET_ID, OTIdentifier & BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID)
00430 {
00431     // Server stores a map of BASKET_ID to BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID. Let's iterate through that map...
00432     FOR_EACH(mapOfBaskets, m_mapBaskets)
00433     {
00434         OTString strBasketID        = (*it).first.c_str();
00435         OTString strBasketAcctID    = (*it).second.c_str();
00436 
00437         OTIdentifier id_BASKET(strBasketID), id_BASKET_ACCT(strBasketAcctID);
00438 
00439         if (BASKET_ID == id_BASKET) // if the basket ID passed in matches this one...
00440         {
00441             BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID = id_BASKET_ACCT;
00442             return true;
00443         }
00444     }
00445     return false;
00446 }
00447 
00448 
00453 //
00454 _SharedPtr<OTAccount> OTServer::GetVoucherAccount(const OTIdentifier & ASSET_TYPE_ID)
00455 {
00456     _SharedPtr<OTAccount> pAccount;
00457     const OTIdentifier SERVER_USER_ID(m_nymServer), SERVER_ID(m_strServerID);
00458     // --------------------------------------------------
00459     bool bWasAcctCreated = false;
00460     pAccount = m_VoucherAccts.GetOrCreateAccount(m_nymServer, SERVER_USER_ID, ASSET_TYPE_ID,
00461                                                 SERVER_ID, bWasAcctCreated);
00462     if (bWasAcctCreated)
00463     {
00464         OTString strAcctID;
00465         pAccount->GetIdentifier(strAcctID);
00466         const OTString strAssetTypeID(ASSET_TYPE_ID);
00467 
00468         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::GetVoucherAccount: Successfully created voucher account ID: %s Asset Type ID: %s\n",
00469                  strAcctID.Get(), strAssetTypeID.Get());
00470 
00471         if (false == SaveMainFile())
00472         {
00473             OTLog::Error("OTServer::GetVoucherAccount: Error saving main server file containing new account ID!!\n");
00474         }
00475     }
00476     // -------------------------------
00477 
00478     return pAccount;
00479 }
00480 
00481 
00483 OTMint * OTServer::GetMint(const OTIdentifier & ASSET_TYPE_ID, int32_t nSeries) // Each asset contract has its own Mint.
00484 {
00485     OTMint * pMint = NULL;
00486 
00487     FOR_EACH(mapOfMints, m_mapMints)
00488     {
00489         pMint = (*it).second;
00490         OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pMint, "NULL mint pointer in OTServer::GetMint\n");
00491 
00492         OTIdentifier theID;
00493         pMint->GetIdentifier(theID);
00494 
00495         if ((ASSET_TYPE_ID  == theID) &&            // if the ID on the Mint matches the ID passed in
00496             (nSeries        == pMint->GetSeries())) // and the series also matches...
00497             return pMint;                           // return the pointer right here, we're done.
00498     }
00499     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
00500     // The mint isn't in memory for the series requested.
00501     const OTString ASSET_ID_STR(ASSET_TYPE_ID);
00502 
00503     OTString    strMintFilename;
00504     strMintFilename.Format("%s%s%s%s%d",
00505                            m_strServerID.Get(), OTLog::PathSeparator(),
00506                            ASSET_ID_STR.Get(), ".", nSeries);
00507 
00508     const char * szFoldername   = OTFolders::Mint().Get();
00509     const char * szFilename     = strMintFilename.Get();
00510     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
00511     pMint = OTMint::MintFactory(m_strServerID, m_strServerUserID, ASSET_ID_STR);
00512 
00513     // You cannot hash the Mint to get its ID. (The ID is a hash of the asset contract.)
00514     // Instead, you must READ the ID from the Mint file, and then compare it to the one expected
00515     // to see if they match (similar to how Account IDs are verified.)
00516 
00517     OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pMint, "Error allocating memory for Mint in OTServer::GetMint");
00518     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
00519     OTString strSeries;
00520     strSeries.Format("%s%d", ".", nSeries);
00521     //
00522     if (pMint->LoadMint(strSeries.Get()))
00523     {
00524         if (pMint->VerifyMint(m_nymServer)) // I don't verify the Mint's expiration date here, just its signature, ID, etc.
00525         {                                   // (Expiry dates are enforced on tokens during deposit--and checked against mint--
00526                                             // but expiry dates are only enforced on the Mint itself during a withdrawal.)
00527             // It's a multimap now...
00528             //m_mapMints[ASSET_ID_STR.Get()] = pMint;
00529 
00530             m_mapMints.insert ( std::pair<std::string, OTMint *>(ASSET_ID_STR.Get(), pMint) );
00531 
00532             return pMint;
00533         }
00534         else
00535         {
00536             OTLog::vError("Error verifying Mint in OTServer::GetMint:\n%s%s%s\n",
00537                           szFoldername, OTLog::PathSeparator(), szFilename);
00538         }
00539     }
00540     else
00541     {
00542         OTLog::vError("Error loading Mint in OTServer::GetMint:\n%s%s%s\n",
00543                       szFoldername, OTLog::PathSeparator(), szFilename);
00544     }
00545 
00546     if (NULL != pMint)
00547         delete pMint;
00548     pMint = NULL;
00549 
00550     return NULL;
00551 }
00552 
00553 
00579 bool OTServer::IssueNextTransactionNumber(OTPseudonym & theNym, int64_t &lTransactionNumber,
00580                                           bool bStoreTheNumber/*=true*/)
00581 {
00582     OTIdentifier NYM_ID(theNym), SERVER_NYM_ID(m_nymServer);
00583 
00584     // If theNym has the same ID as m_nymServer, then we'll use m_nymServer
00585     // instead of theNym.  (Since it's the same nym anyway, we'll stick to the
00586     // one we already loaded so any changes don't get overwritten later.)
00587     OTPseudonym * pNym = NULL;
00588 
00589     if (NYM_ID == SERVER_NYM_ID)
00590         pNym = &m_nymServer;
00591     else
00592         pNym = &theNym;
00593 
00594     // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00595 
00596     // m_lTransactionNumber stores the last VALID AND ISSUED transaction number.
00597     // So first, we increment that, since we don't want to issue the same number twice.
00598     m_lTransactionNumber++;
00599 
00600     // Next, we save it to file.
00601     if (false == SaveMainFile())
00602     {
00603         OTLog::Error("Error saving main server file.\n");
00604         m_lTransactionNumber--;
00605         return false;
00606     }
00607 
00608     // Each Nym stores the transaction numbers that have been issued to it.
00609     // (On client AND server side.)
00610     //
00611     // So whenever the server issues a new number, it's to a specific Nym, then
00612     // it is recorded in his Nym file before being sent to the client (where it
00613     // is also recorded in his Nym file.)  That way the server always knows which
00614     // numbers are valid for each Nym.
00615 
00616     else if ( bStoreTheNumber &&
00617              (false == pNym->AddTransactionNum(m_nymServer, m_strServerID, m_lTransactionNumber, true))) // bSave = true
00618     {
00619         OTLog::Error("Error adding transaction number to Nym file.\n");
00620         m_lTransactionNumber--;
00621         SaveMainFile(); // Save it back how it was, since we're not issuing this number after all.
00622         return false;
00623     }
00624 
00625     // SUCCESS?
00626     // Now the server main file has saved the latest transaction number,
00627     // and the number has been stored on the relevant nym file.
00628     // NOW we set it onto the parameter and return true.
00629     else
00630     {
00631         lTransactionNumber = m_lTransactionNumber;
00632         return true;
00633     }
00634 }
00635 
00636 
00637 
00641 bool OTServer::VerifyTransactionNumber(OTPseudonym & theNym, const int64_t &lTransactionNumber) // passed by reference for speed, but not a return value.
00642 {
00643     OTIdentifier NYM_ID(theNym), SERVER_NYM_ID(m_nymServer);
00644 
00645     // If theNym has the same ID as m_nymServer, then we'll use m_nymServer
00646     // instead of theNym.  (Since it's the same nym anyway, we'll stick to the
00647     // one we already loaded so any changes don't get overwritten later.)
00648     OTPseudonym * pNym = NULL;
00649 
00650     if (NYM_ID == SERVER_NYM_ID)
00651         pNym = &m_nymServer;
00652     else
00653         pNym = &theNym;
00654     // ---------------------------------------------------------------
00655     if (pNym->VerifyTransactionNum(m_strServerID, lTransactionNumber))
00656         return true;
00657     else
00658     {
00659         const OTString strNymID(NYM_ID);
00660         const OTString strIssued(pNym->VerifyIssuedNum(m_strServerID, lTransactionNumber) ?
00661                                  "(However, that number IS issued to that Nym... He must have already used it.)\n" :
00662                                  "(In fact, that number isn't even issued to that Nym, though perhaps it was at some time in the past?)\n");
00663 
00664         OTLog::vError("%s: %ld not available for Nym %s to use. \n%s", __FUNCTION__,
00665 //                    " Oh, and FYI, tangentially, the current Trns# counter is: %ld\n",
00666                       lTransactionNumber, strNymID.Get(), strIssued.Get());
00667 //                    m_lTransactionNumber);
00668     }
00669 
00670     return false;
00671 }
00672 
00673 
00675 bool OTServer::RemoveTransactionNumber(OTPseudonym & theNym, const int64_t &lTransactionNumber, bool bSave/*=false*/)
00676 {
00677     OTIdentifier NYM_ID(theNym), SERVER_NYM_ID(m_nymServer);
00678 
00679     // If theNym has the same ID as m_nymServer, then we'll use m_nymServer
00680     // instead of theNym.  (Since it's the same nym anyway, we'll stick to the
00681     // one we already loaded so any changes don't get overwritten later.)
00682     OTPseudonym * pNym = NULL;
00683 
00684     if (NYM_ID == SERVER_NYM_ID)
00685         pNym = &m_nymServer;
00686     else
00687         pNym = &theNym;
00688 
00689     bool bRemoved = false;
00690 
00691     if (bSave)
00692         bRemoved = pNym->RemoveTransactionNum(m_nymServer, m_strServerID, lTransactionNumber); // the version that passes in a signer nym -- saves to local storage.
00693     else
00694         bRemoved = pNym->RemoveTransactionNum(m_strServerID, lTransactionNumber); // the version that doesn't save.
00695 
00696     return bRemoved;
00697 }
00698 
00699 
00701 bool OTServer::RemoveIssuedNumber(OTPseudonym & theNym, const int64_t &lTransactionNumber, bool bSave/*=false*/)
00702 {
00703     OTIdentifier NYM_ID(theNym), SERVER_NYM_ID(m_nymServer);
00704 
00705     // If theNym has the same ID as m_nymServer, then we'll use m_nymServer
00706     // instead of theNym.  (Since it's the same nym anyway, we'll stick to the
00707     // one we already loaded so any changes don't get overwritten later.)
00708     OTPseudonym * pNym = NULL;
00709 
00710     if (NYM_ID == SERVER_NYM_ID)
00711         pNym = &m_nymServer;
00712     else
00713         pNym = &theNym;
00714 
00715     bool bRemoved = pNym->RemoveIssuedNum(m_nymServer, m_strServerID, lTransactionNumber, bSave);
00716 
00717     return bRemoved;
00718 }
00719 
00720 
00721 
00731 OTAssetContract * OTServer::GetAssetContract(const OTIdentifier & ASSET_TYPE_ID)
00732 {
00733     FOR_EACH(mapOfContracts, m_mapContracts)
00734     {
00735         OTAssetContract * pContract = (*it).second;
00736         OT_ASSERT(NULL != pContract);
00737 
00738         OTIdentifier theContractID;
00739         pContract->GetIdentifier(theContractID);
00740 
00741         if (theContractID == ASSET_TYPE_ID)
00742             return pContract;
00743     }
00744 
00745     return NULL;
00746 }
00747 
00748 
00749 
00752 //
00753 bool OTServer::AddAssetContract(OTAssetContract & theContract)
00754 {
00755     OTAssetContract * pContract = NULL;
00756 
00757     OTString STR_CONTRACT_ID; OTIdentifier CONTRACT_ID;
00758     theContract.GetIdentifier(STR_CONTRACT_ID);
00759     theContract.GetIdentifier(CONTRACT_ID);
00760 
00761     pContract = GetAssetContract(CONTRACT_ID);
00762 
00763     // already exists
00764     if (NULL != pContract) // if not null
00765         return false;
00766 
00767     m_mapContracts[STR_CONTRACT_ID.Get()] = &theContract;
00768 
00769     return true;
00770 }
00771 
00772 
00773 bool OTServer::SaveMainFileToString(OTString & strMainFile)
00774 {
00775     const char * szFunc = "OTServer::SaveMainFileToString";
00776     // ---------------------------------------------------------------
00777 
00778     strMainFile.Format("<?xml version=\"1.0\"?>\n"
00779                        "<notaryServer version=\"%s\"\n"
00780                        " serverID=\"%s\"\n"
00781                        " serverUserID=\"%s\"\n"
00782                        " transactionNum=\"%ld\" >\n\n",
00783                        OTCachedKey::It()->IsGenerated() ? "2.0" : m_strVersion.Get(),
00784                        m_strServerID.Get(),
00785                        m_strServerUserID.Get(),
00786                        m_lTransactionNumber);
00787 
00788 
00789 
00790     if (OTCachedKey::It()->IsGenerated()) // If it exists, then serialize it.
00791     {
00792         OTASCIIArmor ascMasterContents;
00793 
00794         if (OTCachedKey::It()->SerializeTo(ascMasterContents))
00795         {
00796             strMainFile.Concatenate("<cachedKey>\n%s</cachedKey>\n\n", ascMasterContents.Get());
00797         }
00798         else
00799             OTLog::vError("%s: Failed trying to write master key to notary file.\n", szFunc);
00800     }
00801     // ---------------------------------------------------------------
00802 
00803     //mapOfContracts    m_mapContracts;   // If the server needs to store copies of the asset contracts, then here they are.
00804     //mapOfMints        m_mapMints;       // Mints for each of those.
00805 
00806     // ---------------------------------------------------------------
00807 
00808     FOR_EACH(mapOfContracts, m_mapContracts)
00809     {
00810         OTContract * pContract = (*it).second;
00811         OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pContract, "NULL contract pointer in OTServer::SaveMainFile.\n");
00812 
00813         // This is like the Server's wallet.
00814         pContract->SaveContractWallet(strMainFile);
00815 
00816     }
00817 
00818     // ----------------------------------------------------------------
00819 
00820     // Save the basket account information
00821 
00822     FOR_EACH(mapOfBaskets, m_mapBaskets)
00823     {
00824         OTString strBasketID        = (*it).first.c_str();
00825         OTString strBasketAcctID    = (*it).second.c_str();
00826 
00827         const   OTIdentifier BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID(strBasketAcctID);
00828                 OTIdentifier BASKET_CONTRACT_ID;
00829 
00830         bool bContractID = LookupBasketContractIDByAccountID(BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID, BASKET_CONTRACT_ID);
00831 
00832         if (!bContractID)
00833         {
00834             OTLog::vError("%s: Error: Missing Contract ID for basket ID %s\n", szFunc,
00835                           strBasketID.Get());
00836             break;
00837         }
00838 
00839         OTString strBasketContractID(BASKET_CONTRACT_ID);
00840 
00841         strMainFile.Concatenate("<basketInfo basketID=\"%s\"\n"
00842                                 " basketAcctID=\"%s\"\n"
00843                                 " basketContractID=\"%s\" />\n\n",
00844                                 strBasketID.Get(), strBasketAcctID.Get(), strBasketContractID.Get());
00845     }
00846 
00847 
00848     m_VoucherAccts.Serialize(strMainFile);
00849 
00850 
00851     /*
00852      FOR_EACH(mapOfNyms, m_mapNyms)
00853      {
00854         OTPseudonym * pNym = (*it).second;
00855         OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pNym, "NULL pseudonym pointer in OTWallet::m_mapNyms, OTWallet::SaveWallet");
00856 
00857         pNym->SavePseudonymWallet(fl);
00858      }
00859 
00860 
00861      // ---------------------------------------------------------------
00862 
00863      FOR_EACH(mapOfServers, m_mapServers)
00864      {
00865         OTContract * pServer = (*it).second;
00866         OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pServer, "NULL server pointer in OTWallet::m_mapServers, OTWallet::SaveWallet");
00867 
00868         pServer->SaveContractWallet(fl);
00869      }
00870 
00871      // ---------------------------------------------------------------
00872      */
00873 
00874     strMainFile.Concatenate("</notaryServer>\n");
00875 
00876     return true;
00877 }
00878 
00879 
00880 
00881 
00882 // ---------------------------------------------------------------
00883 // Setup the default location for the Sever Main File...
00884 // maybe this should be set differently...
00885 // should be set in the servers configuration.
00886 //
00887 bool OTServer::SaveMainFile()
00888 {
00889     // ---------------------------------------------------------------
00890     // Get the loaded (or new) version of the Server's Main File.
00891     //
00892     OTString strMainFile;
00893 
00894     if (false == SaveMainFileToString(strMainFile))
00895     {
00896         OTLog::vError("%s: Error saving to string. (Giving up on save attempt.)\n", __FUNCTION__);
00897         return false;
00898     }
00899     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
00900     // Try to save the notary server's main datafile to local storage...
00901     //
00902     OTString strFinal;
00903     OTASCIIArmor ascTemp(strMainFile);
00904 
00905     if (false == ascTemp.WriteArmoredString(strFinal, "NOTARY")) // todo hardcoding.
00906     {
00907 
00908         OTLog::vError("%s: Error saving notary (failed writing armored string)\n", __FUNCTION__);
00909         return false;
00910     }
00911     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
00912     // Save the Main File to the Harddrive... (or DB, if other storage module is being used).
00913     //
00914     const bool bSaved = OTDB::StorePlainString(strFinal.Get(),".", m_strWalletFilename.Get());
00915 
00916     if (!bSaved)  // Check if successfull.
00917         OTLog::vError("%s: Error saving main file: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, m_strWalletFilename.Get());
00918 
00919     return bSaved;
00920 }
00921 
00922 
00923 
00924 
00925 // TODO: da2ce7 put a bunch of hardcoded numbers in here. These need to be changed
00926 // to use preprocessor defines.
00927 //
00928 bool OTServer::LoadConfigFile()
00929 {
00930     const char * szFunc = "OTServer::LoadConfigFile()";
00931 
00932     // Setup Config File
00933     OTString strConfigFolder, strConfigFilename;
00934 
00935     if (!OTDataFolder::IsInitialized()) { OT_FAIL; };
00936 
00937     // Create Config Object (OTSettings)
00938     OTString strConfigFilePath="";
00939     if (!OTDataFolder::GetConfigFilePath(strConfigFilePath)) { OT_FAIL; };
00940     OTSettings * p_Config = NULL;
00941     p_Config = new OTSettings(strConfigFilePath);
00942 
00943     // First Load, Create new fresh config file if failed loading.
00944     if (!p_Config -> Load())
00945     {
00946         OTLog::vOutput(0,"%s: Note: Unable to Load Config. Creating a new file: %s\n", szFunc, strConfigFilename.Get());
00947         if (!p_Config -> Reset()) return false;
00948         if (!p_Config -> Save() ) return false;
00949     }
00950 
00951     if (!p_Config -> Reset()) return false;
00952 
00953     // Second Load, Throw Assert if Failed loading.
00954     if (!p_Config -> Load())
00955     {
00956         OTLog::vError(0,"%s: Error: Unable to load config file: %s It should exist, as we just saved it!\n", szFunc, strConfigFilename.Get());
00957         OT_FAIL;
00958     }
00959 
00960 
00961     // ---------------------------------------------
00962     // LOG LEVEL
00963     {
00964         bool bIsNewKey;
00965         int64_t lValue;
00966         p_Config->CheckSet_long("logging","log_level",0,lValue,bIsNewKey);
00967         OTLog::SetLogLevel(static_cast<int32_t> (lValue));
00968     }
00969 
00970 
00971     // ---------------------------------------------
00972     // WALLET
00973 
00974     // WALLET FILENAME
00975     //
00976     // Clean and Set
00977     {
00978         bool bIsNewKey;
00979         OTString strValue;
00980         p_Config->CheckSet_str("wallet","wallet_filename",SERVER_WALLET_FILENAME,strValue,bIsNewKey);
00981         m_strWalletFilename.Set(strValue);
00982         OTLog::vOutput(0,"Using Wallet: %s\n",strValue.Get());
00983     }
00984 
00985     // ---------------------------------------------
00986     // CRON
00987     {
00988         const char * szComment =
00989         ";; CRON  (regular events like market trades and smart contract clauses)\n";
00990 
00991         bool b_SectionExist;
00992         p_Config->CheckSetSection("cron",szComment,b_SectionExist);
00993     }
00994 
00995     {
00996         const char * szComment =
00997         "; refill_trans_number is the count of transaction numbers cron will grab for itself,\n"
00998         "; whenever its supply is getting low.  If it ever drops below 20% of this count\n"
00999         "; while in the middle of processing, it will put a WARNING into your server log.\n";
01000 
01001         bool bIsNewKey;
01002         int64_t lValue;
01003         p_Config->CheckSet_long("cron","refill_trans_number",500,lValue,bIsNewKey,szComment);
01004         OTCron::SetCronRefillAmount(static_cast<int32_t>(lValue));
01005     }
01006 
01007     {
01008         const char * szComment =
01009         "; ms_between_cron_beats is the number of milliseconds before Cron processes\n"
01010         "; (all the trades, all the smart contracts, etc every 10 seconds.)\n";
01011 
01012         bool bIsNewKey;
01013         int64_t lValue;
01014         p_Config->CheckSet_long("cron","ms_between_cron_beats",10000,lValue,bIsNewKey,szComment);
01015         OTCron::SetCronMsBetweenProcess(static_cast<int32_t>(lValue));
01016     }
01017 
01018     {
01019         const char * szComment =
01020         "; max_items_per_nym is the number of cron items (such as market offers or payment\n"
01021         "; plans) that any given Nym is allowed to have live and active at the same time.\n";
01022 
01023         bool bIsNewKey;
01024         int64_t lValue;
01025         p_Config->CheckSet_long("cron","max_items_per_nym",10,lValue,bIsNewKey,szComment);
01026         OTCron::SetCronMaxItemsPerNym(static_cast<int32_t>(lValue));
01027     }
01028 
01029     // -----------------------------------
01030     // HEARTBEAT
01031 
01032     {
01033         const char * szComment =
01034         ";; HEARTBEAT\n";
01035 
01036         bool bSectionExist;
01037         p_Config->CheckSetSection("heartbeat",szComment,bSectionExist);
01038     }
01039 
01040     {
01041         const char * szComment =
01042         "; no_requests is the number of client requests the server processes per heartbeat.\n";
01043 
01044         bool bIsNewKey;
01045         int64_t lValue;
01046         p_Config->CheckSet_long("heartbeat","no_requests",10,lValue,bIsNewKey,szComment);
01047         OTServer::SetHeartbeatNoRequests(static_cast<int32_t>(lValue));
01048     }
01049 
01050     {
01051         const char * szComment =
01052         "; ms_between_beats is the number of milliseconds between each heartbeat.\n";
01053 
01054         bool bIsNewKey;
01055         int64_t lValue;
01056         p_Config->CheckSet_long("heartbeat","ms_between_beats",100,lValue,bIsNewKey,szComment);
01057         OTServer::SetHeartbeatMsBetweenBeats(static_cast<int32_t>(lValue));
01058     }
01059 
01060 
01061     // ----------------------------------------------------------------
01062     // PERMISSIONS
01063 
01064     {
01065         const char * szComment =
01066             ";; PERMISSIONS\n"
01067             ";; You can deactivate server functions here by setting them to false.\n"
01068             ";; (Even if you do, override_nym_id will STILL be able to do those functions.)\n";
01069 
01070         bool bSectionExists;
01071         p_Config->CheckSetSection("permissions",szComment,bSectionExists);
01072     }
01073 
01074     {
01075         OTString strValue;
01076         const char * szValue;
01077 
01078         std::string stdstrValue = OTServer::GetOverrideNymID();
01079         szValue = stdstrValue.c_str();
01080 
01081         bool bIsNewKey;
01082 
01083         if (NULL == szValue)
01084             p_Config->CheckSet_str("permissions","override_nym_id",NULL,strValue,bIsNewKey);
01085         else
01086             p_Config->CheckSet_str("permissions","override_nym_id",szValue,strValue,bIsNewKey);
01087 
01088         OTServer::SetOverrideNymID(strValue.Get());
01089     }
01090 
01091     // ---------------------------------------------
01092     // MARKETS
01093 
01094     {
01095     const char * szComment =
01096         "; minimum_scale is the smallest allowed power-of-ten for the scale, for any market.\n"
01097         "; (1oz, 10oz, 100oz, 1000oz.)\n";
01098 
01099     bool bIsNewKey;
01100     int64_t lValue;
01101     p_Config -> CheckSet_long("markets","minimum_scale",GetMinMarketScale(),lValue,bIsNewKey,szComment);
01102     this->SetMinMarketScale(lValue);
01103     }
01104 
01105     // ---------------------------------------------
01106     // SECURITY (beginnings of..)
01107 
01108     // Master Key Timeout
01109     {
01110         const char * szComment =
01111             "; master_key_timeout is how int64_t the master key will be in memory until a thread wipes it out.\n"
01112             "; 0   : means you have to type your password EVERY time OT uses a private key. (Even multiple times in a single function.)\n"
01113             "; 300 : means you only have to type it once per 5 minutes.\n"
01114             "; -1  : means you only type it once PER RUN (popular for servers.)\n";
01115 
01116         bool bIsNewKey;
01117         int64_t lValue;
01118         p_Config->CheckSet_long("security","master_key_timeout",SERVER_MASTER_KEY_TIMEOUT_DEFAULT,lValue,bIsNewKey,szComment);
01119         OTCachedKey::It()->SetTimeoutSeconds(static_cast<int32_t>(lValue));
01120     }
01121 
01122     // Use System Keyring
01123     {
01124         bool bIsNewKey;
01125         bool bValue;
01126         p_Config->CheckSet_bool("security","use_system_keyring",SERVER_USE_SYSTEM_KEYRING,bValue,bIsNewKey);
01127         OTCachedKey::It()->UseSystemKeyring(bValue);
01128 
01129 
01130 #if defined(OT_KEYRING_FLATFILE)
01131         // Is there a password folder? (There shouldn't be, but we allow it...)
01132         //
01133         if (bValue)
01134         {
01135             bool bIsNewKey2;
01136             OTString strValue;
01137             p_Config->CheckSet_str("security","password_folder",SERVER_PASSWORD_FOLDER,strValue,bIsNewKey2);
01138             if (strValue.Exists())
01139             {
01140                 OTKeyring::FlatFile_SetPasswordFolder(strValue.Get());
01141                 OTLog::vOutput(0," Using server password folder: %s\n",strValue.Get());
01142             }
01143         }
01144 #endif
01145     }
01146 
01147     // ---------------------------------------------
01148     // (#defined right above this function.)
01149     //
01150 
01151     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "admin_usage_credits",      __admin_usage_credits);
01152     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "admin_server_locked",      __admin_server_locked);
01153     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_usage_credits",        __cmd_usage_credits);
01154     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_issue_asset",          __cmd_issue_asset);
01155     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_get_contract",         __cmd_get_contract);
01156     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_check_server_id",      __cmd_check_server_id);
01157     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_create_user_acct",     __cmd_create_user_acct);
01158     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_del_user_acct",        __cmd_del_user_acct);
01159     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_check_user",           __cmd_check_user);
01160     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_get_request",          __cmd_get_request);
01161     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_get_trans_num",        __cmd_get_trans_num);
01162     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_send_message",         __cmd_send_message);
01163     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_get_nymbox",           __cmd_get_nymbox);
01164     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_process_nymbox",       __cmd_process_nymbox);
01165     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_create_asset_acct",    __cmd_create_asset_acct);
01166     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_del_asset_acct",       __cmd_del_asset_acct);
01167     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_get_acct",             __cmd_get_acct);
01168     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_get_inbox",            __cmd_get_inbox);
01169     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_get_outbox",           __cmd_get_outbox);
01170     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_process_inbox",        __cmd_process_inbox);
01171     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_issue_basket",         __cmd_issue_basket);
01172     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "transact_exchange_basket", __transact_exchange_basket);
01173     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_notarize_transaction", __cmd_notarize_transaction);
01174     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "transact_process_inbox",   __transact_process_inbox);
01175     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "transact_transfer",        __transact_transfer);
01176     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "transact_withdrawal",      __transact_withdrawal);
01177     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "transact_deposit",         __transact_deposit);
01178     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "transact_withdraw_voucher",__transact_withdraw_voucher);
01179     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "transact_pay_dividend",    __transact_pay_dividend);
01180     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "transact_deposit_cheque",  __transact_deposit_cheque);
01181     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_get_mint",             __cmd_get_mint);
01182     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "transact_withdraw_cash",   __transact_withdraw_cash);
01183     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "transact_deposit_cash",    __transact_deposit_cash);
01184     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_get_market_list",      __cmd_get_market_list);
01185     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_get_market_offers",    __cmd_get_market_offers);
01186     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_get_market_recent_trades",__cmd_get_market_recent_trades);
01187     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_get_nym_market_offers",__cmd_get_nym_market_offers);
01188     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "transact_market_offer",    __transact_market_offer);
01189     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "transact_payment_plan",    __transact_payment_plan);
01190     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "transact_cancel_cron_item",__transact_cancel_cron_item);
01191     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "transact_smart_contract",  __transact_smart_contract);
01192     p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "cmd_trigger_clause",       __cmd_trigger_clause);
01193 
01194     // Done Loading... Lets save any changes...
01195     if (!p_Config -> Save())
01196     {
01197         OTLog::vError("%s: Error! Unable to save updated Config!!!\n",szFunc);
01198         OT_FAIL;
01199     }
01200 
01201     // Finsihed Saving... now lets cleanup!
01202     if (!p_Config -> Reset()) return false;
01203 
01204     if (NULL != p_Config) delete p_Config;
01205     p_Config = NULL;
01206 
01207     return true;
01208 }
01209 
01210 // -----------------------------------------------------
01211 
01212 
01213 OTServer::OTServer() : m_bReadOnly(false), m_bShutdownFlag(false), m_pServerContract(NULL), m_lTransactionNumber(0)
01214 {
01215 //  m_lTransactionNumber = 0;   // This will be set when the server main xml file is loaded. For now, initialize to 0.
01216 //
01217 //  m_bShutdownFlag = false;    // If I ever set this to true, then the caller will shutdown gracefully.
01218 // (Caller must regularly check the flag and shutdown when it sees the change.)
01219 }
01220 
01221 
01222 OTServer::~OTServer()
01223 {
01224     Release_Server();
01225 }
01226 
01227 // -----------------------------------------------------
01228 
01229 void OTServer::Release_Server()
01230 {
01231     // -------------------------------
01232     if (NULL == m_pServerContract)
01233         delete m_pServerContract;
01234     m_pServerContract = NULL;
01235     // -------------------------------
01236     // Erase various dynamically-allocated objects...
01237     // (asset contracts, and mints, for example.)
01238     //
01239     while (m_mapContracts.size() > 0)
01240     {
01241         mapOfContracts::iterator it = m_mapContracts.begin();
01242         OTAssetContract * pContract = (*it).second;
01243         OT_ASSERT(NULL != pContract);
01244         // --------------------------
01245         m_mapContracts.erase(it);
01246         // --------------------------
01247         delete pContract;
01248         pContract = NULL;
01249     }
01250     // -------------------------------
01251     // Mints...
01252     //
01253     while (m_mapMints.size() > 0)
01254     {
01255         mapOfMints::iterator it = m_mapMints.begin();
01256         OTMint * pMint = (*it).second;
01257         OT_ASSERT(NULL != pMint);
01258         // --------------------------
01259         m_mapMints.erase(it);
01260         // --------------------------
01261         delete pMint;
01262         pMint = NULL;
01263     }
01264     // -------------------------------------------------------
01265     // PID -- Set it to 0 in the lock file so the next time we run OT, it knows there isn't
01266     // another copy already running (otherwise we might wind up with two copies trying to write
01267     // to the same data folder simultaneously, which could corrupt the data...)
01268     //
01269 //    OTLog::vError("m_strDataPath: %s\n", m_strDataPath.Get());
01270 //    OTLog::vError("SERVER_PID_FILENAME: %s\n", SERVER_PID_FILENAME);
01271 
01272     OTString strDataPath;
01273     const bool bGetDataFolderSuccess = OTDataFolder::Get(strDataPath);
01274     // ----------------------------------------------
01275     if (!m_bReadOnly && bGetDataFolderSuccess)
01276     {
01277         OTString strPIDPath;
01278         OTPaths::AppendFile(strPIDPath, strDataPath, SERVER_PID_FILENAME);
01279 
01280         uint32_t the_pid = 0;
01281 
01282         std::ofstream pid_outfile(strPIDPath.Get());
01283 
01284         if (pid_outfile.is_open())
01285         {
01286             pid_outfile << the_pid;
01287             pid_outfile.close();
01288         }
01289         else
01290             OTLog::vError("Failed trying to open data locking file (to wipe PID back to 0): %s\n",
01291                           strPIDPath.Get());
01292     }
01293 }
01294 
01295 
01296 
01297 void OTServer::Release()
01298 {
01299     Release_Server();
01300 
01301     // ot_super::Release() call would normally go here, if we had a super class.
01302 }
01303 
01304 // -----------------------------------------------------
01305 
01306 // Loads the config file,
01307 // Initializes OTDB:: default storage,
01308 // Sets up the data folders,
01309 // Loads the main file,
01310 // and validates the server ID (for the Nym)
01311 //
01312 void OTServer::Init(bool bReadOnly/*=false*/)
01313 {
01314     // -------------------------------------------------------
01315     if (!OTDataFolder::IsInitialized()) { OTLog::vError("%s: Unable to Init data folders", __FUNCTION__); OT_FAIL; };
01316     if (!this->LoadConfigFile())        { OTLog::vError("%s: Unable to Load Config File!", __FUNCTION__); OT_FAIL; };
01317     // -------------------------------------------------------
01318     m_bReadOnly = bReadOnly;
01319     // -------------------------------------------------------
01320     // Server Data Path
01321     OTString strDataPath;
01322     const bool bGetDataFolderSuccess = OTDataFolder::Get(strDataPath);
01323     // -------------------------------------------------------
01324     // PID -- Make sure we're not running two copies of OT on the same data simultaneously here.
01325     //
01326     if (bGetDataFolderSuccess)
01327     {
01328         // If we want to WRITE to the data location, then we can't be in read-only
01329         // mode, and there can't be another copy running at the same time.
01330         //
01331         if (!bReadOnly)
01332         {
01333             // 1. READ A FILE STORING THE PID. (It will already exist, if OT is already running.)
01334             //
01335             // We open it for reading first, to see if it already exists. If it does,
01336             // we read the number. 0 is fine, since we overwrite with 0 on shutdown. But
01337             // any OTHER number means OT is still running. Or it means it was killed while
01338             // running and didn't shut down properly, and that you need to delete the pid file
01339             // by hand before running OT again. (This is all for the purpose of preventing two
01340             // copies of OT running at the same time and corrupting the data folder.)
01341             //
01342             OTString strPIDPath;
01343             OTPaths::AppendFile(strPIDPath,strDataPath,SERVER_PID_FILENAME);
01344 
01345             std::ifstream pid_infile(strPIDPath.Get());
01346 
01347             // 2. (IF FILE EXISTS WITH ANY PID INSIDE, THEN DIE.)
01348             //
01349             if (pid_infile.is_open()) // it existed already
01350             {
01351                 uint32_t old_pid = 0;
01352                 pid_infile >> old_pid;
01353                 pid_infile.close();
01354 
01355                 // There was a real PID in there.
01356                 if (old_pid != 0)
01357                 {
01358                     const uint64_t lPID = old_pid;
01359                     OTLog::vError("\n\n\nIS OPEN-TRANSACTIONS ALREADY RUNNING?\n\n"
01360                                   "I found a PID (%llu) in the data lock file, located at: %s\n\n"
01361                                   "If the OT process with PID %llu is truly not running anymore, "
01362                                   "then just ERASE THAT FILE and then RESTART.\n", lPID, strPIDPath.Get(), lPID);
01363                     exit(-1);
01364                 }
01365                 // Otherwise, though the file existed, the PID within was 0.
01366                 // (Meaning the previous instance of OT already set it to 0 as it was shutting down.)
01367             }
01368             // Next let's record our PID to the same file, so other copies of OT can't trample on US.
01369 
01370             // 3. GET THE CURRENT (ACTUAL) PROCESS ID.
01371             //
01372             uint64_t the_pid = 0;
01373 
01374 #ifdef _WIN32
01375             the_pid = GetCurrentProcessId();
01376 #else
01377             the_pid = getpid();
01378 #endif
01379 
01380             // 4. OPEN THE FILE IN WRITE MODE, AND SAVE THE PID TO IT.
01381             //
01382             std::ofstream pid_outfile(strPIDPath.Get());
01383 
01384             if (pid_outfile.is_open())
01385             {
01386                 pid_outfile << the_pid;
01387                 pid_outfile.close();
01388             }
01389             else
01390                 OTLog::vError("Failed trying to open data locking file (to store PID %llu): %s\n",
01391                               the_pid, strPIDPath.Get());
01392         }
01393     }
01394     // -------------------------------------------------------
01395     OTDB::InitDefaultStorage(OTDB_DEFAULT_STORAGE,OTDB_DEFAULT_PACKER);
01396 //  bool bSuccessInitDefault =
01397     //OTDB::InitDefaultStorage(OTDB_DEFAULT_STORAGE, OTDB_DEFAULT_PACKER,SERVER_MAIN_FILENAME);
01398     // -------------------------------------------------------
01399 
01400 
01401     // -------------------------------------------------------
01402     // Load up the transaction number and other OTServer data members.
01403     //
01404     bool bMainFileExists = m_strWalletFilename.Exists() ? OTDB::Exists(".", m_strWalletFilename.Get()) : false;
01405 
01406     if (!bMainFileExists)
01407     {
01408         if (bReadOnly)
01409         {
01410             OTLog::vError("%s: Error: Main file non-existent (%s). "
01411                           "Plus, unable to create, since read-only flag is set.\n",
01412                           __FUNCTION__,
01413                           m_strWalletFilename.Get());
01414             OT_FAIL;  // end execution here.
01415         }
01416         else
01417             bMainFileExists = CreateMainFile();
01418     }
01419     // -----------------------------------
01420     if (bMainFileExists)
01421     {
01422         if (!LoadMainFile(bReadOnly))
01423         {
01424             OTLog::vError("\n%s: Error in Loading Main File!\n", __FUNCTION__);
01425             OT_FAIL;  // end execution here.
01426         }
01427 
01428         // We just want to call this function once in order to make sure that the
01429         // Nym is loaded up and ready for use decrypting messages that are sent to it.
01430         // If you comment this out, the server will be unable to decrypt and open envelopes.
01431         if (!ValidateServerIDfromUser(m_strServerID))
01432         {
01433             OTLog::vError("\n%s: Error in Validation of ServerID from User!\n", __FUNCTION__);
01434             OT_FAIL;  // end execution here.
01435         }
01436     }
01437 
01438     // With the Server's private key loaded, and the latest transaction number loaded,
01439     // and all the various other data (contracts, etc) the server is now ready for operation!
01440 }
01441 // -----------------------------------------------------
01442 
01443 
01444 
01445 bool OTServer::LoadServerUserAndContract()
01446 {
01447     const char *szFunc = "OTServer::LoadServerUserAndContract";
01448     bool bSuccess      = false;
01449     // -----------------------------------------
01450     OT_ASSERT(m_strVersion.Exists());
01451     OT_ASSERT(m_strServerID.Exists());
01452     OT_ASSERT(m_strServerUserID.Exists());
01453     // -----------------------------------------
01454     //
01455     m_nymServer.SetIdentifier(m_strServerUserID);
01456 
01457     if (!m_nymServer.Loadx509CertAndPrivateKey(false))
01458     {
01459         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Error loading server certificate and keys.\n", szFunc);
01460     }
01461     else if (!m_nymServer.VerifyPseudonym())
01462     {
01463         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Error verifying server nym.\n", szFunc);
01464     }
01465     else
01466     {
01467         // This file will be saved during the course of operation
01468         // Just making sure it is loaded up first.
01469         //
01470         bool bLoadedSignedNymfile = m_nymServer.LoadSignedNymfile(m_nymServer);
01471         OT_ASSERT_MSG(bLoadedSignedNymfile, "ASSERT: OTServer::LoadServerUserAndContract: m_nymServer.LoadSignedNymfile(m_nymServer)\n");
01472 //      m_nymServer.SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer); // Uncomment this if you want to create the file. NORMALLY LEAVE IT OUT!!!! DANGEROUS!!!
01473 
01474         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Loaded server certificate and keys.\nNext, loading Cron...\n", szFunc);
01475         // ----------------------------------------------------------------
01476         // Load Cron (now that we have the server Nym.
01477         // (I WAS loading this erroneously in Server.Init(), before
01478         // the Nym had actually been loaded from disk. That didn't work.)
01479         //
01480         const OTIdentifier SERVER_ID(m_strServerID);
01481 
01482         // Make sure the Cron object has a pointer to the server's Nym.
01483         // (For signing stuff...)
01484         //
01485         m_Cron.SetServerID(SERVER_ID);
01486         m_Cron.SetServerNym(&m_nymServer);
01487 
01488         if (!m_Cron.LoadCron())
01489             OTLog::vError("%s: Failed loading Cron file. (Did you just create this server?)\n", szFunc);
01490         // ----------------------------------------------------------------
01491         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Loading the server contract...\n", szFunc);
01492 
01493         // We have the serverID, so let's load  up the server Contract!
01494         OTString strContractPath(OTFolders::Contract().Get());
01495 
01496         OTServerContract * pContract = new OTServerContract(m_strServerID, strContractPath, m_strServerID, m_strServerID);
01497         OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pContract, "ASSERT while allocating memory for main Server Contract in OTServer::LoadServerUserAndContract\n");
01498 
01499         if (pContract->LoadContract())
01500         {
01501             if (pContract->VerifyContract())
01502             {
01503                 OTLog::Output(0, "\n** Main Server Contract Verified **\n");
01504                 m_pServerContract = pContract;
01505                 bSuccess          = true;
01506             }
01507             else
01508             {
01509                 delete pContract; pContract = NULL;
01510                 OTLog::Output(0, "\nMain Server Contract FAILED to verify.\n");
01511             }
01512         }
01513         else
01514         {
01515             delete pContract; pContract = NULL;
01516             OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n%s: Failed reading Main Server Contract:\n%s\n", szFunc,
01517                            strContractPath.Get());
01518         }
01519     }
01520 
01521     return bSuccess;
01522 }
01523 
01524 
01525 
01526 
01527 // -------------------------
01528 // Reads from cin until Newline.
01529 //
01530 std::string OT_CLI_ReadLine()
01531 {
01532     std::string line;
01533     if (std::getline(std::cin, line))
01534     {
01535         return line;
01536     }
01537 
01538     return "";
01539 }
01540 
01541 
01542 // -------------------------
01543 // Reads from cin until EOF. (Or until the ~ character as the first character on a line.)
01544 //
01545 std::string OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF()
01546 {
01547     // don't skip the whitespace while reading
01548     //  std::cin >> std::noskipws;
01549 
01550     //  std::ostringstream oss;
01551     //
01552     //  oss << std::cin;   // Convert value into a string.
01553     //  s = outs.str();
01554 
01555     // use stream iterators to copy the stream to a string
01556     //  std::istream_iterator<std::string> it(std::cin);
01557     //  std::istream_iterator<std::string> end;
01558     //  std::istream_iterator<char> it(std::cin);
01559     //  std::istream_iterator<char> end;
01560     //  std::string results(it, end);
01561 
01562     //  int32_t onechar;
01563 
01564     std::string result("");
01565 
01566     for (;;)
01567     {
01568         std::string input_line("");
01569 
01570         // -----
01571         //        int32_t n;
01573         //        std::stringstream ssn;
01574         //
01575         //        std::getline(std::cin, input_line);
01576         //        ssn << input_line;
01577         //        ssn >> n;
01578         // -----
01579 
01580         //          std::getline(std::cin, input_line, '\n');
01581         if (std::getline(std::cin, input_line, '\n'))
01582         {
01583             input_line += "\n";
01584 
01585             if (input_line[0] == '~') // This is our special "break" character for multi-line input.
01586                 break;
01587 
01588             result += input_line;
01589         }
01590         else
01591         {
01592             OTLog::Error("OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF: getline() was unable to read a string from std::cin\n");
01593             break;
01594         }
01595         // ---------------------------------
01596         if (std::cin.eof() )
01597         {
01598             //          cout << "IT WAS EOF\n";
01599             std::cin.clear();
01600             break;
01601         }
01602         if (std::cin.fail() )
01603         {
01604             //          cout << "IT WAS FAIL\n";
01605             std::cin.clear();
01606             break;
01607         }
01608         if (std::cin.bad())
01609         {
01610             //          cout << "IT WAS BAD\n";
01611             std::cin.clear();
01612             break;
01613         }
01614         // ---------------------------------
01615         //      std::cin.clear();
01616         //      std::cin.ignore(std::numeric_limits<std::streamsize>::max(), '\n');
01617 
01618     } // while
01619 
01620 
01621     return result;
01622 
01623 }
01624 
01625 
01626 bool OTServer::CreateMainFile()
01627 {
01628     const char * szInstructions =
01629         "\n\n ==> WARNING: Main file not found. To create it, continue this process now...\n\n"
01630         "REQUIREMENTS: You must already have a wallet, where you have created one Nym.\n"
01631         "This will be a temporary wallet only, for the purpose of generating the server\n"
01632         "nym and the master key for that server nym. You can erase the contents of the\n"
01633         "~/.ot/client_data folder once we are done with this process, and the OT client\n"
01634         "will just create a fresh wallet to replace it. In other words, don't continue\n"
01635         "to use the temporary wallet as a REAL wallet, since it contains the master\n"
01636         "key and private key for your new server nym. We're using a temporary client-side\n"
01637         "wallet for the convenience of generating the server nym--we'll copy it over to \n"
01638         "the server side, and then we'll wipe the temp wallet and start with a fresh one\n"
01639         "once this process is done.\n"
01640         "(FYI, you can decode an armored wallet by using the 'opentxs decode' command.)\n"
01641         "-- You must also have the new Server Nym's \"NymID\", which should be found in the\nwallet.\n"
01642         "-- When you have created your server Nym (using your temp wallet) you will want to\n"
01643         "copy the credentials from the temp wallet to your new server:\n"
01644         "    cp -R ~/.ot/client_data/credentials ~/.ot/server_data/ \n"
01645         "-- You must already have a signed server contract. (*** To get one, copy the\n"
01646         "UNSIGNED version of the sample server contract, which is named 'localhost.xml',\n"
01647         "and then change the tags as you see fit. Then use the same Nym, the server Nym,\n"
01648         "to sign the server contract, via the 'opentxs newserver' command.***)\n"
01649         "You must also have the server ID for the above contract, which the newserver\n"
01650         "command will output at the same time it outputs the newly-signed server contract.\n"
01651         "=> Note that the Nym who signs the server contract MUST be the same Nym that you\n"
01652         "provide HERE, for this process now...)\n"
01653         "-- Finally, you must provide the cached key from the same wallet where you brought\n"
01654         "the Nym from (In this case, be careful to only copy the base64-encoded portion\n"
01655         "of the cached key from the wallet, and not the XML tags around it!) We\n"
01656         "recommend you create a blank wallet entirely for this purpose (of generating\n"
01657         "that cached key and server Nym, to be used for your new OT server.) Then erase it\nonce this process is done.\n"
01658         " ==> WARNING: Main file not found. To create it, continue this process now...\n";
01659 
01660     OTLog::Output(0, szInstructions);
01661     // ---------------------------------
01662     OTLog::Output(0, "Enter the ServerID for your server contract: ");
01663     std::string strServerID = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
01664     // ---------------------------------
01665     OTLog::Output(0, "Enter the Server User ID (the NymID of the Nym who signed the server contract): ");
01666     std::string strNymID = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
01667     // ---------------------------------
01668     OTLog::Output(0, "Paste the cached key (ONLY the base64-encoded portion) below, from wallet.xml for that Nym.\n"
01669                   "Terminate with '~' on a line by itself.\n\n");
01670 
01671     std::string strCachedKey = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
01672     // ---------------------------------
01673     OTLog::Output(0, "Paste the contents of the server Nym's certfile, including public/PRIVATE, below.\n"
01674                   "NOTE: LEAVE THIS BLANK unless you REALLY want to use the OLD system. If you leave this\n"
01675                   "blank (preferred), it will instead use the new credentials system. (Just make sure\n"
01676                   "you copied over the \"credentials\" folder, as described above, since we're about to\n"
01677                   "use it, if you leave this blank.)\n"
01678                   "Terminate with '~' on a line by itself.\n\n");
01679 
01680     std::string strCert = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
01681     // ---------------------------------
01682     // signed server contract
01683     OTLog::Output(0, "Paste the complete, signed, server contract below. (You must already have it.)\n"
01684                   "Terminate with '~' on a line by itself.\n\n");
01685 
01686     std::string strContract = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
01687     // ---------------------------------
01688     if (!OTDB::StorePlainString(strContract, "contracts", strServerID))
01689     {
01690         OTLog::Error("Failed trying to store the server contract.\n");
01691         return false;
01692     }
01693     // ---------------------------------
01694     if ((strCert.size()) > 0 && !OTDB::StorePlainString(strCert, "certs", strNymID))
01695     {
01696         OTLog::Error("Failed trying to store the server Nym's public/private cert.\n");
01697         return false;
01698     }
01699     // ---------------------------------
01700     const char * szBlankFile = // todo hardcoding.
01701         "<?xml version=\"1.0\"?>\n"
01702         "<notaryServer version=\"2.0\"\n"
01703         " serverID=\"%s\"\n"
01704         " serverUserID=\"%s\"\n"
01705         " transactionNum=\"%ld\" >\n"
01706         "\n"
01707         "<cachedKey>\n"
01708         "%s</cachedKey>\n"
01709         "\n"
01710         "<accountList type=\"voucher\" count=\"0\" >\n"
01711         "\n"
01712         "</accountList>\n"
01713         "\n"
01714         "</notaryServer>\n\n"
01715         ;
01716 
01717     const int64_t lTransNum = 5; // a starting point, for the new server.
01718 
01719     OTString strNotaryFile;
01720     strNotaryFile.Format(szBlankFile,
01721                          strServerID.c_str(),
01722                          strNymID.c_str(),
01723                          lTransNum,
01724                          strCachedKey.c_str());
01725 
01726     std::string str_Notary(strNotaryFile.Get());
01727 
01728     if (!OTDB::StorePlainString(str_Notary, ".", "notaryServer.xml")) // todo hardcoding.
01729     {
01730         OTLog::Error("Failed trying to store the new notaryServer.xml file.\n");
01731         return false;
01732     }
01733     // ---------------------------------------------------------------
01734     OTASCIIArmor ascCachedKey;
01735     ascCachedKey.Set(strCachedKey.c_str());
01736     OTCachedKey::It()->SetCachedKey(ascCachedKey);
01737 
01738     if (!OTCachedKey::It()->HasHashCheck())
01739     {
01740         OTPassword tempPassword; tempPassword.zeroMemory();
01741         _SharedPtr<OTCachedKey> sharedPtr(OTCachedKey::It());
01742         sharedPtr->GetMasterPassword(sharedPtr, tempPassword,
01743                                      "We do not have a check hash yet for this password, "
01744                                      "please enter your password", true);
01745         if (!SaveMainFile())
01746         {
01747             OT_FAIL;
01748         }
01749     }
01750     // ---------------------------------------------------------------
01751     // At this point, the contract is saved, the cert is saved, and the notaryServer.xml file
01752     // is saved. All we have left is the Nymfile, which we'll create.
01753 
01754     const OTString strServerUserID(strNymID.c_str());
01755 
01756     m_nymServer.SetIdentifier(strServerUserID);
01757 
01758     if (!m_nymServer.Loadx509CertAndPrivateKey())
01759     {
01760         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Error loading server credentials, or certificate and private key.\n", __FUNCTION__);
01761     }
01762     else if (!m_nymServer.VerifyPseudonym())
01763     {
01764         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Error verifying server nym. Are you sure you have the right ID?\n", __FUNCTION__);
01765     }
01766     else if (!m_nymServer.SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer))
01767     {
01768         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Error saving new nymfile for server nym.\n", __FUNCTION__);
01769     }
01770     else
01771     {
01772         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: OKAY, we have apparently created the new server. Remember to erase the contents "
01773                        "of your ~/.ot/client_data folder, since we used a temporary wallet to generate the server "
01774                        "nym and its master key.\n"
01775                        "Let's try to load up your new server contract...\n", __FUNCTION__);
01776         return true;
01777     }
01778 
01779     return false;
01780 }
01781 
01782 
01783 /*
01784 
01785     {
01786         OTASCIIArmor ascMasterContents;
01787 
01788         if (OTCachedKey::It()->SerializeTo(ascMasterContents))
01789         {
01790             strMainFile.Concatenate("<masterKey>\n%s</masterKey>\n\n", ascMasterContents.Get());
01791         }
01792         else
01793             OTLog::vError("%s: Failed trying to write master key to notary file.\n", __FUNCTION__);
01794     }
01795 
01796 
01797 
01798 <?xml version="1.0"?>
01799 <notaryServer version="2.0"
01800  serverID="%s"
01801  serverUserID="%s"
01802  transactionNum="5" >
01803 
01804 <masterKey>
01805 %s</masterKey>
01806 
01807 <accountList type="voucher" count="0" >
01808 
01809 </accountList>
01810 
01811 </notaryServer>
01812 
01813  */
01814 
01815 // ------------------------------------------
01816 
01817 bool OTServer::LoadMainFile(bool bReadOnly/*=false*/)
01818 {
01819     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
01820     //
01821     if (!OTDB::Exists(".", m_strWalletFilename.Get()))
01822     {
01823         OTLog::vError("%s: Error finding file: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, m_strWalletFilename.Get());
01824         return false;
01825     }
01826     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
01827     OTString strFileContents(OTDB::QueryPlainString(".", m_strWalletFilename.Get())); // <=== LOADING FROM DATA STORE.
01828 
01829     if (!strFileContents.Exists())
01830     {
01831         OTLog::vError("%s: Unable to read main file: %s\n",
01832                       __FUNCTION__, m_strWalletFilename.Get());
01833         return false;
01834     }
01835     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
01836     //
01837     // If, for example, the server user Nym is in old format (no master key)
01838     // then we will set this to true while loading. Then at the BOTTOM of this
01839     // function, we'll convert the Nym to the new format and re-save the notary
01840     // file.
01841     //
01842     bool bNeedToConvertUser = false;
01843     bool bNeedToSaveAgain = false;
01844 
01845     bool bFailure = false;
01846 
01847     {
01848         OTStringXML xmlFileContents(strFileContents);
01849 
01850         if (false == xmlFileContents.DecodeIfArmored()) // bEscapedIsAllowed=true by default.
01851         {
01852             OTLog::vError("%s: Notary server file apparently was encoded and then failed decoding. Filename: %s \n"
01853                           "Contents: \n%s\n", __FUNCTION__, m_strWalletFilename.Get(), strFileContents.Get());
01854             return false;
01855         }
01856         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
01857         irr::io::IrrXMLReader* xml = irr::io::createIrrXMLReader(xmlFileContents);
01858         OTCleanup<irr::io::IrrXMLReader> theXMLGuardian(xml); // So I don't have to clean it up later.
01859         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
01860         // parse the file until end reached
01861         while(xml && xml->read())
01862         {
01863             // strings for storing the data that we want to read out of the file
01864 
01865             OTString AssetName;
01866             OTString AssetContract;
01867             OTString AssetID;
01868 
01869             const OTString strNodeName(xml->getNodeName());
01870 
01871             switch(xml->getNodeType())
01872             {
01873             case irr::io::EXN_TEXT:
01874                     // in this xml file, the only text which occurs is the messageText
01875                     //messageText = xml->getNodeData();
01876                     break;
01877             case irr::io::EXN_ELEMENT:
01878                 {
01879                     if (strNodeName.Compare("notaryServer"))
01880                     {
01881                         m_strVersion            = xml->getAttributeValue("version");
01882                         m_strServerID           = xml->getAttributeValue("serverID");
01883                         m_strServerUserID       = xml->getAttributeValue("serverUserID");
01884 
01885 
01886                         OTString strTransactionNumber;  // The server issues transaction numbers and stores the counter here for the latest one.
01887                         strTransactionNumber    = xml->getAttributeValue("transactionNum");
01888                         m_lTransactionNumber    = atol(strTransactionNumber.Get());
01889 
01890                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\nLoading Open Transactions server. File version: %s\n"
01891                                        " Last Issued Transaction Number: %ld\n Server ID:      %s\n Server User ID: %s\n",
01892                                        m_strVersion.Get(), m_lTransactionNumber, m_strServerID.Get(), m_strServerUserID.Get());
01893                         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
01894                         //
01895                         if (m_strVersion.Compare("1.0")) // This means this Nym has not been converted yet to master password.
01896                         {
01897                             bNeedToConvertUser = true;
01898 
01899                             if (!(OTCachedKey::It()->isPaused()))
01900                                 OTCachedKey::It()->Pause();
01901 
01902                             if (!this->LoadServerUserAndContract())
01903                             {
01904                                 OTLog::vError("%s: Failed calling LoadServerUserAndContract.\n", __FUNCTION__);
01905                                 bFailure = true;
01906                             }
01907 
01908                             if (OTCachedKey::It()->isPaused())
01909                                 OTCachedKey::It()->Unpause();
01910                         }
01911                         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
01912                     }
01913                     // todo in the future just remove masterkey. I'm leaving it for now so people's
01914                     // data files can get converted over. After a while just remove it.
01915                     //
01916                     else if (strNodeName.Compare("masterKey") || strNodeName.Compare("cachedKey"))
01917                     {
01918                         OTASCIIArmor ascCachedKey;
01919 
01920                         if (OTContract::LoadEncodedTextField(xml, ascCachedKey))
01921                         {
01922                             // We successfully loaded the masterKey from file, so let's SET it
01923                             // as the master key globally...
01924                             //
01925                             OTCachedKey::It()->SetCachedKey(ascCachedKey);
01926 
01927                             if (!OTCachedKey::It()->HasHashCheck())
01928                             {
01929                                 OTPassword tempPassword; tempPassword.zeroMemory();
01930                                 _SharedPtr<OTCachedKey> sharedPtr(OTCachedKey::It());
01931                                 bNeedToSaveAgain = sharedPtr->GetMasterPassword(sharedPtr, tempPassword,
01932                                                                                 "We do not have a check hash yet for this password, "
01933                                                                                 "please enter your password", true);
01934                             }
01935                         }
01936 
01937                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\nLoading cachedKey:\n%s\n", ascCachedKey.Get());
01938                         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
01939                         //
01940                         // It's only here, AFTER the master key has been loaded, that we can
01941                         // go ahead and load the server user, the server contract, cron, etc.
01942                         // (It wasn't that way in version 1, before we had master keys.)
01943                         //
01944                         if (false == m_strVersion.Compare("1.0")) // This is, for example, 2.0
01945                         {
01946                             if (!this->LoadServerUserAndContract())
01947                             {
01948                                 OTLog::vError("%s: Failed calling LoadServerUserAndContract.\n", __FUNCTION__);
01949                                 bFailure = true;
01950                             }
01951                         }
01952                         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
01953                     }
01954                     else if (strNodeName.Compare("accountList")) // the voucher reserve account IDs.
01955                     {
01956                         const OTString strAcctType  = xml->getAttributeValue("type");
01957                         const OTString strAcctCount = xml->getAttributeValue("count");
01958 
01959                         if ((-1) == m_VoucherAccts.ReadFromXMLNode(xml, strAcctType, strAcctCount))
01960                             OTLog::vError("%s: Error loading voucher accountList.\n", __FUNCTION__);
01961                     }
01962                     else if (strNodeName.Compare("basketInfo"))
01963                     {
01964                         OTString strBasketID            = xml->getAttributeValue("basketID");
01965                         OTString strBasketAcctID        = xml->getAttributeValue("basketAcctID");
01966                         OTString strBasketContractID    = xml->getAttributeValue("basketContractID");
01967 
01968                         const OTIdentifier BASKET_ID(strBasketID), BASKET_ACCT_ID(strBasketAcctID), BASKET_CONTRACT_ID(strBasketContractID);
01969 
01970                         if (AddBasketAccountID(BASKET_ID, BASKET_ACCT_ID, BASKET_CONTRACT_ID))
01971                             OTLog::vOutput(0, "Loading basket currency info...\n Basket ID: %s\n Basket Acct ID: %s\n Basket Contract ID: %s\n",
01972                                            strBasketID.Get(), strBasketAcctID.Get(), strBasketContractID.Get());
01973                         else
01974                             OTLog::vError("Error adding basket currency info...\n Basket ID: %s\n Basket Acct ID: %s\n",
01975                                           strBasketID.Get(), strBasketAcctID.Get());
01976                     }
01977 
01978                     // Create an OTAssetContract and load them from file, (for each asset type),
01979                     // and add them to the internal map.
01980                     else if (strNodeName.Compare("assetType"))
01981                     {
01982                         OTASCIIArmor ascAssetName = xml->getAttributeValue("name");
01983 
01984                         if (ascAssetName.Exists())
01985                             ascAssetName.GetString(AssetName, false); // linebreaks == false
01986 
01987                         AssetID         = xml->getAttributeValue("assetTypeID");    // hash of contract itself
01988 
01989                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n\n****Asset Contract**** (server listing)\n Name: %s\n Contract ID: %s\n",
01990                                        AssetName.Get(), AssetID.Get());
01991 
01992                         OTString strContractPath;
01993                         strContractPath = OTFolders::Contract().Get();
01994 
01995                         OTAssetContract * pContract = new OTAssetContract(AssetName, strContractPath, AssetID, AssetID);
01996 
01997                         OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pContract, "ASSERT: allocating memory for Asset Contract in OTServer::LoadMainFile\n");
01998 
01999                         if (pContract->LoadContract())
02000                         {
02001                             if (pContract->VerifyContract())
02002                             {
02003                                 OTLog::Output(0, "** Asset Contract Verified **\n");
02004 
02005                                 pContract->SetName(AssetName);
02006 
02007                                 m_mapContracts[AssetID.Get()] = pContract;
02008                             }
02009                             else
02010                             {
02011                                 delete pContract; pContract = NULL;
02012                                 OTLog::Output(0, "Asset Contract FAILED to verify.\n");
02013                             }
02014                         }
02015                         else
02016                         {
02017                             delete pContract; pContract = NULL;
02018                             OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failed reading file for Asset Contract.\n", __FUNCTION__);
02019                         }
02020                     }
02021 
02022                     // This is where the server finds out his own contract, which he hashes in order to verify his
02023                     // serverID (which is either hardcoded or stored in the server xml file.)
02024                     //
02025                     // There should be only one of these per transaction server.
02026                     //
02027                     // Commented out because I don't need it right now. TODO. COMING SOON! So the server can load his
02028                     // port information out of the contract BEFORE it starts listening on the port (right now port is
02029                     // still hardcoded.)
02030                     // Todo: Server should also then immediately connect to itself BASED ON THE INFO IN THE CONTRACT
02031                     // in order to verify that whatever is running at that port IS, IN FACT, ITSELF!
02032                     /*
02033                     else if (strNodeName.Compare("notaryProvider"))
02034                     {
02035                         ServerName      = xml->getAttributeValue("name");
02036                         ServerID        = xml->getAttributeValue("serverID");   // hash of contract itself
02037 
02038                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n\n****Notary Server (contract)**** (server listing) Name: %s\nContract ID:\n%s\n",
02039                                        ServerName.Get(), ServerID.Get());
02040 
02041                         OTString strContractPath;
02042                         strContractPath.Format("%s%s%s%s%s", OTLog::Path(), OTLog::PathSeparator(),
02043                                                OTFolders::Contract().Get(),
02044                                                OTLog::PathSeparator(), ServerID.Get());
02045                         OTServerContract * pContract = new OTServerContract(ServerName, strContractPath, ServerID);
02046 
02047                         OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pContract, "Error allocating memory for Server Contract in OTServer::LoadMainFile\n");
02048 
02049                         if (pContract->LoadContract())
02050                         {
02051                             if (pContract->VerifyContract())
02052                             {
