02053                                 OTLog::Output(0, "** Server Contract Verified **\n");
02054 
02055                                 m_mapContracts[ServerID.Get()] = pContract;
02056                             }
02057                             else
02058                             {
02059                                 delete pContract; pContract = NULL;
02060                                 OTLog::Output(0, "Server Contract FAILED to verify.\n");
02061                             }
02062                         }
02063                         else
02064                         {
02065                             delete pContract; pContract = NULL;
02066                             OTLog::Output(0, "Failed reading file for Server Contract in OTServer::LoadMainFile\n");
02067                         }
02068                     }
02069                      */
02070 
02071 
02072 
02073                     /*
02074                      // commented out because, since I already have the serverID, then the server
02075                      // already knows which certfile to open in order to get at its private key.
02076                      // So I already have the private key loaded, so I don't need pseudonyms in
02077                      // the config file right now.
02078                      //
02079                      // In the future, I will load the server XML file (here) FIRST, and get the serverID and
02080                      // contract file from that. THEN I will hash the contract file and verify that it matches
02081                      // the serverID. THEN I will use that serverID to open the Certfile and get my private key.
02082                      //
02083                      // In the meantime I don't need this yet, serverID is setup in the config file (that I'm reading now.)
02084                     else if (strNodeName.Compare("pseudonym")) // The server has to sign things, too.
02085                     {
02086                         NymName = xml->getAttributeValue("name");// user-assigned name for GUI usage
02087                         NymID = xml->getAttributeValue("nymID"); // message digest from hash of x.509 cert, used to look up certfile.
02088 
02089                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n\n** Pseudonym ** (server): %s\nID: %s\nfile: %s\n",
02090                                 NymName.Get(), NymID.Get(), NymFile.Get());
02091 
02092                         OTPseudonym * pNym = new OTPseudonym(NymName, NymFile, NymID);
02093 
02094                         if (pNym && pNym->LoadNymfile((char*)(NymFile.Get())))
02095                         {
02096                             if (pNym->Loadx509CertAndPrivateKey())
02097                             {
02098                                 if (pNym->VerifyPseudonym())
02099                                 {
02100                                     m_mapNyms[NymID.Get()] = pNym;
02101                                     g_pTemporaryNym = pNym; // TODO remove this temporary line used for testing only.
02102                                 }
02103                                 else {
02104                                     OTLog::Error("Error verifying public key from x509 against Nym ID in OTWallet::LoadWallet\n");
02105                                 }
02106                             }
02107                             else {
02108                                 OTLog::Error("Error loading x509 file for Pseudonym in OTWallet::LoadWallet\n");
02109                             }
02110                         }
02111                         else {
02112                             OTLog::Error("Error creating or loading Nym in OTWallet::LoadWallet\n");
02113                         }
02114                     }
02115                     */
02116 
02117                     else
02118                     {
02119                         // unknown element type
02120                         OTLog::vError("%s: Unknown element type: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, xml->getNodeName());
02121                     }
02122                 }
02123                     break;
02124                     // --------------------
02125                 default:
02126                     break;
02127             } // switch
02128         } // while xml->read
02129     }
02130     // --------------------------------
02131     if (!bReadOnly)
02132     {
02133         {
02134             OTString strReason("Converting Server Nym to master key.");
02135             if (bNeedToConvertUser && m_nymServer.Savex509CertAndPrivateKey(true, &strReason)) SaveMainFile();
02136         }
02137         {
02138             OTString strReason("Creating a Hash Check for the master key.");
02139             if (bNeedToSaveAgain && m_nymServer.Savex509CertAndPrivateKey(true, &strReason)) SaveMainFile();
02140         }
02141     }
02142     return !bFailure;
02143 }
02144 
02145 
02146 
02147 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
02148 
02149 
02150 
02151 // Get the list of markets on this server.
02152 void OTServer::UserCmdGetMarketList(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
02153 {
02154     // (1) set up member variables
02155     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@getMarketList"; // reply to getMarketList
02156     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
02157 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
02158 
02159     OTASCIIArmor ascOutput;
02160     int32_t nMarketCount = 0;
02161 
02162     msgOut.m_bSuccess = m_Cron.GetMarketList(ascOutput, nMarketCount);
02163 
02164     // If success,
02165     if ((true == msgOut.m_bSuccess) && (nMarketCount > 0))
02166     {
02167         msgOut.m_ascPayload.Set(ascOutput);
02168 
02169         OTString strCount;
02170         strCount.Format("%d", nMarketCount);
02171         msgOut.m_lDepth = atol(strCount.Get());
02172     }
02173     // if Failed, we send the user's message back to him, ascii-armored as part of response.
02174     else if (false == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
02175     {
02176         OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn);
02177         msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage);
02178     }
02179 
02180     // (2) Sign the Message
02181     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
02182 
02183     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
02184     //
02185     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
02186     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
02187     msgOut.SaveContract();
02188 }
02189 
02190 
02191 // Get the publicly-available list of offers on a specific market.
02192 void OTServer::UserCmdGetMarketOffers(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
02193 {
02194     // (1) set up member variables
02195     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@getMarketOffers";   // reply to getMarketOffers
02196     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
02197     msgOut.m_strNymID2      = MsgIn.m_strNymID2;// Market ID.
02198 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
02199 
02200     int64_t lDepth = MsgIn.m_lDepth;
02201     if (lDepth < 0)
02202         lDepth = 0;
02203 
02204     const OTIdentifier MARKET_ID(MsgIn.m_strNymID2);
02205 
02206     // ------------------------------------------
02207 
02208     OTMarket * pMarket = m_Cron.GetMarket(MARKET_ID);
02209 
02210     // If success,
02211     if ((msgOut.m_bSuccess = ((pMarket != NULL) ? true:false) )) // if assigned true
02212     {
02213         OTASCIIArmor ascOutput;
02214         int32_t nOfferCount = 0;
02215 
02216         msgOut.m_bSuccess = pMarket->GetOfferList(ascOutput, lDepth, nOfferCount);
02217 
02218         if ((true == msgOut.m_bSuccess) && (nOfferCount > 0))
02219         {
02220             msgOut.m_ascPayload = ascOutput;
02221             msgOut.m_lDepth     = nOfferCount;
02222         }
02223     }
02224 
02225     // if Failed, we send the user's message back to him, ascii-armored as part of response.
02226     if (false == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
02227     {
02228         OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn);
02229         msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage);
02230     }
02231 
02232     // (2) Sign the Message
02233     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
02234 
02235     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
02236     //
02237     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
02238     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
02239     msgOut.SaveContract();
02240 }
02241 
02242 
02243 // Get a report of recent trades that have occurred on a specific market.
02244 void OTServer::UserCmdGetMarketRecentTrades(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
02245 {
02246     // (1) set up member variables
02247     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@getMarketRecentTrades"; // reply to getMarketRecentTrades
02248     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
02249     msgOut.m_strNymID2      = MsgIn.m_strNymID2;// Market ID.
02250 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
02251 
02252     const OTIdentifier MARKET_ID(MsgIn.m_strNymID2);
02253 
02254     // ------------------------------------------
02255 
02256     OTMarket * pMarket = m_Cron.GetMarket(MARKET_ID);
02257 
02258     // If success,
02259     if ((msgOut.m_bSuccess =  ((pMarket != NULL) ? true:false) )) // if assigned true
02260     {
02261         OTASCIIArmor ascOutput;
02262         int32_t nTradeCount = 0;
02263 
02264         msgOut.m_bSuccess = pMarket->GetRecentTradeList(ascOutput, nTradeCount);
02265 
02266         if (true == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
02267         {
02268             msgOut.m_lDepth = nTradeCount;
02269 
02270             if (nTradeCount > 0)
02271                 msgOut.m_ascPayload = ascOutput;
02272         }
02273     }
02274 
02275     // if Failed, we send the user's message back to him, ascii-armored as part of response.
02276     if (false == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
02277     {
02278         OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn);
02279         msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage);
02280     }
02281 
02282     // (2) Sign the Message
02283     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
02284 
02285     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
02286     //
02287     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
02288     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
02289     msgOut.SaveContract();
02290 }
02291 
02292 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
02293 
02294 
02295 
02296 
02297 // Get the offers that a specific Nym has placed on a specific market.
02298 //
02299 void OTServer::UserCmdGetNym_MarketOffers(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
02300 {
02301     // (1) set up member variables
02302     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@getNym_MarketOffers";   // reply to getMarketOffers
02303     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
02304 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
02305 
02306     OTIdentifier NYM_ID; theNym.GetIdentifier(NYM_ID);
02307 
02308     // ------------------------------------------
02309 
02310     OTASCIIArmor ascOutput;
02311     int32_t nOfferCount = 0;
02312 
02313     msgOut.m_bSuccess = m_Cron.GetNym_OfferList(ascOutput, NYM_ID, nOfferCount);
02314 
02315     if ((true == msgOut.m_bSuccess) && (nOfferCount > 0))
02316     {
02317         msgOut.m_ascPayload = ascOutput;
02318         msgOut.m_lDepth     = nOfferCount;
02319     }
02320     // if Failed, we send the user's message back to him, ascii-armored as part of response.
02321     if (false == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
02322     {
02323         OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn);
02324         msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage);
02325     }
02326 
02327     // (2) Sign the Message
02328     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
02329 
02330     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
02331     //
02332     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
02333     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
02334     msgOut.SaveContract();
02335 }
02336 
02337 
02338 // ------------------------------------------------------------
02339 
02340 
02341 
02342 
02343 
02344 void OTServer::UserCmdCheckServerID(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
02345 {
02346     // (1) set up member variables
02347     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@checkServerID"; // reply to checkServerID
02348     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
02349 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
02350 
02351     // already at the top of ProcessUserCommand, which calls this.
02352 //  msgOut.m_strRequestNum.Set(MsgIn.m_strRequestNum);
02353 
02354     if (MsgIn.m_strServerID == m_strServerID)   // ServerID, a hash of the server contract.
02355         msgOut.m_bSuccess       = true;
02356     else
02357         msgOut.m_bSuccess       = false;
02358 
02359     // (2) Sign the Message
02360     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
02361 
02362     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
02363     //
02364     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
02365     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
02366     msgOut.SaveContract();
02367 }
02368 
02369 
02370 
02371 void OTServer::UserCmdGetTransactionNum(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
02372 {
02373     // (1) set up member variables
02374     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@getTransactionNum"; // reply to getTransactionNum
02375     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
02376 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
02377 
02378     // already at the top of ProcessUserCommand, which calls this.
02379 //  msgOut.m_strRequestNum.Set(MsgIn.m_strRequestNum);
02380 
02381     const OTIdentifier SERVER_ID(m_strServerID);
02382 
02383     // ---------------
02384     // A few client requests, and a few server replies (not exactly matched up)
02385     // will include a copy of the NymboxHash.  The server may reject certain
02386     // client requests that have a bad value here (since it would be out of sync
02387     // anyway); the client is able to see the server's hash and realize to
02388     // re-download the nymbox and other intermediary files.
02389     //
02390     // ------------------------------------------------------------
02391     int32_t nCount = theNym.GetTransactionNumCount(SERVER_ID);
02392     // ------------------------------------------------------------
02393     const
02394     OTIdentifier  theMsgNymboxHash(MsgIn.m_strNymboxHash);    // theMsgNymboxHash is the hash sent by the client side
02395     OTIdentifier  EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH;
02396 
02397     const bool bGotNymboxHashServerSide = theNym.GetNymboxHashServerSide(SERVER_ID, EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH);
02398     const bool bGotNymboxHashClientSide = MsgIn.m_strNymboxHash.Exists();
02399 
02400     if (bGotNymboxHashServerSide)  // EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH is the hash stored on the server side
02401         EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH.GetString(msgOut.m_strNymboxHash);
02402     // -------------------------------------------------------------
02403     if (
02404         (bGotNymboxHashServerSide && bGotNymboxHashClientSide && (theMsgNymboxHash != EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH))
02405         ||
02406         (bGotNymboxHashServerSide && !bGotNymboxHashClientSide)
02407         )
02408     {
02409         OTLog::Output(0, "OTServer::UserCmdGetTransactionNum: Rejecting message since nymbox hash "
02410                       "doesn't match. (Send a getNymbox message to grab the newest one.)\n");
02411 
02412     }
02413     else if (nCount > 50) // todo no hardcoding. (max transaction nums allowed out at a single time.)
02414     {
02415         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::UserCmdGetTransactionNum: Failure: Nym %s already has "
02416                        "more than 50 unused transaction numbers signed out. (He needs to use those first. "
02417                        "Tell him to download his latest Nymbox.)\n", MsgIn.m_strNymID.Get());
02418     }
02419     // ------------------------------------------------------------
02420     else
02421     {
02422         OTIdentifier USER_ID, NYMBOX_HASH;
02423         theNym.GetIdentifier(USER_ID);
02424 
02425         bool        bSuccess = true, bCalculated = false;
02426         bool        bSavedNymbox = false;
02427         OTLedger    theLedger(USER_ID, USER_ID, SERVER_ID); // Nymbox
02428 
02429         // We'll store the transaction numbers here immediately after they're issued,
02430         // before adding them to the Nymbox.
02431         //
02432         OTNumList   theNumlist;
02433 
02434         int64_t    lFirstTransNum = 0; // While there may be 20 transaction numbers on this tranasction, ONE of them (the first one) is the "official" number of this transaction. The rest are just attached in an extra variable.
02435 
02436         // Update: Now we're going to grab 20 or 30 transaction numbers,
02437         // instead of just 1 like before!!!
02438         //
02439         for (int32_t i = 0; i < 100; i++) // todo, hardcoding!!!! (But notice we grab 100 transaction numbers at a time now.)
02440         {
02441             int64_t lTransNum = 0;
02442             // This call will save the new transaction number to the nym's file.
02443             // ??? Why did I say that, when clearly the last parameter is false?
02444             // AHHHH Because I drop it into the Nymbox instead, and make him sign for it!
02445 
02446             if (false == IssueNextTransactionNumber(theNym, lTransNum, false)) // bool bStoreTheNumber = false
02447             {
02448                 lTransNum = 0;
02449                 OTLog::Error("OTServer::UserCmdGetTransactionNu: Error issuing next transaction number!\n");
02450                 bSuccess = false;
02451                 break;
02452             }
02453 
02454             theNumlist.Add(lTransNum); // <=========
02455             if (0 == i) // First iteration
02456                 lFirstTransNum = lTransNum;
02457         }
02458         // --------------------------------------------------------
02459 
02460         if (false == bSuccess)
02461         {
02462             // Apparently nothing. Also, plenty of logs just above already, if this ever happens.
02463         }
02464         else if (false == theLedger.LoadNymbox())
02465         {
02466             OTLog::Error("Error loading Nymbox in OTServer::UserCmdGetTransactionNum\n");
02467         }
02468         // Drop in the Nymbox
02469         else if ((msgOut.m_bSuccess =   (
02470 //                                       theLedger.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer) &&    // This forces ALL box receipts to load.
02471                                          theLedger.VerifyContractID() &&            // We don't need them right now, so we verify
02472                                          theLedger.VerifySignature(m_nymServer)     // everything else without loading them.
02473                                          ) // if loaded and verified.
02474                  )) // if success
02475         {
02476             // Note: I decided against adding newly-requested transaction numbers to existing OTTransaction::blanks in the Nymbox.
02477             // Why not? Because once the user downloads the Box Receipt, he will think he has it already, when the Server meanwhile
02478             // has a new version of that same Box Receipt. But the user will never re-download it if he believes that he already has
02479             // it.
02480             // Since the transaction can contain 10, 20, or 50 transaction numbers now, we don't NEED to be able to combine them
02481             // anyway, since the problem is still effectively solved.
02482 
02483             OTTransaction * pTransaction = OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(theLedger, OTTransaction::blank, lFirstTransNum);  // Generate a new OTTransaction::blank
02484 
02485             if (NULL != pTransaction) // The above has an OT_ASSERT within, but I just like to check my pointers.
02486             {
02487                 // ADD the contents of theNumlist (the 20 new transaction numbers we're giving the user)
02488                 // to this OTTransaction::blank.
02489                 //
02490                 pTransaction->AddNumbersToTransaction(theNumlist);
02491 
02492                 pTransaction->  SignContract(m_nymServer);
02493                 pTransaction->  SaveContract();
02494 
02495                 theLedger.AddTransaction(*pTransaction);
02496 
02497                 theLedger.ReleaseSignatures();
02498                 theLedger.SignContract(m_nymServer);
02499                 theLedger.SaveContract();
02500 
02501                 bSavedNymbox = true;
02502                 theLedger.SaveNymbox(&NYMBOX_HASH);
02503 
02504                 // Any inbox/nymbox/outbox ledger will only itself contain
02505                 // abbreviated versions of the receipts, including their hashes.
02506                 //
02507                 // The rest is stored separately, in the box receipt, which is created
02508                 // whenever a receipt is added to a box, and deleted after a receipt
02509                 // is removed from a box.
02510                 //
02511                 pTransaction->SaveBoxReceipt(theLedger);
02512             }
02513             else
02514                 bCalculated = theLedger.CalculateNymboxHash(NYMBOX_HASH);
02515         }
02516         else
02517         {
02518             OTLog::Error("Error verifying Nymbox in OTServer::UserCmdGetTransactionNum\n");
02519         }
02520         // ------------------------------------------------------------
02521         std::set<int64_t> theList;
02522         theNumlist.Output(theList);
02523 
02524         FOR_EACH(std::set<int64_t>, theList)
02525         {
02526             const int64_t lTransNum = *it;
02527             // ----------------------------
02528             RemoveTransactionNumber (theNym, lTransNum, false); //bSave=false
02529             RemoveIssuedNumber      (theNym, lTransNum, false); // I'll drop it in his Nymbox -- he can SIGN for it.
02530             // Then why was it added in the first place? Because we originally sent it back in the reply directly,
02531             // so IssueNext was designed to work that way originally.
02532         }
02533         // ----------------
02534 
02535         if (bSavedNymbox)
02536         {
02537             theNym.SetNymboxHashServerSide(NYMBOX_HASH);
02538             theNym.SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer);
02539 
02540             NYMBOX_HASH.GetString(msgOut.m_strNymboxHash);
02541         }
02542         else if (true == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
02543         {
02544             bCalculated = theLedger.CalculateNymboxHash(NYMBOX_HASH);
02545 
02546             theNym.SetNymboxHashServerSide(NYMBOX_HASH);    // Save the hash onto the Nym
02547             theNym.SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer);
02548 
02549             NYMBOX_HASH.GetString(msgOut.m_strNymboxHash);  // Get the hash onto the message
02550         }
02551         // else EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH.GetString(msgOut.m_strNymboxHash); (above)
02552     }
02553 
02554     // (2) Sign the Message
02555     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
02556 
02557     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
02558     //
02559     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
02560     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
02561     msgOut.SaveContract();
02562 }
02563 
02564 void OTServer::UserCmdGetRequest(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
02565 {
02566     // (1) set up member variables
02567     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@getRequest";    // reply to getRequest
02568     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
02569 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
02570 
02571     msgOut.m_strRequestNum.Set(MsgIn.m_strRequestNum); // Outoing reply contains same request num coming in (1).
02572 
02573     int64_t lReqNum = 1; // The request number being REQUESTED (in this message) will be sent in msgOut.m_lNewRequestNum
02574 
02575     msgOut.m_bSuccess   = theNym.GetCurrentRequestNum(m_strServerID, lReqNum);
02576 
02577     // Server was unable to load ReqNum, which is unusual because the calling function
02578     // should have already insured its existence.
02579     if (!msgOut.m_bSuccess)
02580     {
02581         OTLog::Error("Error loading request number in OTServer::UserCmdGetRequest\n");
02582     }
02583     // ---------------
02584     else
02585         msgOut.m_lNewRequestNum = lReqNum;
02586 //      msgOut.m_strRequestNum.Format("%ld", lReqNum); // This will now contain the same req num (1) that came in, with the new one stored in msgOut.m_lNewRequestNum instead.
02587     // ---------------
02588     const OTIdentifier SERVER_ID(m_strServerID);
02589     // ---------------
02590     OTIdentifier EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH;
02591     if (theNym.GetNymboxHashServerSide(SERVER_ID, EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH))
02592         EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH.GetString(msgOut.m_strNymboxHash);
02593     else
02594     {
02595         const OTIdentifier theNymID(theNym);
02596         OTLedger theLedger(theNymID, theNymID, SERVER_ID);
02597 
02598         if (theLedger.LoadNymbox()          &&
02599             theLedger.VerifyContractID()    &&
02600             theLedger.VerifySignature(m_nymServer))
02601         {
02602             theLedger.CalculateNymboxHash(EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH);
02603 
02604             theNym.SetNymboxHashServerSide(EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH);
02605             theNym.SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer);
02606 
02607             EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH.GetString(msgOut.m_strNymboxHash);
02608         }
02609     }
02610     // ---------------
02611 
02612     // (2) Sign the Message
02613     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
02614 
02615     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
02616     //
02617     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
02618     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
02619     msgOut.SaveContract();
02620 }
02621 
02622 
02623 
02624 void OTServer::UserCmdSendUserMessage(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
02625 {
02626     // (1) set up member variables
02627     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@sendUserMessage";   // reply to sendUserMessage
02628     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID;         // UserID
02629     msgOut.m_strNymID2      = MsgIn.m_strNymID2;        // UserID of recipient pubkey
02630 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;            // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
02631 
02632     const OTString      strInMessage(MsgIn);
02633     const OTIdentifier  SENDER_USER_ID(theNym),
02634                         RECIPIENT_USER_ID(MsgIn.m_strNymID2),
02635                         SERVER_ID(m_strServerID);
02636     msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(strInMessage);
02637     // ------------------------------------------------------------
02638     const bool bSent = this->SendMessageToNym(SERVER_ID, SENDER_USER_ID, RECIPIENT_USER_ID, &MsgIn); // pstrMessage=NULL
02639 
02640     if (!bSent)
02641     {
02642         OTLog::vError("OTServer::UserCmdSendUserMessage: Failed while calling SendMessageToNym.\n");
02643         msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
02644     }
02645     else
02646     {
02647         msgOut.m_bSuccess = true;
02648     }
02649     // ------------------------------------------------------------
02650     // (2) Sign the Message
02651     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
02652 
02653     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
02654     //
02655     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
02656     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
02657     msgOut.SaveContract();
02658 }
02659 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02660 
02661 void OTServer::UserCmdSendUserInstrument(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
02662 {
02663     // (1) set up member variables
02664     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@sendUserInstrument";    // reply to sendUserInstrument
02665     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID;         // UserID
02666     msgOut.m_strNymID2      = MsgIn.m_strNymID2;        // UserID of recipient pubkey
02667 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;            // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
02668 
02669     const OTString      strInMessage(MsgIn);
02670     const OTIdentifier  SENDER_USER_ID(theNym),
02671                         RECIPIENT_USER_ID(MsgIn.m_strNymID2),
02672                         SERVER_ID(m_strServerID);
02673     msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(strInMessage);
02674     // ------------------------------------------------------------
02675     const bool bSent = this->SendInstrumentToNym(SERVER_ID, SENDER_USER_ID, RECIPIENT_USER_ID, &MsgIn); // pPayment=NULL, szCommand=NULL
02676 
02677     if (!bSent)
02678     {
02679         OTLog::vError("OTServer::UserCmdSendUserInstrument: Failed while calling SendInstrumentToNym.\n");
02680         msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
02681     }
02682     else
02683     {
02684         msgOut.m_bSuccess = true;
02685     }
02686     // ------------------------------------------------------------
02687     // (2) Sign the Message
02688     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
02689 
02690     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
02691     //
02692     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
02693     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
02694     msgOut.SaveContract();
02695 }
02696 
02697 
02698 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02699 
02700 bool OTServer::SendInstrumentToNym(const OTIdentifier & SERVER_ID,
02701                                    const OTIdentifier & SENDER_USER_ID,
02702                                    const OTIdentifier & RECIPIENT_USER_ID,
02703                                          OTMessage    * pMsg/*=NULL*/,     // the request msg from payer, which is attached WHOLE to the Nymbox receipt. contains payment already.
02704                                    const OTPayment    * pPayment/*=NULL*/, // or pass this instead: we will create our own msg here (with message inside) to be attached to the receipt.
02705                                    const char         * szCommand/*=NULL*/)
02706 {
02707     OT_ASSERT_MSG( !( (NULL == pMsg) && (NULL == pPayment) ), "pMsg and pPayment -- these can't BOTH be NULL.\n"); // must provide one or the other.
02708     OT_ASSERT_MSG( !( (NULL != pMsg) && (NULL != pPayment) ), "pMsg and pPayment -- these can't BOTH be not-NULL.\n"); // can't provide both.
02709     // ------------------------
02710     OT_ASSERT_MSG((NULL == pPayment) || ((NULL != pPayment) && pPayment->IsValid()) , "OTServer::SendInstrumentToNym: You can only pass a valid payment here.");
02711     // ------------------------
02712     // If a payment was passed in (for us to use it to construct pMsg, which is NULL in the case where payment isn't NULL)
02713     // Then we grab it in string form, so we can pass it on...
02714     OTString strPayment;
02715     if (NULL != pPayment)
02716     {
02717         const bool bGotPaymentContents = pPayment->GetPaymentContents(strPayment);
02718         if (!bGotPaymentContents) OTLog::vError("%s: Error GetPaymentContents Failed", __FUNCTION__);
02719     }
02720     // ------------------------
02721     const bool bDropped = this->DropMessageToNymbox(SERVER_ID,
02722                                                     SENDER_USER_ID,
02723                                                     RECIPIENT_USER_ID,
02724                                                     OTTransaction::instrumentNotice,
02725                                                     pMsg,
02726                                                     (NULL != pMsg) ? NULL : &strPayment,
02727                                                     szCommand);
02728 
02729     return bDropped;
02730 }
02731 
02732 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02733 
02734 bool OTServer::SendMessageToNym(const OTIdentifier & SERVER_ID,
02735                                 const OTIdentifier & SENDER_USER_ID,
02736                                 const OTIdentifier & RECIPIENT_USER_ID,
02737                                       OTMessage    * pMsg/*=NULL*/,        // the request msg from payer, which is attached WHOLE to the Nymbox receipt. contains message already.
02738                                 const OTString     * pstrMessage/*=NULL*/) // or pass this instead: we will create our own msg here (with message inside) to be attached to the receipt.
02739 {
02740     return this->DropMessageToNymbox(SERVER_ID,
02741                                      SENDER_USER_ID,
02742                                      RECIPIENT_USER_ID,
02743                                      OTTransaction::message,
02744                                      pMsg,
02745                                      pstrMessage); //, szCommand=NULL
02746 }
02747 
02748 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02749 
02750 // Can't be static (this->IssueNextTransactionNumber is called...)
02751 //
02752 // About pMsg...
02753 // (Normally) when you send a cheque to someone, you encrypt it inside an envelope, and that
02754 // envelope is attached to a OTMessage (sendUserInstrument) and sent to the server. The server
02755 // takes your entire OTMessage and attaches it to an instrumentNotice (OTTransaction) which is
02756 // added to the recipient's Nymbox.
02757 // In that case, just pass the pointer to the incoming message here as pMsg, and the OT Server
02758 // will attach it as described.
02759 // But let's say you are paying a dividend. The server can't just attach your dividend request in
02760 // that case. Normally the recipient's cheque is already in the request. But with a dividend, there
02761 // could be a thousand recipients, and their individual vouchers are only generated and sent AFTER
02762 // the server receives the "pay dividend" request.
02763 // Therefore in that case, NULL would be passed for pMsg, meaning that inside this function we have
02764 // to generate our own OTMessage "from the server" instead of "from the sender". After all, the server's
02765 // private key is the only signer we have in here. And the recipient will be expecting to have to
02766 // open a message, so we must create one to give him. So if pMsg is NULL, then this function will
02767 // create a message "from the server", containing the instrument, and drop it into the recipient's nymbox
02768 // as though it were some incoming message from a normal user.
02769 // This message, in the case of payDividend, should be an "@payDividend" message, "from" the server
02770 // and "to" the recipient. The payment instrument must be attached to that new message, and therefore it
02771 // must be passed into this function.
02772 // Of course, if pMsg was not NULL, that means the message (and instrument inside of it) already exist,
02773 // so no instrument would need to be passed. But if pMsg IS NULL, that means the msg must be generated,
02774 // and thus the instrument MUST be passed in, so that that can be done.
02775 // Therefore the instrument will sometimes be passed in, and sometimes not. Therefore the instrument must
02776 // be passed as a pointer.
02777 //
02778 // Conclusion: if pMsg is passed in, then pass a null instrument. (Since the instrument is already on pMsg.)
02779 //                (And since the instrument defaults to NULL, this makes pMsg the final argument in the call.)
02780 //         but if pMsg is NULL, then you must pass the payment instrument as the next argument. (So pMsg can be created with it.)
02781 // Note: you cannot pass BOTH, or the instrument will simply be ignored, since it's already assumed to be in pMsg.
02782 // You might ask: what about the original request then, doesn't the recipient get a copy of that? Well, maybe we
02783 // pass it in here and attach it to the new message. Or maybe we just set it as the voucher memo.
02784 //
02785 bool OTServer::DropMessageToNymbox(const OTIdentifier & SERVER_ID,
02786                                    const OTIdentifier & SENDER_USER_ID,
02787                                    const OTIdentifier & RECIPIENT_USER_ID,
02788                                    OTTransaction::transactionType theType,
02789                                          OTMessage    * pMsg/*=NULL*/,
02790                                    const OTString     * pstrMessage/*=NULL*/,
02791                                    const char         * szCommand/*=NULL*/) // If you pass something here, it will replace pMsg->m_strCommand below
02792 {
02793     OT_ASSERT_MSG( !( (NULL == pMsg) && (NULL == pstrMessage) ), "pMsg and pstrMessage -- these can't BOTH be NULL.\n"); // must provide one or the other.
02794     OT_ASSERT_MSG( !( (NULL != pMsg) && (NULL != pstrMessage) ), "pMsg and pstrMessage -- these can't BOTH be not-NULL.\n"); // can't provide both.
02795     // ------------------------
02796     const char * szFunc = "OTServer::DropMessageToNymbox";
02797     // ------------------------
02798     int64_t lTransNum = 0;
02799     const bool bGotNextTransNum = this->IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lTransNum, false); // bool bStoreTheNumber = false
02800 
02801     if (!bGotNextTransNum)
02802     {
02803         OTLog::vError("%s: Error: failed trying to get next transaction number.\n");
02804         return false;
02805     }
02806     // ------------------------
02807     switch (theType)
02808     {
02809         case OTTransaction::message:            break;
02810         case OTTransaction::instrumentNotice:   break;
02811         default:
02812             OTLog::vError("%s: Unexpected transactionType passed here (expected message "
02813                           "or instrumentNotice.)\n", szFunc);
02814             return false;
02815     }
02816     // ------------------------
02817     // If pMsg was not already passed in here, then
02818     // create pMsg using pstrMessage.
02819     //
02820     OTCleanup<OTMessage> theMsgAngel;
02821 
02822     if (NULL == pMsg) // we have to create it ourselves.
02823     {
02824         pMsg = new OTMessage;
02825         OT_ASSERT(NULL != pMsg);
02826         theMsgAngel.SetCleanupTarget(*pMsg); // In this case we created it, so we clean it up as well.
02827         // ---------------------------------
02828         if (NULL != szCommand)
02829             pMsg->m_strCommand = szCommand;
02830         else
02831         {
02832             switch (theType)
02833             {
02834                 case OTTransaction::message:            pMsg->m_strCommand = "sendUserMessage";    break;
02835                 case OTTransaction::instrumentNotice:   pMsg->m_strCommand = "sendUserInstrument"; break;
02836                 default:  break; // should never happen.
02837             }
02838         }
02839         // --------------------------------------------------------------
02840         pMsg->m_strServerID = this->m_strServerID;
02841         pMsg->m_bSuccess    = true;
02842         SENDER_USER_ID.   GetString(pMsg->m_strNymID);
02843         RECIPIENT_USER_ID.GetString(pMsg->m_strNymID2); // set the recipient ID in pMsg to match our recipient ID.
02844         // ---------------------------------
02845         // Load up the recipient's public key (so we can encrypt the envelope
02846         // to him that will contain the payment instrument.)
02847         //
02848         OTPseudonym nymRecipient(RECIPIENT_USER_ID);
02849 
02850         bool bLoadedNym = nymRecipient.LoadPublicKey(); // Old style (deprecated.) But this function calls the new style, LoadCredentials, at the top. Eventually we'll just call that here directly.
02851         // -----------------------------------------------------------
02852         if (!bLoadedNym)
02853         {
02854             OTLog::vError("%s: Failed trying to load public key for recipient.\n", szFunc);
02855             return false;
02856         }
02857         else if (!nymRecipient.VerifyPseudonym())
02858         {
02859             OTLog::vError("%s: Failed trying to verify Nym for recipient.\n", szFunc);
02860             return false;
02861         }
02862         // ---------------------------------
02863         const OTAsymmetricKey & thePubkey = nymRecipient.GetPublicEncrKey();
02864         // ---------------------------------
02865         // Wrap the message up into an envelope and attach it to pMsg.
02866         //
02867         OTEnvelope  theEnvelope;
02868 
02869         pMsg->m_ascPayload.Release();
02870 
02871         if ((NULL != pstrMessage) && pstrMessage->Exists() &&
02872             theEnvelope.Seal(thePubkey, *pstrMessage) && // Seal pstrMessage into theEnvelope, using nymRecipient's public key.
02873             theEnvelope.GetAsciiArmoredData(pMsg->m_ascPayload)) // Grab the sealed version as base64-encoded string, into pMsg->m_ascPayload.
02874         {
02875             pMsg->SignContract(m_nymServer);
02876             pMsg->SaveContract();
02877         }
02878         else
02879         {
02880             OTLog::vError("%s: Failed trying to seal envelope containing message "
02881                           "(or while grabbing the base64-encoded result.)\n",
02882                           szFunc);
02883             return false;
02884         }
02885 
02886         // ---------------------------------
02887         // By this point, pMsg is all set up, signed and saved. Its payload contains
02888         // the envelope (as base64) containing the encrypted message.
02889     }
02890 //  else // pMsg was passed in, so it's not NULL. No need to create it ourselves like above. (pstrMessage should be NULL anyway in this case.)
02891 //  {
02892 //       // Apparently no need to do anything in here at all.
02893 //  }
02894     // --------------------------------------
02895     // Grab a string copy of pMsg.
02896     //
02897     const OTString strInMessage(*pMsg);
02898     // --------------------------------------
02899     OTLedger theLedger(RECIPIENT_USER_ID, RECIPIENT_USER_ID, SERVER_ID); // The recipient's Nymbox.
02900     // ------------------------
02901     // Drop in the Nymbox
02902     if ( (theLedger.LoadNymbox()                &&  // I think this loads the box receipts too, since I didn't call "LoadNymboxNoVerify"
02903 //        theLedger.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)  &&  // This loads all the Box Receipts, which is unnecessary.
02904           theLedger.VerifyContractID()          &&  // Instead, we'll verify the IDs and Signature only.
02905           theLedger.VerifySignature(m_nymServer)
02906        ) )
02907     {
02908         // Create the instrumentNotice to put in the Nymbox.
02909         OTTransaction * pTransaction = OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(theLedger, theType, lTransNum);
02910 
02911         if (NULL != pTransaction) // The above has an OT_ASSERT within, but I just like to check my pointers.
02912         {
02913             // NOTE: todo: SHOULD this be "in reference to" itself? The reason, I assume we are doing this
02914             // is because there is a reference STRING so "therefore" there must be a reference # as well. Eh?
02915             // Anyway, it must be understood by those involved that a message is stored inside. (Which has no transaction #.)
02916 
02917             pTransaction->  SetReferenceToNum(lTransNum);       // <====== Recipient RECEIVES entire incoming message as string here, which includes the sender user ID,
02918             pTransaction->  SetReferenceString(strInMessage);   // and has an OTEnvelope in the payload. Message is signed by sender, and envelope is encrypted to recipient.
02919 
02920             pTransaction->  SignContract(m_nymServer);
02921             pTransaction->  SaveContract();
02922             // -----------------------------------------
02923             theLedger.AddTransaction(*pTransaction); // Add the message transaction to the nymbox. (It will cleanup.)
02924 
02925             theLedger.ReleaseSignatures();
02926             theLedger.SignContract(m_nymServer);
02927             theLedger.SaveContract();
02928             theLedger.SaveNymbox(); // We don't grab the Nymbox hash here, since nothing important changed (just a message was sent.)
02929 
02930 
02931             // Any inbox/nymbox/outbox ledger will only itself contain
02932             // abbreviated versions of the receipts, including their hashes.
02933             //
02934             // The rest is stored separately, in the box receipt, which is created
02935             // whenever a receipt is added to a box, and deleted after a receipt
02936             // is removed from a box.
02937             //
02938             pTransaction->SaveBoxReceipt(theLedger);
02939 
02940             return true;
02941         }
02942         else // should never happen
02943         {
02944             const OTString strRecipientUserID(RECIPIENT_USER_ID);
02945             OTLog::vError("%s: Failed while trying to generate transaction in order to "
02946                           "add a message to Nymbox: %s\n",
02947                           szFunc, strRecipientUserID.Get());
02948         }
02949     }
02950     else
02951     {
02952         const OTString strRecipientUserID(RECIPIENT_USER_ID);
02953         OTLog::vError("%s: Failed while trying to load or verify Nymbox: %s\n",
02954                       szFunc, strRecipientUserID.Get());
02955     }
02956 
02957     return false;
02958 }
02959 
02960 
02961 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02962 
02963 
02964 void OTServer::UserCmdCheckUser(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
02965 {
02966     // (1) set up member variables
02967     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@checkUser";     // reply to checkUser
02968     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
02969     msgOut.m_strNymID2      = MsgIn.m_strNymID2;// UserID of public key requested by user.
02970 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
02971 
02972     OTPseudonym nym2;
02973     nym2.SetIdentifier(MsgIn.m_strNymID2);
02974 
02975     bool bLoaded        = nym2.LoadPublicKey(); // This calls LoadCredentials inside.
02976     msgOut.m_bSuccess   = (bLoaded && nym2.VerifyPseudonym());
02977 
02978     // If success, we send the Nym2's public key back to the user.
02979     if (msgOut.m_bSuccess)
02980     {
02981         nym2.GetPublicEncrKey().GetPublicKey(msgOut.m_strNymPublicKey, true);
02982 
02983         // NEW: Also attach the public credentials to the response
02984         //      (not just a public key.)
02985         //
02986         if (nym2.GetMasterCredentialCount() > 0)
02987         {
02988             // -----------------------------
02989             // Create an OTDB::StringMap object.
02990             //
02991             OTDB::Storable * pStorable = NULL;
02992             OTCleanup<OTDB::Storable> theAngel;
02993             OTDB::StringMap * pMap = NULL;
02994             // --------------------------------------------------------------
02995             pStorable = OTDB::CreateObject(OTDB::STORED_OBJ_STRING_MAP); // this asserts already, on failure.
02996             theAngel.SetCleanupTargetPointer(pStorable); // It will definitely be cleaned up.
02997             pMap = (NULL == pStorable) ? NULL : dynamic_cast<OTDB::StringMap *>(pStorable);
02998             // --------------------------------------------------------------
02999             // It exists.
03000             //
03001             if (NULL == pMap)
03002             {
03003                 OTLog::vError("%s: Error: failed trying to create a STORED_OBJ_STRING_MAP.\n",
03004                               __FUNCTION__);
03005                 msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
03006             }
03007             else
03008             {
03009                 // -----------------------------------------------
03010                 OTString       strCredList;
03011                 mapOfStrings & theMap = pMap->the_map;
03012 
03013                 nym2.GetPublicCredentials(strCredList, &theMap);
03014                 // -----------------------------------------------
03015                 // Serialize the StringMap to a string...
03016                 //
03017                 if (theMap.size() > 0) // Won't bother if there are zero credentials somehow.
03018                 {
03019                     std::string str_Encoded = OTDB::EncodeObject(*pMap);
03020                     const bool bSuccessEncoding = (str_Encoded.size() > 0);
03021                     if (bSuccessEncoding)
03022                     {
03023                         msgOut.m_ascPayload.SetString(strCredList);   // <========== Success
03024                         msgOut.m_ascPayload2.Set(str_Encoded.c_str());  // Payload contains credentials list, payload2 contains actual credentials.
03025                     }
03026                 }
03027             }
03028         } // bLoadedCredentials
03029     } // msgOut.m_bSuccess
03030     // if Failed, we send the user's message back to him, ascii-armored as part of response.
03031     else
03032     {
03033         OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn);
03034         msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage);
03035     }
03036 
03037     // (2) Sign the Message
03038     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
03039 
03040     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
03041     //
03042     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
03043     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
03044     msgOut.SaveContract();
03045 }
03046 
03047 
03048 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
03049 
03050 /*
03051  Allows ANY Nym to GET AND SET the Usage Credits for ANY other Nym!
03052  UPDATE: Only the override Nym can change the credits,
03053  You might ask, "But what if I don't want users to be able to set the Usage Credits?"
03054  That makes sense: Go to ~/.ot/server.cfg and set cmd_usage_credits=false (which is its default BTW.)
03055  That way, NO ONE can set credits, or view them for other people. (People can still view their own.)
03056  But you might ask, "But what if I want the ADMIN to still be able to set and view credits?"
03057  That makes sense: Just make sure the override_nym_id in server.cfg is set to your admin Nym, and
03058  that Nym will STILL be able to use this message:
03059  */
03060 void OTServer::UserCmdUsageCredits(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
03061 {
03062     // (1) set up member variables
03063     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@usageCredits";  // reply to usageCredits
03064     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
03065     msgOut.m_strNymID2      = MsgIn.m_strNymID2;// UserID of user whose usage credits are being examined / adjusted.
03066 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
03067     // -----------------------------------
03068     const bool bIsPrivilegedNym = ((OTServer::GetOverrideNymID().size() > 0) && // And if there's an override Nym...
03069                                    (0 == OTServer::GetOverrideNymID().compare((MsgIn.m_strNymID.Get())))); // And if the acting Nym IS the override Nym...
03070     // -----------------------------------
03071     // The amount the usage credits are being ADJUSTED by.
03072     const int64_t lAdjustment  = (bIsPrivilegedNym && OTServer::__admin_usage_credits) ? MsgIn.m_lDepth : 0;
03073 
03074     msgOut.m_lDepth = 0; // Returns total Usage Credits on Nym at the end.
03075     // -----------------------------------
03076     OTPseudonym nym2;
03077     OTIdentifier nym2ID, SERVER_ID(m_strServerID);
03078     nym2.SetIdentifier(MsgIn.m_strNymID2);
03079     nym2.GetIdentifier(nym2ID);
03080 
03081     const bool bIsSameNym   = nym2.CompareID(theNym);
03082     OTPseudonym * pNym      = NULL;
03083 
03084     bool bErrorCondition        = false;
03085     bool bHaveToCreateNymfile   = false;
03086 
03087     // If nym2 and theNym are already the same Nym, then pNym points to theNym by now already.
03088     // (And we'll skip this block.) Otherwise we load up nym2, and point pNym to nym2 instead.
03089     //
03090     if (bIsSameNym)
03091         pNym = &theNym;
03092     else // theNym and nym2 are different Nyms, so let's load it up.
03093     {
03094         bool bLoadedPublicKey   = nym2.LoadPublicKey() && nym2.VerifyPseudonym(); // Old style (deprecated.) For now, this calls LoadCredentials inside (which is the new style.) Eventually we'll just call that here directly.
03095         bool bLoadSignedNymfile = nym2.LoadSignedNymfile(m_nymServer);
03096         // -----------------
03097         if (!bLoadSignedNymfile && !bLoadedPublicKey) // Nym didn't already exist.
03098         {
03099             pNym = &nym2;
03100             bHaveToCreateNymfile = true;
03101         }
03102         else if (bLoadedPublicKey && !bLoadSignedNymfile) // Error -- if key was there, then nymfile should have been also.
03103         {
03104             OTLog::vError("%s: Nym public key (%s) exists, but nymfile doesn't! "
03105                          "Could be error reading from storage. (Failure.)\n", __FUNCTION__,
03106                           MsgIn.m_strNymID2.Get());
03107             bErrorCondition = true;
03108         }
03109         else
03110         {
03111             pNym = &nym2;
03112         }
03113     }
03114     // -----------------------------------
03115     if (false == MsgIn.m_strNymID.Compare(MsgIn.m_strNymID2)) // If the Nym is not performing this on himself...
03116     {
03117         // Either this is a Nym performing the action on himself (which is read-only.)
03118         // Or he is the "override Nym" (special powers) and he is allowed to do it on anybody (adjusting the credits up or down.)
03119         // But if he's NOT the override Nym, then he can NOT do it, even read-only, on anyone OTHER than himself.
03120         //
03121         // Inside this block, we've said, "If the Nym is NOT doing this on himself... (But on someone else)"
03122         // ...Then we KNOW, if that's true, that the Nym had BETTER have special powers, or there's an error.
03123         //
03124         if (false == ((OTServer::GetOverrideNymID().size() > 0) &&
03125                       (0 == OTServer::GetOverrideNymID().compare((MsgIn.m_strNymID.Get()))))) // ...And if he's not the special "override Nym"...
03126         {
03127             OTLog::vError("%s: Failed attempt by a normal Nym to view or adjust usage credits on a different Nym (you're only allowed to do this to yourself, unless your nym is the specially-empowered 'override nym'.)\n", __FUNCTION__);
03128             bErrorCondition = true;
03129         }
03130     }
03131     // -----------------------------------------------------
03132     OTLedger theNymbox(nym2ID, nym2ID, SERVER_ID);
03133     // ------------------------------------
03134     bool bSuccessLoadingNymbox  = theNymbox.LoadNymbox();
03135 
03136     if (bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
03137         bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = (theNymbox.VerifyContractID() && theNymbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer));
03138     else
03139     {
03140         bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = theNymbox.GenerateLedger(nym2ID, SERVER_ID, OTLedger::nymbox, true); // bGenerateFile=true
03141 
03142         if (bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
03143         {
03144             bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = theNymbox.SignContract(m_nymServer);
03145 
03146             if (bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
03147             {
03148                 bSuccessLoadingNymbox = theNymbox.SaveContract();
03149 
03150                 if (bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
03151                     bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = theNymbox.SaveNymbox();
03152             }
03153         }
03154     }
03155     // -----------------------------------------------------
03156     if (!bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
03157         bErrorCondition = true;
03158     // -----------------------------------------------------
03159     // By this point, pNym points to the correct Nym, if bErrorCondition=false;
03160     //
03161     if (!bErrorCondition)
03162     {
03163         // Get the current usage credits, which will be sent in the reply.
03164         //
03165         const int64_t & lOldCredits   = pNym->GetUsageCredits();
03166         const int64_t      lTentativeNew = lOldCredits + lAdjustment;
03167         const int64_t       lNewCredits   = (lTentativeNew < 0) ? (-1) : lTentativeNew; // It can never be less than -1.
03168 
03169         // if adjustment is non-zero, and the acting Nym has authority to make adjustments...
03170 //         if ((0 != lAdjustment) && bIsPrivilegedNym)
03171         //
03172         // Note: if the adjustment is non-zero, then we ALREADY know the acting Nym has the authority.
03173         // How do we know?
03174         //
03175         // int64_t lAdjustment  = (bIsPrivilegedNym && OTServer::__admin_usage_credits) ? MsgIn.m_lDepth : 0;
03176         //
03177         // (Therefore we also know that the server is in usage credits mode, as well.)
03178         //
03179         if (0 != lAdjustment)
03180         {
03181             // Only the override Nym can get inside this block and set the credits.
03182             // And ONLY in the case where usage credits are turned on, on the server side.
03183             // Any other Nym can use UsageCredits message but as read-only, to retrieve
03184             // the value, not to actually set it. In that case, the adjustment is always
03185             // interpreted as "0", and the return value usage credits is always set to -1.
03186             //
03187             pNym->SetUsageCredits(lNewCredits);
03188             msgOut.m_bSuccess = pNym->SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer); // We changed it, so let's save pNym...
03189         }
03190         else
03191             msgOut.m_bSuccess = true; // No adjustment -- we're just returning the current usage credits or -1, depending on whether server is in usage mode.
03192         //
03193         // This is because we always return credits of -1 in this case, so we don't want to be secretly
03194         // continuing to adjust the credits farther and farther while simultaneously returning -1.
03195         // -------------------------------------------------
03196         // Either way (even if adjustment is zero) then lNewCredits contains the value being sent back...
03197         //
03198         if (OTServer::__admin_usage_credits) // If the server has usage credits turned on...
03199             msgOut.m_lDepth = lNewCredits;   // ...then adjustment or not, we send the current usage credits balance back in the server reply.
03200         else                                 // Else if the server does NOT have usage credits turned on...
03201             msgOut.m_lDepth = -1;            // ...then we always return -1, so the client doesn't pop up any error messages related to usage credits.
03202     }
03203     // -----------------------------------------------------
03204     // (2) Sign the Message
03205     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
03206 
03207     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
03208     //
03209     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
03210     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
03211     msgOut.SaveContract();
03212 }
03213 
03214 
03215 
03216 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
03217 
03218 
03219 
03220 
03222 void OTServer::UserCmdIssueAssetType(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
03223 {
03224     const char * szFunc = "OTServer::UserCmdIssueAssetType";
03225 
03226     // (1) set up member variables
03227     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@issueAssetType";// reply to issueAssetType
03228     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
03229     msgOut.m_strAssetID     = MsgIn.m_strAssetID;   // Asset Type ID, a hash of the asset contract.
03230 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
03231 
03232     // already at the top of ProcessUserCommand, which calls this.
03233 //  msgOut.m_strRequestNum.Set(MsgIn.m_strRequestNum);
03234 
03235     const OTIdentifier USER_ID(theNym), SERVER_ID(m_strServerID), ASSET_TYPE_ID(MsgIn.m_strAssetID);
03236 
03237     OTAssetContract * pAssetContract = GetAssetContract(ASSET_TYPE_ID);
03238 
03239     // Make sure the contract isn't already available on this server.
03240     //
03241     if (NULL != pAssetContract) // it exists already.
03242     {
03243         OTLog::vError("%s: Error: Attempt to issue asset type that already exists.\n",
03244                       szFunc);
03245     }
03246     else
03247     {
03248         // Pull the contract out of the message and verify it.
03249         OTString strFoldername(OTFolders::Contract().Get()), strFilename(MsgIn.m_strAssetID.Get());
03250 
03251         OTString strContract(MsgIn.m_ascPayload);
03252         pAssetContract = new OTAssetContract(MsgIn.m_strAssetID, strFoldername, strFilename, MsgIn.m_strAssetID);
03253 
03254         OTIdentifier    ASSET_USER_ID;
03255         bool            bSuccessLoadingContract = false;
03256         bool            bSuccessCalculateDigest = false;
03257         OTPseudonym *   pNym                    = NULL;
03258 
03259         if (NULL == pAssetContract)
03260         {
03261             OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failed trying to instantiate asset contract. Asset ID: %s\n",
03262                           szFunc, MsgIn.m_strAssetID.Get());
03263         }
03264         else // success instantiating contract.
03265         {
03266             bSuccessLoadingContract = pAssetContract->LoadContractFromString(strContract);
03267 
03268             if (!bSuccessLoadingContract)
03269             {
03270                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failed trying to load asset contract from string. Asset ID: %s\n",
03271                                szFunc, MsgIn.m_strAssetID.Get());
03272                 OTLog::vOutput(1, "%s: Failed trying to load asset contract from string. Contract:\n\n%s\n\n",
03273                                szFunc, strContract.Get());
03274             }
03275             else if (pAssetContract->GetBasketInfo().Exists())
03276             {
03277                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Prevented attempt by user to issue a basket currency contract. (He needs to use the issueBasket message for that.)\n");
03278             }
03279             else // success loading contract from string.
03280             {
03281                 pNym = (OTPseudonym*)pAssetContract->GetContractPublicNym(); // todo fix this cast.
03282 
03283                 if (NULL == pNym)
03284                 {
03285                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failed trying to retrieve Issuer's public key from asset "
03286                                    "contract. Asset ID: %s\n", szFunc, MsgIn.m_strAssetID.Get());
03287                 }
03288                 else // success retrieving issuer Nym's public key from asset contract.
03289                 {
03290                     pNym->GetIdentifier(ASSET_USER_ID);
03291 
03292                     bSuccessCalculateDigest = true;
03293 
03294 //                    OTString strPublicKey;
03295 //                    bool bGotPublicKey = pNym->GetPublicSignKey().GetPublicKey(strPublicKey);
03296 //
03297 //                    if (!bGotPublicKey)
03298 //                    {
03299 //                        OTLog::vError("%s: Error getting public key in OTServer::UserCmdIssueAssetType.\n",
03300 //                                      szFunc);
03301 //                    }
03302 //                    else // success retrieving public key from Nym
03303 //                    {
03304 //                        bSuccessCalculateDigest = ASSET_USER_ID.CalculateDigest(strPublicKey);
03305 //
03306 //                        if (!bSuccessCalculateDigest)
03307 //                        {
03308 //                            OTLog::vError("%s: Error calculating digest in OTServer::UserCmdIssueAssetType.\n",
03309 //                                          szFunc);
03310 //                        }
03311 //                    }
03312                 }
03313             }
03314         }
03315 
03316         // Make sure the public key in the contract is the public key of the Nym.
03317         // If we successfully loaded the contract from the string, and the contract
03318         // internally verifies (the ID matches the hash of the contract, and the
03319         // signature verifies with the contract key that's inside the contract),
03320         // AND the Nym making this request has the same ID as the Nym in the
03321         // asset contract. (ONLY the issuer of that contract can connect to this
03322         // server and issue his currency.)
03323         // TODO make sure a receipt is issued that the issuer can post on his
03324         // website, to verify that he has indeed issued the currency at the specified
03325         // transaction processor.  That way, users can double-check.
03326         if (bSuccessCalculateDigest)
03327         {
03328             if ((ASSET_USER_ID == USER_ID))
03329                                         // The ID of the user who signed the contract must be the ID of the user
03330                                         // whose public key is associated with this user account. They are one.
03331             {
03332                 if (pAssetContract->VerifyContract())
03333                 {
03334                     // Create an ISSUER account (like a normal account, except it can go negative)
03335                     OTAccount * pNewAccount = NULL;
03336                     OTCleanup<OTAccount> theAcctGuardian;
03337 
03338                     pNewAccount = OTAccount::GenerateNewAccount(USER_ID, SERVER_ID,
03339                                                                 m_nymServer, MsgIn,
03340                                                                 OTAccount::issuer);
03341 
03342                     // If we successfully create the account, then bundle it in the message XML payload
03343                     if (NULL != pNewAccount) // This last parameter generates an ISSUER account
03344                     {                                                                   // instead of the default SIMPLE.
03345                         theAcctGuardian.SetCleanupTarget(*pNewAccount); // So I don't have to worry about cleaning it up.
03346 
03347                         OTString tempPayload(*pNewAccount);
03348                         msgOut.m_ascPayload.SetString(tempPayload);
03349 
03350                         // Attach the new account number to the outgoing message.
03351                         pNewAccount->GetIdentifier(msgOut.m_strAcctID);
03352 
03353                         // Now that the account is actually created, let's add the new asset contract
03354                         // to the server's list.
03355                         AddAssetContract(*pAssetContract); // Do NOT clean this up unless failure! Server will clean it up.
03356                         SaveMainFile(); // So the main xml file knows to load this asset type next time we run.
03357 
03358                         // Make sure the contracts/%s file is created for next time.
03359                         pAssetContract->SaveContract(OTFolders::Contract().Get(), strFilename.Get());
03360                         // ---------------------------------------------------
03361                         OTIdentifier theNewAccountID;
03362                         pNewAccount->GetIdentifier(theNewAccountID);
03363                         // -----------------------------------------------
03364                         OTLog::Output(0, "Generating inbox/outbox for new issuer acct. \n");
03365 
03366                         OTLedger    theOutbox   (USER_ID, theNewAccountID, SERVER_ID),
03367                                     theInbox    (USER_ID, theNewAccountID, SERVER_ID);
03368 
03369                         bool bSuccessLoadingInbox   = theInbox.LoadInbox();
03370                         bool bSuccessLoadingOutbox  = theOutbox.LoadOutbox();
03371                         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
03372                         // ...or generate them otherwise...
03373 
03374                         if (true == bSuccessLoadingInbox) // WEIRD IF THIS HAPPENED...
03375                             bSuccessLoadingInbox    = theInbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer); // todo -- this should NEVER happen, the ID was just RANDOMLY generated, so HOW did the inbox already exist???
03376                         else
03377                         {
03378                             bSuccessLoadingInbox    = theInbox.GenerateLedger(theNewAccountID, SERVER_ID, OTLedger::inbox, true); // bGenerateFile=true
03379 
03380                             if (bSuccessLoadingInbox)
03381                             {
03382                                 bSuccessLoadingInbox    = theInbox.SignContract(m_nymServer);
03383 
03384                                 if (bSuccessLoadingInbox)
03385                                 {
03386                                     bSuccessLoadingInbox = theInbox.SaveContract();
03387 
03388                                     if (bSuccessLoadingInbox)
03389                                         bSuccessLoadingInbox    = pNewAccount->SaveInbox(theInbox);
03390                                 }
03391                             }
03392                         }
03393                         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
03394                         if (true == bSuccessLoadingOutbox) // WEIRD IF THIS HAPPENED....
03395                             bSuccessLoadingOutbox   = theOutbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer); // todo -- this should NEVER happen, the ID was just RANDOMLY generated, so HOW did the outbox already exist???
03396                         else
03397                         {
03398                             bSuccessLoadingOutbox   = theOutbox.GenerateLedger(theNewAccountID, SERVER_ID, OTLedger::outbox, true); // bGenerateFile=true
03399 
03400                             if (bSuccessLoadingOutbox)
03401                             {
03402                                 bSuccessLoadingOutbox   = theOutbox.SignContract(m_nymServer);
03403 
03404                                 if (bSuccessLoadingOutbox)
03405                                 {
03406                                     bSuccessLoadingOutbox = theOutbox.SaveContract();
03407 
03408                                     if (bSuccessLoadingOutbox)
03409                                         bSuccessLoadingOutbox   = pNewAccount->SaveOutbox(theOutbox);
03410                                 }
03411                             }
03412                         }
03413                         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
03414                         if (false == bSuccessLoadingInbox)
03415                         {
03416                             OTString strNewAcctID(theNewAccountID);
03417 
03418                             OTLog::vError("ERROR generating inbox ledger in OTServer::UserCmdIssueAssetType:\n%s\n",
03419                                           strNewAcctID.Get());
03420                         }
03421                         else if (false == bSuccessLoadingOutbox)
03422                         {
03423                             OTString strNewAcctID(theNewAccountID);
03424 
03425                             OTLog::vError("ERROR generating outbox ledger in OTServer::UserCmdIssueAssetType:\n%s\n",
03426                                           strNewAcctID.Get());
03427                         }
03428                         else
03429                         {
03430                             msgOut.m_bSuccess = true; // <==== SUCCESS!!
03431 
03432                             // On the server side, each nym stores a list of its asset accounts (IDs).
03433                             //
03434                             std::set<std::string> & theAccountSet = theNym.GetSetAssetAccounts();
03435                             theAccountSet.insert(msgOut.m_strAcctID.Get());
03436 
03437                             theNym.SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer);
03438 
03439                             // TODO fire off a separate process here to create the mint.
03440                             //
03441                             // THE PROGRAM ALREADY EXISTS (CreateMint) and you can RUN IT BY HAND FOR NOW.
03442                             // But in actual production environment, we'll trigger that executable here,
03443                             // and within a few minutes, users will be able to getMint successfully (and
03444                             // thus withdraw cash.)
03445                         }
03446                     }
03447                     else
03448                         OTLog::Error("Failure generating new issuer account in OTServer::UserCmdIssueAssetType.\n");
03449                 }
03450                 else
03451                     OTLog::Error("Failure verifying asset contract in OTServer::UserCmdIssueAssetType.\n");
03452             }
03453             else
03454             {
03455                 OTString strAssetUserID(ASSET_USER_ID), strUserID;
03456                 theNym.GetIdentifier(strUserID);
03457                 OTLog::vError("User ID on this user account (%s) does NOT match User ID "
03458                               "for public key used in asset contract: %s\n",
03459                               strUserID.Get(), strAssetUserID.Get());
03460             }
03461         }
03462         else
03463             OTLog::vError("%s: Failure loading asset contract from client.\n", __FUNCTION__);
03464         // -----------------------------------------------
03465         if (pAssetContract && !msgOut.m_bSuccess) // We only clean it up here, if the Server didn't take ownership of it.
03466         {
03467             delete pAssetContract;
03468             pAssetContract = NULL;
03469         }
03470     }
03471 
03472     // Either way, we need to send the user's command back to him as well.
03473     {
03474         OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn);
03475         msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage);
03476     }
03477 
03478     // (2) Sign the Message
03479     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
03480 
03481     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
03482     //
03483     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
03484     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
03485     msgOut.SaveContract();
03486 
03487     // (You are in UserCmdIssueAssetType.)
03488 
03489     // *************************************************************
03490     // REPLY NOTICE TO NYMBOX
03491     //
03492     // Now that we signed / saved the reply message...
03493     //
03494     // After specific messages, we drop a notice with a copy of the server's reply
03495     // into the Nymbox.  This way we are GUARANTEED that the Nym will receive and process
03496     // it. (And thus never get out of sync.)
03497     //
03498     if (msgOut.m_bSuccess)
03499     {
03500         const OTString strReplyMessage(msgOut);
03501         const int64_t lReqNum = atol(MsgIn.m_strRequestNum.Get());
03502         // If it fails, it logs already.
03503         this->DropReplyNoticeToNymbox(SERVER_ID, USER_ID, strReplyMessage, lReqNum,
03504                                       false,    // trans success (not a transaction...)
03505                                       &theNym);
03506     }
03507 }
03508 
03509 
03510 
03512 void OTServer::UserCmdIssueBasket(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
03513 {
03514     // (1) set up member variables
03515     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@issueBasket";   // reply to issueBasket
03516     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
03517 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
03518 
03519     // Either way, we need to send the user's command back to him as well.
03520     {
03521         OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn);
03522         msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage);
03523     }
03524 
03525     const OTIdentifier USER_ID(theNym), SERVER_ID(m_strServerID), SERVER_USER_ID(m_nymServer);
03526 
03527     OTString strBasket(MsgIn.m_ascPayload);
03528     OTBasket theBasket;
03529 
03530     if (!theBasket.LoadContractFromString(strBasket))
03531     {
03532         OTLog::vError("%s: Failed trying to load basket from string.\n", __FUNCTION__);
03533     }
03534     else if (!theBasket.VerifySignature(theNym))
03535     {
03536         OTLog::vError("%s: Failed verifying signature on basket.\n", __FUNCTION__);
03537     }
03538     else
03539     {
03540         // The basket ID should be the same on all servers.
03541         // The basket contract ID will be unique on each server.
03542         //
03543         // The contract ID of the basket is calculated based on the UNSIGNED portion of the contract
03544         // (so it is unique on every server) and for the same reason with the AccountID removed before calculating.
