03545         OTIdentifier BASKET_ID, BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID, BASKET_CONTRACT_ID;
03546         theBasket.CalculateContractID(BASKET_ID);
03547 
03548         // Use BASKET_ID to look up the Basket account and see if it already exists (the server keeps a list.)
03549         bool bFoundBasket = LookupBasketAccountID(BASKET_ID, BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID);
03550 
03551         if (bFoundBasket)
03552         {
03553             OTLog::vError("%s: Rejected: user tried to create basket currency that already exists.\n", __FUNCTION__);
03554         }
03555         else // Basket doesn't already exist -- so perhaps we can create it then.
03556         {
03557             // Let's make sure that all the sub-currencies for this basket are available on this server.
03558             // NOTE: this also prevents someone from using another basket as a sub-currency UNLESS it already
03559             // exists on this server. (For example, they couldn't use a basket contract from some other
03560             // server, since it wouldn't be issued here...) Also note that issueAssetType explicitly prevents
03561             // baskets from being issued -- you HAVE to use issueBasket for creating any basket currency.
03562             // Taken in tandem, this insures that the only possible way to have a basket currency as a sub-currency
03563             // is if it's already issued on this server.
03564             //
03565             bool bSubCurrenciesAllExist = true;
03566 
03567             for (int32_t i = 0; i < theBasket.Count(); i++)
03568             {
03569                 BasketItem * pItem = theBasket.At(i);
03570                 OT_ASSERT(NULL != pItem);
03571 
03572                 if (NULL == this->GetAssetContract(pItem->SUB_CONTRACT_ID)) // Sub-currency not found.
03573                 {
03574                     const OTString strSubID(pItem->SUB_CONTRACT_ID);
03575                     OTLog::vError("%s: Failed: Sub-currency for basket is not issued on this server: %s\n",
03576                                   __FUNCTION__, strSubID.Get());
03577                     bSubCurrenciesAllExist = false;
03578                     break;
03579                 }
03580             }
03581             // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
03582             // By this point we know that the basket currency itself does NOT already exist (good.)
03583             // We also know that all the subcurrencies DO already exist (good.)
03584             //
03585             if (bSubCurrenciesAllExist)
03586             {
03587                 // GenerateNewAccount also expects the NymID to be stored in m_strNymID.
03588                 // Since we want the SERVER to be the user for basket accounts, I'm setting it that
03589                 // way in MsgIn so that GenerateNewAccount will create the sub-account with the server
03590                 // as the owner, instead of the user.
03591                 SERVER_USER_ID.GetString(MsgIn.m_strNymID);
03592 
03593                 // We need to actually create all the sub-accounts.
03594                 // This loop also sets the Account ID onto the basket items (which formerly was blank, from the client.)
03595                 // This loop also adds the BASKET_ID and the NEW ACCOUNT ID to a map on the server for later reference.
03596                 for (int32_t i = 0; i < theBasket.Count(); i++)
03597                 {
03598                     BasketItem * pItem = theBasket.At(i);
03599                     OT_ASSERT(NULL != pItem);
03600 
03601                     /*
03602                      // Just make sure theMessage has these members populated:
03603                      //
03604                      // theMessage.m_strNymID;
03605                      // theMessage.m_strAssetID;
03606                      // theMessage.m_strServerID;
03607 
03608                      // static method (call it without an instance, using notation: OTAccount::GenerateNewAccount)
03609                      OTAccount * OTAccount::GenerateNewAccount( const OTIdentifier & theUserID, const OTIdentifier & theServerID,
03610                                                                 const OTPseudonym & theServerNym,   const OTMessage & theMessage,
03611                                                                 const OTAccount::AccountType eAcctType=OTAccount::simple)
03612 
03613                      // The above method uses this one internally...
03614                      bool OTAccount::GenerateNewAccount(const OTPseudonym & theServer, const OTMessage & theMessage,
03615                                                         const OTAccount::AccountType eAcctType=OTAccount::simple)
03616                      */
03617 
03618                     OTAccount * pNewAccount = NULL;
03619 
03620                     // GenerateNewAccount expects the Asset ID to be in MsgIn.
03621                     // So we'll just put it there to make things easy...
03622                     //
03623                     pItem->SUB_CONTRACT_ID.GetString(MsgIn.m_strAssetID);
03624 
03625                     pNewAccount = OTAccount::GenerateNewAccount(SERVER_USER_ID,
03626                                                                 SERVER_ID,
03627                                                                 m_nymServer,
03628                                                                 MsgIn,
03629                                                                 OTAccount::basketsub);
03630 
03631                     // If we successfully create the account, then bundle it
03632                     // in the message XML payload
03633                     //
03634                     if (NULL != pNewAccount)
03635                     {
03636                         msgOut.m_bSuccess = true;
03637 
03638                         // Now the item finally has its account ID. Let's grab it.
03639                         pNewAccount->GetIdentifier(pItem->SUB_ACCOUNT_ID);
03640 
03641                         delete pNewAccount;
03642                         pNewAccount = NULL;
03643                     }
03644                     else
03645                     {
03646                         OTLog::vError("%s: Failed while calling: "
03647                                      "OTAccount::GenerateNewAccount(SERVER_USER_ID, SERVER_ID, m_nymServer, "
03648                                      "MsgIn, OTAccount::basketsub)\n", __FUNCTION__);
03649                         msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
03650                         break;
03651                     }
03652                 } // for
03653 
03654 
03655                 if (true == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
03656                 {
03657                     // Generate a new OTAssetContract -- the ID will be a hash of THAT contract, which includes theBasket as well as
03658                     // the server's public key as part of its contents. Therefore, the actual Asset Type ID of the basket currency
03659                     // will be different from server to server.
03660                     //
03661                     // BUT!! Because we can also generate a hash of theBasket.m_xmlUnsigned (which is what OTBasket::CalculateContractID
03662                     // does) then we have a way of obtaining a number that will be the same from server to server, for cross-server
03663                     // transfers of basket assets.
03664                     //
03665                     // The way it will work is, when the cross-server transfer request is generated, the server will check the asset contract
03666                     // for the "from" account and see if it is for a basket currency. If it is, there will be a function on the contract
03667                     // that returns the Basket ID, which can be included in the message to the target server, which uses the ID to look
03668                     // for its own basket issuer account for the same basket asset type. This allows the target server to translate the
03669                     // Asset Type ID to its own corresponding ID for the same basket.
03670                     // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
03671                     theBasket.ReleaseSignatures();
03672                     theBasket.SignContract(m_nymServer);
03673                     theBasket.SaveContract();
03674 
03675                     // The basket does not yet exist on this server. Create a new Asset Contract to support it...
03676                     OTAssetContract * pBasketContract = new OTAssetContract;
03677 
03678                     // todo check for memory allocation failure here.
03679 
03680                     // Put the Server's Public Key into the "contract" key field of the new Asset Contract...
03681                     // This adds a "contract" key to the asset contract (the server's public key)
03682                     // Asset Contracts are verified by a key found internal to the contract, so it's
03683                     // necessary to put the key in there so it will verify later.
03684                     // This also updates the m_xmlUnsigned contents, signs the contract, saves it,
03685                     // and calculates the new ID.
03686                     pBasketContract->CreateBasket(theBasket, m_nymServer);
03687 
03688                     // Grab the new asset ID for the new basket currency
03689                     pBasketContract->GetIdentifier(BASKET_CONTRACT_ID);
03690                     OTString STR_BASKET_CONTRACT_ID(BASKET_CONTRACT_ID);
03691 
03692                     // set the new Asset Type ID, aka ContractID, onto the outgoing message.
03693                     msgOut.m_strAssetID = STR_BASKET_CONTRACT_ID;
03694 
03695                     // Save the new Asset Contract to disk
03696                     const OTString strFoldername(OTFolders::Contract().Get()), strFilename(STR_BASKET_CONTRACT_ID.Get());
03697 
03698                     // Save the new basket contract to the contracts folder
03699                     // (So the users can use it the same as they would use any other contract.)
03700                     pBasketContract->SaveContract(strFoldername.Get(), strFilename.Get());
03701 
03702                     AddAssetContract(*pBasketContract);
03703                     // I don't save this here. Instead, I wait for AddBasketAccountID and then I call SaveMainFile after that. See below.
03704                     // TODO need better code for reverting when something screws up halfway through a change.
03705                     // If I add this contract, it's not enough to just "not save" the file. I actually need to re-load the file
03706                     // in order to TRULY "make sure" this won't screw something up on down the line.
03707 
03708                     // Once the new Asset Type is generated, from which the BasketID can be requested at will, next we need to create
03709                     // the issuer account for that new Asset Type.  (We have the asset type ID and the contract file. Now let's create
03710                     // the issuer account the same as we would for any normal issuer account.)
03711                     //
03712                     // The issuer account is special compared to a normal issuer account, because within its walls, it must store an
03713                     // OTAccount for EACH sub-contract, in order to store the reserves. That's what makes the basket work.
03714 
03715                     OTAccount * pBasketAccount = NULL;
03716 
03717                     // GenerateNewAccount expects the Asset ID to be in MsgIn. So we'll just put it there to make things easy...
03718                     MsgIn.m_strAssetID = STR_BASKET_CONTRACT_ID;
03719 
03720                     pBasketAccount = OTAccount::GenerateNewAccount(SERVER_USER_ID, SERVER_ID, m_nymServer, MsgIn, OTAccount::basket);
03721 
03722                     if (NULL != pBasketAccount)
03723                     {
03724                         msgOut.m_bSuccess = true;
03725 
03726                         pBasketAccount->GetIdentifier(msgOut.m_strAcctID); // string
03727                         pBasketAccount->GetAssetTypeID().GetString(msgOut.m_strAssetID);
03728 
03729                         pBasketAccount->GetIdentifier(BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID); // id
03730 
03731                         // So the server can later use the BASKET_ID (which is universal)
03732                         // to lookup the account ID on this server corresponding to that basket.
03733                         // (The account ID will be different from server to server, thus the need
03734                         // to be able to look it up via the basket ID.)
03735                         AddBasketAccountID(BASKET_ID, BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID, BASKET_CONTRACT_ID);
03736 
03737                         SaveMainFile(); // So the main xml file loads this basket info next time we run.
03738 
03739                         delete pBasketAccount;
03740                         pBasketAccount = NULL;
03741                     }
03742                     else
03743                     {
03744                         msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
03745                     }
03746 
03747                 }// if true == msgOut.m_bSuccess
03748             } // Subcurrencies all do exist.
03749         } // basket doesn't already exist (creating it)
03750     }
03751 
03752     // (2) Sign the Message
03753     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
03754 
03755     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
03756     //
03757     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
03758     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
03759     msgOut.SaveContract();
03760 }
03761 
03762 
03763 
03765 void OTServer::UserCmdCreateAccount(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
03766 {
03767     const char * szFunc = "OTServer::UserCmdCreateAccount";
03768 
03769     // (1) set up member variables
03770     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@createAccount"; // reply to createAccount
03771     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
03772 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
03773 
03774     // Either way, we need to send the user's command back to him as well.
03775     OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn);
03776     msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage);
03777 
03778     const OTIdentifier USER_ID(theNym), SERVER_ID(m_strServerID);
03779     // ----------------------------------------------
03780 
03781     OTAccount * pNewAccount = OTAccount::GenerateNewAccount(USER_ID, SERVER_ID, m_nymServer, MsgIn);
03782     OTCleanup<OTAccount> theAcctAngel(pNewAccount);
03783 
03784     // If we successfully create the account, then bundle it in the message XML payload
03785     if (NULL != pNewAccount)
03786     {
03787         OTAssetContract * pContract = GetAssetContract(pNewAccount->GetAssetTypeID());
03788 
03789         if (NULL == pContract)
03790         {
03791             const OTString strAssetID(pNewAccount->GetAssetTypeID());
03792             OTLog::vError("%s: Error: Unable to get AssetContract for asset type: %s\n",
03793                           szFunc, strAssetID.Get());
03794         }
03795         else if (pContract->IsShares())
03796         {
03797             // The asset type keeps a list of all accounts for that type.
03798             // (For shares, not for currencies.)
03799             //
03800             const bool bAdded = pContract->AddAccountRecord(*pNewAccount);
03801             if (!bAdded)
03802             {
03803                 const OTString strAssetID(pNewAccount->GetAssetTypeID());
03804                 OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR Adding Account Record: %s ... Aborting.\n", __FUNCTION__,strAssetID.Get());
03805                 return; //error
03806             }
03807         }
03808         // -----------------------------------------------
03809         OTIdentifier theNewAccountID;
03810         pNewAccount->GetIdentifier(theNewAccountID);
03811 
03812 //      OTLog::Error("DEBUG: GenerateNewAccount successfully returned account pointer. Contents:\n%s\n", tempPayload.Get());
03813 
03814         // -----------------------------------------------
03815 
03816         OTLedger    theOutbox(USER_ID, theNewAccountID, SERVER_ID),
03817                     theInbox (USER_ID, theNewAccountID, SERVER_ID);
03818 
03819         bool bSuccessLoadingInbox   = theInbox. LoadInbox();
03820         bool bSuccessLoadingOutbox  = theOutbox.LoadOutbox();
03821 
03822         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
03823 
03824         // ...or generate them otherwise...
03825 
03826         if (true == bSuccessLoadingInbox) // WEIRD IF THIS HAPPENED...
03827             bSuccessLoadingInbox    = theInbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer); // todo -- this should NEVER happen, the ID was just RANDOMLY generated, so HOW did the inbox already exist???
03828         else
03829         {
03830             bSuccessLoadingInbox    = theInbox.GenerateLedger(theNewAccountID, SERVER_ID, OTLedger::inbox, true); // bGenerateFile=true
03831 
03832             if (bSuccessLoadingInbox)
03833             {
03834                 bSuccessLoadingInbox    = theInbox.SignContract(m_nymServer);
03835 
03836                 if (bSuccessLoadingInbox)
03837                 {
03838                     bSuccessLoadingInbox = theInbox.SaveContract();
03839 
03840                     if (bSuccessLoadingInbox)
03841                         bSuccessLoadingInbox    = pNewAccount->SaveInbox(theInbox);
03842                 }
03843             }
03844         }
03845 
03846         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
03847 
03848         if (true == bSuccessLoadingOutbox) // WEIRD IF THIS HAPPENED....
03849             bSuccessLoadingOutbox   = theOutbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer); // todo -- this should NEVER happen, the ID was just RANDOMLY generated, so HOW did the outbox already exist???
03850         else
03851         {
03852             bSuccessLoadingOutbox   = theOutbox.GenerateLedger(theNewAccountID, SERVER_ID, OTLedger::outbox, true); // bGenerateFile=true
03853 
03854             if (bSuccessLoadingOutbox)
03855             {
03856                 bSuccessLoadingOutbox   = theOutbox.SignContract(m_nymServer);
03857 
03858                 if (bSuccessLoadingOutbox)
03859                 {
03860                     bSuccessLoadingOutbox = theOutbox.SaveContract();
03861 
03862                     if (bSuccessLoadingOutbox)
03863                         bSuccessLoadingOutbox   = pNewAccount->SaveOutbox(theOutbox);
03864                 }
03865             }
03866         }
03867 
03868         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
03869 
03870         if (false == bSuccessLoadingInbox)
03871         {
03872             const OTString strNewAcctID(theNewAccountID);
03873 
03874             OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR generating inbox ledger: %s\n", szFunc,
03875                           strNewAcctID.Get());
03876         }
03877         else if (false == bSuccessLoadingOutbox)
03878         {
03879             const OTString strNewAcctID(theNewAccountID);
03880 
03881             OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR generating outbox ledger: %s\n", szFunc,
03882                           strNewAcctID.Get());
03883         }
03884         else
03885         {
03886             msgOut.m_bSuccess = true; // <==== SUCCESS!!
03887 
03888             pNewAccount->GetIdentifier(msgOut.m_strAcctID);
03889 
03890             // On the server side, each nym stores a list of its asset accounts (IDs).
03891             //
03892             std::set<std::string> & theAccountSet = theNym.GetSetAssetAccounts();
03893             theAccountSet.insert(msgOut.m_strAcctID.Get());
03894 
03895             theNym.SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer);
03896 
03897             // ---------------------------------
03898 
03899             OTString tempPayload(*pNewAccount);
03900             msgOut.m_ascPayload.SetString(tempPayload);
03901         }
03902         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
03903     }
03904 
03905 
03906     // (2) Sign the Message
03907     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
03908 
03909     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
03910     //
03911     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
03912     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
03913     msgOut.SaveContract();
03914 
03915 
03916     // (You are in UserCmdCreateAcct.)
03917 
03918     // *************************************************************
03919     // REPLY NOTICE TO NYMBOX
03920     //
03921     // Now that we signed / saved the reply message...
03922     //
03923     // After specific messages, we drop a notice with a copy of the server's reply
03924     // into the Nymbox.  This way we are GUARANTEED that the Nym will receive and process
03925     // it. (And thus never get out of sync.)
03926     //
03927     if (msgOut.m_bSuccess)
03928     {
03929         const OTString strReplyMessage(msgOut);
03930         const int64_t lReqNum = atol(MsgIn.m_strRequestNum.Get());
03931 
03932         // If it fails, it logs already.
03933         this->DropReplyNoticeToNymbox(SERVER_ID, USER_ID, strReplyMessage, lReqNum, // No need to update the NymboxHash in this case.
03934                                       false);   // trans success (not a transaction)
03935 //      this->DropReplyNoticeToNymbox(SERVER_ID, USER_ID, strReplyMessage, lReqNum, &theNym);
03936     }
03937 }
03938 
03939 
03940 
03941 
03942 
03943 void OTServer::NotarizeTransfer(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTAccount & theFromAccount, OTTransaction & tranIn, OTTransaction & tranOut, bool & bOutSuccess)
03944 {
03945     // The outgoing transaction is an "atTransfer", that is, "a reply to the transfer request"
03946     tranOut.SetType(OTTransaction::atTransfer);
03947 
03948     OTItem * pItem          = NULL;
03949     OTItem * pBalanceItem   = NULL;
03950     OTItem * pResponseItem  = NULL;
03951     OTItem * pResponseBalanceItem   = NULL;
03952 
03953     // The incoming transaction may be sent to inboxes and outboxes, and it
03954     // will probably be bundled in our reply to the user as well. Therefore,
03955     // let's grab it as a string.
03956     OTString strInReferenceTo;
03957     OTString strBalanceItem;
03958 
03959     // Grab the actual server ID from this object, and use it as the server ID here.
03960     const OTIdentifier  SERVER_ID(m_strServerID),       USER_ID(theNym),    ACCOUNT_ID(theFromAccount),
03961                         ASSET_TYPE_ID(theFromAccount.GetAssetTypeID());
03962 
03963     OTString strUserID(USER_ID), strAccountID(ACCOUNT_ID);
03964     // --------------------
03965     pResponseBalanceItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atBalanceStatement);
03966     pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
03967     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseBalanceItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
03968     // --------------------
03969     pResponseItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atTransfer);
03970     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
03971     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
03972     // --------------------
03973 
03974     if (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_transfer))
03975     {
03976         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeTransfer: User %s cannot do this transaction (All acct-to-acct transfers are disallowed in server.cfg)\n",
03977                        strUserID.Get());
03978     }
03979     // --------------------
03980     else if (NULL == (pBalanceItem = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::balanceStatement)))
03981     {
03982         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
03983         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeTransfer: Expected OTItem::balanceStatement in trans# %ld: \n\n%s\n\n",
03984                        tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR LOADING TRANSACTION INTO STRING) ");
03985     }
03986     // For now, there should only be one of these transfer items inside the transaction.
03987     // So we treat it that way... I either get it successfully or not.
03988     else if (NULL == (pItem = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::transfer)))
03989     {
03990         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
03991         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeTransfer: Expected OTItem::transfer in trans# %ld: \n\n%s\n\n",
03992                        tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR LOADING TRANSACTION INTO STRING) ");
03993     }
03994     else if (ACCOUNT_ID == pItem->GetDestinationAcctID())
03995     {
03996         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
03997         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeTransfer: Failed attempt by user %s in trans# %ld, to transfer money \"To the From Acct\": \n\n%s\n\n",
03998                        strUserID.Get(), tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR LOADING TRANSACTION INTO STRING) ");
03999     }
04000     else
04001     {
04002         // The response item, as well as the inbox and outbox items, will contain a copy
04003         // of the request item. So I save it into a string here so they can all grab a copy of it
04004         // into their "in reference to" fields.
04005         pItem->SaveContractRaw(strInReferenceTo);
04006         pBalanceItem->SaveContractRaw(strBalanceItem);
04007 
04008         // IDFromAccount is the ID on the "from" Account that was passed in.
04009         // IDItemFromAccount is the "from" account ID on the transaction Item we are currently examining.
04010         // IDItemToAccount is the "to" account ID on the transaction item we are currently examining.
04011         OTIdentifier IDFromAccount(theFromAccount);
04012 
04013         // Server response item being added to server response transaction (tranOut)
04014         // They're getting SOME sort of response item.
04015 
04016         pResponseItem->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
04017         pResponseItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
04018         pResponseItem->SetNumberOfOrigin(*pItem);
04019 
04020         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceString(strBalanceItem); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
04021         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
04022         pResponseBalanceItem->SetNumberOfOrigin(*pItem);
04023 
04024 //      OTString strTestInRefTo2;
04025 //      pResponseItem->GetReferenceString(strTestInRefTo2);
04026 //      OTLog::Error("DEBUG: Item in reference to: %s\n", strTestInRefTo2.Get());
04027 
04028         // Set the ID on the To Account based on what the transaction request said. (So we can load it up.)
04029         OTAccount * pDestinationAcct = OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount(pItem->GetDestinationAcctID(), SERVER_ID);
04030         OTCleanup<OTAccount> theDestAcctGuardian(pDestinationAcct); // This is safe in cases where NULL is returned. No more need to cleanup pDestAcct.
04031 
04032         // Only accept transfers with positive amounts.
04033         if (0 > pItem->GetAmount())
04034         {
04035             OTLog::Output(0, "OTServer::NotarizeTransfer: Failure: Attempt to transfer negative balance.\n");
04036         }
04037 
04038         // I'm using the operator== because it exists.
04039         // If the ID on the "from" account that was passed in,
04040         // does not match the "Acct From" ID on this transaction item
04041         else if (!(IDFromAccount == pItem->GetPurportedAccountID()))
04042         {
04043             OTLog::Output(0, "OTServer::NotarizeTransfer: Error: 'From' account ID on the transaction does not match 'from' account ID on the transaction item.\n");
04044         }
04045         // ok so the IDs match. Does the destination account exist?
04046         else if (NULL == pDestinationAcct)
04047         {
04048             OTLog::Output(0, "OTServer::NotarizeTransfer: ERROR verifying existence of the 'to' account.\n");
04049         }
04050         // Is the destination a legitimate other user's acct, or is it just an internal server account?
04051         // (That is, stash accounts, voucher accounts, basket accounts, etc are only used internally,
04052         // and may not be recipients to user transfers...)
04053         //
04054         else if (pDestinationAcct->IsInternalServerAcct())
04055         {
04056             OTLog::Output(0, "OTServer::NotarizeTransfer: Failure: Destination account is used internally by the server, and is not a valid recipient for this transaction.\n");
04057         }
04058         // Are both of the accounts of the same Asset Type?
04059         else if (!(theFromAccount.GetAssetTypeID() == pDestinationAcct->GetAssetTypeID()))
04060         {
04061             OTString strFromAssetID(theFromAccount.GetAssetTypeID()),
04062             strDestinationAssetID(pDestinationAcct->GetAssetTypeID());
04063             OTLog::vOutput(0, "ERROR - user attempted to transfer between accounts of 2 different "
04064                     "asset types in OTServer::NotarizeTransfer:\n%s\n%s\n", strFromAssetID.Get(),
04065                     strDestinationAssetID.Get());
04066         }
04067         // Does it verify?
04068         // I call VerifySignature here since VerifyContractID was already called in LoadExistingAccount().
04069         else if (!pDestinationAcct->VerifySignature(m_nymServer))
04070         {
04071             OTLog::Output(0, "ERROR verifying signature on, the 'to' account in OTServer::NotarizeTransfer\n");
04072         }
04073 
04074         // This entire function can be divided into the top and bottom halves.
04075         // The top half is oriented around finding the "transfer" item (in the "transfer" transaction)
04076         // and setting up the response item that will go into the response transaction.
04077         // The bottom half is oriented, in the case of success, around creating the necessary inbox
04078         // and outbox entries, and debiting the account, and basically performing the actual transfer.
04079         else
04080         {
04081             // Okay then, everything checks out. Let's add this to the sender's outbox and the recipient's inbox.
04082             // IF they can be loaded up from file, or generated, that is.
04083 
04084             // Load the inbox/outbox in case they already exist
04085             OTLedger    theFromOutbox   (USER_ID, IDFromAccount, SERVER_ID),
04086                         theToInbox      (pItem->GetDestinationAcctID(), SERVER_ID);
04087 
04088             bool bSuccessLoadingInbox   = theToInbox.LoadInbox();
04089             bool bSuccessLoadingOutbox  = theFromOutbox.LoadOutbox();
04090             // --------------------------------------------------------------------
04091             // ...or generate them otherwise...
04092 
04093             // NOTE:
04094             // 1. Any normal user had his inbox created at the same time as his asset account was created.
04095             // 2. If there is an error now, we don't necessarily just want to re-create (and overwrite) that file.
04096             // 3. Therefore I do not generate the ledger for safety reasons, per 2.
04097             // 4. Also, what if an attempt is being made to transfer to an account that isn't SUPPOSED to have
04098             //    an inbox? For example, a server voucher account (where backing funds for vouchers are stored) does
04099             //    not have an inbox, and should not be able to receive transfers. In that case, we definitely don't want
04100             //    to just "generate" an inbox here! Instead, we want it to fail. In fact, I'm adding a check, above, for
04101             //    the account type. In fact, I'm adding a new method to OTAccount where we can just ask it, for each
04102             //    transaction type, whether it can even be used for that purpose in the first place.
04103             //    Update: appears OTAccount::IsInternalServerAcct already basically fits the bill.
04104 
04105             if (true == bSuccessLoadingInbox)
04106                 bSuccessLoadingInbox    = theToInbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer);
04107             else
04108                 OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeTransfer: Error loading 'to' inbox.\n");
04109 //          else
04110 //              bSuccessLoadingInbox    = theToInbox.GenerateLedger(pItem->GetDestinationAcctID(), SERVER_ID, OTLedger::inbox, true); // bGenerateFile=true
04111             // --------------------------------------------------------------------
04112             if (true == bSuccessLoadingOutbox)
04113                 bSuccessLoadingOutbox   = theFromOutbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer);
04114             else
04115                 OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeTransfer: Error loading 'from' outbox.\n");
04116 //          else
04117 //              bSuccessLoadingOutbox   = theFromOutbox.GenerateLedger(IDFromAccount, SERVER_ID, OTLedger::outbox, true); // bGenerateFile=true
04118             // --------------------------------------------------------------------
04119             OTLedger * pInbox   = theFromAccount.LoadInbox(m_nymServer);
04120             OTLedger * pOutbox  = theFromAccount.LoadOutbox(m_nymServer);
04121 
04122             OTCleanup<OTLedger> theInboxAngel(pInbox);
04123             OTCleanup<OTLedger> theOutboxAngel(pOutbox);
04124 
04125             if (NULL == pInbox) // || !pInbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) OTAccount::Load (above) already verifies.
04126             {
04127                 OTLog::Error("Error loading or verifying inbox.\n");
04128             }
04129 
04130             else if (NULL == pOutbox) // || !pOutbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) OTAccount::Load (above) already verifies.
04131             {
04132                 OTLog::Error("Error loading or verifying outbox.\n");
04133             }
04134             // --------------------------------------------------------------------
04135             else if (false == bSuccessLoadingInbox || false == bSuccessLoadingOutbox)
04136             {
04137                 OTLog::Error("ERROR generating ledger in OTServer::NotarizeTransfer.\n");
04138             }
04139             else
04140             {
04141                 // Generate new transaction number for these new transactions
04142                 // todo check this generation for failure (can it fail?)
04143                 int64_t lNewTransactionNumber = 0;
04144 
04145                 IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lNewTransactionNumber, false); // bStoreTheNumber = false
04146                 // ------------------------------------------
04147                 // I create TWO Outbox transactions -- one for the real outbox, (theFromOutbox)
04148                 // and one for pOutbox (used for verifying the balance statement.)
04149                 // pTEMPOutboxTransaction (here below) is that last one, pOutbox.
04150                 //
04151                 OTTransaction * pTEMPOutboxTransaction  = OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(*pOutbox, OTTransaction::pending,
04152                                                                                              lNewTransactionNumber);
04153                 // ------------------------------------------
04154                 OTTransaction * pOutboxTransaction      = OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(theFromOutbox, OTTransaction::pending,
04155                                                                                              lNewTransactionNumber);
04156 
04157 //              IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lNewTransactionNumber, false); // bStoreTheNumber = false
04158                 OTTransaction * pInboxTransaction       = OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(theToInbox, OTTransaction::pending,
04159                                                                                              lNewTransactionNumber);
04160                 // ------------------------------------------
04161                 // UPDATE: I am now issuing one new transaction number above, instead of two. This is to make it easy
04162                 // for the two to cross-reference each other. Later if I want to remove the transaction from the inbox
04163                 // and need to know the corresponding transaction # for the outbox, it will be the same number.
04164 
04165                 // I have to set this one up just like the one below.
04166                 pTEMPOutboxTransaction->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo);
04167                 pTEMPOutboxTransaction->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum());
04168                 pTEMPOutboxTransaction->SetNumberOfOrigin(*pItem);
04169                 // -------------------------------------------
04170                 // the new transactions store a record of the item they're referring to.
04171                 pOutboxTransaction->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo);
04172                 pOutboxTransaction->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum());
04173                 pOutboxTransaction->SetNumberOfOrigin(*pItem);
04174 
04175                 //todo put these two together in a method.
04176                 pInboxTransaction->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo);
04177                 pInboxTransaction->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum());
04178                 pInboxTransaction->SetNumberOfOrigin(*pItem);
04179 
04180                 // Now we have created 2 new transactions from the server to the users' boxes
04181                 // Let's sign them and add to their inbox / outbox.
04182                 pOutboxTransaction->SignContract(m_nymServer);
04183                 pInboxTransaction-> SignContract(m_nymServer);
04184 
04185                 pOutboxTransaction->SaveContract();
04186                 pInboxTransaction-> SaveContract();
04187                 // -------------------------------------------
04188                 // Meanwhile a copy of the outbox transaction is also added to
04189                 // pOutbox. (It's just another copy of the outbox, but used
04190                 // purely for verifying the balance statement, while a different
04191                 // copy of the outbox is used for actually adding the receipt
04192                 // and saving to the outbox file.)
04193                 //
04194                 pTEMPOutboxTransaction->SignContract(m_nymServer);
04195                 pTEMPOutboxTransaction->SaveContract();
04196 
04197                 // No need to save a box receipt in this case, like we normally would
04198                 // when adding a transaction to a box.
04199                 pOutbox->AddTransaction(*pTEMPOutboxTransaction); // pOutbox will clean this up
04200 
04201                 // The balance item from the user, for the outbox transaction, will not have
04202                 // the correct transaction number (because I just generated it above, so the user
04203                 // could not possibly have known that when he sent his message.) Currently it is
04204                 // set to "1" in the user request, but I just put the actual number in the pOutbox
04205                 // above (since I now have the actual number.)
04206                 //
04207                 // So when the receipt is saved (the output transaction) it will show the user's
04208                 // signed request with "1" in the outbox, included in the server's signed reply
04209                 // with lNewTransactionNumber in the outbox to correspond to it. The user saves
04210                 // a copy of the same receipt, thus he will be unable to produce a receipt signed
04211                 // by the server, without producing the exact same thing.
04212                 // ("1" in the request and lNewTransactionNumber in the signed response.)
04213                 //
04214                 // This all means that the below call to VerifyBalanceStatement() needs to verify
04215                 // the number "1" on the user request, as lNewTransactionNumber in pOutbox, in order
04216                 // to handle this special case, since otherwise the verification would fail.
04217                 //
04218                 if (!(pBalanceItem->VerifyBalanceStatement(pItem->GetAmount() * (-1), // My acct balance will be smaller as a result of this transfer.
04219                                                            theNym,
04220                                                            *pInbox,
04221                                                            *pOutbox,
04222                                                            theFromAccount,
04223                                                            tranIn,
04224                                                            lNewTransactionNumber)))
04225                 {
04226                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "ERROR verifying balance statement while performing transfer. Acct ID:\n%s\n",
04227                                    strAccountID.Get());
04228                 }
04229 
04230                 else
04231                 {
04232                     pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the balance agreement (just above) was successful.
04233                     pResponseBalanceItem->SetNewOutboxTransNum(lNewTransactionNumber); // So the receipt will show that the client's "1" in the outbox is now actually "34" or whatever, issued by the server as part of successfully processing the transaction.
04234 
04235                     // Deduct the amount from the account...
04236                     // TODO an issuer account here, can go negative.
04237                     // whereas a regular account should not be allowed to go negative.
04238                     if (theFromAccount.Debit(pItem->GetAmount()))
04239                     {//todo need to be able to "roll back" if anything inside this block fails.
04240                         // Here the transactions we just created are actually added to the ledgers.
04241                         theFromOutbox.  AddTransaction(*pOutboxTransaction);
04242                         theToInbox.     AddTransaction(*pInboxTransaction);
04243 
04244                         // Release any signatures that were there before (They won't
04245                         // verify anymore anyway, since the content has changed.)
04246                         theFromOutbox.  ReleaseSignatures();
04247                         theToInbox.     ReleaseSignatures();
04248 
04249                         // Sign them.
04250                         theFromOutbox.  SignContract(m_nymServer);
04251                         theToInbox.     SignContract(m_nymServer);
04252 
04253                         // Save them internally
04254                         theFromOutbox.  SaveContract();
04255                         theToInbox.     SaveContract();
04256 
04257                         // Save their internals (signatures and all) to file.
04258                         theFromAccount.SaveOutbox(theFromOutbox);
04259                         pDestinationAcct->SaveInbox(theToInbox);
04260                         // ----------------------------------------
04261 
04262                         theFromAccount. ReleaseSignatures();
04263                         theFromAccount. SignContract(m_nymServer);
04264                         theFromAccount. SaveContract();
04265                         theFromAccount. SaveAccount();
04266 
04267                         pDestinationAcct->ReleaseSignatures();
04268                         pDestinationAcct->SignContract(m_nymServer);
04269                         pDestinationAcct->SaveContract();
04270                         pDestinationAcct->SaveAccount();
04271 
04272                         // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
04273                         // otherwise, if we never entered this block, then it would still be set to rejection, and the
04274                         // new items would never have been added to the inbox/outboxes, and those files, along with
04275                         // the account file, would never have had their signatures released, or been re-signed or
04276                         // re-saved back to file.  The debit failed, so all of those other actions would fail also.
04277                         // BUT... if the message comes back with acknowledgement--then all of these actions must have
04278                         // happened, and here is the server's signature to prove it.
04279                         // Otherwise you get no items and no signature. Just a rejection item in the response transaction.
04280                         pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
04281 
04282                         bOutSuccess = true;  // The transfer was successful.
04283 
04284                         // Any inbox/nymbox/outbox ledger will only itself contain
04285                         // abbreviated versions of the receipts, including their hashes.
04286                         //
04287                         // The rest is stored separately, in the box receipt, which is created
04288                         // whenever a receipt is added to a box, and deleted after a receipt
04289                         // is removed from a box.
04290                         //
04291                         pOutboxTransaction->    SaveBoxReceipt(theFromOutbox);
04292                         pInboxTransaction->     SaveBoxReceipt(theToInbox);
04293                     }
04294                     else
04295                     {
04296                         delete pOutboxTransaction; pOutboxTransaction = NULL; // I can't use OTCleanup here because sometimes we DON'T delete it. (above)
04297                         delete pInboxTransaction; pInboxTransaction = NULL;
04298                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Unable to debit account %s in the amount of: %ld\n",
04299                                        __FUNCTION__, strAccountID.Get(), pItem->GetAmount());
04300                     }
04301                 }
04302             } // both boxes were successfully loaded or generated.
04303         }
04304 //      OTString strTestInRefTo;
04305 //      pResponseItem->GetReferenceString(strTestInRefTo);
04306 //      OTLog::vError("DEBUG: Item in reference to: %s\n", strTestInRefTo.Get());
04307 
04308     } // if pItem = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::transfer)
04309 
04310     // sign the response item before sending it back (it's already been added to the transaction above)
04311     // Now, whether it was rejection or acknowledgement, it is set properly and it is signed, and it
04312     // is owned by the transaction, who will take it from here.
04313     pResponseItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
04314     pResponseItem->SaveContract(); // the signing was of no effect because I forgot to save.
04315 
04316     pResponseBalanceItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
04317     pResponseBalanceItem->SaveContract();
04318 }
04319 
04320 
04321 
04322 
04331 void OTServer::NotarizeWithdrawal(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTAccount & theAccount,
04332                                   OTTransaction & tranIn, OTTransaction & tranOut, bool & bOutSuccess)
04333 {
04334     // The outgoing transaction is an "atWithdrawal", that is, "a reply to the withdrawal request"
04335     tranOut.SetType(OTTransaction::atWithdrawal);
04336 
04337     OTItem * pItem          = NULL;
04338     OTItem * pItemCash      = NULL;
04339     OTItem * pItemVoucher   = NULL;
04340     OTItem * pBalanceItem   = NULL;
04341     OTItem * pResponseItem  = NULL;
04342     OTItem * pResponseBalanceItem   = NULL;
04343 
04344     // The incoming transaction may be sent to inboxes and outboxes, and it
04345     // will probably be bundled in our reply to the user as well. Therefore,
04346     // let's grab it as a string.
04347     OTString strInReferenceTo;
04348     OTString strBalanceItem;
04349 
04350     // Grab the actual server ID from this object, and use it as the server ID here.
04351     const OTIdentifier  SERVER_ID(m_strServerID),       USER_ID(theNym), ACCOUNT_ID(theAccount),
04352                         SERVER_USER_ID(m_nymServer),    ASSET_TYPE_ID(theAccount.GetAssetTypeID());
04353 
04354     const OTString strUserID(USER_ID), strAccountID(ACCOUNT_ID), strAssetTypeID(ASSET_TYPE_ID);
04355     // -----------------------------------------------------------------
04356 
04357     // Here we find out if we're withdrawing cash, or a voucher
04358     // (A voucher is a cashier's cheque aka banker's cheque).
04359     //
04360     OTItem::itemType theReplyItemType = OTItem::error_state;
04361 
04362     pItemVoucher = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::withdrawVoucher);
04363 
04364     if (NULL == pItemVoucher)
04365     {
04366         pItemCash = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::withdrawal);
04367         pItem = pItemCash;
04368         // ---------
04369         if (NULL != pItem)
04370             theReplyItemType = OTItem::atWithdrawal;
04371     }
04372     else
04373     {
04374         pItem = pItemVoucher;
04375         // ---------
04376         theReplyItemType = OTItem::atWithdrawVoucher;
04377     }
04378     // -----------------------------------------------------------------
04379     pResponseItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, theReplyItemType);
04380     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
04381     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
04382 
04383     pResponseBalanceItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atBalanceStatement);
04384     pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
04385     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseBalanceItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
04386     // --------------------------------------
04387     if (NULL == pItem)
04388     {
04389         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
04390         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeWithdrawal: Expected OTItem::withdrawal or OTItem::withdrawVoucher in trans# %ld: \n\n%s\n\n",
04391                        tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR LOADING TRANSACTION INTO STRING) ");
04392     }
04393     // Below this point, we know that pItem is good, and that either pItemVoucher OR pItemCash is good,
04394     // and that pItem points to the good one. Therefore next, let's verify permissions:
04395     // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
04396     // This permission has to do with ALL withdrawals (cash or voucher)
04397     else if (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_withdrawal))
04398     {
04399         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeWithdrawal: User %s cannot do this transaction (All withdrawals are disallowed in server.cfg)\n",
04400                        strUserID.Get());
04401     }
04402     // -----------------------------------------
04403     // This permission has to do with vouchers.
04404     else if ((NULL != pItemVoucher) &&
04405              (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_withdraw_voucher)))
04406     {
04407         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeWithdrawal: User %s cannot do this transaction (withdrawVoucher is disallowed in server.cfg)\n",
04408                        strUserID.Get());
04409     }
04410     // This permission has to do with cash.
04411     else if ((NULL != pItemCash) &&
04412              (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_withdraw_cash)))
04413     {
04414         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeWithdrawal: User %s cannot do this transaction (withdraw cash is disallowed in server.cfg)\n",
04415                        strUserID.Get());
04416     }
04417     // ----------------------------------------------------------
04418     // Check for a balance agreement...
04419     //
04420     else if (NULL == (pBalanceItem = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::balanceStatement)))
04421     {
04422         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
04423         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeWithdrawal: Expected OTItem::balanceStatement, but not found in trans # %ld: \n\n%s\n\n",
04424                        tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR LOADING TRANSACTION INTO STRING) ");
04425     }
04426     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
04427     else if (pItem->GetType() == OTItem::withdrawVoucher)
04428     {
04429         // The response item will contain a copy of the request item. So I save it into a string
04430         // here so they can all grab a copy of it into their "in reference to" fields.
04431         pItem->SaveContractRaw(strInReferenceTo);
04432         pBalanceItem->SaveContractRaw(strBalanceItem);
04433 
04434         // Server response item being added to server response transaction (tranOut)
04435         // (They're getting SOME sort of response item.)
04436 
04437         pResponseItem->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
04438         pResponseItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
04439 
04440         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceString(strBalanceItem); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
04441         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
04442 
04443 //      OTAccount * pVoucherReserveAcct = NULL;
04444         _SharedPtr<OTAccount>   pVoucherReserveAcct; // contains the server's funds to back vouchers of a specific asset type.
04445         // ----------------------------------------------------
04446         OTLedger * pInbox   = theAccount.LoadInbox(m_nymServer);
04447         OTLedger * pOutbox  = theAccount.LoadOutbox(m_nymServer);
04448 
04449         OTCleanup<OTLedger> theInboxAngel(pInbox);
04450         OTCleanup<OTLedger> theOutboxAngel(pOutbox);
04451         // ----------------------------------------------------
04452         // I'm using the operator== because it exists.
04453         // If the ID on the "from" account that was passed in,
04454         // does not match the "Acct From" ID on this transaction item.
04455         //
04456         if (!(ACCOUNT_ID == pItem->GetPurportedAccountID()))
04457         {  // TODO see if this is already verified by the caller function and if so, remove.
04458             OTLog::Output(0, "Error: Account ID does not match account ID on the withdrawal item.\n");
04459         }
04460         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
04461         else if (NULL == pInbox) // || !pInbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) OTAccount::Load (above) already verifies.
04462         {
04463             OTLog::Error("Error loading or verifying inbox.\n");
04464         }
04465 
04466         else if (NULL == pOutbox) // || !pOutbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) OTAccount::Load (above) already verifies.
04467         {
04468             OTLog::Error("Error loading or verifying outbox.\n");
04469         }
04470         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
04471         // The server will already have a special account for issuing vouchers. Actually, a list of them --
04472         // one for each asset type. Since this is the normal way of doing business, GetVoucherAccount() will
04473         // just create it if it doesn't already exist, and then return the pointer. Therefore, a failure here
04474         // is a catastrophic failure!  Should never fail.
04475         //
04476         else if ((pVoucherReserveAcct = GetVoucherAccount(ASSET_TYPE_ID)) && // If assignment results in good pointer...
04477                  pVoucherReserveAcct->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer))            // and if it points to an acct that verifies...
04478         {
04479             OTString strVoucherRequest, strItemNote;
04480             pItem->GetNote(strItemNote);
04481             pItem->GetAttachment(strVoucherRequest);
04482 
04483             OTAccount    & theVoucherReserveAcct = (*pVoucherReserveAcct);
04484             OTIdentifier   VOUCHER_ACCOUNT_ID(theVoucherReserveAcct);
04485 
04486             OTCheque    theVoucher       (SERVER_ID, ASSET_TYPE_ID),
04487                         theVoucherRequest(SERVER_ID, ASSET_TYPE_ID);
04488 
04489             bool bLoadContractFromString = theVoucherRequest.LoadContractFromString(strVoucherRequest);
04490 
04491             if (!bLoadContractFromString)
04492             {
04493                 OTLog::vError("OTServer::%s: ERROR loading voucher request from string:\n%s\n",
04494                               __FUNCTION__, strVoucherRequest.Get());
04495             }
04496             else if (!VerifyTransactionNumber(theNym, theVoucherRequest.GetTransactionNum()))
04497             {
04498                 OTLog::vError("OTServer::%s: Failed verifying transaction number on the voucher (%ld) in withdrawal request %ld for Nym: %s\n",
04499                               __FUNCTION__, theVoucherRequest.GetTransactionNum(), tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strUserID.Get());
04500             }
04501             else if (ASSET_TYPE_ID != theVoucherRequest.GetAssetID())
04502             {
04503                 const OTString strFoundAssetID(theVoucherRequest.GetAssetID());
04504                 OTLog::vError("OTServer::%s: Failed verifying asset type ID (%s) on the withdraw voucher request (found: %s) "
04505                               "for transaction %ld, voucher %ld. User: %s\n",
04506                               __FUNCTION__, strAssetTypeID.Get(), strFoundAssetID.Get(),
04507                               tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), theVoucherRequest.GetTransactionNum(), strUserID.Get());
04508             }
04509             else if (!(pBalanceItem->VerifyBalanceStatement(theVoucherRequest.GetAmount() * (-1), // My account's balance will go down by this much.
04510                                                             theNym,
04511                                                             *pInbox,
04512                                                             *pOutbox,
04513                                                             theAccount,
04514                                                             tranIn)))
04515             {
04516                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "ERROR verifying balance statement while issuing voucher. Acct ID:\n%s\n",
04517                                strAccountID.Get());
04518             }
04519             else // successfully loaded the voucher request from the string...
04520             {
04521                 pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the transaction agreement was successful.
04522                 // -------------------------------------------
04523                 OTString strChequeMemo;
04524                 strChequeMemo.Format("%s%s", strItemNote.Get(), theVoucherRequest.GetMemo().Get());
04525 
04526                 // 10 minutes ==    600 Seconds
04527                 // 1 hour   ==     3600 Seconds
04528                 // 1 day    ==    86400 Seconds
04529                 // 30 days  ==  2592000 Seconds
04530                 // 3 months ==  7776000 Seconds
04531                 // 6 months == 15552000 Seconds
04532 
04533                 const time64_t  VALID_FROM  = OTTimeGetCurrentTime(); // This time is set to TODAY NOW
04534                 const time64_t  VALID_TO    = OTTimeAddTimeInterval(VALID_FROM, OTTimeGetSecondsFromTime(OT_TIME_SIX_MONTHS_IN_SECONDS));
04535 
04536                 // UPDATE: We now use a transaction number owned by the remitter, instead of the transaction server.
04537                 //
04538 //              int64_t lNewTransactionNumber = 0;
04539 //              IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lNewTransactionNumber); // bStoreTheNumber defaults to true. We save the transaction
04540                                                                                 // number on the server Nym (normally we'd discard it) because
04541                 const int64_t lAmount = theVoucherRequest.GetAmount();              // when the cheque is deposited, the server nym, as the owner of
04542                 const OTIdentifier & RECIPIENT_ID = theVoucherRequest.GetRecipientUserID(); // the voucher account, needs to verify the transaction # on the
04543                                                                                             // cheque (to prevent double-spending of cheques.)
04544                 bool bIssueVoucher = theVoucher.IssueCheque(
04545                                                             lAmount,                // The amount of the cheque.
04546                                                             theVoucherRequest.GetTransactionNum(),  // Requiring a transaction number prevents double-spending of cheques.
04547                                                             VALID_FROM,             // The expiration date (valid from/to dates) of the cheque
04548                                                             VALID_TO,               // Vouchers are automatically starting today and lasting 6 months.
04549                                                             VOUCHER_ACCOUNT_ID,     // The asset account the cheque is drawn on.
04550                                                             SERVER_USER_ID,         // User ID of the sender (in this case the server.)
04551                                                             strChequeMemo.Get(),    // Optional memo field. Includes item note and request memo.
04552                                                             theVoucherRequest.HasRecipient() ? (&RECIPIENT_ID) : NULL);
04553 
04554                 // IF we successfully created the voucher, AND the voucher amount is greater than 0,
04555                 // AND debited the user's account,
04556                 // AND credited the server's voucher account,
04557                 //
04558                 // THEN save the accounts and return the voucher to the user.
04559                 //
04560                 if (bIssueVoucher  &&  (lAmount > 0)    &&
04561                     theAccount.Debit(theVoucherRequest.GetAmount())
04562                     )
04563                 {
04564                     if (false == pVoucherReserveAcct->Credit(theVoucherRequest.GetAmount()))
04565                     {
04566                         OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeWithdrawal: Failed crediting voucher reserve account.\n");
04567 
04568                         if (false == theAccount.Credit(theVoucherRequest.GetAmount()))
04569                             OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeWithdrawal (voucher): Failed crediting user account.\n");
04570                     }
04571                     else
04572                     {
04573                         OTString strVoucher;
04574                         theVoucher.SetAsVoucher(USER_ID, ACCOUNT_ID);   // All this does is set the voucher's internal contract string to
04575                                                                         // "VOUCHER" instead of "CHEQUE". Plus it saves the remitter's IDs.
04576                         theVoucher.SignContract(m_nymServer);
04577                         theVoucher.SaveContract();
04578                         theVoucher.SaveContractRaw(strVoucher);
04579 
04580                         pResponseItem->SetAttachment(strVoucher);
04581                         pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
04582 
04583                         bOutSuccess = true;  // The withdrawal of a voucher was successful.
04584                         // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
04585                         // Release any signatures that were there before (They won't
04586                         // verify anymore anyway, since the content has changed.)
04587                         theAccount. ReleaseSignatures();
04588                         theAccount. SignContract(m_nymServer);  // Sign
04589                         theAccount. SaveContract();             // Save
04590                         theAccount. SaveAccount();              // Save to file
04591 
04592                         // We also need to save the Voucher cash reserve account.
04593                         // (Any issued voucher cheque is automatically backed by this reserve account.
04594                         // If a cheque is deposited, the funds come back out of this account. If the
04595                         // cheque expires, then after the expiry period, if it remains in the account,
04596                         // it is now the property of the transaction server.)
04597                         pVoucherReserveAcct->ReleaseSignatures();
04598                         pVoucherReserveAcct->SignContract(m_nymServer);
04599                         pVoucherReserveAcct->SaveContract();
04600                         pVoucherReserveAcct->SaveAccount();
04601                     }
04602                 }
04603                 //else{} // TODO log that there was a problem with the amount
04604 
04605             } // voucher request loaded successfully from string
04606         } // GetVoucherAccount()
04607         else
04608         {
04609             OTLog::vError("GetVoucherAccount() failed in NotarizeWithdrawal. Asset Type:\n%s\n",
04610                           strAssetTypeID.Get());
04611         }
04612     }
04613 
04614     // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04615 
04616     // WITHDRAW DIGITAL CASH (BLINDED TOKENS)
04617     //
04618     // For now, there should only be one of these withdrawal items inside the transaction.
04619     // So we treat it that way... I either get it successfully or not.
04620     //
04621     else if (pItem->GetType() == OTItem::withdrawal)
04622     {
04623         // The response item will contain a copy of the request item. So I save it into a string
04624         // here so they can all grab a copy of it into their "in reference to" fields.
04625         //
04626         pItem->SaveContractRaw(strInReferenceTo);
04627         pBalanceItem->SaveContractRaw(strBalanceItem);
04628 
04629         // Server response item being added to server response transaction (tranOut)
04630         // They're getting SOME sort of response item.
04631         //
04632         pResponseItem->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
04633         pResponseItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
04634 
04635         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceString(strBalanceItem); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
04636         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
04637         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
04638         OTLedger * pInbox   = theAccount.LoadInbox(m_nymServer);
04639         OTLedger * pOutbox  = theAccount.LoadOutbox(m_nymServer);
04640 
04641         OTCleanup<OTLedger> theInboxAngel(pInbox);
04642         OTCleanup<OTLedger> theOutboxAngel(pOutbox);
04643         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
04644         OTMint      * pMint = NULL;
04645         OTAccount   * pMintCashReserveAcct = NULL;
04646 
04647         if (0 > pItem->GetAmount())
04648         {
04649             OTLog::Output(0, "Attempt to withdraw a negative amount.\n");
04650         }
04651         // If the ID on the "from" account that was passed in,
04652         // does not match the "Acct From" ID on this transaction item
04653         //
04654         else if (ACCOUNT_ID != pItem->GetPurportedAccountID())
04655         {
04656             OTLog::Output(0, "Error: 'From' account ID on the transaction does not match 'from' account ID on the withdrawal item.\n");
04657         }
04658         else if (NULL == pInbox) // || !pInbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) Already verified in OTAccount::LoadInbox()
04659         {
04660             OTLog::Error("Error loading or verifying inbox.\n");
04661         }
04662         else if (NULL == pOutbox) // || !pOutbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) Already verified in OTAccount::LoadOutbox()
04663         {
04664             OTLog::Error("Error loading or verifying outbox.\n");
04665         }
04666         else
04667         {
04668             // --------------------------------------------------------------------
04669             // The COIN REQUEST (including the prototokens) comes from the client side.
04670             // so we assume the OTToken is in the payload. Now we need to randomly choose one for
04671             // signing, and reply to the client with that number so that the client can reply back
04672             // to us with the unblinding factors for all the other prototokens (but that one.)
04673             //
04674             // In the meantime, I have to store this request somewhere -- presumably in the outbox or purse.
04675             //
04676             // UPDATE!!! Looks like Lucre protocol is simpler than that. The request only needs to contain a
04677             // single blinded token, which the server signs and sends back. Done.
04678             //
04679             // The amount is known to be safe (by the mint) because the User asks the Mint to create
04680             // a denomination (say, 10) token. The Mint therefore uses the "Denomination 10" key to sign
04681             // the token, and will later use the "Denomination 10" key to verify the token. So the mint
04682             // obviously trusts its own keys... There is nothing else to "open and verify", since only the ID
04683             // itself is what gets blinded and verified.  The amount on the token (as well as the asset type)
04684             // is only there to help the bank to look up the right key, without which the token will DEFINITELY
04685             // NOT verify. So it is in the user's interest to supply the correct amount, because otherwise he'll
04686             // just get the wrong key and then get rejected by the bank.
04687 
04688             OTString strPurse;
04689             pItem->GetAttachment(strPurse);
04690 
04691             // Todo do more security checking in here, like making sure the withdrawal amount matches the
04692             // total of the proto-tokens. Update: I think this is done, since the Debits are done one-at-a-time
04693             // for each token and it's amount/denomination
04694 
04695             OTPurse thePurse(SERVER_ID, ASSET_TYPE_ID);
04696             OTPurse theOutputPurse(SERVER_ID, ASSET_TYPE_ID);
04697             OTToken * pToken = NULL;
04698             dequeOfTokenPtrs theDeque;
04699 
04700             bool bSuccess = false;
04701             bool bLoadContractFromString = thePurse.LoadContractFromString(strPurse);
04702 
04703             if (!bLoadContractFromString)
04704             {
04705                 OTLog::vError("ERROR loading purse from string in OTServer::NotarizeWithdrawal:\n%s\n",
04706                         strPurse.Get());
04707             }
04708             else if (!(pBalanceItem->VerifyBalanceStatement(thePurse.GetTotalValue() * (-1), // This amount will be subtracted from my acct.
04709                                                             theNym,
04710                                                             *pInbox,
04711                                                             *pOutbox,
04712                                                             theAccount,
04713                                                             tranIn)))
04714             {
04715                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "ERROR verifying balance statement while withdrawing cash. Acct ID: %s\n",
04716                                strAccountID.Get());
04717             }
04718             else // successfully loaded the purse from the string...
04719             {
04720                 pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the transaction agreement was successful.
04721 
04722                 // Pull the token(s) out of the purse that was received from the client.
04723                 while ((pToken = thePurse.Pop(m_nymServer)) != NULL)
04724                 {
04725                     // We are responsible to cleanup pToken
04726                     // So I grab a copy here for later...
04727                     theDeque.push_front(pToken);
04728 
04729                     pMint = GetMint(ASSET_TYPE_ID, pToken->GetSeries());
04730 
04731                     if (NULL == pMint)
04732                     {
04733                         OTLog::vError("OTServer::NotarizeWithdrawal: Unable to find Mint (series %d): %s\n",
04734                                       pToken->GetSeries(), strAssetTypeID.Get());
04735                         bSuccess = false;
04736                         break; // Once there's a failure, we ditch the loop.
04737                     }
04738                     else if (NULL == (pMintCashReserveAcct = pMint->GetCashReserveAccount()))
04739                     {
04740                         OTLog::vError("OTServer::NotarizeWithdrawal: Unable to find cash reserve account for Mint (series %d): %s\n",
04741                                       pToken->GetSeries(), strAssetTypeID.Get());
04742                         bSuccess = false;
04743                         break; // Once there's a failure, we ditch the loop.
04744                     }
04745                     // Mints expire halfway into their token expiration period. So if a mint creates
04746                     // tokens valid from Jan 1 through Jun 1, then the Mint itself expires Mar 1.
04747                     // That's when the next series Mint is phased in to start issuing tokens, even
04748                     // though the server continues redeeming the first series tokens until June.
04749                     //
04750                     else if (pMint->Expired())
04751                     {
04752                         OTLog::vError("OTServer::NotarizeWithdrawal: User attempting withdrawal with an expired mint (series %d): %s\n",
04753                                       pToken->GetSeries(), strAssetTypeID.Get());
04754                         bSuccess = false;
04755                         break; // Once there's a failure, we ditch the loop.
04756                     }
04757                     else
04758                     {
04759                         OTString  theStringReturnVal;
04760 
04761                         if (pToken->GetAssetID() != ASSET_TYPE_ID)
04762                         {
04763                             const OTString str1(pToken->GetAssetID()), str2(ASSET_TYPE_ID);
04764                             bSuccess = false;
04765                             OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR while signing token: Expected asset ID %s but found %s instead. (Failure.)\n",
04766                                           __FUNCTION__, str2.Get(), str1.Get());
04767                             break;
04768                         }
04769                         // TokenIndex is for cash systems that send multiple proto-tokens, so the Mint
04770                         // knows which proto-token has been chosen for signing.
04771                         // But Lucre only uses a single proto-token, so the token index is always 0.
04772                         //
04773                         else if (!(pMint->SignToken(m_nymServer, *pToken, theStringReturnVal, 0))) // nTokenIndex = 0 // ******************************************
04774                         {
04775                             bSuccess = false;
04776                             OTLog::vError("%s: Failure in call: pMint->SignToken(m_nymServer, *pToken, theStringReturnVal, 0). (Returning.)\n",
04777                                           __FUNCTION__);
04778                             break;
04779                         }
04780                         else
04781                         {
04782                             OTASCIIArmor  theArmorReturnVal(theStringReturnVal);
04783 
04784                             pToken->ReleaseSignatures(); // this releases the normal signatures, not the Lucre signed token from the Mint, above.
04785 
04786                             pToken->SetSignature(theArmorReturnVal, 0); // nTokenIndex = 0
04787 
04788                             // Sign and Save the token
04789                             pToken->SignContract(m_nymServer);
04790                             pToken->SaveContract();
04791 
04792                             // Now the token is in signedToken mode, and the other prototokens have been released.
04793 
04794                             // Deduct the amount from the account...
04795                             if (theAccount.Debit(pToken->GetDenomination()))
04796                             {//todo need to be able to "roll back" if anything inside this block fails.
04797                                 bSuccess = true;
04798 
04799                                 // Credit the server's cash account for this asset type in the same
04800                                 // amount that was debited. When the token is deposited again, Debit that same
04801                                 // server cash account and deposit in the depositor's acct.
04802                                 // Why, you might ask? Because if the token expires, the money will stay in
04803                                 // the bank's cash account instead of being lost (and screwing up the overall
04804                                 // issuer balance, with the issued money disappearing forever.) The bank knows
04805                                 // that once the series expires, whatever funds are left in that cash account are
04806                                 // for the bank to keep. They can be transferred to another account and kept, instead
04807                                 // of being lost.
04808                                 if (!pMintCashReserveAcct->Credit(pToken->GetDenomination()))
04809                                 {
04810                                     OTLog::Error("Error crediting mint cash reserve account...\n");
04811 
04812                                     // Reverse the account debit (even though we're not going to save it anyway.)
