04813                                     if (false == theAccount.Credit(pToken->GetDenomination()))
04814                                         OTLog::vError("%s: Failed crediting user account back.\n", __FUNCTION__);
04815 
04816                                     bSuccess = false;
04817                                     break;
04818                                 }
04819                             }
04820                             else {
04821                                 bSuccess = false;
04822                                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Unable to debit account %s in the amount of: %ld\n",
04823                                                __FUNCTION__, strAccountID.Get(), pToken->GetDenomination());
04824                                 break; // Once there's a failure, we ditch the loop.
04825                             }
04826                         }
04827                     }
04828                 } // While success popping token out of the purse...
04829 
04830                 if (bSuccess)
04831                 {
04832                     while (!theDeque.empty())
04833                     {
04834                         pToken = theDeque.front();
04835                         theDeque.pop_front();
04836 
04837                         theOutputPurse.Push(theNym, *pToken); // these were in reverse order. Fixing with theDeque.
04838 
04839                         delete pToken;
04840                         pToken = NULL;
04841                     }
04842 
04843                     strPurse.Release(); // just in case it only concatenates.
04844 
04845                     theOutputPurse.SignContract(m_nymServer);
04846                     theOutputPurse.SaveContract(); // todo this is probably unnecessary
04847                     theOutputPurse.SaveContractRaw(strPurse);
04848 
04849 
04850                     // Add the digital cash token to the response message
04851                     pResponseItem->SetAttachment(strPurse);
04852                     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
04853 
04854                     bOutSuccess = true;  // The cash withdrawal was successful.
04855 
04856                     // Release any signatures that were there before (They won't
04857                     // verify anymore anyway, since the content has changed.)
04858                     theAccount. ReleaseSignatures();
04859 
04860                     // Sign
04861                     theAccount. SignContract(m_nymServer);
04862 
04863                     // Save
04864                     theAccount. SaveContract();
04865 
04866                     // Save to file
04867                     theAccount. SaveAccount();
04868 
04869                     // We also need to save the Mint's cash reserve.
04870                     // (Any cash issued by the Mint is automatically backed by this reserve
04871                     // account. If cash is deposited, it comes back out of this account. If the
04872                     // cash expires, then after the expiry period, if it remains in the account,
04873                     // it is now the property of the transaction server.)
04874                     pMintCashReserveAcct->ReleaseSignatures();
04875                     pMintCashReserveAcct->SignContract(m_nymServer);
04876                     pMintCashReserveAcct->SaveContract();
04877                     pMintCashReserveAcct->SaveAccount();
04878 
04879                     // Notice if there is any failure in the above loop, then we will never enter this block.
04880                     // Therefore the account will never be saved with the new debited balance, and the output
04881                     // purse will never be added to the response item.  No tokens will be returned to the user
04882                     // and the account will not be saved, thus retaining the original balance.
04883                     //
04884                     // Only if everything is successful do we enter this block, save the output purse onto the
04885                     // response, and save the newly-debitted account back to disk.
04886                 }
04887                 // Still need to clean up theDeque
04888                 else
04889                 {
04890                     while (!theDeque.empty())
04891                     {
04892                         pToken = theDeque.front();
04893                         theDeque.pop_front();
04894 
04895                         delete pToken;
04896                         pToken = NULL;
04897                     }
04898                 }
04899 
04900             } // purse loaded successfully from string
04901 
04902         } // the Account ID on the item matched properly
04903         // ---------------------------------------------------
04904         // sign the response item before sending it back (it's already been added to the transaction above)
04905         // Now, whether it was rejection or acknowledgement, it is set properly and it is signed, and it
04906         // is owned by the transaction, who will take it from here.
04907         pResponseItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
04908         pResponseItem->SaveContract(); // the signing was of no effect because I forgot to save.
04909 
04910         pResponseBalanceItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
04911         pResponseBalanceItem->SaveContract();
04912     } // if pItem = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::withdrawal)
04913     else
04914     {
04915         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
04916         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeWithdrawal: Expected OTItem::withdrawal or OTItem::withdrawVoucher in trans# %ld: \n\n%s\n\n",
04917                        tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR LOADING TRANSACTION INTO STRING) ");
04918     }
04919 
04920     // sign the response item before sending it back (it's already been added to the transaction above)
04921     // Now, whether it was rejection or acknowledgement, it is set properly and it is signed, and it
04922     // is owned by the transaction, who will take it from here.
04923     pResponseItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
04924     pResponseItem->SaveContract(); // the signing was of no effect because I forgot to save.
04925 
04926     pResponseBalanceItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
04927     pResponseBalanceItem->SaveContract();
04928 }
04929 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04930 
04931 
04932 
04933 
04934 
04935 
04936 
04937 /*
04938 class OTAcctFunctor_PayDividend
04939 {
04940 public:
04941     OTAcctFunctor_PayDividend(const OTIdentifier & theServerID);
04942     virtual ~OTAcctFunctor_PayDividend();
04943 
04944     virtual bool Trigger(OTAccount & theAccount);
04945 };
04946 */
04947 
04948 OTAcctFunctor_PayDividend::OTAcctFunctor_PayDividend(const OTIdentifier  & theServerID,
04949                                                      const OTIdentifier  & theUserID,
04950                                                      const OTIdentifier  & thePayoutAssetID,
04951                                                      const OTIdentifier  & theVoucherAcctID,
04952                                                      const OTString      & strMemo,
04953                                                            OTServer      & theServer,
04954                                                            int64_t            lPayoutPerShare,
04955                                                            mapOfAccounts * pLoadedAccounts/*=NULL*/)
04956 : OTAcctFunctor(theServerID, pLoadedAccounts),
04957   m_pUserID       (new OTIdentifier(theUserID)),
04958   m_pPayoutAssetID(new OTIdentifier(thePayoutAssetID)),
04959   m_pVoucherAcctID(new OTIdentifier(theVoucherAcctID)),
04960   m_pstrMemo      (new OTString    (strMemo)),
04961   m_pServer(&theServer),
04962   m_lPayoutPerShare(lPayoutPerShare),
04963   m_lAmountPaidOut (0),
04964   m_lAmountReturned(0)
04965 {
04966 
04967 }
04968 
04969 OTAcctFunctor_PayDividend::~OTAcctFunctor_PayDividend()
04970 {
04971     if (NULL != m_pUserID)
04972         delete m_pUserID;
04973     m_pUserID         = NULL;
04974     if (NULL != m_pPayoutAssetID)
04975         delete m_pPayoutAssetID;
04976     m_pPayoutAssetID  = NULL;
04977     if (NULL != m_pVoucherAcctID)
04978         delete m_pVoucherAcctID;
04979     m_pVoucherAcctID  = NULL;
04980     if (NULL != m_pstrMemo)
04981         delete m_pstrMemo;
04982     m_pstrMemo        = NULL;
04983     m_pServer         = NULL; // don't delete this one (I don't own it.)
04984     m_lPayoutPerShare = 0;
04985     m_lAmountPaidOut  = 0;
04986     m_lAmountReturned = 0;
04987 }
04988 
04989 
04990 // For each "simple" account of a specific asset type, this function
04991 // is called in order to pay a dividend to the Nym who owns that account.
04992 //
04993 bool OTAcctFunctor_PayDividend::Trigger(OTAccount & theSharesAccount) // theSharesAccount is, say, a Pepsi shares account.  Here, we'll send a dollars voucher to its owner.
04994 {
04995     const int64_t lPayoutAmount = (theSharesAccount.GetBalance() * this->GetPayoutPerShare());
04996 
04997     if (lPayoutAmount <= 0)
04998     {
04999         OTLog::Output(0, "OTAcctFunctor_PayDividend::Trigger: nothing to pay, since this account owns no shares. (Returning true.)");
05000         return true; // nothing to pay, since this account owns no shares. Success!
05001     }
05002     // -----------------------------------------
05003     OT_ASSERT(NULL != this->GetServerID());
05004     const OTIdentifier & theServerID = *(this->GetServerID());
05005     // -----------------------------------------
05006     OT_ASSERT(NULL != this->GetPayoutAssetID());
05007     const OTIdentifier & thePayoutAssetID = *(this->GetPayoutAssetID());
05008     // -----------------------------------------
05009     OT_ASSERT(NULL != this->GetVoucherAcctID());
05010     const OTIdentifier & theVoucherAcctID = *(this->GetVoucherAcctID());
05011     // -----------------------------------------
05012     OT_ASSERT(NULL != this->GetServer());
05013     OTServer & theServer = *(this->GetServer());
05014     // -----------------------------------------
05015     OTPseudonym & theServerNym = const_cast<OTPseudonym &>(theServer.GetServerNym());
05016     // -----------------------------------------
05017     const OTIdentifier   theServerNymID(theServerNym);
05018     const OTIdentifier & RECIPIENT_ID = theSharesAccount.GetUserID();
05019     // -----------------------------------------
05020     OT_ASSERT(NULL != this->GetUserID());
05021     const OTIdentifier & theSenderUserID = *(this->GetUserID());
05022     // -----------------------------------------
05023     OT_ASSERT(NULL != this->GetMemo());
05024     const OTString & strMemo = *(this->GetMemo());
05025     // -----------------------------------------
05026     // Note: theSenderUserID is the originator of the Dividend Payout.
05027     // However, all the actual vouchers will be from "the server Nym" and
05028     // not from theSenderUserID. So then why is it even here? Because anytime
05029     // there's an error, the server will send to theSenderUserID instead of
05030     // RECIPIENT_ID (so the original sender can have his money back, instead of
05031     // just having it get lost in the ether.)
05032     // -----------------------------------------
05033     bool bReturnValue = false;
05034 
05035     OTCheque  theVoucher(theServerID, thePayoutAssetID);
05036 
05037     // 10 minutes ==    600 Seconds
05038     // 1 hour   ==     3600 Seconds
05039     // 1 day    ==    86400 Seconds
05040     // 30 days  ==  2592000 Seconds
05041     // 3 months ==  7776000 Seconds
05042     // 6 months == 15552000 Seconds
05043 
05044     const time64_t VALID_FROM = OTTimeGetCurrentTime();          // This time is set to TODAY NOW
05045     const time64_t VALID_TO = OTTimeAddTimeInterval(VALID_FROM, OTTimeGetSecondsFromTime(OT_TIME_SIX_MONTHS_IN_SECONDS)); // This time occurs in 180 days (6 months).  Todo hardcoding.
05046 
05047     int64_t lNewTransactionNumber = 0;
05048 
05049     const bool  bGotNextTransNum =
05050     theServer.IssueNextTransactionNumber(theServerNym, lNewTransactionNumber);    // bStoreTheNumber defaults to true. We save the transaction
05051                                                                                   // number on the server Nym (normally we'd discard it) because
05052                                                                                   // when the cheque is deposited, the server nym, as the owner of
05053                                                                                   // the voucher account, needs to verify the transaction # on the
05054                                                                                   // cheque (to prevent double-spending of cheques.)
05055     // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05056     if (bGotNextTransNum)
05057     {
05058         const bool bIssueVoucher = theVoucher.IssueCheque(lPayoutAmount,            // The amount of the cheque.
05059                                                           lNewTransactionNumber,    // Requiring a transaction number prevents double-spending of cheques.
05060                                                           VALID_FROM,               // The expiration date (valid from/to dates) of the cheque
05061                                                           VALID_TO,                 // Vouchers are automatically starting today and lasting 6 months.
05062                                                           theVoucherAcctID,         // The asset account the cheque is drawn on.
05063                                                           theServerNymID,           // User ID of the sender (in this case the server nym.)
05064                                                           strMemo,                  // Optional memo field. Includes item note and request memo.
05065                                                           &RECIPIENT_ID);
05066 
05067         // All account crediting / debiting happens in the caller, in OTServer.
05068         //    (AND it happens only ONCE, to cover ALL vouchers.)
05069         // Then in here, the voucher either gets send to the recipient, or if error, sent back home to
05070         // the issuer Nym. (ALL the funds are removed, then the vouchers are sent one way or the other.)
05071         // Any returned vouchers, obviously serve to notify the dividend payer of where the errors were
05072         // (as well as give him the opportunity to get his money back.)
05073         //
05074         bool bSent = false;
05075         if (bIssueVoucher)
05076         {
05077             // All this does is set the voucher's internal contract string to
05078             // "VOUCHER" instead of "CHEQUE". We also set the server itself as
05079             // the remitter, which is unusual for vouchers, but necessary in the
05080             // case of dividends.
05081             //
05082             theVoucher.SetAsVoucher(theServerNymID, theVoucherAcctID);
05083             // ----------------------------------------------------
05084             theVoucher.SignContract(theServerNym);
05085             theVoucher.SaveContract();
05086 
05087             // Send the voucher to the payments inbox of the recipient.
05088             //
05089             const
05090             OTString  strVoucher(theVoucher);
05091             OTPayment thePayment(strVoucher);
05092 
05093             // calls DropMessageToNymbox
05094             bSent = theServer.SendInstrumentToNym(theServerID,
05095                                                   theServerNymID,  // sender nym
05096                                                   RECIPIENT_ID,    // recipient nym
05097                                                   NULL, &thePayment, "payDividend"); // todo: hardcoding.
05098             bReturnValue = bSent; // <======= RETURN VALUE.
05099             if (bSent)
05100                 m_lAmountPaidOut += lPayoutAmount; // At the end of iterating all accounts, if m_lAmountPaidOut is less than lTotalPayoutAmount, then we return to rest to the sender.
05101         }
05102         else
05103         {
05104             const OTString strPayoutAssetID(thePayoutAssetID), strRecipientUserID(RECIPIENT_ID);
05105             OTLog::vError("OTAcctFunctor_PayDividend::Trigger: ERROR failed issuing voucher (to send to dividend payout recipient.) "
05106                           "WAS TRYING TO PAY %ld of asset type %s to Nym %s.\n",
05107                           lPayoutAmount, strPayoutAssetID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
05108         }
05109         // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
05110         // If we didn't send it, then we need to return the funds to where they came from.
05111         //
05112         if (!bSent)
05113         {
05114             OTCheque  theReturnVoucher(theServerID, thePayoutAssetID);
05115 
05116             const bool bIssueReturnVoucher = theReturnVoucher.IssueCheque(lPayoutAmount, // The amount of the cheque.
05117                                                               lNewTransactionNumber,     // Requiring a transaction number prevents double-spending of cheques.
05118                                                               VALID_FROM,                // The expiration date (valid from/to dates) of the cheque
05119                                                               VALID_TO,                  // Vouchers are automatically starting today and lasting 6 months.
05120                                                               theVoucherAcctID,          // The asset account the cheque is drawn on.
05121                                                               theServerNymID,            // User ID of the sender (in this case the server nym.)
05122                                                               strMemo,                   // Optional memo field. Includes item note and request memo.
05123                                                               &theSenderUserID);         // We're returning the money to its original sender.
05124             if (bIssueReturnVoucher)
05125             {
05126                 // All this does is set the voucher's internal contract string to
05127                 // "VOUCHER" instead of "CHEQUE".
05128                 //
05129                 theReturnVoucher.SetAsVoucher(theServerNymID, theVoucherAcctID);
05130                 theReturnVoucher.SignContract(theServerNym);
05131                 theReturnVoucher.SaveContract();
05132 
05133                 // Return the voucher back to the payments inbox of the original sender.
05134                 //
05135                 const
05136                 OTString  strReturnVoucher(theReturnVoucher);
05137                 OTPayment theReturnPayment(strReturnVoucher);
05138 
05139                 // calls DropMessageToNymbox
05140                 bSent = theServer.SendInstrumentToNym(theServerID,
05141                                                       theServerNymID,  // sender nym
05142                                                       theSenderUserID, // recipient nym (original sender.)
05143                                                       NULL, &theReturnPayment, "payDividend"); // todo: hardcoding.
05144                 if (bSent)
05145                     m_lAmountReturned += lPayoutAmount; // At the end of iterating all accounts, if m_lAmountPaidOut+m_lAmountReturned is less than lTotalPayoutAmount, then we return the rest to the sender.
05146             }
05147             else
05148             {
05149                 const OTString strPayoutAssetID(thePayoutAssetID), strSenderUserID(theSenderUserID);
05150                 OTLog::vError("OTAcctFunctor_PayDividend::Trigger: ERROR failed issuing voucher (to return back to "
05151                               "the dividend payout initiator, after a failed payment attempt to the originally intended "
05152                               "recipient.) WAS TRYING TO PAY %ld of asset type %s to Nym %s.\n",
05153                               lPayoutAmount, strPayoutAssetID.Get(), strSenderUserID.Get());
05154             }
05155         } // if !bSent
05156     }
05157     else // !bGotNextTransNum
05158     {
05159         const OTString strPayoutAssetID(thePayoutAssetID), strRecipientUserID(RECIPIENT_ID);
05160         OTLog::vError("OTAcctFunctor_PayDividend::Trigger: ERROR!! Failed issuing next transaction "
05161                       "number while trying to send a voucher (while paying dividends.) "
05162                       "WAS TRYING TO PAY %ld of asset type %s to Nym %s.\n",
05163                       lPayoutAmount, strPayoutAssetID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
05164     }
05165 
05166     return bReturnValue;
05167 }
05168 
05169 
05187 void OTServer::NotarizePayDividend(OTPseudonym   & theNym, OTAccount     & theSourceAccount,
05188                                    OTTransaction & tranIn, OTTransaction & tranOut,    bool & bOutSuccess)
05189 {
05190     const char * szFunc = "OTServer::NotarizePayDividend";
05191 
05192     // The outgoing transaction is an "atPayDividend", that is, "a reply to the 'pay dividend' request"
05193     tranOut.SetType(OTTransaction::atPayDividend);
05194 
05195     OTItem * pItem                  = NULL;  // This pointer and the following one, are 2 pointers, as a vestige
05196     OTItem * pItemPayDividend       = NULL;  // from the withdrawal code, which has two forms: voucher and cash.
05197     OTItem * pBalanceItem           = NULL;  // The balance agreement item, which must be on any transaction.
05198     OTItem * pResponseItem          = NULL;  // Server's response to pItem.
05199     OTItem * pResponseBalanceItem   = NULL;  // Server's response to pBalanceItem.
05200 
05201     // The incoming transaction may be sent to inboxes and outboxes, and it
05202     // will probably be bundled in our reply to the user as well. Therefore,
05203     // let's grab it as a string.
05204     //
05205     OTString  strInReferenceTo;
05206     OTString  strBalanceItem;
05207 
05208     // Grab the actual server ID from this object, and use it as the server ID here.
05209     //
05210     const OTIdentifier  SERVER_ID       (m_strServerID),
05211                         USER_ID         (theNym),
05212                         SOURCE_ACCT_ID  (theSourceAccount),
05213                         SERVER_USER_ID  (m_nymServer),
05214                         PAYOUT_ASSET_ID (theSourceAccount.GetAssetTypeID()); // Ex: Pepsi shares, Dollar dividend. (PAYOUT_ASSET_ID is Dollars.)
05215 
05216     const OTString  strUserID      (USER_ID),
05217                     strAccountID   (SOURCE_ACCT_ID),
05218                     strAssetTypeID (PAYOUT_ASSET_ID);
05219     // -----------------------------------------------------------------
05220     // Make sure the appropriate item is attached.
05221     //
05222     OTItem::itemType theReplyItemType = OTItem::error_state;
05223 
05224     pItemPayDividend = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::payDividend);
05225 
05226     if (NULL != pItemPayDividend) // found it.
05227     {
05228         pItem = pItemPayDividend;
05229         // ---------
05230         theReplyItemType = OTItem::atPayDividend;
05231     }
05232     // -----------------------------------------------------------------
05233     // Server response item being added to server response transaction (tranOut)
05234     // (They're getting SOME sort of response item.)
05235     //
05236     pResponseItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, theReplyItemType);
05237     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
05238     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
05239 
05240     pResponseBalanceItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atBalanceStatement);
05241     pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
05242     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseBalanceItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
05243     // --------------------------------------
05244     if (NULL == pItem)
05245     {
05246         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
05247         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Expected OTItem::payDividend in trans# %ld: \n\n%s\n\n",
05248                        szFunc,
05249                        tranIn.GetTransactionNum(),
05250                        strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR SERIALIZING TRANSACTION INTO A STRING) ");
05251     }
05252     // Below this point, we know that pItem is good, and that pItemPayDividend is good,
05253     // and that pItem points to it. Therefore next, let's verify permissions:
05254     // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
05255     //
05256     // This permission has to do with ALL withdrawals from an account
05257     // (cash / voucher / dividends)
05258 
05259     else if (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_withdrawal))
05260     {
05261         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: User %s cannot do this transaction (All withdrawals are "
05262                        "disallowed in server.cfg, even for paying dividends with.)\n",
05263                        szFunc, strUserID.Get());
05264     }
05265     // -----------------------------------------
05266     // This permission has to do with paying dividends.
05267     //
05268     else if ((NULL != pItemPayDividend) &&
05269              (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_pay_dividend)))
05270     {
05271         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: User %s cannot do this transaction "
05272                        "(payDividend is disallowed in server.cfg)\n",
05273                        szFunc,
05274                        strUserID.Get());
05275     }
05276     // ----------------------------------------------------------
05277     // Check for a balance agreement...
05278     //
05279     else if (NULL == (pBalanceItem = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::balanceStatement)))
05280     {
05281         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
05282         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Expected OTItem::balanceStatement, but not found in trans # %ld: \n\n%s\n\n", szFunc,
05283                        tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR SERIALIZING TRANSACTION INTO A STRING) ");
05284     }
05285     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
05286     else if (pItem->GetType() == OTItem::payDividend) // Superfluous by this point. Artifact of withdrawal code.
05287     {
05288         // The response item will contain a copy of the request item. So I save it into a string
05289         // here so they can all grab a copy of it into their "in reference to" fields.
05290         //
05291         pItem->SaveContractRaw(strInReferenceTo);
05292         pBalanceItem->SaveContractRaw(strBalanceItem);
05293 
05294         // Make sure the response items know which transaction # they're in response to,
05295         // and have a copy of the original request-transaction.
05296         //
05297         pResponseItem->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
05298         pResponseItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
05299 
05300         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceString(strBalanceItem); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
05301         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
05302         // ----------------------------------------------------
05303         const int64_t lTotalCostOfDividend = pItem->GetAmount();
05304         // ----------------------------------------------------
05305         OTCheque    theVoucherRequest;
05306         OTString    strVoucherRequest, strItemNote; // When paying a dividend, you create a voucher request (the same as in withdrawVoucher). It's just for information
05307         pItem->GetAttachment(strVoucherRequest);    // passing, since payDividend needs a few bits of info, and this is a convenient way of passing it.
05308         pItem->GetNote      (strItemNote);
05309         const bool  bLoadContractFromString = theVoucherRequest.LoadContractFromString(strVoucherRequest);
05310 
05311         if (!bLoadContractFromString)
05312         {
05313             OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR loading dividend payout's voucher request from string:\n%s\n",
05314                           szFunc, strVoucherRequest.Get());
05315         }
05316         // ----------------------------------------------------
05317         else if (theVoucherRequest.GetAmount() <= 0)
05318         {
05319             OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR expected >0 'payout per share' as 'amount' on request voucher:\n%s\n",
05320                           szFunc, strVoucherRequest.Get());
05321         }
05322         // ----------------------------------------------------
05323         else
05324         {
05325             // the request voucher (sent from client) contains the payout amount per share.
05326             // Whereas pItem contains lTotalCostOfDividend, which is the total cost (the
05327             // payout multiplied by number of shares.)
05328             //
05329             const int64_t lAmountPerShare = theVoucherRequest.GetAmount(); // already validated, just above.
05330             // ----------------------------------------------------
05331             const OTIdentifier SHARES_ISSUER_ACCT_ID = theVoucherRequest.GetSenderAcctID();
05332 
05333             const OTString strSharesIssuerAcct(SHARES_ISSUER_ACCT_ID);
05334             // ----------------------------------------------------
05335             // Get the asset contract for the shares type, stored in the voucher request, inside pItem.
05336             //       (Make sure it's NOT the same asset type as theSourceAccount.)
05337             //
05338             const OTIdentifier    SHARES_ASSET_ID      = theVoucherRequest.GetAssetID();
05339             OTAssetContract    *  pSharesContract      = GetAssetContract(SHARES_ASSET_ID);
05340             OTAccount          *  pSharesIssuerAccount = NULL;
05341             OTCleanup<OTAccount>  theAcctAngel;
05342 
05343             if (NULL != pSharesContract)
05344             {
05345                 pSharesIssuerAccount = OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount(SHARES_ISSUER_ACCT_ID, SERVER_ID);
05346                 theAcctAngel.SetCleanupTargetPointer(pSharesIssuerAccount);
05347             }
05348 
05349             // ----------------------------------------------------
05350             if (NULL == pSharesContract)
05351             {
05352                 const OTString strSharesType(SHARES_ASSET_ID);
05353                 OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR unable to find shares contract based on asset type ID: %s\n", szFunc,
05354                               strSharesType.Get());
05355             }
05356             // ----------------------------------------------------
05357             else if (!pSharesContract->IsShares())
05358             {
05359                 const OTString strSharesType(SHARES_ASSET_ID);
05360                 OTLog::vError("%s: FAILURE: Asset contract is not shares-based. Asset type ID: %s\n",
05361                               szFunc, strSharesType.Get());
05362             }
05363             // ----------------------------------------------------
05364             else if (false == pSharesContract->VerifySignature(theNym))
05365             {
05366                 const OTString strSharesType(SHARES_ASSET_ID);
05367                 OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR unable to verify signature for Nym (%s) on shares contract "
05368                               "with asset ID: %s\n", szFunc, strUserID.Get(), strSharesType.Get());
05369             }
05370             // ----------------------------------------------------
05371             else if (NULL == pSharesIssuerAccount)
05372             {
05373                 OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR unable to find issuer account for shares: %s\n", szFunc,
05374                               strSharesIssuerAcct.Get());
05375             }
05376             // ----------------------------------------------------
05377             else if (PAYOUT_ASSET_ID == SHARES_ASSET_ID) // these can't be the same
05378             {
05379                 const OTString strSharesType(PAYOUT_ASSET_ID);
05380                 OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR dividend payout attempted, using shares asset type as payout type also. "
05381                               "(It's logically impossible for it to payout to itself, using "
05382                               "ITSELF as the asset type for the payout): %s\n", szFunc, strSharesType.Get());
05383             }
05384             // ----------------------------------------------------
05385             else if (false == pSharesIssuerAccount->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer))
05386             {
05387                 const OTString strIssuerAcctID(SHARES_ISSUER_ACCT_ID);
05388                 OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR failed trying to verify issuer account: %s\n",
05389                               szFunc, strIssuerAcctID.Get());
05390             }
05391             // ----------------------------------------------------
05392             else if (false == pSharesIssuerAccount->VerifyOwner(theNym))
05393             {
05394                 const OTString strIssuerAcctID(SHARES_ISSUER_ACCT_ID);
05395                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR verifying signer's ownership of shares issuer account (%s), "
05396                                "while trying to pay dividend from source account: %s\n",
05397                                szFunc, strIssuerAcctID.Get(), strAccountID.Get());
05398             }
05399             // ----------------------------------------------------
05400 //          const int64_t lTotalCostOfDividend = pItem->GetAmount();
05401 //          const int64_t lAmountPerShare = theVoucherRequest.GetAmount(); // already validated, just above.
05402             //
05403             // Make sure the share issuer's account balance (number of shares issued * (-1)),
05404             // when multiplied by the dividend "amount payout per share", equals the "total cost of dividend"
05405             // as expected based on the value from pItem->GetAmount.
05406             //
05407             //
05408             else if ((pSharesIssuerAccount->GetBalance() * (-1) * lAmountPerShare) != lTotalCostOfDividend)
05409             {
05410                 const OTString strIssuerAcctID(SHARES_ISSUER_ACCT_ID);
05411                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR: total payout of dividend as calculated (%ld) doesn't match client's request (%ld) for source acct: %s\n",
05412                                szFunc, (pSharesIssuerAccount->GetBalance() * (-1) * lAmountPerShare), lTotalCostOfDividend, strAccountID.Get());
05413             }
05414             // ----------------------------------------------------
05415             else if (theSourceAccount.GetBalance() < lTotalCostOfDividend)
05416             {
05417                 const OTString strIssuerAcctID(SHARES_ISSUER_ACCT_ID);
05418                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: FAILURE: not enough funds (%ld) to cover total dividend payout (%ld) for source acct: %s\n",
05419                                szFunc, theSourceAccount.GetBalance(), lTotalCostOfDividend, strAccountID.Get());
05420             }
05421             // ----------------------------------------------------
05422             else
05423             {
05424                 // Remove all the funds at once (so the balance agreement matches up.)
05425                 // Then, iterate through the asset accounts and use a functor to send a voucher to each one.
05426                 // (Or back to the issuer, for any that fail.)
05427 
05428                 // UPDATE: unfortunately the balance agreement will be a lie unless the complete amount is removed.
05429                 // Therefore, failures must be sent back to the issuer as individual receipts, containing the vouchers
05430                 // for any failures, so he can have a record of them, and so he can recover the funds.
05431                 // ----------------------------------------------------
05432                 OTLedger * pInbox   = theSourceAccount.LoadInbox (m_nymServer);
05433                 OTLedger * pOutbox  = theSourceAccount.LoadOutbox(m_nymServer);
05434                 OTCleanup<OTLedger>   theInboxAngel (pInbox);
05435                 OTCleanup<OTLedger>   theOutboxAngel(pOutbox);
05436                 // ----------------------------------------------------
05437                 _SharedPtr<OTAccount>   pVoucherReserveAcct;        // contains the server's funds to back vouchers of a specific asset type.
05438 //              OTAccount   *       pVoucherReserveAcct = NULL;
05439                 // ----------------------------------------------------
05440                 //
05441                 // If the ID on the "from" account that was passed in, does
05442                 // not match the "Acct From" ID on this transaction item...
05443                 //
05444                 if (SOURCE_ACCT_ID != pItem->GetPurportedAccountID())
05445                 {   // TODO see if this is already verified by the caller function and if so, remove.
05446                     // (I believe the item would have entirely failed to load, if the account ID, and
05447                     // other IDs, hadn't matched up with the transaction when we loaded it.)
05448                     //
05449                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Error: Account ID does not match account ID on the 'pay dividend' item.\n", szFunc);
05450                 }
05451                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
05452                 else if (NULL == pInbox) // || !pInbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) OTAccount::Load (above) already verifies.
05453                 {
05454                     OTLog::vError("%s: Error loading or verifying inbox.\n", szFunc);
05455                 }
05456                 else if (NULL == pOutbox) // || !pOutbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) OTAccount::Load (above) already verifies.
05457                 {
05458                     OTLog::vError("%s: Error loading or verifying outbox.\n", szFunc);
05459                 }
05460                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
05461                 // The server will already have a special account for issuing vouchers. Actually, a list of them --
05462                 // one for each asset type. Since this is the normal way of doing business, GetVoucherAccount() will
05463                 // just create it if it doesn't already exist, and then return the pointer. Therefore, a failure here
05464                 // is a catastrophic failure!  Should never fail.
05465                 //
05466                 else if ((pVoucherReserveAcct = GetVoucherAccount(PAYOUT_ASSET_ID)) && // If GetVoucherAccount returns a good pointer...
05467                           pVoucherReserveAcct->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer))             // ...and if it points to an acct that verifies with the server's nym...
05468                 {
05469                     OTAccount    & theVoucherReserveAcct = (*pVoucherReserveAcct);
05470                     const
05471                     OTIdentifier   VOUCHER_ACCOUNT_ID(theVoucherReserveAcct);
05472 
05473                     // *********************************************************************************
05474                     // This amount must be the total amount based on the amount issued.
05475                     // For example if 1000 shares of Pepsi were issued, and the dividend is $2 per share,
05476                     // then loading the issuer's account will show a balance of -1000, and I must have
05477                     // $2000 in my source account if I am going to pay this dividend.
05478                     //
05479                     // This $2000 is entirely removed from my account at once, and the below balance agreement
05480                     // must be for $2000. The vouchers are sent to the owners of each account, in amounts
05481                     // proportionate to the number of shares in the account. For any voucher that fails to be
05482                     // sent (for whatever reason) it is sent back to theNym instead.
05483                     //
05484                     if (!(pBalanceItem->VerifyBalanceStatement(lTotalCostOfDividend * (-1), // My account's balance will go down by this much.
05485                                                                theNym,
05486                                                                *pInbox,
05487                                                                *pOutbox,
05488                                                                theSourceAccount,
05489                                                                tranIn)))
05490                     {
05491                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR verifying balance statement while trying to pay dividend. Source Acct ID: %s\n",
05492                                        szFunc, strAccountID.Get());
05493                     }
05494                     // *********************************************************************************
05495 
05496                     else // successfully verified the balance agreement.
05497                     {
05498                         pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the transaction agreement was successful.
05499                         // -------------------------------------------------
05500                         // IF we successfully created the voucher, AND the voucher amount is greater than 0,
05501                         // AND debited the user's account,
05502                         // AND credited the server's voucher account,
05503                         //
05504                         // THEN save the accounts and pay the dividend out to the shareholders.
05505                         //
05506                         if ( (lTotalCostOfDividend > 0) &&
05507                              // ----------------
05508                              theSourceAccount.Debit(lTotalCostOfDividend) // todo: failsafe: update this code in case of problems in this sensitive area. need better funds transfer code.
05509                            )
05510                         {
05511                             const OTString strVoucherAcctID(VOUCHER_ACCOUNT_ID);
05512 
05513                             if (false == pVoucherReserveAcct->Credit(lTotalCostOfDividend)) //theVoucherRequest.GetAmount()))
05514                             {
05515                                 OTLog::vError("%s: Failed crediting %ld units to voucher reserve account: %s\n",
05516                                               szFunc, lTotalCostOfDividend, strVoucherAcctID.Get());
05517 
05518                                 // Since pVoucherReserveAcct->Credit failed, we have to return
05519                                 // the funds from theSourceAccount.Debit (Credit them back.)
05520                                 //
05521                                 if (false == theSourceAccount.Credit(lTotalCostOfDividend))
05522                                     OTLog::vError("%s: Failed crediting back the user account, after taking his funds "
05523                                                   "and failing to credit them to the voucher reserve account.\n", szFunc);
05524                             }
05525                             // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
05526                             else    // By this point, we have taken the full funds and moved them to the voucher
05527                             {       // reserve account. So now, let's iterate all the accounts for that share type,
05528                                     // and send a voucher to the owner of each one, to payout his dividend.
05529 
05530 
05531                                 // todo: determine whether I need to attach anything here at all...
05532                                 //
05533 //                              pResponseItem->SetAttachment(strVoucher);
05534                                 pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
05535 
05536                                 bOutSuccess = true;  // The paying of the dividends was successful.
05537                                 //
05538                                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
05539                                 //
05540                                 // SAVE THE ACCOUNTS WITH THE NEW BALANCES (FUNDS ARE MOVED)
05541                                 //
05542                                 // At this point, we save the accounts, so that the funds transfer is solid before
05543                                 // we start mailing vouchers out to people.
05544 
05545                                 // Release any signatures that were there before (They won't
05546                                 // verify anymore anyway, since the content has changed.)
05547                                 theSourceAccount.   ReleaseSignatures();
05548                                 theSourceAccount.   SignContract(m_nymServer);  // Sign
05549                                 theSourceAccount.   SaveContract();             // Save
05550                                 theSourceAccount.   SaveAccount();              // Save to file
05551 
05552                                 // We also need to save the Voucher cash reserve account.
05553                                 // (Any issued voucher cheque is automatically backed by this reserve account.
05554                                 // If a cheque is deposited, the funds come back out of this account. If the
05555                                 // cheque expires, then after the expiry period, if it remains in the account,
05556                                 // it is now the property of the transaction server.)
05557                                 pVoucherReserveAcct->ReleaseSignatures();
05558                                 pVoucherReserveAcct->SignContract(m_nymServer);
05559                                 pVoucherReserveAcct->SaveContract();
05560                                 pVoucherReserveAcct->SaveAccount();
05561 
05562                                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
05563                                 //
05564                                 // PAY THE SHAREHOLDERS
05565                                 //
05566                                 // Here's where we actually loop through the asset accounts for the share type,
05567                                 // and send a voucher to the owner of each one.
05568                                 //
05569                                 // This way, the actionPayDividend won't possibly load these accounts twice.
05570                                 // We make them available here this way.
05571                                 //
05572                                 mapOfAccounts       theAccounts;
05573                                 theAccounts.insert( std::pair<std::string, OTAccount *>(strAccountID.Get(),        &theSourceAccount));
05574                                 theAccounts.insert( std::pair<std::string, OTAccount *>(strSharesIssuerAcct.Get(), pSharesIssuerAccount));
05575                                 theAccounts.insert( std::pair<std::string, OTAccount *>(strVoucherAcctID.Get(),    &theVoucherReserveAcct));
05576 
05577                                 OTAcctFunctor_PayDividend  actionPayDividend(SERVER_ID,
05578                                                                              USER_ID,
05579                                                                              PAYOUT_ASSET_ID,
05580                                                                              VOUCHER_ACCOUNT_ID,
05581                                                                              strInReferenceTo, // Memo for each voucher (containing original payout request pItem)
05582                                                                              *this,
05583                                                                              lAmountPerShare,
05584                                                                              &theAccounts);
05585 
05586                                 // Loops through all the accounts for a given asset type (PAYOUT_ASSET_ID), and triggers
05587                                 // actionPayDividend for each one. This sends the owner nym for each, a voucher drawn on
05588                                 // VOUCHER_ACCOUNT_ID. (In the amount of lAmountPerShare * number of shares in account.)
05589                                 //
05590                                 const bool bForEachAcct = pSharesContract->ForEachAccountRecord(actionPayDividend);   // <================== pay all the dividends here.
05591                                 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
05592 
05593                                 // TODO: Since the above line of code loops through all the accounts and loads them
05594                                 // up, transforms them, and saves them again, we cannot use our own loaded accounts below
05595                                 // this point. (They could overwrite themselves.) theSourceAccount especially, was passed in
05596                                 // from above -- so how can we possible warn the caller than he cannot save this account without
05597                                 // overwriting work we have done in this function?
05598                                 //
05599                                 // Aside from any more elegant solution, the only way to make it work in this case would be to
05600                                 // make a map or list of all the accounts that are already loaded in memory (such as theSourceAccount)
05601                                 // and PASS THEM IN to the above ForEachAccountRecord call. This way it would have the option to use
05602                                 // the "already loaded" versions, where appropriate, instead of loading them twice. (As it is,
05603                                 // theSourceAccount is not used below this point, though we couldn't preven the caller from using it.)
05604                                 //
05605                                 // Therefore we need to have some central system where accounts can be loaded, locked, saved, etc.
05606                                 // So we cannot ever overwrite ourselves BY DESIGN. (And the same for other data types as well, like Nyms.)
05607                                 // Todo.
05608                                 //
05609                                 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
05610                                 if (!bForEachAcct) // todo failsafe. Handle this better.
05611                                 {
05612                                     OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR: After moving funds for dividend payment, there was some "
05613                                                   "error when sending out the vouchers to the payout recipients.\n", szFunc);
05614                                 }
05615                                 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
05616                                 //
05617                                 // REFUND ANY LEFTOVERS
05618                                 //
05619                                 const int64_t lLeftovers = lTotalCostOfDividend - (actionPayDividend.GetAmountPaidOut() +
05620                                                                                 actionPayDividend.GetAmountReturned());
05621                                 if (lLeftovers > 0)
05622                                 {
05623                                     // Of the total amount removed from the sender's account, and after paying all dividends,
05624                                     // there was a leftover amount that wasn't paid to anybody. Therefore, we should pay it back
05625                                     // to the sender himself, now.
05626                                     //
05627                                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: After dividend payout, with %ld units removed initially, "
05628                                                    "there were %ld units remaining. (Returning them to sender...)\n",
05629                                                    szFunc, lTotalCostOfDividend, lLeftovers);
05630                                     // ------------------------------------------
05631                                     OTCheque  theVoucher(SERVER_ID, PAYOUT_ASSET_ID);
05632 
05633                                     // 10 minutes ==    600 Seconds
05634                                     // 1 hour   ==     3600 Seconds
05635                                     // 1 day    ==    86400 Seconds
05636                                     // 30 days  ==  2592000 Seconds
05637                                     // 3 months ==  7776000 Seconds
05638                                     // 6 months == 15552000 Seconds
05639 
05640                                     const time64_t  VALID_FROM  = OTTimeGetCurrentTime();            // This time is set to TODAY NOW
05641                                     const time64_t  VALID_TO = OTTimeAddTimeInterval(VALID_FROM, OTTimeGetSecondsFromTime(OT_TIME_SIX_MONTHS_IN_SECONDS)); // This time occurs in 180 days (6 months).  Todo hardcoding.
05642 
05643                                     int64_t        lNewTransactionNumber = 0;
05644                                     const bool  bGotNextTransNum =
05645                                     IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lNewTransactionNumber);     // bStoreTheNumber defaults to true. We save the transaction
05646                                                                                                         // number on the server Nym (normally we'd discard it) because
05647                                                                                                         // when the cheque is deposited, the server nym, as the owner of
05648                                                                                                         // the voucher account, needs to verify the transaction # on the
05649                                                                                                         // cheque (to prevent double-spending of cheques.)
05650                                     // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05651                                     if (bGotNextTransNum)
05652                                     {
05653                                         const OTIdentifier SERVER_NYM_ID(m_nymServer);
05654                                         const bool bIssueVoucher = theVoucher.IssueCheque(lLeftovers,               // The amount of the cheque.
05655                                                                                           lNewTransactionNumber,    // Requiring a transaction number prevents double-spending of cheques.
05656                                                                                           VALID_FROM,               // The expiration date (valid from/to dates) of the cheque
05657                                                                                           VALID_TO,                 // Vouchers are automatically starting today and lasting 6 months.
05658                                                                                           VOUCHER_ACCOUNT_ID,       // The asset account the cheque is drawn on.
05659                                                                                           SERVER_NYM_ID,            // User ID of the sender (in this case the server nym.)
05660                                                                                           strInReferenceTo,         // Optional memo field. Includes item note and request memo.
05661                                                                                           &USER_ID);
05662 
05663                                         // All account crediting / debiting happens in the caller, in OTServer.
05664                                         //    (AND it happens only ONCE, to cover ALL vouchers.)
05665                                         // Then in here, the voucher either gets send to the recipient, or if error, sent back home to
05666                                         // the issuer Nym. (ALL the funds are removed, then the vouchers are sent one way or the other.)
05667                                         // Any returned vouchers, obviously serve to notify the dividend payer of where the errors were
05668                                         // (as well as give him the opportunity to get his money back.)
05669                                         //
05670                                         bool bSent = false;
05671                                         if (bIssueVoucher)
05672                                         {
05673                                             theVoucher.SetAsVoucher(SERVER_NYM_ID, VOUCHER_ACCOUNT_ID); // All this does is set the voucher's internal contract string
05674                                             theVoucher.SignContract(m_nymServer);                       // to "VOUCHER" instead of "CHEQUE".
05675                                             theVoucher.SaveContract();
05676 
05677                                             // Send the voucher to the payments inbox of the recipient.
05678                                             //
05679                                             const
05680                                             OTString  strVoucher(theVoucher);
05681                                             OTPayment thePayment(strVoucher);
05682 
05683                                             // calls DropMessageToNymbox
05684                                             bSent = this->SendInstrumentToNym(SERVER_ID,
05685                                                                               SERVER_NYM_ID,  // sender nym
05686                                                                               USER_ID,        // recipient nym (returning to original sender.)
05687                                                                               NULL, &thePayment, "payDividend"); // todo: hardcoding.
05688                                         }
05689                                         // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
05690                                         // If we didn't send it, then we need to return the funds to where they came from.
05691                                         //
05692                                         if (!bSent)
05693                                         {
05694                                             const OTString strPayoutAssetID(PAYOUT_ASSET_ID), strSenderUserID(USER_ID);
05695                                             OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR failed issuing voucher (to return leftovers back to "
05696                                                           "the dividend payout initiator.) WAS TRYING TO PAY %ld of asset type %s to Nym %s.\n",
05697                                                           szFunc, lLeftovers, strPayoutAssetID.Get(), strSenderUserID.Get());
05698                                         } // if !bSent
05699                                     }
05700                                     else // !bGotNextTransNum
05701                                     {
05702                                         const OTString strPayoutAssetID(PAYOUT_ASSET_ID), strRecipientUserID(USER_ID);
05703                                         OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR!! Failed issuing next transaction "
05704                                                       "number while trying to send a voucher (while returning leftover funds, after paying dividends.) "
05705                                                       "WAS TRYING TO PAY %ld of asset type %s to Nym %s.\n", szFunc,
05706                                                       lLeftovers, strPayoutAssetID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
05707                                     }
05708                                 }
05709                             } // else
05710                             // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
05711                         }
05712                         //else{} // TODO log that there was a problem with the amount
05713 
05714                     } // voucher request loaded successfully from string
05715                 } // GetVoucherAccount()
05716                 else
05717                 {
05718                     OTLog::vError("%s: GetVoucherAccount() failed. Asset Type:\n%s\n", szFunc,
05719                                   strAssetTypeID.Get());
05720                 }
05721             }
05722         } // (else bLoadContract is true)
05723     }
05724     // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05725     else
05726     {
05727         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
05728         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Expected OTItem::payDividend in trans# %ld: \n\n%s\n\n", szFunc,
05729                        tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR LOADING TRANSACTION INTO STRING) ");
05730     }
05731     // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05732     // sign the response item before sending it back (it's already been added to the transaction above)
05733     // Now, whether it was rejection or acknowledgement, it is set properly and it is signed, and it
05734     // is owned by the transaction, who will take it from here.
05735     pResponseItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
05736     pResponseItem->SaveContract(); // the signing was of no effect because I forgot to save.
05737 
05738     pResponseBalanceItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
05739     pResponseBalanceItem->SaveContract();
05740 }
05741 
05742 
05743 
05744 
05745 
05747 void OTServer::NotarizeDeposit(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTAccount & theAccount, OTTransaction & tranIn, OTTransaction & tranOut, bool & bOutSuccess)
05748 {
05749     // The outgoing transaction is an "atDeposit", that is, "a reply to the deposit request"
05750     tranOut.SetType(OTTransaction::atDeposit);
05751 
05752     OTItem * pItem          = NULL;
05753     OTItem * pItemCheque    = NULL;
05754     OTItem * pItemCash      = NULL;
05755     OTItem * pBalanceItem   = NULL;
05756     OTItem * pResponseItem  = NULL;
05757     OTItem * pResponseBalanceItem   = NULL;
05758 
05759     // The incoming transaction may be sent to inboxes and outboxes, and it
05760     // will probably be bundled in our reply to the user as well. Therefore,
05761     // let's grab it as a string.
05762     OTString strInReferenceTo;
05763     OTString strBalanceItem;
05764 
05765     // Grab the actual server ID from this object, and use it as the server ID here.
05766     const OTIdentifier  SERVER_ID(m_strServerID),       USER_ID(theNym),    ACCOUNT_ID(theAccount),
05767                         SERVER_USER_ID(m_nymServer),    ASSET_TYPE_ID(theAccount.GetAssetTypeID());
05768 
05769     const OTString strUserID(USER_ID), strAccountID(ACCOUNT_ID);
05770 
05771     OTMint      * pMint                 = NULL; // the Mint itself.
05772     OTAccount   * pMintCashReserveAcct  = NULL; // the Mint's funds for cash withdrawals.
05773     // -----------------------------------------------------------------
05774     // Here we find out if we're depositing cash, or a cheque
05775     //
05776     OTItem::itemType theReplyItemType = OTItem::error_state;
05777 
05778     pItemCheque = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::depositCheque);
05779 
05780     if (NULL == pItemCheque)
05781     {
05782         pItemCash = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::deposit);
05783         pItem = pItemCash;
05784         // -------
05785         theReplyItemType = OTItem::atDeposit;
05786     }
05787     else
05788     {
05789         pItem = pItemCheque;
05790         // -------
05791         theReplyItemType = OTItem::atDepositCheque;
05792     }
05793     // --------------------------------------
05794     pResponseItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, theReplyItemType);
05795     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
05796     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
05797 
05798     pResponseBalanceItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atBalanceStatement);
05799     pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
05800     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseBalanceItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
05801     // --------------------------------------
05802     if (NULL == pItem)
05803     {
05804         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
05805         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Expected OTItem::deposit or OTItem::depositCheque in trans# %ld: \n\n%s\n\n",
05806                        tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR LOADING TRANSACTION INTO STRING) ");
05807     }
05808     // Below this point, we know that pItem is good, and that either pItemCheque OR pItemCash is good,
05809     // and that pItem points to the good one. Therefore next, let's verify permissions:
05810     // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
05811 
05812     // This permission has to do with ALL deposits (cash or cheque)
05813     else if (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_deposit))
05814     {
05815         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: User %s cannot do this transaction (All deposits are disallowed in server.cfg)\n",
05816                        strUserID.Get());
05817     }
05818     // -----------------------------------------
05819     // This permission has to do with vouchers.
05820     else if ((NULL != pItemCheque) &&
05821              (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_deposit_cheque)))
05822     {
05823         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: User %s cannot do this transaction (depositCheque is disallowed in server.cfg)\n",
05824                        strUserID.Get());
05825     }
05826     // This permission has to do with cash.
05827     else if ((NULL != pItemCash) &&
05828              (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_deposit_cash)))
05829     {
05830         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: User %s cannot do this transaction (deposit cash is disallowed in server.cfg)\n",
05831                        strUserID.Get());
05832     }
05833     // ----------------------------------------------------------
05834     // Check for a balance agreement...
05835     //
05836     else if (NULL == (pBalanceItem = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::balanceStatement)))
05837     {
05838         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
05839         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Expected OTItem::balanceStatement, but not found in trans # %ld: \n\n%s\n\n",
05840                        tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR LOADING TRANSACTION INTO STRING) ");
05841     }
05842     // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05843     // DEPOSIT CHEQUE  (Deposit Cash is the bottom half of the function, deposit cheque is the top half.)
05844     else if (pItem->GetType() == OTItem::depositCheque)
05845     {
05846         // The response item, as well as the sender's inbox, will soon contain a copy
05847         // of the request item. So I save it into a string here so they can grab a copy of it
05848         // into their "in reference to" fields.
05849         pItem->SaveContractRaw(strInReferenceTo);
05850         pBalanceItem->SaveContractRaw(strBalanceItem);
05851 
05852         // Server response item being added to server response transaction (tranOut)
05853         // They're getting SOME sort of response item.
05854 
05855         pResponseItem->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
05856         pResponseItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
05857 
05858         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceString(strBalanceItem); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
05859         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
05860         // -----------------------------------------------------
05861         OTLedger * pInbox   = theAccount.LoadInbox(m_nymServer);
05862         OTLedger * pOutbox  = theAccount.LoadOutbox(m_nymServer);
05863 
05864         OTCleanup<OTLedger> theInboxAngel(pInbox);
05865         OTCleanup<OTLedger> theOutboxAngel(pOutbox);
05866 
05867         if (NULL == pInbox) // || !pInbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) Verified in OTAccount::Load
05868         {
05869             OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Error loading or verifying inbox for depositor account.\n");
05870         }
05871 
05872         else if (NULL == pOutbox) // || !pOutbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) Verified in OTAccount::Load
05873         {
05874             OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Error loading or verifying outbox for depositor account.\n");
05875         }
05876         // NOTE: Below this point, pInbox and pOutbox are both available, AND will be properly
05877         // cleaned up automatically upon scope exit.
05878         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
05879         // If the ID on the "from" account that was passed in,
05880         // does not match the "Acct From" ID on this transaction item
05881         else if (ACCOUNT_ID != pItem->GetPurportedAccountID())
05882         {
05883             // TODO: Verify that this if block is unnecessary, and if so, remove it.
05884             // (The item should already have been verified when the transaction itself was
05885             // verified, before this function was even called. I think this is just an oversight.)
05886             OTLog::Output(0, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Error: account ID does not match account ID on the deposit item.\n");
05887         }
05888         else
05889         {
05890             // Get the cheque from the Item and load it up into a Cheque object.
05891             OTString strCheque;
05892             pItem->GetAttachment(strCheque);
05893             OTCheque theCheque(SERVER_ID, ASSET_TYPE_ID); // allocated on the stack :-)
05894             bool bLoadContractFromString = theCheque.LoadContractFromString(strCheque);
05895 
05896             if (!bLoadContractFromString)
05897             {
05898                 OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR loading cheque from string:\n%s\n", __FUNCTION__,
05899                         strCheque.Get());
05900             }
05901             // ----------------------------------------
05902             // See if the cheque is drawn on the same server as the deposit account
05903             // (the server running this code right now.)
05904             //
05905             else if (SERVER_ID != theCheque.GetServerID())
05906             {
05907                 const OTString  strSenderUserID(theCheque.GetSenderUserID());
05908                 const OTString  strRecipientUserID(theCheque.GetRecipientUserID());
05909                 // --------------------------------------------
05910                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Cheque rejected (%ld): "
05911                                "Incorrect Server ID on cheque. Sender User ID: %s\nRecipient User ID is: %s\n",
05912                                __FUNCTION__, theCheque.GetTransactionNum(), strSenderUserID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
05913             }
05914             // ----------------------------------------
05915             // See if the cheque is already expired or otherwise not within it's valid date range.
05916             else if (false == theCheque.VerifyCurrentDate())
05917             {
05918                 const OTString  strSenderUserID(theCheque.GetSenderUserID());
05919                 const OTString  strRecipientUserID(theCheque.GetRecipientUserID());
05920                 // --------------------------------------------
05921                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Cheque rejected (%ld): "
05922                                "Not within valid date range. Sender User ID: %s\nRecipient User ID: %s\n",
05923                                __FUNCTION__, theCheque.GetTransactionNum(), strSenderUserID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
05924             }
05925             // ----------------------------------------
05926             // You can't deposit a cheque into the same account that it's drawn on. (Otherwise, in loading
05927             // both accounts, I would cause one of them to  be overwritten. I'm not willing to do the same
05928             // pointer magic that I'm doing with Nyms... instead I just disallow this entirely.)
05929             //
05930             // UPDATE: New rule: If you deposit a cheque into the same account it's drawn on,
05931             // the effect is the cancellation of the cheque. (If we are in this block, it means
05932             // the original cheque writer is now trying to cancel the cheque before the recipient
05933             // has a chance to deposit it.)
05934             //
05935             // CANCELLATION OF CHEQUES:
05936             //
05937             else if (ACCOUNT_ID == theCheque.GetSenderAcctID()) // Depositor ACCOUNT_ID is recipient's acct. (theNym.) But pSenderNym is normally someone else (the sender).
05938             {
05939 //              OTLog::vError("OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Error: Unable to deposit into the same account cheque was drawn on:\n%s\n",
05940 //                            strCheque.Get());
05941 
05942                 // UPDATE: This block is now for cancelling the cheque before the original
05943                 // recipient manages to deposit it.
05944 
05945                 const OTString  strSenderUserID(theCheque.GetSenderUserID());
05946                 const OTString  strRecipientUserID(theCheque.GetRecipientUserID());
05947                 // --------------------------------------------
05948                 if (theCheque.GetSenderUserID() != USER_ID)
05949                 {
05950                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failure verifying cheque: Strange: while the depositing account has the "
05951                                    "same ID as the cheque sender acct, somehow the user IDs do not match. (Should never happen.)\n"
05952                                    "Cheque Sender User ID: %s\n Depositor User ID: %s\n", __FUNCTION__,
05953                                    strSenderUserID.Get(), strUserID.Get());
05954                 }
05955                 // --------------------------------------------
05956                 else if (theCheque.GetAmount() != 0)
05957                 {
05958                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failure verifying cheque: While attempting to perform cancellation, "
05959                                    "the cheque has a non-zero amount.\n"
05960                                    "Sender User ID: %s\nRecipient User ID: %s\n", __FUNCTION__,
05961                                    strSenderUserID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
05962                 }
05963                 // --------------------------------------------
05964                 // Make sure the transaction number on the cheque is still available and valid for use by theNym.
05965                 //
05966                 else if (false == VerifyTransactionNumber(theNym, theCheque.GetTransactionNum()))
05967                 {
05968                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failure verifying cheque: Bad transaction number.\n"
05969                                    "Sender User ID: %s\nRecipient User ID: %s\n", __FUNCTION__,
05970                                    strSenderUserID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
05971                 }
05972                 // ---------------------------------------------
05973                 // Let's see if the sender's signature matches the one on the cheque...
05974                 else if (false == theCheque.VerifySignature(theNym))
05975                 {
05976                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failure verifying cheque signature for "
05977                                    "sender ID: %s\nRecipient User ID: %s\n Cheque:\n\n%s\n\n", __FUNCTION__,
05978                                    strSenderUserID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get(), strCheque.Get());
05979                 }
05980                 // ---------------------------------------------
05981                 else if (!(pBalanceItem->VerifyBalanceStatement(theCheque.GetAmount(), // This amount is always zero in the case of cheque cancellation.
05982                                                                 theNym,
05983                                                                 *pInbox,
05984                                                                 *pOutbox,
05985                                                                 theAccount,
05986                                                                 tranIn)))
05987                 {
05988                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR verifying balance statement while cancelling cheque %ld. Acct ID:\n%s\n",
05989                                    __FUNCTION__, theCheque.GetTransactionNum(), strAccountID.Get());
05990                 }
05991                 // ---------------------------------------------
05992                 else
05993                 {
05994                     pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the transaction agreement was successful.
05995 
05996                     if (// Clear the transaction number. Sender Nym was responsible for it (and still is, until
05997                         // he signs to accept the cheque reecipt). Still, however, he HAS used the cheque, so
05998                         // I'm removing his ability to use that number twice. It will remain on his issued list
05999                         // until he signs for the receipt.
06000                         //
