06001                         (false == RemoveTransactionNumber(theNym, theCheque.GetTransactionNum(), true)) //bSave=true
06002                         )// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
06003                     {
06004                         OTLog::vError("%s: Failed marking the transaction number as in use. (Should never happen.)\n",
06005                                       __FUNCTION__);
06006                     }
06007                     else
06008                     {
06009                         // Generate new transaction number (for putting the check receipt in the sender's inbox.)
06010                         // todo check this generation for failure (can it fail?)
06011                         int64_t lNewTransactionNumber = 0;
06012 
06013                         IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lNewTransactionNumber, false); // bStoreTheNumber = false
06014 
06015                         OTTransaction * pInboxTransaction = OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(*pInbox, OTTransaction::chequeReceipt,
06016                                                                                                lNewTransactionNumber);
06017 
06018                         // The depositCheque request OTItem is saved as a "in reference to" field,
06019                         // on the inbox chequeReceipt transaction.
06020                         //todo put these two together in a method.
06021                         pInboxTransaction->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo);
06022                         pInboxTransaction->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum());
06023 
06024                         pInboxTransaction->SetAsCancelled();
06025 
06026                         // Now we have created a new transaction from the server to the sender's inbox
06027                         // Let's sign and save it...
06028                         pInboxTransaction->SignContract(m_nymServer);
06029                         pInboxTransaction->SaveContract();
06030 
06031                         // Here the transaction we just created is actually added to the source acct's inbox.
06032                         pInbox->AddTransaction(*pInboxTransaction);
06033 
06034                         // Release any signatures that were there before (They won't
06035                         // verify anymore anyway, since the content has changed.)
06036                         //
06037                         pInbox->ReleaseSignatures();
06038                         pInbox->SignContract(m_nymServer);
06039                         pInbox->SaveContract();
06040 
06041                         theAccount.SaveInbox(*pInbox);
06042 
06043                         // Any inbox/nymbox/outbox ledger will only itself contain
06044                         // abbreviated versions of the receipts, including their hashes.
06045                         //
06046                         // The rest is stored separately, in the box receipt, which is created
06047                         // whenever a receipt is added to a box, and deleted after a receipt
06048                         // is removed from a box.
06049                         //
06050                         pInboxTransaction->SaveBoxReceipt(*pInbox);
06051                         // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06052                         // AT THIS POINT, the sender/depositor's inbox has had the cheque transaction added to it,
06053                         // as his receipt. (He must perform a balance agreement in order to get it out of his inbox.)
06054                         //
06055                         // THERE IS NOTHING LEFT TO DO BUT SAVE THE FILES!!
06056 
06057                         theAccount.ReleaseSignatures();
06058                         theAccount.SignContract(m_nymServer);
06059                         theAccount.SaveContract();
06060                         theAccount.SaveAccount();
06061 
06062                         // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
06063                         // otherwise, if we never entered this block, then it would still be set to rejection, and the
06064                         // new item would never have been added to the inbox, and the inbox file would never have had
06065                         // its signatures released, or been re-signed or re-saved back to file.
06066                         // BUT... if the message comes back with acknowledgement--then all of these actions must have
06067                         // happened, and here is the server's signature to prove it.
06068                         // Otherwise you get no items and no signature. Just a rejection item in the response transaction.
06069                         //
06070                         pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
06071 
06072                         bOutSuccess = true;  // The cheque cancellation was successful.
06073 
06074                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: SUCCESS cancelling cheque %ld, which had been drawn from account: %s\n",
06075                                        __FUNCTION__, theCheque.GetTransactionNum(), strAccountID.Get());
06076 
06077                         tranOut.SetAsCancelled();
06078 
06079                         // TODO: Our code that actually saves the new balance statement receipt should go here
06080                         // (that is, only after ultimate success.) Otherwise we still want to store the old receipt.
06081                         // For now I'm verifying it, but not storing it.  This means the security for it works, but
06082                         // in a dispute, I can't prove it / cover my ass.  So very soon a receipt WILL be saved here
06083                         // that is, a copy of the user's signed BalanceAgreement.
06084                         // Note: if I'm saving the entire outgoing transaction reply, or message reply, (versus just
06085                         // the reply to a certain item) then I think I have the balance agreement already? Double check.
06086                     }
06087                 } // "else"
06088             } // ABOVE: Cheque cancellation
06089             // ----------------------------------------
06090             else // BELOW: Cheque deposit
06091             {
06092                 const OTIdentifier & SOURCE_ACCT_ID   (theCheque.GetSenderAcctID()); // relevant for both vouchers AND cheques.
06093                 const OTIdentifier & SENDER_USER_ID   (theCheque.GetSenderUserID());
06094 
06095                 const OTIdentifier & REMITTER_ACCT_ID   (theCheque.GetRemitterAcctID()); // only relevant in case of vouchers.
06096                 const OTIdentifier & REMITTER_USER_ID   (theCheque.GetRemitterUserID());
06097 
06098                 // If the cheque has a remitter ...and the depositor IS the remitter...
06099                 // (Then the remitter is cancelling the voucher.)
06100                 //
06101                 const bool bHasRemitter        = theCheque.HasRemitter();
06102                 const bool bRemitterCancelling = (bHasRemitter && (USER_ID == theCheque.GetRemitterUserID()));
06103 
06104                 // The point of the logic here is to enable remitters to deposit vouchers. Basically allows
06105                 // them to "cancel" the voucher, and get their money back.
06106                 //
06107                 const OTIdentifier & RECIPIENT_USER_ID(bRemitterCancelling ? USER_ID : theCheque.GetRecipientUserID());
06108 
06109                 // (Note that we allow the remitter of a voucher to deposit that voucher.)
06110 
06111                 const OTString  strSenderUserID(SENDER_USER_ID),
06112                                 strSourceAcctID(SOURCE_ACCT_ID),
06113                                 strRecipientUserID(RECIPIENT_USER_ID),
06114                                 strRemitterUserID(REMITTER_USER_ID),
06115                                 strRemitterAcctID(REMITTER_ACCT_ID);
06116                 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06117                 OTLedger    theSenderInbox  (  SENDER_USER_ID,   SOURCE_ACCT_ID, SERVER_ID); // chequeReceipt goes here.
06118                 OTLedger    theRemitterInbox(REMITTER_USER_ID, REMITTER_ACCT_ID, SERVER_ID); // voucherReceipt goes here.
06119                 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06120                 OTLedger  * pSenderInbox   = &theSenderInbox;
06121                 OTLedger  * pRemitterInbox = &theRemitterInbox;
06122                 OTAccount * pRemitterAcct  = NULL;  // Only used in the case of vouchers.
06123                 OTCleanup<OTAccount> theRemitterAcctGuardian; // This is set below, right after OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount().
06124                 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06125                 OTAccount * pSourceAcct    = NULL;  // We'll load this up and change its balance, save it then delete the instance.
06126                                                     // (I'll use OTCleanup to take care of deleting the instance, so it's automatic.)
06127                 OTCleanup<OTAccount> theSourceAcctGuardian; // This is set below, right after OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount().
06128                 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06129                 OTPseudonym     theRemitterNym(REMITTER_USER_ID);
06130                 OTPseudonym *   pRemitterNym = &theRemitterNym;
06131                 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06132                 OTPseudonym     theSenderNym(SENDER_USER_ID);
06133                 OTPseudonym *   pSenderNym = &theSenderNym;
06134 
06135                 // Don't want to overwrite files or db records in cases where the sender is also the depositor.
06136                 // (Similar concern if the server is also the depositor, but that's already partly handled
06137                 // before we get to this point... theNym is already substituted for m_nymServer,
06138                 // if the IDs match, before any of the commands are processed.)
06139                 //
06140                 // The conundrum is in the multiplicity of combinations. The server COULD be the sender
06141                 // OR the depositor, or he could be BOTH, or the server might NOT be the sender OR depositor,
06142                 // yet they could still be the same person.  Normally all 3 are separate entities.  That's a
06143                 // lot of combinations. I want to make sure that I don't overwrite ANY files while juggling the
06144                 // respective nymfiles, transaction numbers, request numbers, etc.
06145                 //
06146                 // Solution:  When commands are first processed, and the Request Number is processed, theNym
06147                 // is ALREADY replaced with m_nymServer IF the IDs match and the signature verifies. It is then
06148                 // passed that way to all of the commands (including the one we are in now.)
06149                 //
06150                 // I THEN do the logic BELOW as additional to that. Make sure if you change anything that you
06151                 // think int64_t and hard about what you are doing!!
06152                 //
06153                 // Here's the logic:
06154                 // -- theNym is the depositor (for sure.)
06155                 // -- m_nymServer is the server nym (for sure.)
06156                 // -- By the time we get here, IF the ServerUserID and UserID match,
06157                 //    then theNym IS ALREADY m_nymServer, literally a reference to it.
06158                 //    (This is performed before we even get to this point, so that the
06159                 //    same problem doesn't occur with request numbers.)
06160                 // -- In cases where the "server is also the depositor", it's therefore
06161                 //    ALREADY handled, since theNym already points to m_nymServer.
06162                 // -- theSenderNym is used to load the sender nym in cases where we have
06163                 //    to load it from file or db ourselves. (Most normal cases.)
06164                 // -- In those normal cases, pSenderNym will point to theSenderNym and
06165                 //    we load it up from file or database.
06166                 // -- In cases where the sender is also the user (the depositor), then
06167                 //    pSenderNym will point to theNym instead of to theSenderNym, and we
06168                 //    no longer bother loading it, since the user is already loaded.
06169                 // -- In cases where the sender is also the server, then pSenderNym will
06170                 //    point to m_nymServer instead of to theSenderNym, and we no longer
06171                 //    bother loading it, since the server's nym is already loaded.
06172 
06173                 bool    bDepositorIsServer     = (USER_ID          == SERVER_USER_ID);
06174                 bool    bDepositorIsSender     = (USER_ID          == SENDER_USER_ID);
06175                 bool    bDepositorIsRemitter   = (USER_ID          == REMITTER_USER_ID);
06176                 bool    bDepositAcctIsRemitter = (ACCOUNT_ID       == REMITTER_ACCT_ID);
06177                 bool    bSourceAcctIsRemitter  = (SOURCE_ACCT_ID   == REMITTER_ACCT_ID);
06178                 bool    bSenderIsServer        = (SENDER_USER_ID   == SERVER_USER_ID);
06179                 bool    bRemitterIsServer      = (REMITTER_USER_ID == SERVER_USER_ID);
06180                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06181                 bool    bSenderUserAlreadyLoaded   = false;
06182                 bool    bSourceAcctAlreadyLoaded   = false;
06183                 bool    bRemitterUserAlreadyLoaded = false;
06184                 bool    bRemitterAcctAlreadyLoaded = false;
06185                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06186 
06187                 // The depositor is already loaded, (for sure.)
06188 
06189                 // The server is already loaded, (for sure.)
06190 
06191                 // If the depositor IS the server, then it already points there (for sure.)
06192                 if (bDepositorIsServer)
06193                 {
06194                     //OTPseudonym & theNym = m_nymServer; // Already handled in the code that calls IncrementRequestNum().
06195 
06196                     //bSenderUserAlreadyLoaded = false; // Sender is either determined to be already loaded (directly below) or
06197                                                         // it is loaded as part of the cheque verification process below that.
06198                                                         // At this point I can't set it because I just don't know yet.
06199                 }
06200                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06201                 // If the depositor IS the sender, pSenderNym points to depositor, and we're already loaded.
06202                 if (bDepositorIsSender)
06203                 {
06204                     pSenderNym = &theNym;
06205                     bSenderUserAlreadyLoaded = true;
06206                 }
06207                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06208                 // If the server IS the sender, pSenderNym points to the server, and we're already loaded.
06209                 if (bSenderIsServer)
06210                 {
06211                     pSenderNym = &m_nymServer;
06212                     bSenderUserAlreadyLoaded = true;
06213                 }
06214                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06215                 bool bSuccessLoadSenderInbox   = false;
06216                 bool bSuccessLoadRemitterInbox = false;
06217 
06218                 if (bHasRemitter)
06219                 {
06220                     pSenderInbox = NULL;
06221 
06222                     // If the depositor IS the remitter, pRemitterNym points to depositor, and we're already loaded.
06223                     if (bDepositorIsRemitter)
06224                     {
06225                         pRemitterNym = &theNym;
06226                         bRemitterUserAlreadyLoaded = true;
06227                     }
06228                     // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06229                     // If the server IS the remitter, pRemitterNym points to the server, and we're already loaded.
06230                     if (bRemitterIsServer)
06231                     {
06232                         pRemitterNym = &m_nymServer;
06233                         bRemitterUserAlreadyLoaded = true;
06234                     }
06235                     // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06236                     // If the account IS the remitter's account, pRemitterNym points to the server, and we're already loaded.
06237                     if (bDepositAcctIsRemitter)
06238                     {
06239                         pRemitterAcct  = &theAccount;
06240                         pRemitterInbox = pInbox;
06241 
06242                         bRemitterAcctAlreadyLoaded = true;
06243                         bSuccessLoadRemitterInbox  = true;
06244 
06245                         // Just for completeness. In this case ALL THREE accounts would be the same account,
06246                         // which is probably disallowed later on anyway.
06247                         //
06248                         if (bSourceAcctIsRemitter)
06249                         {
06250                             pSourceAcct  = pRemitterAcct;
06251                             pSenderInbox = pRemitterInbox;
06252 
06253                             bSourceAcctAlreadyLoaded = true;
06254                             bSuccessLoadSenderInbox  = true;
06255                         }
06256                     }
06257                 }
06258                 else // Definitely has no remitter. Therefore definitely NOT a voucher.
06259                 {    // (If it's not a voucher, that means we should DEFINITELY be able to load the sender's inbox.)
06260                     // ----------------------------------
06261                     // Load source account's inbox
06262 
06263                     bSuccessLoadSenderInbox = pSenderInbox->LoadInbox();
06264 
06265                     // ...If it loads, verify it. Otherwise, generate it...
06266                     if (bSuccessLoadSenderInbox)
06267                         bSuccessLoadSenderInbox = pSenderInbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer);
06268                     else
06269                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: Failed loading inbox for %s source account.\n", __FUNCTION__,
06270                                        (bHasRemitter) ? "cheque" : "voucher");
06271 //                  else
06272 //                      bSuccessLoadSenderInbox = pSenderInbox->GenerateLedger(SOURCE_ACCT_ID, SERVER_ID, OTLedger::inbox, true); // bGenerateFile=true
06273 
06274                 }
06275                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06276                 // To deposit a cheque, need to verify:  (in no special order)
06277                 //
06278                 // -- DONE Load the source account and verify it exists.
06279                 // -- DONE Make sure the source acct is verified for the server signature.
06280                 // -- DONE Make sure the Asset Type of the cheque matches the Asset Type of BOTH source and recipient accts.
06281                 // -- DONE See if there is a Recipient User ID. If so, MAKE SURE it matches the user depositing the cheque!
06282                 // -- DONE See if the Sender User even exists.
06283                 // -- DONE See if the Sender User ID matches the hash of the actual public key in the sender's pubkey file.
06284                 // -- DONE Make sure the cheque has the right server ID.
06285                 // -- DONE Make sure the cheque has not yet EXPIRED.
06286                 // -- DONE Make sure the cheque signature is verified with the sender's pubkey.
06287                 // -- DONE Make sure the account ID on the transaction item matches the depositor account ID.
06288                 // -- DONE Verify the funds are in the source acct.
06289                 //
06290                 // -- DONE Plus deal with sender's inbox.
06291 
06292                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06293                 // If there's a remitter, then it's a voucher, and thus the sender MUST be the server.
06294                 // (If the sender on a voucher is NOT the server, then it's very suspicious.)
06295                 //
06296                 if (bHasRemitter && !bSenderIsServer)
06297                 {
06298                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: Failure: Voucher has a 'sender' who is not the server: %s\n",
06299                                    __FUNCTION__, strSenderUserID.Get());
06300                 }
06301                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06302 //              else if (bRemitterIsServer) // Disallowed for now. UPDATE: Necesssary for paying dividends.
06303 //              {
06304 //                  OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: Failure: Voucher has the server set as the 'remitter' (disallowed.)\n",
06305 //                                 __FUNCTION__);
06306 //              }
06307                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06308                 // See if we can load the sender's public key (to verify cheque signature,
06309                 // and to remove transaction number if it's not a voucher.)
06310                 // if !bSenderUserAlreadyLoaded since the server already had its public key loaded at boot-time.
06311                 // (also since the depositor and sender might be the same person.)
06312                 else if (!bSenderUserAlreadyLoaded                &&
06313 //                      (false == theSenderNym.LoadCredentials()) &&  // New style.
06314                         (false == theSenderNym.LoadPublicKey())       // Old style (The call on this line is deprecated.) NOTE: LoadPublicKey already calls LoadCredentials at its top, though eventually we'll just call it here directly, once LoadPublicKey is removed for good.
06315                     )
06316                 {
06317                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: Error loading public key for %s signer during "
06318                                    "deposit: %s\nRecipient User ID: %s\n", __FUNCTION__,
06319                                    (bHasRemitter) ? "cheque" : "voucher",
06320                                    strSenderUserID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
06321                 }
06322 
06323                 // See if the Nym ID (User ID) that we have matches the message digest of his public key.
06324                 else if (false == pSenderNym->VerifyPseudonym())
06325                 {
06326                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: Failure verifying %s: "
06327                                    "Bad Sender User ID (fails hash check of pubkey)"
06328                                    ": %s\nRecipient User ID: %s\n", __FUNCTION__,
06329                                    (bHasRemitter) ? "cheque" : "voucher",
06330                                    strSenderUserID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
06331                 }
06332 
06333                 // See if we can load the sender's nym file (to verify the transaction # on the cheque)
06334                 // if !bSenderUserAlreadyLoaded since the server already had its nym file loaded at boot-time.
06335                 // (also since the depositor and sender might be the same person.)
06336                 else if (!bSenderUserAlreadyLoaded && (false == theSenderNym.LoadSignedNymfile(m_nymServer)))
06337                 {
06338                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: Error loading nymfile for %s signer during deposit, user ID: %s\n"
06339                                    "Recipient User ID: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, (bHasRemitter) ? "cheque" : "voucher",
06340                                    strSenderUserID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
06341                 }
06342                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06343                 // See if we can load the remitter's public key (if it's a voucher.)
06344                 // if !bRemitterAlreadyLoaded since the server already had its public key loaded at boot-time.
06345                 // (also since the depositor or server, and remitter, might be the same person.)
06346                 else if (bHasRemitter && !bRemitterUserAlreadyLoaded &&
06347 //                  (false == theRemitterNym.LoadCredentials())      &&  // New style.
06348                     (false == theRemitterNym.LoadPublicKey())            // Old style (The call on this line is deprecated.) NOTE: LoadPublicKey already calls LoadCredentials at its top, though eventually we'll just call it here directly, once LoadPublicKey is removed for good.
06349                     )
06350                 {
06351                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: Error loading public key for remitter during "
06352                                    "voucher deposit: %s\nRecipient User ID: %s\n", __FUNCTION__,
06353                                    strRemitterUserID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
06354                 }
06355 
06356                 // See if the Nym ID (User ID) that we have matches the message digest of his public key.
06357                 else if (bHasRemitter && !pRemitterNym->VerifyPseudonym())
06358                 {
06359                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: Failure verifying voucher: "
06360                                    "Bad Remitter User ID (fails hash check of pubkey)"
06361                                    ": %s\nRecipient User ID: %s\n", __FUNCTION__,
06362                                    strRemitterUserID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
06363                 }
06364 
06365                 // See if we can load the remitter's nym file (to verify the transaction # on the cheque)
06366                 // if !bRemitterUserAlreadyLoaded since the server already had its nym file loaded at boot-time.
06367                 // (also since the depositor and remitter might be the same person.)
06368                 else if (bHasRemitter && !bRemitterUserAlreadyLoaded && (false == theRemitterNym.LoadSignedNymfile(m_nymServer)))
06369                 {
06370                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: Error loading nymfile for remitter during voucher deposit: %s\n"
06371                                    "Recipient User ID: %s\n", __FUNCTION__,
06372                                    strRemitterUserID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
06373                 }
06374                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06375                 // Make sure they're not double-spending this cheque.
06376                 //
06377                 else if (false == VerifyTransactionNumber(*(bHasRemitter ? pRemitterNym : pSenderNym),
06378                                                           theCheque.GetTransactionNum()))
06379                 {
06380                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: Failure verifying %s: Bad transaction number.\n"
06381                                    "Recipient User ID: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, (bHasRemitter) ? "cheque" : "voucher",
06382                                    strRecipientUserID.Get());
06383                 }
06384                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06385                 // Let's see if the sender's signature matches the one on the cheque...
06386                 else if (false == theCheque.VerifySignature(*pSenderNym)) // This is same for cheques and vouchers.
06387                 {
06388                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: Failure verifying %s signature for "
06389                                    "sender ID: %s Recipient User ID: %s", __FUNCTION__,
06390                                    (bHasRemitter) ? "cheque" : "voucher",
06391                                    strSenderUserID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
06392                     if (bHasRemitter)
06393                         OTLog::vOutput(0, " Remitter User ID: %s\n", strRemitterUserID.Get());
06394                     else
06395                         OTLog::Output(0, "\n");
06396                 }
06397                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06398                 // If there is a recipient user ID on the check, it must match the user depositing the cheque.
06399                 // (But if there is NO recipient user ID, then it's a blank cheque and ANYONE can deposit it.)
06400                 else if (theCheque.HasRecipient() && !(USER_ID == RECIPIENT_USER_ID))
06401                 {
06402                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failure matching %s recipient to depositor. Depositor User ID: %s "
06403                                    "Recipient User ID: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, (bHasRemitter) ? "cheque" : "voucher",
06404                                    strUserID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
06405                 }
06406                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06407                 // Try to load the source account (that cheque is drawn on) up into memory.
06408                 // We'll need to debit funds from it...  Also, set the cleanup object onto this pointer.
06409                 else if (!bSourceAcctAlreadyLoaded &&
06410                             ((
06411                              NULL == (pSourceAcct = OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount(SOURCE_ACCT_ID, SERVER_ID))
06412                             )
06413                             ||
06414                             (
06415                              theSourceAcctGuardian.SetCleanupTargetPointer(pSourceAcct), false  // I want this to eval to false, but I want SetCleanup to call.
06416                             ))                                                                  // Also, SetCleanup() is safe even if pointer is NULL.
06417                         )
06418                     // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06419                 {
06420                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: %s deposit failure, "
06421                                    "trying to load source acct, ID: %s Recipient User ID: %s",
06422                                    __FUNCTION__, (bHasRemitter) ? "Cheque" : "Voucher", strSourceAcctID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get());
06423                     if (bHasRemitter)
06424                         OTLog::vOutput(0, " Remitter User ID: %s\n", strRemitterUserID.Get());
06425                     else
06426                         OTLog::Output(0, "\n");
06427                 }
06428                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06429                 // If the cheque is a voucher (drawn on an internal server account) then there is no need to
06430                 // load any "sender inbox" (which will not exist anyway.) Whereas if the source account is NOT
06431                 // an internal server account (but rather, is a NORMAL account) then it had better have
06432                 // successfully loaded that inbox, or we have a problem.
06433                 //
06434                 else if (!bSuccessLoadSenderInbox && !pSourceAcct->IsInternalServerAcct())
06435                 {
06436                     OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR verifying inbox ledger for source acct ID: %s\n",
06437                                   __FUNCTION__, strSourceAcctID.Get());
06438                 }
06439                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06440                 // Does the source account verify?
06441                 // I call VerifySignature here since VerifyContractID was already called in LoadExistingAccount().
06442                 // (Otherwise I might normally call VerifyAccount(), which does both...)
06443                 //
06444                 // Someone can't just alter an account file, because then the server's signature
06445                 // won't verify anymore on that file and transactions will fail such as right here:
06446                 //
06447                 else if (!pSourceAcct->VerifySignature(m_nymServer))
06448                 {
06449                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR verifying signature on source account while depositing %s. Acct ID: %s\n",
06450                                    __FUNCTION__, (bHasRemitter) ? "cheque" : "voucher", strAccountID.Get());
06451                 }
06452                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06453                 // Need to make sure the signer is the owner of the source account...
06454                 else if (!pSourceAcct->VerifyOwner(*pSenderNym))
06455                 {
06456                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: ERROR verifying signer's ownership of source account while "
06457                                    "depositing %s. Source Acct ID: %s\n", __FUNCTION__,
06458                                    (bHasRemitter) ? "cheque" : "voucher",
06459                                    strAccountID.Get());
06460                 }
06461                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06462                 else
06463                 {
06464                     bSourceAcctAlreadyLoaded = true;
06465                     // -------------------------------------
06466                     if (bSourceAcctIsRemitter)
06467                     {
06468                         pRemitterAcct              = pSourceAcct;
06469                         bRemitterAcctAlreadyLoaded = true;
06470 
06471                         pRemitterInbox             = pSenderInbox;
06472 
06473                         if (NULL != pRemitterInbox) // This part is here for completeness only. It will never actually happen,
06474                             bSuccessLoadRemitterInbox = true; // since a voucher source account is owned by server and has no inbox.
06475                     }
06476                     // *********************************************************************
06477 
06478                     // Try to load the remitter account (that voucher was originally financed from) up into memory.
06479                     // We'll need to verify it so we can drop the receipt into its inbox. Also, set the cleanup object onto this pointer.
06480                     //
06481                     if (bHasRemitter && !bRemitterAcctAlreadyLoaded &&
06482                         (
06483                          (
06484                          NULL == (pRemitterAcct = OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount(REMITTER_ACCT_ID, SERVER_ID))
06485                          )
06486                         ||
06487                          (
06488                          theRemitterAcctGuardian.SetCleanupTargetPointer(pRemitterAcct), false // I want this to eval to false, but I want SetCleanup to call.
06489                          )                                                                     // Also, SetCleanup() is safe even if pointer is NULL.
06490                         )
06491                     )
06492                     {
06493                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Voucher deposit, failure "
06494                                        "trying to load remitter acct, ID: %s Recipient User ID: %s Remitter User ID: %s\n",
06495                                        __FUNCTION__, strRemitterAcctID.Get(), strRecipientUserID.Get(), strRemitterUserID.Get());
06496                     }
06497                     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06498                     // Does the remitter account verify?
06499                     // I call VerifySignature here since VerifyContractID was already called in LoadExistingAccount().
06500                     // (Otherwise I might normally call VerifyAccount(), which does both...)
06501                     //
06502                     else if (bHasRemitter && !pRemitterAcct->VerifySignature(m_nymServer))
06503                     {
06504                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR verifying signature on remitter account while depositing voucher. "
06505                                        "Remitter Acct ID: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, strRemitterAcctID.Get());
06506                     }
06507                     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06508                     // Need to make sure the remitter is the owner of the remitter account...
06509                     else if (bHasRemitter && !pRemitterAcct->VerifyOwner(*pRemitterNym))
06510                     {
06511                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: ERROR verifying remitter's ownership of remitter account while "
06512                                        "depositing voucher. Remitter Acct ID: %s\n", __FUNCTION__, strRemitterAcctID.Get());
06513                     }
06514                     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06515                     else if ( bHasRemitter                 && // If it's a voucher, and the source account isn't the remitter account...
06516                              !bSourceAcctIsRemitter        && // (if it was, there'd definitely be no remitter inbox, since it'd be a server acct.)
06517                              !bSuccessLoadRemitterInbox    && // ...and if we haven't successfully loaded the remitter's inbox yet...
06518                              (!pRemitterInbox->LoadInbox() || !pRemitterInbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer))) // Then load and verify it.
06519                     {
06520                         OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR loading or verifying inbox ledger for remitter acct ID: %s\n",
06521                                       __FUNCTION__, strRemitterAcctID.Get());
06522                     }
06523                     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06524                     // Are all of the accounts, AND the cheque, all of the same Asset Type?
06525                     else if (!( theCheque.GetAssetID() == pSourceAcct->GetAssetTypeID() ) ||
06526                              !( theCheque.GetAssetID() == theAccount.GetAssetTypeID()   ) ||
06527                               ( bHasRemitter &&
06528                              !( theCheque.GetAssetID() == pRemitterAcct->GetAssetTypeID() ))
06529                             )
06530                     {
06531                         OTString    strSourceAssetID(pSourceAcct->GetAssetTypeID()),
06532                                     strRecipientAssetID(theAccount.GetAssetTypeID());
06533                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: ERROR - user attempted to deposit cheque between accounts of different "
06534                                 "asset types. Source Acct: %s\nType: %s\nRecipient Acct: %s\nType: %s\n", __FUNCTION__,
06535                                 strSourceAcctID.Get(), strSourceAssetID.Get(),
06536                                 strAccountID.Get(), strRecipientAssetID.Get());
06537 
06538                         if (bHasRemitter)
06539                         {
06540                             OTString strRemitterAssetID(pRemitterAcct->GetAssetTypeID());
06541                             OTLog::vOutput(0, "Remitter Acct: %s\nType: %s\n", strRemitterAcctID.Get(),
06542                                            strRemitterAssetID.Get());
06543                         }
06544                     }
06545                     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06546 
06547                     // The BALANCE AGREEMENT includes a signed and dated:
06548                     /*
06549                      user ID, server ID, account ID, transaction ID.
06550 
06551                      BY THE TIME you are ever inside the procesing for ANY transaction. we know for
06552                      a fact that NotarizeTransaction has ALREADY checked all the items on the transaction
06553                      (the ones in its list) to make sure they ALL have the same owner, and signature,
06554                      and transaction number, and account ID, and server ID. This happens when the items
06555                      first load via VerifyContractID(), and then in NotarizeTransaction() with a call to
06556                      VerifyItems(). Therefore I can consider the above variables COVERED for pItem as
06557                      well as pBalanceItem.
06558 
06559                      Balance Agreement also includes:
06560                      -- A copy of all the transaction numbers that should still be issued to the Nym,
06561                         AFTER one is removed from depositing this cheque. (The same number on tranIn and pItem.)
06562                         NEED TO VERIFY BOTH LISTS ARE THE SAME AFTER REMOVING ONE ON MY SIDE.
06563                      -- Account balance.
06564                         (NEED TO VERIFY BALANCE WOULD BE THE SAME AFTER PROCESSING TRANSACTION.
06565                      -- Inbox and Outbox reports on a single list of sub-items.
06566                         (NEED TO VERIFY INBOX AND OUTBOX ITEMS MATCH BY RE-CREATING AND THEN COMPARING.)
06567 
06568                      All these are now done in VerifyBalanceStatement().
06569 
06570                      */
06571 
06572                     else if (!(pBalanceItem->VerifyBalanceStatement(theCheque.GetAmount(),
06573                                                                     theNym,
06574                                                                     *pInbox,
06575                                                                     *pOutbox,
06576                                                                     theAccount,
06577                                                                     tranIn)))
06578                     {
06579                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: ERROR verifying balance statement while depositing cheque. Acct ID:\n%s\n",
06580                                        __FUNCTION__, strAccountID.Get());
06581                     }
06582 
06583                     // Debit Source account, Credit Recipient Account, add to Sender's inbox.
06584                     //
06585                     // Also clear the transaction number so this cheque can't be deposited again.
06586                     //
06587                     else
06588                     {
06589                         pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the transaction agreement was successful.
06590 
06591                         // Deduct the amount from the source account, and add it to the recipient account...
06592                         if (false == pSourceAcct->Debit(theCheque.GetAmount()))
06593                         {
06594                             OTLog::vError("OTServer::%s: Failed debiting source account.\n", __FUNCTION__);
06595                         }
06596                         else if (false == theAccount.Credit(theCheque.GetAmount()))
06597                         {
06598                             OTLog::vError("OTServer::%s: Failed crediting destination account.\n", __FUNCTION__);
06599 
06600                             if (false == pSourceAcct->Credit(theCheque.GetAmount()))
06601                                 OTLog::vError("OTServer::%s: Failed crediting back source account.\n", __FUNCTION__);
06602                         }
06603                         else if (// Clear the transaction number. Sender Nym was responsible for it (and still is, until
06604                                  // he signs to accept the cheque reecipt). Alternately, remitter Nym is responsible for
06605                                  // it, until he signs to accept the voucher receipt. At this point, the cheque is USED,
06606                                  // so I'm removing his ability to use that number twice. It will remain on his issued
06607                                  // list until he signs for the receipt.
06608                                  //
06609                                  false == RemoveTransactionNumber(*(bHasRemitter ? pRemitterNym : pSenderNym),
06610                                                                   theCheque.GetTransactionNum(), true) //bSave=true
06611                                 )// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
06612                         {
06613                             OTLog::vError("%s: Strange: Failed removing transaction number from sender or remitter, even though "
06614                                           "it verified just earlier...\n", __FUNCTION__);
06615                             // -----------------------------------------------------------
06616                             if (false == pSourceAcct->Credit(theCheque.GetAmount()))
06617                                 OTLog::vError("OTServer::%s: Failed crediting-back source account.\n", __FUNCTION__);
06618 
06619                             if (false == theAccount.Debit(theCheque.GetAmount()))
06620                                 OTLog::vError("OTServer::%s: Failed debiting-back destination account.\n", __FUNCTION__);
06621                             // -----------------------------------------------------------
06622                         }
06623                         else
06624                         {   // need to be able to "roll back" if anything inside this block fails.
06625                             // update: actually does pretty good roll-back as it is. The debits and credits
06626                             // don't save unless everything is a success.
06627 
06628                             OTAccount * pAcctWhereReceiptGoes  = NULL;
06629                             OTLedger  * pInboxWhereReceiptGoes = NULL;
06630                             // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06631                             if (bHasRemitter) // voucher
06632                             {
06633                                 pAcctWhereReceiptGoes  = pRemitterAcct;
06634                                 pInboxWhereReceiptGoes = pRemitterInbox;
06635                             }
06636                             else // normal cheque
06637                             {
06638                                 pAcctWhereReceiptGoes  = pSourceAcct;
06639                                 pInboxWhereReceiptGoes = pSenderInbox;
06640                             }
06641                             // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06642                             // Add the chequeReceipt to the inbox of the signer on the cheque.
06643                             // (Or add the voucherReceipt to the inbox of the remitter of the voucher.)
06644                             //
06645                             // The original sender (or remitter, whichever is applicable) can close out the
06646                             // transaction number associated with the cheque by signing-off on that chequeReceipt or
06647                             // voucherReceipt.
06648                             //
06649                             if (pAcctWhereReceiptGoes->IsInternalServerAcct()) // Must be a voucher remitted by the server. (Unusual, but possible... Typically a voucher is remitted by a normal user, but this can happen in the case of dividends.)
06650                             {
06651                                 if (!bHasRemitter || !bRemitterIsServer)
06652                                     OTLog::vError("%s: Error: Apparently this is a voucher remitted directly by the server (such as a dividend payment) "
06653                                                   "but one of these values is false: bHasRemitter (), bRemitterIsServer()\n", __FUNCTION__,
06654                                                   bHasRemitter ? "true" : "false", bRemitterIsServer ? "true" : "false");
06655                                 // -----------------------------------------------
06656                                 else
06657                                 {
06658                                     // If bHasRemitter is true, which it is, then we KNOW the server is the sender, since
06659                                     // we explicitly verified that already above. But the receipt doesn't go to the sender's inbox,
06660                                     // but rather, to the remitter's inbox. However, in this block, clearly IsInternalServerAcct is true,
06661                                     // where the receipt is supposed to go, which means the server is also the remitter! And we verified
06662                                     // that also in the above 'if' statement, so we explicitly know that bRemitterIsServer. And in that
06663                                     // case, we can't just drop a receipt into his inbox, since the server has no inbox, and that means
06664                                     // he will never be able to close out the transaction number by accepting the receipt, like a normal
06665                                     // user would be able to do.
06666                                     //
06667                                     // Therefore, we explicitly remove the issued number here from the remitter (whom we know to actually
06668                                     // be the server.) He has no inbox, and he won't get any receipt -- but the number will be closed out
06669                                     // properly. Before this fix, the server was probably keeping every voucher number open for eternity.
06670                                     //
06671                                     if (!RemoveIssuedNumber(*pRemitterNym, theCheque.GetTransactionNum(), true)) //bSave=true
06672                                         OTLog::vError("%s: Strange: Failed removing issued number from remitter (the server nym, in this case), "
06673                                                       "even though the number verified just earlier...\n", __FUNCTION__);
06674                                 }
06675                             }
06676                             else // For normal cheques, and for normal vouchers (where the remitter is a normal user.)
06677                             {
06678                                 // Generate new transaction number (for putting the check receipt in the sender's inbox.)
06679                                 // todo check this generation for failure (can it fail?)
06680                                 int64_t lNewTransactionNumber = 0;
06681 
06682                                 IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lNewTransactionNumber, false); // bStoreTheNumber = false
06683 
06684                                 OTTransaction * pInboxTransaction = OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(*pInboxWhereReceiptGoes,
06685                                                                                                        theCheque.HasRemitter() ?
06686                                                                                                             OTTransaction::voucherReceipt :
06687                                                                                                             OTTransaction::chequeReceipt,
06688                                                                                                        lNewTransactionNumber);
06689 
06690                                 // The depositCheque request OTItem is saved as a "in reference to" field,
06691                                 // on the inbox chequeReceipt or voucherReceipt transaction.
06692                                 //todo put these two together in a method.
06693                                 pInboxTransaction->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo);
06694                                 pInboxTransaction->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum());
06695                                 pInboxTransaction->SetNumberOfOrigin(theCheque.GetTransactionNum());
06696 
06697                                 if (bRemitterCancelling)
06698                                     pInboxTransaction->SetAsCancelled();
06699 
06700                                 // Now we have created a new transaction from the server to the sender's inbox (or remitter's inbox.)
06701                                 // Let's sign and save it...
06702                                 pInboxTransaction->SignContract(m_nymServer);
06703                                 pInboxTransaction->SaveContract();
06704 
06705                                 // Here the transaction we just created is actually added to the source acct's or remitter's inbox.
06706                                 pInboxWhereReceiptGoes->AddTransaction(*pInboxTransaction);
06707 
06708                                 // Release any signatures that were there before (They won't
06709                                 // verify anymore anyway, since the content has changed.)
06710                                 //
06711                                 pInboxWhereReceiptGoes->ReleaseSignatures();
06712                                 pInboxWhereReceiptGoes->SignContract(m_nymServer);
06713                                 pInboxWhereReceiptGoes->SaveContract();
06714 
06715                                 pAcctWhereReceiptGoes->SaveInbox(*pInboxWhereReceiptGoes);
06716 
06717                                 // if there's NOT a remitter, then the source account is ALREADY saved below this block.
06718                                 // (Otherwise we need to save his acct here.)
06719                                 //
06720                                 if ( bHasRemitter &&
06721                                     !bRemitterIsServer) // If remitter is also server, then no need to save here, since source acct is ALREADY saved below.
06722                                 {
06723                                     // If there IS a remitter who is NOT the server, then we save his
06724                                     // account here, so it will contain the updated inbox hash (since
06725                                     // we just added a receipt to its inbox.)
06726                                     //
06727                                     pAcctWhereReceiptGoes->ReleaseSignatures();
06728                                     pAcctWhereReceiptGoes->SignContract(m_nymServer);
06729                                     pAcctWhereReceiptGoes->SaveContract();
06730                                     pAcctWhereReceiptGoes->SaveAccount();
06731                                 }
06732 
06733                                 // Any inbox/nymbox/outbox ledger will only itself contain
06734                                 // abbreviated versions of the receipts, including their hashes.
06735                                 //
06736                                 // The rest is stored separately, in the box receipt, which is created
06737                                 // whenever a receipt is added to a box, and deleted after a receipt
06738                                 // is removed from a box.
06739                                 //
06740                                 pInboxTransaction->SaveBoxReceipt(*pInboxWhereReceiptGoes);
06741                             }
06742                             // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06743                             // AT THIS POINT, the source account is debited, the recipient account is credited,
06744                             // and the sender's (or remitter's) inbox has had the chequeReceipt or voucherReceipt added to it.
06745                             // (He must perform a balance agreement in order to get it out of his inbox.)
06746                             //
06747                             // THERE IS NOTHING LEFT TO DO BUT SAVE THE FILES!!
06748 
06749                             pSourceAcct->   ReleaseSignatures();
06750                             theAccount.     ReleaseSignatures();
06751 
06752                             pSourceAcct->   SignContract(m_nymServer);
06753                             theAccount.     SignContract(m_nymServer);
06754 
06755                             pSourceAcct->   SaveContract();
06756                             theAccount.     SaveContract();
06757 
06758                             pSourceAcct->   SaveAccount();
06759                             theAccount.     SaveAccount();
06760 
06761                             // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
06762                             // otherwise, if we never entered this block, then it would still be set to rejection, and the
06763                             // new item would never have been added to the inbox, and the inbox file, along with the
06764                             // account files, would never have had their signatures released, or been re-signed or
06765                             // re-saved back to file.  The debit failed, so all of those other actions would fail also.
06766                             // BUT... if the message comes back with acknowledgement--then all of these actions must have
06767                             // happened, and here is the server's signature to prove it.
06768                             // Otherwise you get no items and no signature. Just a rejection item in the response transaction.
06769                             //
06770                             pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
06771 
06772                             bOutSuccess = true;  // The cheque deposit was successful.
06773 
06774                             if (bRemitterCancelling)
06775                             {
06776                                 tranOut.SetAsCancelled();
06777                                 OTLog::vOutput(1, "OTServer::%s: SUCCESS crediting remitter account from voucher cancellation.\n",
06778                                                __FUNCTION__);
06779                             }
06780                             else
06781                                 OTLog::vOutput(1, "OTServer::%s: SUCCESS crediting account from cheque deposit.\n", __FUNCTION__);
06782 
06783                             // TODO: Our code that actually saves the new balance statement receipt should go here
06784                             // (that is, only after ultimate success.) Otherwise we still want to store the old receipt.
06785                             // For now I'm verifying it, but not storing it.  This means the security for it works, but
06786                             // in a dispute, I can't prove it / cover my ass.  So very soon a receipt WILL be saved here
06787                             // that is, a copy of the user's signed BalanceAgreement.
06788                             // Note: if I'm saving the entire outgoing transaction reply, or message reply, (versus just
06789                             // the reply to a certain item) then I think I have the balance agreement already? Double check.
06790 
06791                         }
06792 
06793                         // Make sure we clean this up.
06794 //                      delete pSourceAcct; // No longer necessary -- handled by OTCleanup in this case.
06795 //                      pSourceAcct = NULL; // OTCleanup handles this now.
06796                     } // "else"
06797                 } // "else"
06798             } // successfully loaded cheque from string
06799         } // account ID DOES match item's account ID
06800 
06801 //      OTString strTestInRefTo;
06802 //      pResponseItem->GetReferenceString(strTestInRefTo);
06803 //      OTLog::vOutput(0, "DEBUG: Item in reference to: %s\n", strTestInRefTo.Get());
06804 
06805     } // deposit cheque
06806 
06807     // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06808 
06809     // BELOW -- DEPOSIT CASH
06810 
06811     // For now, there should only be one of these deposit items inside the transaction.
06812     // So we treat it that way... I either get it successfully or not.
06813     //
06814     // Deposit (the transaction) now supports deposit (the item) and depositCheque (the item)
06815     else if (pItem->GetType() == OTItem::deposit)
06816     {
06817         // The response item, as well as the inbox and outbox items, will contain a copy
06818         // of the request item. So I save it into a string here so they can all grab a copy of it
06819         // into their "in reference to" fields.
06820         pItem->SaveContractRaw(strInReferenceTo);
06821         pBalanceItem->SaveContractRaw(strBalanceItem);
06822 
06823         // Server response item being added to server response transaction (tranOut)
06824         // They're getting SOME sort of response item.
06825 
06826         pResponseItem->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
06827         pResponseItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
06828 
06829         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceString(strBalanceItem); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
06830         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
06831 
06832         // If the ID on the "from" account that was passed in,
06833         // does not match the "Acct From" ID on this transaction item
06834         if (ACCOUNT_ID != pItem->GetPurportedAccountID())
06835         {
06836             OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Error: 'From' account ID on the transaction does not match 'from' account ID on the deposit item.\n");
06837         }
06838         else
06839         {
06840             // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06841             OTLedger * pInbox   = theAccount.LoadInbox(m_nymServer);
06842             OTLedger * pOutbox  = theAccount.LoadOutbox(m_nymServer);
06843 
06844             OTCleanup<OTLedger> theInboxAngel(pInbox);
06845             OTCleanup<OTLedger> theOutboxAngel(pOutbox);
06846 
06847             if (NULL == pInbox) // || !pInbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) OTAccount::Load (above) already verifies.
06848             {
06849                 OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Error loading or verifying inbox.\n");
06850                 OT_FAIL; // pInbox may get dereferenced
06851             }
06852 
06853             else if (NULL == pOutbox) // || !pOutbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) OTAccount::Load (above) already verifies.
06854             {
06855                 OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Error loading or verifying outbox.\n");
06856                 OT_FAIL; // pOutbox may get dereferenced
06857             }
06858             // --------------------------------------------------------------------
06859             OTString strPurse;
06860             pItem->GetAttachment(strPurse);
06861 
06862             OTPurse thePurse(SERVER_ID, ASSET_TYPE_ID);
06863             OTToken * pToken = NULL;
06864 
06865             bool bLoadContractFromString = thePurse.LoadContractFromString(strPurse);
06866 
06867             if (!bLoadContractFromString)
06868             {
06869                 OTLog::vError("OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: ERROR loading purse from string:\n%s\n",
06870                         strPurse.Get());
06871             }
06872 
06873             else if (!(pBalanceItem->VerifyBalanceStatement(thePurse.GetTotalValue(),
06874                                                             theNym,
06875                                                             *pInbox,
06876                                                             *pOutbox,
06877                                                             theAccount,
06878                                                             tranIn)))
06879             {
06880                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: ERROR verifying balance statement while depositing cash. Acct ID:\n%s\n",
06881                                strAccountID.Get());
06882             }
06883 
06884             // TODO: double-check all verification stuff all around on the purse and token, transaction, mint, etc.
06885 
06886             else // the purse loaded successfully from the string
06887             {
06888                 pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the transaction agreement was successful.
06889 
06890                 bool bSuccess = false;
06891 
06892                 // Pull the token(s) out of the purse that was received from the client.
06893                 while ((pToken = thePurse.Pop(m_nymServer)) != NULL)
06894                 {
06895                     // This way I don't have to worry about cleaning up pToken or leaking memory.
06896                     OTCleanup<OTToken> theTokenGuardian(*pToken);
06897 
06898                     pMint = GetMint(ASSET_TYPE_ID, pToken->GetSeries());
06899 
06900                     if (NULL == pMint)
06901                     {
06902                         OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Unable to get or load Mint.\n");
06903                         break;
06904                     }
06905                     else if ((pMintCashReserveAcct = pMint->GetCashReserveAccount()) != NULL)
06906                     {
06907 //                      OTString DEBUG_STR(*pToken);
06908 //                      OTLog::vError("\n**************\nEXTRACTED TOKEN FROM PURSE:\n%s\n", DEBUG_STR.Get());
06909 
06910                         OTString    strSpendableToken;
06911                         bool bToken = pToken->GetSpendableString(m_nymServer, strSpendableToken);
06912 //                      OTLog::vError("\n**************\nSPENDABLE STRING:\n%s\n", strSpendableToken.Get());
06913 
06914                         if (!bToken)  // if failure getting the spendable token data from the token object
06915                         {
06916                             bSuccess = false;
06917                             OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: ERROR verifying token: Failure retrieving token data. \n");
06918                             break;
06919                         }
06920                         else if (!(pToken->GetAssetID() == ASSET_TYPE_ID)) // or if failure verifying asset type
06921                         {
06922                             bSuccess = false;
06923                             OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: ERROR verifying token: Wrong asset type. \n");
06924                             break;
06925                         }
06926                         else if (!(pToken->GetServerID() == SERVER_ID)) // or if failure verifying server ID
06927                         {
06928                             bSuccess = false;
06929                             OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: ERROR verifying token: Wrong server ID. \n");
06930                             break;
06931                         }
06932                         // This call to VerifyToken verifies the token's Series and From/To dates against the
06933                         // mint's, and also verifies that the CURRENT date is inside that valid date range.
06934                         //
06935                         // It also verifies the Lucre coin data itself against the key for that series and
06936                         // denomination. (The signed and unblinded Lucre coin is finally verified in Lucre
06937                         // using the appropriate Mint private key.)
06938                         //
06939                         else if (!(pMint->VerifyToken(m_nymServer, strSpendableToken, pToken->GetDenomination())))
06940                         {
06941                             bSuccess = false;
06942                             OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: ERROR verifying token: Token verification failed. \n");
06943                             break;
06944                         }
06945                         // Lookup the token in the SPENT TOKEN DATABASE, and make sure
06946                         // that it hasn't already been spent...
06947                         else if (pToken->IsTokenAlreadySpent(strSpendableToken))
06948                         {
06949                             // TODO!!!! Need to store the spent token database in multiple places, on multiple media!
06950                             //          Furthermore need to CHECK those multiple places inside IsTokenAlreadySpent.
06951                             //          In fact, that should all be configurable in the server config file!
06952                             //          Related: make sure IsTokenAlreadySpent differentiates between ACTUALLY not finding
06953                             //          a token as spent (successfully), versus some error state with the storage.
06954                             bSuccess = false;
06955                             OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: ERROR verifying token: Token was already spent. \n");
06956                             break;
06957                         }
06958                         else
06959                         {
06960                             OTLog::Output(3, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: SUCCESS verifying token...    \n");
06961 
06962                             // need to be able to "roll back" if anything inside this block fails.
06963                             // so unless bSuccess is true, I don't save the account below.
06964                             //
06965 
06966                             // two defense mechanisms here:  mint cash reserve acct, and spent token database
06967                             //
06968                             if (false == pMintCashReserveAcct->Debit(pToken->GetDenomination()))
06969                             {
06970                                 OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Error debiting the mint cash reserve account. "
06971                                              "SHOULD NEVER HAPPEN...\n");
06972                                 bSuccess = false;
06973                                 break;
06974                             }
06975                             // CREDIT the amount to the account...
06976                             else if (false == theAccount.Credit(pToken->GetDenomination()))
06977                             {
06978                                 OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Error crediting the user's asset account...\n");
06979 
06980                                 if (false == pMintCashReserveAcct->Credit(pToken->GetDenomination()))
06981                                     OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Failure crediting-back mint's cash reserve account "
06982                                                  "while depositing cash.\n");
06983                                 bSuccess = false;
06984                                 break;
06985                             }
06986                             // Spent token database. This is where the call is made to add
06987                             // the token to the spent token database.
06988                             else if (false == pToken->RecordTokenAsSpent(strSpendableToken))
06989                             {
06990                                 OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Failed recording token as spent...\n");
06991 
06992                                 if (false == pMintCashReserveAcct->Credit(pToken->GetDenomination()))
06993                                     OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Failure crediting-back mint's cash reserve account while depositing cash.\n");
06994 
06995                                 if (false == theAccount.Debit(pToken->GetDenomination()))
06996                                     OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Failure debiting-back user's asset account while depositing cash.\n");
06997 
06998                                 bSuccess = false;
06999                                 break;
07000                             }
07001                             else // SUCCESS!!! (this iteration)
07002                             {
07003                                 OTLog::vOutput(2, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: SUCCESS crediting account with cash token...\n");
07004                                 bSuccess = true;
07005 
07006                                 // No break here -- we allow the loop to carry on through.
07007                             }
07008                         }
07009                     }
07010                     else
07011                     {
07012                         OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: Unable to get cash reserve account for Mint.\n");
07013                         bSuccess = false;
07014                         break;
07015                     }
07016 
07017 //                  delete pToken; // Unnecessary now, handled by OTCleanup.
07018 //                  pToken = NULL;
07019 
07020                 } // while success popping token from purse ------------------------------------
07021 
07022                 if (bSuccess)
07023                 {
07024                     // Release any signatures that were there before (They won't
07025                     // verify anymore anyway, since the content has changed.)
07026                     theAccount. ReleaseSignatures();
07027 
07028                     // Sign
07029                     theAccount. SignContract(m_nymServer);
07030 
07031                     // Save
07032                     theAccount. SaveContract();
07033 
07034                     // Save to file
07035                     theAccount. SaveAccount();
07036 
07037                     // We also need to save the Mint's cash reserve.
07038                     // (Any cash issued by the Mint is automatically backed by this reserve
07039                     // account. If cash is deposited, it comes back out of this account. If the
07040                     // cash expires, then after the expiry period, if it remains in the account,
07041                     // it is now the property of the transaction server.)
07042                     pMintCashReserveAcct->ReleaseSignatures();
07043                     pMintCashReserveAcct->SignContract(m_nymServer);
07044                     pMintCashReserveAcct->SaveContract();
07045                     pMintCashReserveAcct->SaveAccount();
07046 
07047                     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
07048 
07049                     bOutSuccess = true;  // The cash deposit was successful.
07050 
07051                     OTLog::Output(1, "OTServer::NotarizeDeposit: .....SUCCESS -- crediting account from cash deposit.\n");
07052 
07053                     // TODO:  Right here, again, I need to save the receipt from the new balance agreement, since we have
07054                     // "ultimate success".  Also need to save the Nym, since he had a transaction number removed in
07055                     // the above call to VerifyBalanceAgreement. If we failed here, then we wouldn't WANT to save, since
07056                     // that number should stay on him! Same reason we don't save the accounts if anything goes wrong.
07057                 }
07058             } // the purse loaded successfully from the string
07059         } // the account ID matches correctly to the acct ID on the item.
07060 
07061 //      OTString strTestInRefTo;
07062 //      pResponseItem->GetReferenceString(strTestInRefTo);
07063 //      OTLog::vError("DEBUG: Item in reference to: %s\n", strTestInRefTo.Get());
07064 
07065     } // if pItem = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::deposit)
07066     else
07067     {
07068         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
07069         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Expected OTItem::deposit or OTItem::depositCheque on trans# %ld: \n\n%s\n\n",
07070                        __FUNCTION__, tranIn.GetTransactionNum(),
07071                        strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR CREATING STRING FROM TRANSACTION.) ");
07072     }
07073 
07074     // sign the response item before sending it back (it's already been added to the transaction above)
07075     // Now, whether it was rejection or acknowledgement, it is set properly and it is signed, and it
07076     // is owned by the transaction, who will take it from here.
07077     pResponseItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
07078     pResponseItem->SaveContract(); // the signing was of no effect because I forgot to save.
07079 
07080     pResponseBalanceItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
07081     pResponseBalanceItem->SaveContract();
07082 }
07083 
07084 
07085 
07086 // DONE:  Need to make sure both parties have included TWO!!! transaction numbers, so both
07087 // have the option to cancel later!  (And so the server can expire it later, and cover its own ass.)
07088 //
07089 // Note: still need to do something with those numbers upon closing. (cron expiration, and cancelCronItem.)
07090 //
07091 
07092 // DONE: The current version verifies that it's signed by both parties.
07093 //  Fix it so that it loads the merchant's copy to verify recipient signature.
07094 
07095 
07101 void OTServer::NotarizePaymentPlan(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTAccount & theDepositorAccount, OTTransaction & tranIn, OTTransaction & tranOut, bool & bOutSuccess)
07102 {
07103     // The outgoing transaction is an "atPaymentPlan", that is, "a reply to the paymentPlan request"
07104     tranOut.SetType(OTTransaction::atPaymentPlan);
07105 
07106     OTItem * pItem          = NULL;
07107     OTItem * pBalanceItem   = NULL;
07108     OTItem * pResponseItem  = NULL;
07109     OTItem * pResponseBalanceItem   = NULL;
07110 
07111     // The incoming transaction may be sent to inboxes and outboxes, and it
07112     // will definitely be bundled in our reply to the user as well. Therefore,
07113     // let's grab it as a string.
07114     OTString strInReferenceTo;
07115     OTString strBalanceItem;
07116 
07117     // Grab the actual server ID from this object, and use it as the server ID here.
07118     const OTIdentifier  SERVER_ID(m_strServerID),       DEPOSITOR_USER_ID(theNym),
