07119                         SERVER_USER_ID(m_nymServer),    DEPOSITOR_ACCT_ID(theDepositorAccount), USER_ID(theNym);
07120 
07121     const OTString strUserID(USER_ID);
07122     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
07123     pItem           = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::paymentPlan);
07124     pBalanceItem    = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::transactionStatement);
07125     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
07126     pResponseItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atPaymentPlan);
07127     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
07128     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
07129     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
07130     pResponseBalanceItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atTransactionStatement);
07131     pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
07132     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseBalanceItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
07133     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
07134     if ((NULL != pItem) &&
07135         (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_payment_plan)))
07136     {
07137         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: User %s cannot do this transaction (All payment plans are disallowed in server.cfg)\n",
07138                        __FUNCTION__, strUserID.Get());
07139     }
07140     // For now, there should only be one of these paymentPlan items inside the transaction.
07141     // So we treat it that way... I either get it successfully or not.
07142     else if ((NULL == pItem) || (NULL == pBalanceItem))
07143     {
07144         OTLog::vError("%s: Error, expected OTItem::paymentPlan and OTItem::transactionStatement.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07145     }
07146     else
07147     {
07148         if (DEPOSITOR_ACCT_ID != pItem->GetPurportedAccountID())
07149         {
07150             OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Error: Source account ID on the transaction does not match sender's account ID on the transaction item.\n",
07151                            __FUNCTION__);
07152         }
07153         // --------------------------------------------------------------------
07154         else if (false == pBalanceItem->VerifyTransactionStatement(theNym, tranIn)) // bIsRealTransaction=true
07155         {
07156             OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failed verifying transaction statement.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07157         }
07158         else
07159         {
07160             pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the transaction agreement was successful.
07161 
07162             // The response item will contain a copy of the request item. So I save it into a string
07163             // here so it can be saved into the "in reference to" field.
07164             pItem       ->SaveContractRaw(strInReferenceTo);
07165             pBalanceItem->SaveContractRaw(strBalanceItem);
07166 
07167             // Server response item being added to server response transaction (tranOut)
07168             // They're getting SOME sort of response item.
07169 
07170             pResponseItem->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
07171             pResponseItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
07172 
07173             pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceString(strBalanceItem); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
07174             pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
07175 
07176             // Also load up the Payment Plan from inside the transaction item.
07177             OTString    strPaymentPlan;
07178             pItem->GetAttachment(strPaymentPlan);
07179             OTPaymentPlan * pPlan = new OTPaymentPlan();
07180             OT_ASSERT(NULL != pPlan);
07181 
07182             // If we failed to load the plan...
07183             if ((false == pPlan->LoadContractFromString(strPaymentPlan)))
07184             {
07185                 OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR loading payment plan from string:\n%s\n", __FUNCTION__,
07186                               strPaymentPlan.Get());
07187             }
07188 //          else if (!pPlan->VerifySignature(theNym))  // This is now done below, in VerifyAgreement()!
07189 //          {
07190 //              OTLog::vOutput(0, "ERROR verifying sender signature on Payment Plan.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07191 //          }
07192             else if (pPlan->GetServerID() != SERVER_ID)
07193             {
07194                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR bad server ID on payment plan.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07195             }
07196             else if (pPlan->GetAssetID() != theDepositorAccount.GetAssetTypeID())
07197             {
07198                 const OTString strAssetID1(pPlan->GetAssetID()), strAssetID2(theDepositorAccount.GetAssetTypeID());
07199                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR wrong Asset Type ID (%s) on payment plan. Expected: %s\n", __FUNCTION__,
07200                                strAssetID1.Get(), strAssetID2.Get());
07201             }
07202             else
07203             {
07204                 // CANCELLING? OR ACTIVATING?
07205                 // If he is cancelling the payment plan (from his outpayments box, before it's even had a chance
07206                 // to be activated by the sender) then the recipient (merchant) will be the depositor. Otherwise,
07207                 // if he is activating the payment plan (from his payments inbox) then the sender (customer) will
07208                 // be the depositor.
07209 
07210                 OTIdentifier theCancelerNymID;
07211                 const bool bCancelling  = (pPlan->IsCanceled() && pPlan->GetCancelerID(theCancelerNymID));
07212                 // ----------------------------------------------------
07213                 const int64_t lExpectedNum = bCancelling ? 0 : pItem->GetTransactionNum();
07214                 const int64_t lFoundNum    = pPlan->GetTransactionNum();
07215                 // ----------------------------------------------------
07216                 const OTIdentifier & FOUND_USER_ID = bCancelling ? pPlan->GetRecipientUserID() : pPlan->GetSenderUserID();
07217                 const OTIdentifier & FOUND_ACCT_ID = bCancelling ? pPlan->GetRecipientAcctID() : pPlan->GetSenderAcctID();
07218                 // ----------------------------------------------------
07219                 const int64_t lFoundOpeningNum = pPlan->GetOpeningNumber(FOUND_USER_ID);
07220                 const int64_t lFoundClosingNum = pPlan->GetClosingNumber(FOUND_ACCT_ID);
07221                 // ----------------------------------------------------
07222                 if (lFoundNum != lExpectedNum)
07223                 {
07224                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR bad main transaction number while %s payment plan (%ld). Expected based on transaction: %ld\n",
07225                                    __FUNCTION__, bCancelling ? "cancelling" : "activating", lFoundNum, lExpectedNum);
07226                 }
07227                 if (lFoundOpeningNum != pItem->GetTransactionNum())
07228                 {
07229                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR bad transaction number while %s payment plan (%ld). Expected based on transaction: %ld\n",
07230                                    __FUNCTION__, bCancelling ? "cancelling" : "activating", lFoundOpeningNum, pItem->GetTransactionNum());
07231                 }
07232                 else if (FOUND_USER_ID != DEPOSITOR_USER_ID)
07233                 {
07234                     const OTString strIDExpected(FOUND_USER_ID), strIDDepositor(DEPOSITOR_USER_ID);
07235                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR wrong user ID while %s payment plan. Depositor: %s  Found on plan: %s\n",
07236                                    __FUNCTION__, bCancelling ? "cancelling" : "activating", strIDDepositor.Get(), strIDExpected.Get());
07237                 }
07238                 else if (bCancelling && (DEPOSITOR_USER_ID != theCancelerNymID))
07239                 {
07240                     const OTString strIDExpected(DEPOSITOR_USER_ID), strIDDepositor(theCancelerNymID);
07241                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR wrong canceler Nym ID while canceling payment plan. Depositor: %s  Canceler: %s\n",
07242                                    __FUNCTION__, strIDExpected.Get(), strIDDepositor.Get());
07243                 }
07244                 else if (FOUND_ACCT_ID != DEPOSITOR_ACCT_ID)
07245                 {
07246                     const OTString strAcctID1(FOUND_ACCT_ID), strAcctID2(DEPOSITOR_ACCT_ID);
07247                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR wrong Acct ID (%s) while %s payment plan. Expected: %s\n",
07248                                    __FUNCTION__, strAcctID1.Get(), bCancelling ? "cancelling" : "activating", strAcctID2.Get());
07249                 }
07250                 // If we're activating the plan (versus cancelling) then the transaction number opens
07251                 // the payment plan, but there must also be a closing number for closing it.
07252                 else if (!bCancelling && // If activating and:
07253                          ((pPlan->GetCountClosingNumbers() < 1) || // ...if there aren't enough closing numbers...
07254                           !VerifyTransactionNumber(theNym, lFoundClosingNum))) // ...or the official closing # isn't available for use on theNym.
07255                 { // We don't check opening number here, since NotarizeTransaction already did.
07256                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR: the Closing number %ld wasn't available for use while activating a payment plan.\n",
07257                                    __FUNCTION__, lFoundClosingNum);
07258                 }
07259                 else if ( bCancelling && // If cancelling and:
07260                           ( (pPlan->GetRecipientCountClosingNumbers() < 2) ||
07261                             !VerifyTransactionNumber(theNym, lFoundClosingNum)
07262                           )
07263                         )
07264                 {
07265                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR: the Closing number wasn't available for use while cancelling a payment plan.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07266                 }
07267                 else  // The plan is good (so far.)
07268                 {
07269                     // The RECIPIENT_ACCT_ID is the ID on the "To" Account. (When doing a transfer, normally 2nd acct is the Payee.)
07270                     const OTIdentifier  RECIPIENT_ACCT_ID(pPlan->GetRecipientAcctID()),
07271                                         RECIPIENT_USER_ID(pPlan->GetRecipientUserID());
07272 
07273                     bool bRecipientNymIsServerNym = ((RECIPIENT_USER_ID == SERVER_USER_ID)    ? true : false);
07274                     bool bUsersAreSameNym         = ((DEPOSITOR_USER_ID == RECIPIENT_USER_ID) ? true : false);
07275 
07276                     OTPseudonym     theRecipientNym;        // We'll probably use this, but maybe not. So I use a pointer that will maybe point here.
07277                     OTPseudonym *   pRecipientNym   = NULL; // Here's the pointer.  (Logic explained directly below.)
07278                     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
07279                     // Set pRecipientNym to point to the right one so we can use it below. (Do NOT use theRecipientNym,
07280                     // since it won't always point to that one.)
07281 
07282                     bool bFoundRecipientNym = false;
07283 
07284                     // Find out if Recipient Nym is also the Server Nym...
07285                     if (bRecipientNymIsServerNym)
07286                     {
07287                         // If the Recipient Nym is the server, then just point to that.
07288                         pRecipientNym       = &m_nymServer;
07289                         bFoundRecipientNym  = true;
07290 
07291                         // (No need to verify Nym here since already done in this case.)
07292                     }
07293                     else if (bUsersAreSameNym)  // Else if the participants are the same Nym, point to the one we already loaded.
07294                     {
07295                         pRecipientNym       = &theNym;
07296                         bFoundRecipientNym  = true;
07297 
07298                         // (No need to verify Nym here since already done in this case, before we even got here.)
07299                     }
07300                     else    // Otherwise load the Recipient Nym from Disk and point to that.
07301                     {
07302                         theRecipientNym.SetIdentifier(RECIPIENT_USER_ID);
07303 
07304                         bool bLoadedNym = theRecipientNym.LoadPublicKey();    // Old style (deprecated.) NOTE: LoadCredentials is already called inside LoadPublicKey, at the top, but eventually we'll be calling it here directly, once LoadPublicKey is removed.
07305 
07306                         if (false == bLoadedNym)
07307                         {
07308                             OTString strNymID(RECIPIENT_USER_ID);
07309                             OTLog::vError("%s: Failure loading Recipient Nym public key: %s\n", __FUNCTION__,
07310                                           strNymID.Get());
07311                             bFoundRecipientNym = false;
07312                         }
07313                         else if (!theRecipientNym.VerifyPseudonym() || !theRecipientNym.LoadSignedNymfile(m_nymServer))
07314                         {
07315                             OTString strNymID(RECIPIENT_USER_ID);
07316                             OTLog::vError("%s: Failure loading or verifying Recipient Nym public key: %s\n", __FUNCTION__,
07317                                           strNymID.Get());
07318                             bFoundRecipientNym = false;
07319                         }
07320                         else
07321                         {
07322                             pRecipientNym = &theRecipientNym; //  <=====
07323                             bFoundRecipientNym = true;
07324                         }
07325                     }
07326                     // Below this point, ALWAYS use pRecipientNym, NOT theRecipientNym.
07327                     // pRecipientNym is always guaranteed below here to point to the right one.
07328                     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
07329                     if (!bFoundRecipientNym || (NULL == pRecipientNym))
07330                     {
07331                         // (No need to log here; already logged right above.)
07332                         // OTLog::vOutput("Unable to load or verify Recipient Nym.()", __FUNCTION__);
07333                     }
07334 
07335                     // Below this point, we know for sure that the Recipient Nym is loaded and verified, and we know
07336                     // that if the Server or Sender is actually the Recipient, that the pRecipientNym pointer will
07337                     // always point to the right one, and no files can be overwritten. *phew*
07338 
07339 
07340                     // You CAN have both accounts owned by the same Nym, but you CANNOT have them both actually be the SAME ACCT.
07341                     else if (!bCancelling && (DEPOSITOR_ACCT_ID == RECIPIENT_ACCT_ID))  // ACTIVATING
07342                     {
07343                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Error: Source account ID matches Recipient account ID "
07344                                        "on attempted Payment Plan notarization.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07345                     }
07346                     // Unless you are cancelling...
07347                     else if (bCancelling && (DEPOSITOR_ACCT_ID != RECIPIENT_ACCT_ID))   // CANCELLING
07348                     {
07349                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Error: Source account ID doesn't match Recipient account ID "
07350                                        "on attempted Payment Plan cancellation.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07351                     }
07352                     else if (!bCancelling && !pPlan->VerifyAgreement(*pRecipientNym, theNym)) // ACTIVATING
07353                     {
07354                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR verifying Sender and Recipient on Payment Plan "
07355                                        "(against merchant and customer copies.)\n", __FUNCTION__);
07356                     }
07357                     // This is now done above, in VerifyAgreement().
07358                     // We only have it here now in cases of cancellation (where VerifyAgreement isn't called.)
07359                     //                                                                        // CANCELING
07360                     else if (bCancelling && !pPlan->VerifySignature(*pRecipientNym))
07361                     {
07362                         OTLog::Output(0, "ERROR verifying Recipient's signature on Payment Plan.\n");
07363                     }
07364                     else // -----------------------------------------------------------------
07365                     {
07366                         // Verify that BOTH of the Recipient's transaction numbers
07367                         // (opening and closing) are available for use.
07368                         //
07369                         // These three blocks are only checked if we are activating, not cancelling.
07370                         // Why? Because if we're canceling, then we ALREADY checked these things above.
07371                         // But if we're activating, that means we checked the sender above only, and
07372                         // thus we still need to check the recipient.
07373                         //
07374                         if (!bCancelling && pPlan->GetRecipientCountClosingNumbers() < 2)
07375                         {
07376                             OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR verifying Recipient's Opening and Closing number on a Payment Plan "
07377                                            "(he should have two numbers, but he doesn't.)\n", __FUNCTION__);
07378                         }
07379                         else if (!bCancelling && !VerifyTransactionNumber(*pRecipientNym, pPlan->GetRecipientOpeningNum()))
07380                         {
07381                             OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR verifying Recipient's opening transaction number on a payment plan.\n",
07382                                            __FUNCTION__);
07383                         }
07384                         else if (!bCancelling && !VerifyTransactionNumber(*pRecipientNym, pPlan->GetRecipientClosingNum()))
07385                         {
07386                             OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR verifying Recipient's Closing transaction number on a Payment Plan.\n",
07387                                            __FUNCTION__);
07388                         }
07389                         // -----------------------------------------------------------------
07390                         else
07391                         {
07392                             // Load up the recipient ACCOUNT and validate it.
07393                             //
07394                             OTAccount * pRecipientAcct = NULL;
07395                             OTCleanup<OTAccount> theRecipientAcctGuardian;
07396                             // -------------------------------------------
07397                             if (!bCancelling) // ACTIVATING
07398                             {
07399                                 pRecipientAcct = OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount(RECIPIENT_ACCT_ID, SERVER_ID);
07400                                 theRecipientAcctGuardian.SetCleanupTargetPointer(pRecipientAcct); // This will cleanup pRecipAcct, or do nothing if it's NULL.
07401                             }
07402                             else              // CANCELLING
07403                             {
07404                                 pRecipientAcct = &theDepositorAccount;
07405                             }
07406                             // --------------------------------------------------------
07407                             //
07408                             // --------------------------------------------------------
07409                             if (NULL == pRecipientAcct)
07410                             {
07411                                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR loading Recipient account.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07412                             }
07413                             else if (!pRecipientAcct->VerifyOwner(*pRecipientNym))
07414                             {
07415                                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR verifying ownership of the recipient account.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07416                             }
07417                             // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
07418                             else if (pRecipientAcct->IsInternalServerAcct())
07419                             {
07420                                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failed: recipient account is an internal "
07421                                                "server account (currently prohibited.)\n", __FUNCTION__);
07422                             }
07423                             // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
07424                             // Are both of the accounts of the same Asset Type? VERY IMPORTANT!!
07425                             else if (pRecipientAcct->GetAssetTypeID() != theDepositorAccount.GetAssetTypeID())
07426                             {
07427                                 OTString    strSourceAssetID(theDepositorAccount.GetAssetTypeID()),
07428                                             strRecipAssetID(pRecipientAcct->GetAssetTypeID());
07429                                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR - user attempted to %s a payment plan between dissimilar "
07430                                                "asset types:\n%s\n%s\n", __FUNCTION__, bCancelling ? "cancel" : "activate",
07431                                                strSourceAssetID.Get(),
07432                                                strRecipAssetID.Get());
07433                             }
07434                             // Does it verify?
07435                             // I call VerifySignature here since VerifyContractID was already called in LoadExistingAccount().
07436                             else if (!pRecipientAcct->VerifySignature(m_nymServer))
07437                             {
07438                                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR verifying signature on the Recipient account.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07439                             }
07440                             // This one is superfluous, but I'm leaving it. (pPlan and pRecip are both already
07441                             // matches to a 3rd value: source acct asset type ID.)
07442                             else if (pRecipientAcct->GetAssetTypeID() != pPlan->GetAssetID())
07443                             {
07444                                 const OTString strAssetID1(pPlan->GetAssetID()), strAssetID2(pRecipientAcct->GetAssetTypeID());
07445                                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR wrong Asset Type ID (%s) on Recipient Acct. Expected per Plan: %s\n",
07446                                                __FUNCTION__, strAssetID2.Get(), strAssetID1.Get());
07447                             }
07448                             // --------------------------------------------------------
07449                             // At this point I feel pretty confident that the Payment Plan is a valid request from both parties.
07450                             // I have both users AND both accounts and validated against the Payment Plan, signatures and all.
07451                             // The only other possibility is that the merchant is canceling the payment plan before the customer
07452                             // had a chance to confirm/activate it.
07453                             else
07454                             {
07455 //                                theInboxAngel.SetCleanupTarget(*pInbox);
07456                                 // -----------------------------------------------------
07457                                 // If activating, add it to Cron...
07458                                 //
07459                                 // We add the payment plan to the server's Cron object, which does regular processing.
07460                                 // That object will take care of processing the payment plan according to its terms.
07461                                 //
07462                                 // NOTE: FYI, inside AddCronItem, since this is a new CronItem, a Cron Receipt will
07463                                 // be saved with the User's signature on it, containing the Cron Item from the user's
07464                                 // original request. After that, the item is stored internally to Cron itself, and
07465                                 // signed by the server--and changes over time as cron processes. (The original receipt
07466                                 // can always be loaded when necessary.)
07467                                 //
07468                                 if (!bCancelling && m_Cron.AddCronItem(*pPlan, &theNym, true, OTTimeGetCurrentTime())) // bSaveReceipt=true
07469                                 {
07470                                     //todo need to be able to "roll back" if anything inside this block fails.
07471 
07472                                     // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
07473                                     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
07474 
07475                                     bOutSuccess = true;  // The payment plan activation was successful.
07476 
07477                                     OTLog::vOutput(2, "%s: Successfully added payment plan to Cron object.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07478 
07479                                     // ***************************************************************
07480 
07481                                     // Server side, the Nym stores a list of all open cron item numbers.
07482                                     // (So we know if there is still stuff open on Cron for that Nym, and we know what it is.)
07483                                     //
07484                                     std::set<int64_t> & theIDSet = theNym.GetSetOpenCronItems();
07485                                     theIDSet.insert(pPlan->GetTransactionNum());
07486                                     theIDSet.insert(pPlan->GetClosingNum());
07487 //                                  theNym.SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer); // saved below
07488 
07489                                     // This just marks the Closing number so I can't USE it again. (Since I'm using it as the closing
07490                                     // number for this cron item now.) I'm still RESPONSIBLE for the number until RemoveIssuedNumber()
07491                                     // is called. If we didn't call this here, then I could come back later and USE THE NUMBER AGAIN!
07492                                     // (Bad!)
07493                                     // -------------------------------------
07494                                     // RemoveTransactionNumber was already called for tranIn->GetTransactionNum()
07495                                     // (That's the opening number.)
07496                                     //
07497                                     // Here's the closing number:
07498                                     RemoveTransactionNumber(theNym, pPlan->GetClosingNum(), true); // bSave=true
07499                                     // -------------------------------------
07500                                     // RemoveIssuedNum will be called for that original transaction number when the finalReceipt is created.
07501                                     // RemoveIssuedNum will be called for the Closing number when the finalReceipt is accepted.
07502 
07503                                     // ***************************************************************
07504 
07505                                     std::set<int64_t> & theIDSet2 = pRecipientNym->GetSetOpenCronItems();
07506                                     theIDSet2.insert(pPlan->GetRecipientOpeningNum());
07507                                     theIDSet2.insert(pPlan->GetRecipientClosingNum());
07508 //                                  pRecipientNym->SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer); // saved below
07509 
07510                                     // For recipient, I also remove the opening and closing numbers as AVAILABLE FOR USE.
07511                                     // But they aren't removed as ISSUED until later...
07512                                     // RemoveIssuedNum is called for the Recipient's opening number onFinalReceipt,
07513                                     // and it's called for the Recipient's closing number when that final receipt is closed out.
07514                                     RemoveTransactionNumber(*pRecipientNym, pPlan->GetRecipientOpeningNum(), false); // bSave=true
07515                                     RemoveTransactionNumber(*pRecipientNym, pPlan->GetRecipientClosingNum(), true);  // bSave=true
07516 
07517                                     // ***************************************************************
07518                                     // Send success notice to other parties.
07519                                     // (So they can deal with their payments inbox and outpayments box,
07520                                     // where pending copies of the instrument may still be waiting.)
07521                                     //
07522                                     int64_t lOtherNewTransNumber = 0;
07523                                     IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lOtherNewTransNumber, false); // bStoreTheNumber = false
07524 
07525                                     if (false == pPlan->SendNoticeToAllParties(true, //bSuccessMsg=true
07526                                                                                m_nymServer, SERVER_ID,
07527                                                                                lOtherNewTransNumber,
07528     //                                                                         pPlan->GetTransactionNum(), // Each party has its own opening number. Handled internally.
07529                                                                                strPaymentPlan,
07530                                                                                NULL, NULL, &theNym))
07531                                     {
07532                                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failed notifying parties while trying to activate payment plan: %ld.\n",
07533                                                        __FUNCTION__, pPlan->GetOpeningNum());
07534                                     }
07535                                     // --------------------------------------
07536                                 } // if (m_Cron.AddCronItem(*pPlan, &theNym, true, OTTimeGetCurrentTime())) // bSaveReceipt=true
07537                                 else
07538                                 {
07539                                     if (bCancelling)
07540                                     {
07541                                         tranOut.SetAsCancelled();
07542 
07543                                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Canceling a payment plan before it was ever activated. (At user's request.)\n",
07544                                                        __FUNCTION__);
07545                                     }
07546                                     else
07547                                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Unable to add payment plan to Cron. (Failed activating payment plan.)\n", __FUNCTION__);
07548 
07549                                     // Send a failure notice to the other parties.
07550                                     //
07551                                     // DROP REJECTION NOTICE HERE TO ALL PARTIES....
07552                                     // SO THEY CAN CLAW BACK THEIR TRANSACTION #s....
07553                                     //
07554                                     int64_t lOtherNewTransNumber = 0;
07555                                     IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lOtherNewTransNumber, false); // bStoreTheNumber = false
07556 
07557                                     if (false == pPlan->SendNoticeToAllParties(false, //bSuccessMsg=false (OTItem::rejection)
07558                                                                                m_nymServer, SERVER_ID,
07559                                                                                lOtherNewTransNumber,
07560     //                                                                         pPlan->GetTransactionNum(), // Each party has its own opening number. Handled internally.
07561                                                                                strPaymentPlan,
07562                                                                                NULL, NULL, &theNym))
07563                                     {
07564                                         // NOTE: A party may deliberately try to activate a payment plan without signing it.
07565                                         // (As a way of rejecting it.) This will cause rejection notices to go to all the other
07566                                         // parties, allowing them to harvest back their closing numbers.
07567                                         // Since that is expected to happen, that means if you have 2 parties, and the 2nd one
07568                                         // "activates" it (without signing), then this piece of code here will DEFINITELY fail to
07569                                         // send the rejection notice to the first party (since the 2nd one hadn't even signed the
07570                                         // thing yet.)
07571                                         //
07572                                         // (Since we expect that to normally happen, we don't log an error here.)
07573 
07574     //                                  OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failed notifying all parties about failed activation of payment plan: %ld.\n",
07575     //                                                 __FUNCTION__, pPlan->GetTransactionNum());
07576                                     }
07577                                 } // Failure adding Cron Item.
07578                                 // --------------------------------------------------------
07579                             }
07580                         }
07581                     } // If recipient Nym successfully loaded from storage.
07582                 } // If Payment Plan successfully loaded from Transaction Item.
07583             } // else
07584 
07585             // If the payment plan WAS successfully added to Cron, then we don't need to
07586             // delete it here, since Cron owns it now, and will deal with cleaning
07587             // it up at the right time. (So I can't use OTCleanup on pPlan.)
07588             if ((NULL != pPlan) && (pResponseItem->GetStatus() != OTItem::acknowledgement))
07589             {
07590                 delete pPlan;
07591                 pPlan = NULL;
07592             }
07593         } // if pItem = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::paymentPlan)
07594     }
07595 
07596     // sign the response item before sending it back (it's already been added to the transaction above)
07597     // Now, whether it was rejection or acknowledgement, it is set properly and it is signed, and it
07598     // is owned by the transaction, who will take it from here.
07599     pResponseItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
07600     pResponseItem->SaveContract(); // the signing was of no effect because I forgot to save.
07601 
07602     pResponseBalanceItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
07603     pResponseBalanceItem->SaveContract();
07604 }
07605 
07606 
07607 
07608 
07609 
07610 // Done.
07611 //
07612 void OTServer::NotarizeSmartContract(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTAccount & theActivatingAccount, OTTransaction & tranIn, OTTransaction & tranOut, bool & bOutSuccess)
07613 {
07614     // The outgoing transaction is an "atSmartContract", that is, "a reply to the smartContract request"
07615     tranOut.SetType(OTTransaction::atSmartContract);
07616 
07617     OTItem * pItem                  = NULL;
07618     OTItem * pBalanceItem           = NULL;
07619     OTItem * pResponseItem          = NULL;
07620     OTItem * pResponseBalanceItem   = NULL;
07621 
07622     // The incoming transaction may be sent to inboxes and outboxes, and it
07623     // will definitely be bundled in our reply to the user as well. Therefore,
07624     // let's grab it as a string.
07625     OTString strInReferenceTo;
07626     OTString strBalanceItem;
07627 
07628     // Grab the actual server ID from this object, and use it as the server ID here.
07629     const OTIdentifier  SERVER_ID(m_strServerID),       ACTIVATOR_USER_ID(theNym),
07630                         SERVER_USER_ID(m_nymServer),    ACTIVATOR_ACCT_ID(theActivatingAccount),
07631                         USER_ID(theNym);
07632     const OTString      strUserID(USER_ID);
07633     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
07634     pItem           = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::smartContract);
07635     pBalanceItem    = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::transactionStatement);
07636     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
07637     pResponseItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atSmartContract);
07638     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
07639     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
07640     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
07641     pResponseBalanceItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atTransactionStatement);
07642     pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
07643     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseBalanceItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
07644     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
07645     if ((NULL != pItem) &&
07646         (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_smart_contract)))
07647     {
07648         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: User %s cannot do this transaction (All smart contracts are disallowed in server.cfg)\n",
07649                        __FUNCTION__, strUserID.Get());
07650     }
07651     // For now, there should only be one of these smartContract items inside the transaction.
07652     // So we treat it that way... I either get it successfully or not.
07653     else if ((NULL == pItem) || (NULL == pBalanceItem))
07654     {
07655         OTLog::vError("%s: Error, expected OTItem::smartContract and OTItem::transactionStatement.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07656     }
07657     else
07658     {
07659         if (ACTIVATOR_ACCT_ID != pItem->GetPurportedAccountID())
07660         {
07661             OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Error: Source account ID on the transaction does not match activator's account ID on the transaction item.\n",
07662                            __FUNCTION__);
07663         }
07664         else if (false == pBalanceItem->VerifyTransactionStatement(theNym, tranIn)) // bIsRealTransaction=true
07665         {
07666             OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failed verifying transaction statement.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07667         }
07668         else
07669         {
07670             pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the transaction agreement was successful.
07671 
07672             // The response item will contain a copy of the request item. So I save it into a string
07673             // here so it can be saved into the "in reference to" field.
07674             pItem->SaveContractRaw(strInReferenceTo);
07675             pBalanceItem->SaveContractRaw(strBalanceItem);
07676 
07677             // Server response item being added to server response transaction (tranOut)
07678             // They're getting SOME sort of response item.
07679 
07680             pResponseItem->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
07681             pResponseItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
07682 
07683             pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceString(strBalanceItem); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
07684             pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
07685 
07686             // Also load up the smart contract from inside the transaction item.
07687             OTString strContract;
07688             pItem->GetAttachment(strContract);
07689             OTSmartContract * pContract = new OTSmartContract(SERVER_ID);
07690             OT_ASSERT(NULL != pContract);
07691 
07692             // If we failed to load the smart contract...
07693             if ((false == pContract->LoadContractFromString(strContract)))
07694             {
07695                 OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR loading smart contract from string:\n\n%s\n\n",
07696                               __FUNCTION__, strContract.Get());
07697             }
07698             else if (pContract->GetServerID() != SERVER_ID)
07699             {
07700                 const OTString strWrongID(pContract->GetServerID());
07701                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR bad server ID (%s) on smart contract. Expected %s\n",
07702                                __FUNCTION__, strWrongID.Get(), m_strServerID.Get());
07703             }
07704             else
07705             {
07706                 // CANCELING, or ACTIVATING?
07707                 //
07708                 OTIdentifier theCancelerNymID;
07709                 const bool bCancelling  = (pContract->IsCanceled() && pContract->GetCancelerID(theCancelerNymID));
07710                 // ----------------------------------------------------
07711                 const int64_t lFoundNum    = pContract->GetTransactionNum();
07712                 const int64_t lExpectedNum = pItem->GetTransactionNum();
07713                 // ----------------------------------------------------
07714                 int64_t lFoundOpeningNum = 0;
07715                 int64_t lFoundClosingNum = 0;
07716 
07717                 OTIdentifier FOUND_USER_ID;
07718                 OTIdentifier FOUND_ACCT_ID;
07719 
07720                 if (!bCancelling) // ACTIVATING
07721                 {
07722                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "Attempting to activate smart contract...\n");
07723 
07724                     lFoundOpeningNum = pContract->GetOpeningNum();
07725                     lFoundClosingNum = pContract->GetClosingNum();
07726 
07727                     FOUND_USER_ID    = pContract->GetSenderUserID();
07728                     FOUND_ACCT_ID    = pContract->GetSenderAcctID();
07729                 }
07730                 else              // CANCELING
07731                 {
07732                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "Attempting to cancel smart contract...\n");
07733 
07734                     lFoundOpeningNum = pContract->GetOpeningNumber(theCancelerNymID);  // See if there's an opening number for the canceling Nym.
07735                     lFoundClosingNum = pContract->GetClosingNumber(ACTIVATOR_ACCT_ID); // See if there's a closing number for the current account.
07736 
07737                     if (lFoundOpeningNum > 0)
07738                         FOUND_USER_ID    = theCancelerNymID;
07739                     if (lFoundClosingNum > 0)
07740                         FOUND_ACCT_ID    = ACTIVATOR_ACCT_ID;
07741                 }
07742                 // ----------------------------------------------------
07743 
07744                 if (lFoundNum != lExpectedNum)
07745                 {
07746                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR bad main opening transaction number on smart contract. Found: %ld  Expected: %ld\n"
07747                                    "FYI, pItem->GetTransactionNum() is %ld.\n",
07748                                    __FUNCTION__, lFoundNum, lExpectedNum, pItem->GetTransactionNum());
07749                 }
07750                 else if (lFoundOpeningNum != lExpectedNum)
07751                 {
07752                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR bad opening transaction number on smart contract. Found: %ld  Expected: %ld\n",
07753                                    __FUNCTION__, lFoundOpeningNum, lExpectedNum);
07754                 }
07755                 else if (FOUND_USER_ID != ACTIVATOR_USER_ID)
07756                 {
07757                     const OTString strWrongID(ACTIVATOR_USER_ID);
07758                     const OTString strRightID(FOUND_USER_ID);
07759                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR wrong user ID (%s) used while %s smart contract. Expected from contract: %s\n",
07760                                    __FUNCTION__, strWrongID.Get(), bCancelling ? "canceling" : "activating", strRightID.Get());
07761                 }
07762                 else if (FOUND_ACCT_ID != ACTIVATOR_ACCT_ID)
07763                 {
07764                     const OTString strSenderAcctID(FOUND_ACCT_ID), strActivatorAcctID(ACTIVATOR_ACCT_ID);
07765                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR wrong asset Acct ID used (%s) to %s smart contract. Expected from contract: %s\n",
07766                                    __FUNCTION__, strActivatorAcctID.Get(), bCancelling ? "cancel" : "activate", strSenderAcctID.Get());
07767                 }
07768                 // The transaction number opens the smart contract, but there must also be a closing number for closing it.
07769                 else if ((pContract->GetCountClosingNumbers() < 1) ||  // the transaction number was verified before we entered this function, so only the closing # is left...
07770                          !VerifyTransactionNumber(theNym, lFoundClosingNum)) // Verify that it can still be USED (not closed... that's VerifyIssuedNum())
07771                 {
07772                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR: the Closing number %ld wasn't available for use while %s a smart contract.\n",
07773                                    __FUNCTION__, lFoundClosingNum, bCancelling ? "canceling" : "activating");
07774                 }
07775                 // NOTE: since theNym has ALREADY been substituted for the Server's Nym by this point, if indeed they are the same Nym,
07776                 // then I could probably just ALLOW the server to be a party to a smart contract. It will definitely be on the "list of
07777                 // nyms that are already loaded" due to the substitution. So really it's just a matter of security review, and the below
07778                 // block could be commented out (or not.)  ALSO: If I'm going to enforce this, then I need to do it for ALL parties, not just
07779                 // the activator!
07780                 else if ((pContract->GetSenderUserID() == SERVER_USER_ID) ||
07781                          (NULL != pContract->FindPartyBasedOnNymAsAgent(m_nymServer)))
07782                 {
07783                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ** SORRY ** but the server itself is NOT ALLOWED to be a party "
07784                                    "to any smart contracts. (Pending security review.)\n", __FUNCTION__);
07785                 }
07786                 // *********************************************************
07787                 //
07788                 // VERIFY SMART CONTRACT
07789                 /*
07790                  -- Loop through all parties and load up the authorizing agent's Nym, if not already loaded, for each.
07791                  -- Verify each party, that the authorizing agent is good, and verify his signature on the party's copy
07792                     of the contract.
07793                  -- Definitely during this, need to make sure that the contents of the signed version match the contents
07794                     of the main version, for each signer.
07795                  -- Verify that the authorizing agent actually has the opening transaction # for the party issued to him.
07796                  -- EVEN IF VERIFICATION FAILS HALFWAY THOUGH, REMOVE that opening transaction # for each-and-every agent.
07797                  (So he can't use it twice--leaving it as issued, but no longer as "available to be used on another
07798                  transaction".) Otherwise, if verification failed halfway through, with half of the parties having their
07799                  opening numbers already burned, and the other half not, then it would be impossible to tell, based on
07800                  the failed message itself, which group YOU are in, and therefore whether YOU need to harvest that number
07801                  back or not (in order to avoid going out-of-sync.) THEREFORE WE BURN ALL OPENING NUMBERS so the client API
07802                  can just assume the opening number is burned, if the transaction ran at all. (And, as normal, if the
07803                  transaction did NOT run at all, e.g. if the message failed before the transaction had a chance to run,
07804                  then all opening numbers are still good, for all parties--including the activator.)
07805 
07806                  -- NOTE: this means, if it succeeds, the opening numbers are marked as IN USE
07807                    (RemoveTransactionNum but NOT RemoveIssuedNum.) But if it FAILS, then we also need to RemoveIssuedNum...
07808                    So I'm adding that to VerifySmartContract.
07809 
07810                  -- Next, loop through all the asset accounts...
07811                  -- For each, get a pointer to the authorized agent and verify the CLOSING number for that asset acct.
07812                  (AND mark that number as "used but still issued.") Again, do this for ALL asset accounts on the smart
07813                  contract, even if some of them fail the verification process. (It's also okay to skip the accounts for
07814                  parties who failed verification.) If anything fails, then at the very end, add the closing numbers back
07815                  again as "available for use" on those nyms.
07816 
07817                  -- Since we're looping through all the agents, and looping through all the asset accounts, and
07818                  checking the agent for each asset account, then we might as well make sure that each agent is
07819                  a legit agent for the party, and that each account has a legit agent lording over it.
07820                  */
07821                 else if (bCancelling && !pContract->VerifySignature(theNym))
07822                 {
07823                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failed verifying canceler signature while canceling smart contract.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07824                 }
07825 
07826                 // We let it run through the verifier here, even if we are cancelling.
07827                 // The reason is because this is where the various opening/closing numbers
07828                 // are burned/reserved/etc. So even cancellation needs this part done.
07829                 //
07830                 else if (!pContract->VerifySmartContract(theNym, theActivatingAccount,
07831                                                          m_nymServer,
07832                                                          true)) // bBurnTransNo=false by default, but here we pass TRUE.
07833                 {
07834                     if (bCancelling)
07835                     {
07836                         tranOut.SetAsCancelled();
07837 
07838                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Canceling a smart contract before it was ever even activated (at user's request.)\n",
07839                                        __FUNCTION__);
07840                     }
07841                     else
07842                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: This smart contract has FAILED to verify.\n", __FUNCTION__);
07843 
07844                     /*
07845 
07846                      ------ TODO: Smart Contracts -----------
07847 
07848                      Done:  Whenever a party confirms a smart contract (sending it on to the next party) then a copy of
07849                      the smart contract should go into that party's paymentOutbox. Same thing if the party is the last
07850                      one in the chain, and has activated it on to the server. A copy sits in the paymentOutbox until
07851                      that smart contract is either successfully activated, or FAILS to activate.
07852 
07853                      If a smart contract activates, OTAgreement::DropServerNoticeToNymbox already sends an
07854                      'acknowledgment' notice to all parties.
07855 
07856                      Done: If a smart contract fails to activate, it should ALSO send a notice ('rejection') to
07857                      all parties.
07858 
07859                      TODO: When a party receives a rejection notice in his Nymbox for a certain smart contract,
07860                      he looks up that same smart contract in his paymentOutbox, HARVESTS THE CLOSING NUMBERS, and
07861                      then moves the notice from his outpayments box to his recordBox.
07862                      NOTE: the notice might be in his payments inbox (sometimes) instead of his outpayments box.
07863                      Possibly even both. How so? See below. Point being: Need to check both, at this point.
07864 
07865                      Until this is added, then clients will go out of sync on rejected smart contracts. (Not the kind
07866                      of out-of-sync where they can't do any transactions, but rather, the kind where they have certain
07867                      numbers signed out forever but then never use them on anything because their client thinks those
07868                      numbers were already used on a smart contract somewhere, and without the above code they would
07869                      never have clawed back those numbers.)
07870                      // ------------
07871 
07872                      MORE DETAILS:
07873 
07874                      *** When I send a smart contract on to the next party, remember it's sitting in my payments inbox
07875                      at first. When I confirm it, a copy goes into my outpayments box. Then when I actually SEND it, a
07876                      copy goes into my outpayments box AGAIN. (This is already smart enough to remove this first copy,
07877                      when this happens.) If I activate it (rather than sending it on, perhaps I'm the last one) then it's
07878                      already in my outpayments box from the confirmation.
07879 
07880                      BUT WHEN DO I REMOVE IT FROM THE payments *INBOX* ? Answer: when the successful server reply is
07881                      received from the sendUserInstrument. What if I don't send it to another user? Perhaps I activate it.
07882                      In that case, whether the activation succeeds or fails, I will get an acknowledgment (or rejection)
07883                      notice in my Nymbox. Therefore I can harvest the numbers back when that notice is received (or not.)
07884                      That will be from my outpayments box. But removing it from my INBOX should happen when I get the server
07885                      response to the activation (just as when I get the server response to sendUserInstrument.)
07886                      If I never tried to activate it, and never tried to send it to the next party, and never discarded it,
07887                      then it should remain in my inbox, until I choose to do one of those things.
07888 
07889 
07890                      *** The sent contract remains in the outPayments box until:
07891                         A. Activated. When: When the acknowledgment of activation is received through the Nymbox.
07892                         B. Failed activation. When: Rejection of activation received through the Nymbox.
07893                         C. Expiration. Expired notices may be harvested from the outpayments box. After all,
07894                            they were apparently never activated or even attempted, since either of those actions
07895                            would have resulted in a rejection notice which would have already removed the outpayments
07896                            box. So the transaction numbers can be harvested. BUT make sure you have latest version of
07897                            files first, so you know for sure that the contract never really was activated or attempted.
07898 
07899                      *** What if the incoming smart contract is discarded, instead of confirmed?
07900                      This means it never goes into my outbox in the first place. It's in my inbox, then I discard it.
07901                      Then what? In one scenario, the user simply throws it away. He removes it from the box and never
07902                      notifies anyone. This is physically possible so we must consider it. In that case, it's still sitting
07903                      in other people's outboxes, and will eventually expire, and then those people will just harvest back
07904                      their transaction numbers. It's kind of rude not to notify them, but everything will still be OKAY.
07905                      They also still have the power, since it hasn't been activated, to "false activate" it, which will fail
07906                      since it's not fully-confirmed yet, and then the rejection notice will come through and remove it from
07907                      their outboxes. All parties are notified in that case.
07908                      The polite thing to do, instead of just discarding it, would be for me to do the same (false-activate it)
07909                      meaning I activate it, but without signing it. And possibly putting some other "This must fail" indicator
07910                      on the message, so the server doesn't waste a lot of time figuring that out. Then the failure causes all
07911                      the parties who DID sign it, to get a rejection notification, and I can remove it from my payments inbox at
07912                      that time, when they are all removing it from their outboxes.
07913 
07914                      *** What if the incoming contract is discarded AFTER it was confirmed? From the outbox, meaning it hasn't
07915                      been activated yet. Perhaps I sent someone a cheque that hasn't been cashed yet. Perhaps I sent someone
07916                      a signed smart contract but they haven't activated it yet. Therefore I still have a chance to cancel it.
07917                      I can't just discard it, since they can still deposit their copy whenever they want. But if I RUN IT THROUGH,
07918                      then it will be INVALIDATED thereafter -- and if I beat them to the punch, then it will work. Of course, if
07919                      they activate it, then I will get an activation notice, which will automatically remove it from my outbox.
07920                      So I beat them to the punch, by activating / depositing it myself, which fails, and then we both get rejection
07921                      notices. That removes it from my outbox, as well as the inbox of the guy who I had been stuck waiting on in
07922                      the first place.
07923 
07924 
07925                      WHY WAS IT in whichever box it was in? (Just curious.) Well...
07926                      If inbox, because I discarded it without confirming, yet wanted to be nice and let people who
07927                      had, harvest their numbers back. (Otherwise they'd still eventually expire.) If outpayments box,
07928                      because I activated it (so it's in that box) and it's just legitimately a failed attempt on my
07929                      part, or because I confirmed it and sent to the next guy, and he hasn't activated it yet, and
07930                      I've changed my mind and wish to cancel it. Either way, once I do, I will get the notice (as will
07931                      any other parties) and then it will be removed from that box (and placed in the records box.)
07932                      Another scenario: It's removed from my inbox when some other confirming party "false activates" it
07933                      in order to cancel it and remove it from his outbox. He HAD been sitting there waiting on me, while
07934                      the notice sat in my inbox. But now that it's been invalidated at the server, I will get a rejection
07935                      notice from the server which should remove the one that was sitting in my inbox, to the record box.
07936 
07937                      // ---------------
07938 
07939                      ACTIONS:
07940 
07941                      -- When successful "sendUserInstrument" server reply is received,
07942                         remove that instrument from payments inbox. (If it's there -- it can be.)
07943 
07944                      -- When party receives notice that smart contract has been activated,
07945                         remove the instrument from outpayments box. (If it's there -- it can be.)
07946 
07947                      -- When party receives notice that smart contract has failed activation attempt, then remove
07948                         the instrument from payments inbox AND outpayments box. (If there -- could be for either.)
07949 
07950                      Does this cover all cases?
07951 
07952                      -- Any _sent_ instrument will properly be removed from the payments inbox.
07953                      -- It will go into the outpayments box. Once it activates, it will be removed again from that box. (For all parties.)
07954                      -- If it fails to activate, or if a party discards it from inbox (through a deliberate failed activation) or if a party
07955                         discards it from the outbox (through a deliberate failed activation) either way, it will be removed from both boxes.
07956                      -- If it expires while sitting in my inbox, my high-level API is responsible to remove it and harvest the numbers.
07957                      -- It if expires while sitting in my outbox, my high-level API is responsible to remove it and harvest the numbers.
07958 
07959                      It can be sent, discarded (from outbox, as a scramble-to-discard-it-before-next-guy-deposits it), discarded (from inbox,
07960                      when I decide I won't sign it), it can be ignored until expiration (either box), and it can legitimately activate or fail
07961                      to activate, and either way, all the parties who confirmed it will get a notice and harvest (if necessary.)
07962 
07963                      THIS SEEMS TO COVER ALL CASES!
07964 
07965                      One more thing, just noticed: Whether success or fail, the opening AND closing numbers are marked as "used but not closed"
07966                      on the Nym's record. We do this above for all Nyms just doing verification, since we can't fail halfway through and have
07967                      inconsistent results between them. (All or nothing.)
07968 
07969                      THERFORE: 1. When the Nyms receive "SUCCESS" activating the smart contract, they ALL know that the opening AND closing
07970                      numbers are marked off as used, and can only be closed thereafter through the final receipt. 2. When the Nyms receive
07971                      FAILED activating the smart contract... Do they harvest the numbers back? NOT if they were all marked off already! So
07972                      next, if failure here I need to mark them all as closed, right? Since we failed? And then the client side, when he gets
07973                      the notice, he needs to mark them as closed as well. (NOT harvest them.) We could alternately mark them all as "still
07974                      available" on the server side (or all closing numbers anyway) and mark all the opening numbers as closed. But whatever we
07975                      do, the client side needs to do the same thing.
07976                      The only time we harvest ALL the numbers is then when we haven't even sent it to the server yet? Otherwise we mark them
07977                      as "used and not closed" (if success) or if failure, we mark them as:  ????? Perhaps all still open except the main opening
07978                      one? Or perhaps all the closing numbers are still available and the opening numbers are burned? Or just ALL numbers are
07979                      burned? Which? Why?
07980 
07981                      NOTE: I found the answer in the comments in OTSmartContract::VerifySmartContract. (And there are very good reasons
07982                      involved for why I went the way that I did. Read it for those reasons.) Conclusion:
07983 
07984                      If there is a failed activation attempt, then all parties get a notice, and all parties can CLOSE the opening number,
07985                      which was burned, and they can HARVEST the closing numbers, which were made new again.
07986 
07987                      But if the activation attempt succeeded, then all parties get a notice, and all parties will continue as they were:
07988                      with the opening AND closing numbers marked as "Still issued but in use." Their opening numbers will not close until
07989                      the smart contract is deactivated, and their closing numbers will not close until their final receipts have been closed.
07990                      You might ask, "Then why send the notice, if the transaction numbers are already set up correctly on the client side?"
07991                      The answer is, because the client still does things based on that notice. Like for example, it removes the confirmed
07992                      copy of that smart contract from its outpayments box.
07993 
07994                     */
07995 
07996                     // DROP REJECTION NOTICE HERE TO ALL PARTIES....
07997                     // SO THEY CAN CLAW BACK THEIR TRANSACTION #s....
07998                     //
07999                     int64_t lNewTransactionNumber = 0;
08000                     IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lNewTransactionNumber, false); // bStoreTheNumber = false
08001 
08002                     if (false == pContract->SendNoticeToAllParties(false, //bSuccessMsg=false (OTItem::rejection)
08003                                                                    m_nymServer, SERVER_ID,
08004                                                                    lNewTransactionNumber,
08005     //                                                             pContract->GetTransactionNum(), // Each party has its own opening number. Handled internally.
08006                                                                    strContract,
08007                                                                    NULL, NULL, &theNym))
08008                     {
08009                         // NOTE: A party may deliberately try to activate a smart contract without signing it.
08010                         // (As a way of rejecting it.) This will cause rejection notices to go to all the other
08011                         // parties, allowing them to harvest back their closing numbers.
08012                         // Since that is expected to happen, that means if you have 5 parties, and the 3rd one
08013                         // "activates" the contract, then this piece of code here will DEFINITELY fail to send
08014                         // the rejection notice to the last 2 parties (since they hadn't even signed the contract
08015                         // yet.)
08016                         //
08017                         // (Since we expect that to normally happen, we don't log an error here.)
08018 
08019     //                  OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failed notifying all parties about failed activation of smart contract: %ld.\n",
08020     //                                 __FUNCTION__, pContract->GetTransactionNum());
08021                     }
08022                 } // smart contract is no good.
08023                 // *********************************************************
08024                 // The smart contract is good...
08025                 //
08026                 // NOTIFY ALL PARTIES and ACTIVATE.
08027                 //
08028                 // This is important to notify first, because the hooks in OTSmartContract::onActivate() could very
08029                 // potentially trigger MORE receipts, and we want to make sure the activation receipt comes first.
08030                 //
08031                 else
08032                 {
08033                     int64_t lNewTransactionNumber = 0;
08034                     IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lNewTransactionNumber, false); // bStoreTheNumber = false
08035 
08036                     if (false == pContract->SendNoticeToAllParties(true, //bSuccessMsg=true
08037                                                                    m_nymServer, SERVER_ID,
08038                                                                    lNewTransactionNumber,
08039 //                                                                 pContract->GetTransactionNum(), // Each party has its own opening number. Handled internally.
08040                                                                    strContract,
08041                                                                    NULL, NULL, &theNym))
08042                     {
08043                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Failed notifying parties while trying to activate smart contract: %ld.\n",
08044                                        __FUNCTION__, pContract->GetTransactionNum());
08045                     }
08046                     // -----------------------------------------------------
08047                     // Add it to Cron...
08048                     else if (m_Cron.AddCronItem(*pContract, &theNym, true, OTTimeGetCurrentTime())) // bSaveReceipt=true
08049                     {
08050                         // We add the smart contract to the server's Cron object, which does regular processing.
08051                         // That object will take care of processing the smart contract according to its terms.
08052                         //
08053                         // NOTE: FYI, inside AddCronItem, since this is a new CronItem, a Cron Receipt will
08054                         // be saved with the User's signature on it, containing the Cron Item from the user's
08055                         // original request. After that, the item is stored internally to Cron itself, and
08056                         // signed by the server--and changes over time as cron processes. (The original receipt
08057                         // can always be loaded when necessary.)
08058                         //
08059 
08060                         // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of rejection (the default)
08061                         pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
08062                         bOutSuccess = true;  // The smart contract activation was successful.
08063                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Successfully added smart contract to Cron object.\n",
08064                                        __FUNCTION__);
08065                     } // If smart contract verified.
08066                     else
08067                     {
08068                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Unable to add smart contract to Cron object.\n",
08069                                        __FUNCTION__);
08070                     }
08071                 } // contract verifies, activate it.
08072             } // else
08073             // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
08074             // If the smart contract WAS successfully added to Cron, then we don't need to
08075             // delete it here, since Cron owns it now, and will deal with cleaning
08076             // it up at the right time. (So I can't use OTCleanup on pContract.)
08077             //
08078             if ((NULL != pContract) && (pResponseItem->GetStatus() != OTItem::acknowledgement))
08079             {
08080                 delete pContract;
08081                 pContract = NULL;
08082             }
08083         } // if pItem = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::smartContract)
08084     }
08085 
08086     // sign the response item before sending it back (it's already been added to the transaction above)
08087     // Now, whether it was rejection or acknowledgement, it is set properly and it is signed, and it
08088     // is owned by the transaction, who will take it from here.
08089     pResponseItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08090     pResponseItem->SaveContract(); // the signing was of no effect because I forgot to save.
08091 
08092     pResponseBalanceItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08093     pResponseBalanceItem->SaveContract();
08094 }
08095 
08096 
08097 
08098 
08099 
08100 
08101 
08102 // DONE: The code inside here is just a copy of payment plan.
08103 // Make it into a REAL notarizeCancelCronItem so it actually works.
08104 //
08105 // Cancel a market offer.
08106 // (DONE:  NEED TO CHANGE THIS INTO A TRANSACTION, INSTEAD OF A MESSAGE...)
08107 // Will become "Cancel Cron Item"
08108 //
08109 // DONE: This needs to be "CANCEL CRON ITEM" and it should make use of CLOSING NUMBERS that should
08110 // SHOULD ALREADY be available in the CRON ITEMS!
08111 //
08112 // Basically it allows you to cancel payment plans OR market offers, and places the appropriate
08113 // cancellation receipts (preferably through polymorphism, versus some huge 'if' block here...
08114 //
08115 // When cancelling it uses the closing numbers provided in the cron items.
08116 // Then code the expiration part in OTCron Item or wherever, which should use the SAME closing numbers.
08117 //
08118 void OTServer::NotarizeCancelCronItem(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTAccount & theAssetAccount, OTTransaction & tranIn, OTTransaction & tranOut, bool & bOutSuccess)
08119 {
08120     // The outgoing transaction is an "atCancelCronItem", that is, "a reply to the cancelCronItem request"
08121     tranOut.SetType(OTTransaction::atCancelCronItem);
08122 
08123     OTItem * pItem          = NULL;
08124     OTItem * pBalanceItem   = NULL;
08125     OTItem * pResponseItem  = NULL;
08126     OTItem * pResponseBalanceItem   = NULL;
08127 
08128     // The incoming transaction may be sent to inboxes and outboxes, and it
08129     // will definitely be bundled in our reply to the user as well. Therefore,
08130     // let's grab it as a string.
08131     OTString strInReferenceTo;
08132     OTString strBalanceItem;
08133 
08134     // Grab the actual server ID from this object, and use it as the server ID here.
08135     const OTIdentifier SERVER_ID(m_strServerID), USER_ID(theNym);
08136 
08137     const OTString strUserID(USER_ID);
08138 
08139     pBalanceItem = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::transactionStatement);
08140     // -----------------------------------------------------------
08141     pResponseItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atCancelCronItem);
08142     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
08143     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
08144 
08145     pResponseBalanceItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atTransactionStatement);
08146     pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
08147     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseBalanceItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
08148     // -----------------------------------------------------------
08149     if (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_cancel_cron_item))
08150     {
08151         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: User %s cannot do this transaction "
08152                        "(CancelCronItem messages are disallowed in server.cfg)\n",
08153                        __FUNCTION__, strUserID.Get());
08154     }
08155     else if (NULL == pBalanceItem)
08156     {
08157         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
08158         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: Expected transaction statement in trans# %ld: \n\n%s\n\n", __FUNCTION__,
08159                        tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR LOADING TRANSACTION INTO STRING) ");
08160     }
08161     // For now, there should only be one of these cancelCronItem items inside the transaction.
08162     // So we treat it that way... I either get it successfully or not.
08163     else if (NULL != (pItem = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::cancelCronItem)))
08164     {
08165         // The response item will contain a copy of the request item. So I save it into a string
08166         // here so it can be saved into the "in reference to" field.
08167         pItem->SaveContractRaw(strInReferenceTo);
08168         pBalanceItem->SaveContractRaw(strBalanceItem);
08169 
08170         // ASSET_ACCT_ID is the ID on the "from" Account that was passed in.
08171         //
08172         const OTIdentifier ASSET_ACCT_ID(theAssetAccount);
08173 
08174         // Server response item being added to server response transaction (tranOut)
08175         // They're getting SOME sort of response item.
08176 
08177         pResponseItem->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
08178         pResponseItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
08179 
08180         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceString(strBalanceItem); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
08181         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
08182 
08183         // **********************************************************************
