08184         if (false == (pBalanceItem->VerifyTransactionStatement(theNym, tranIn))) // isRealTransaction=true
08185         {
08186             OTLog::vOutput(0, "ERROR verifying transaction statement in NotarizeCancelCronItem.\n");
08187         }
08188         // **********************************************************************
08189         else
08190         {
08191             pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the transaction agreement was successful.
08192 
08193             const int64_t lReferenceToNum = pItem->GetReferenceToNum();
08194 
08195             // I'm using the operator== because it exists. (Although now I believe != exists also)
08196             // If the ID on the "from" account that was passed in,
08197             // does not match the "Acct From" ID on this transaction item
08198             if (!(ASSET_ACCT_ID == pItem->GetPurportedAccountID()))
08199             {
08200                 OTLog::Output(0, "Error: Asset account ID on the transaction does not match asset account "
08201                               "ID on the transaction item.\n");
08202             }
08203             else // LET'S SEE IF WE CAN REMOVE IT THEN...
08204             {
08205                 OTCronItem * pCronItem = m_Cron.GetItemByValidOpeningNum(lReferenceToNum);
08206 
08207                 // Check for the closing number here (that happens in OTCronItem, since it's polymorphic.)
08208 
08209                 bool bSuccess = false;
08210 
08211                 if ((NULL != pCronItem) && (pCronItem->CanRemoveItemFromCron(theNym))) // see if theNym has right to remove the cronItem from processing.
08212                 {
08213                     bSuccess = m_Cron.RemoveCronItem(pCronItem->GetTransactionNum(), theNym); // <=====
08214                 }
08215 
08216                 // If we were just successful in removing the offer from the market, that means a finalReceipt was
08217                 // just dropped into the inboxes for the relevant asset accounts. Once I process that receipt out of my
08218                 // inbox, (which will require my processing out all related marketReceipts) then the closing number
08219                 // will be removed from my list of responsibility.
08220 
08221                 if (bSuccess)
08222                 {
08223                     // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
08224                     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
08225 
08226                     bOutSuccess = true;  // The "cancel cron item" was successful.
08227 
08228                     OTLog::vOutput(2, "Successfully removed Cron Item from Cron object, based on ID: %ld\n",
08229                                    (NULL != pCronItem) ? pCronItem->GetTransactionNum() : lReferenceToNum);
08230 
08231                     // Any transaction numbers that need to be cleared, happens inside RemoveCronItem().
08232                 }
08233                 else
08234                 {
08235                     OTLog::Output(0, "Unable to remove Cron Item from Cron object OTServer::NotarizeCancelCronItem\n");
08236                 }
08237             }
08238         } // transaction statement verified.
08239     } // if pItem = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::cancelCronItem)
08240     else
08241     {
08242         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
08243         OTLog::vOutput(0, "Error, expected OTItem::cancelCronItem "
08244                      "in OTServer::NotarizeCancelCronItem for trans# %ld:\n\n%s\n\n",
08245                      tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR LOADING TRANSACTION FROM STRING) ");
08246     }
08247     // sign the response item before sending it back (it's already been added to the transaction above)
08248     // Now, whether it was rejection or acknowledgement, it is set properly and it is signed, and it
08249     // is owned by the transaction, who will take it from here.
08250     pResponseItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08251     pResponseItem->SaveContract(); // the signing was of no effect because I forgot to save.
08252 
08253     pResponseBalanceItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08254     pResponseBalanceItem->SaveContract();
08255 }
08256 
08257 
08258 
08259 
08260 
08265 void OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTAccount & theAccount, OTTransaction & tranIn, OTTransaction & tranOut, bool & bOutSuccess)
08266 {
08267     // The outgoing transaction is an "atExchangeBasket", that is, "a reply to the exchange basket request"
08268     tranOut.SetType(OTTransaction::atExchangeBasket);
08269 
08270     OTItem * pItem          = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::exchangeBasket);
08271     OTItem * pBalanceItem   = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::balanceStatement);
08272     OTItem * pResponseItem  = NULL;
08273     OTItem * pResponseBalanceItem   = NULL;
08274 
08275     // The incoming transaction may be sent to inboxes and outboxes, and it
08276     // will probably be bundled in our reply to the user as well. Therefore,
08277     // let's grab it as a string.
08278     OTString strInReferenceTo;
08279     OTString strBalanceItem;
08280 
08281     const OTIdentifier  USER_ID(theNym),
08282                         SERVER_ID(m_strServerID),
08283                         BASKET_CONTRACT_ID(theAccount.GetAssetTypeID()),
08284                         ACCOUNT_ID(theAccount);
08285 
08286     const OTString strUserID(USER_ID);
08287     // -------------------------------------------------------------
08288 
08289     OTLedger * pInbox   = theAccount.LoadInbox(m_nymServer);
08290     OTLedger * pOutbox  = theAccount.LoadOutbox(m_nymServer);
08291 
08292     OTCleanup<OTLedger> theInboxAngel(pInbox);
08293     OTCleanup<OTLedger> theOutboxAngel(pOutbox);
08294     // ----------------------------------------------
08295     pResponseItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atExchangeBasket);
08296     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
08297     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
08298 
08299     pResponseBalanceItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atBalanceStatement);
08300     pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
08301     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseBalanceItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
08302     // --------------------------------------------------------------
08303     bool bSuccess = false;
08304 
08305     if (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_exchange_basket))
08306     {
08307         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: User %s cannot do this transaction (All basket exchanges are disallowed in server.cfg)\n",
08308                        strUserID.Get());
08309     }
08310     else if (NULL == pItem)
08311     {
08312         OTLog::Output(0, "OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: No exchangeBasket item found on this transaction.\n");
08313     }
08314     else if (NULL == pBalanceItem)
08315     {
08316         OTLog::Output(0, "OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: No Balance Agreement item found on this transaction.\n");
08317     }
08318     else if ((NULL == pInbox)) // || !pInbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) OTAccount::Load (above) already verifies.
08319     {
08320         OTLog::Error("Error loading or verifying inbox.\n");
08321     }
08322     else if ((NULL == pOutbox)) // || !pOutbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) OTAccount::Load (above) already verifies.
08323     {
08324         OTLog::Error("Error loading or verifying outbox.\n");
08325     }
08326     else
08327     {
08328 //      theInboxAngel.SetCleanupTarget(*pInbox);
08329 //      theOutboxAngel.SetCleanupTarget(*pOutbox);
08330         // ------------------------------------------
08331 
08332         pItem->SaveContractRaw(strInReferenceTo);
08333         pBalanceItem->SaveContractRaw(strBalanceItem);
08334 
08335         // ----------------------------------------------
08336         pResponseItem->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
08337         pResponseItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
08338 
08339         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceString(strBalanceItem); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
08340         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceToNum(pBalanceItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to tranIn's balance agreement
08341 
08342         // ***************************************************************************
08343 //      OTLog::Error("BELOW THE LOOP===> ABout to call VERIFY BALANCE STATEMENT \n");
08344 
08345         // Now after all that setup, we do the balance agreement!
08346         if (false == pBalanceItem->VerifyBalanceStatement(0,// the one balance agreement that doesn't change any balances.
08347                                                                theNym,  // Could have been a transaction agreement.
08348                                                                *pInbox, // Still could be, in fact....
08349                                                                *pOutbox,
08350                                                                theAccount,
08351                                                                tranIn))
08352         {
08353             OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: ERROR verifying balance statement.\n");
08354 
08355         }
08356         // **********************************************************************
08357 
08358         else // BALANCE AGREEMENT WAS SUCCESSFUL.......
08359         {
08360             pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the balance agreement was successful.
08361 
08362             // --------------------------------------------------------------------
08363 
08364             // Set up some account pointer lists for later...
08365             listOfAccounts          listUserAccounts, listServerAccounts;
08366             std::list<OTLedger*>    listInboxes;
08367 
08368             // Here's the request from the user.
08369             OTString strBasket;
08370             OTBasket theBasket, theRequestBasket;
08371 
08372             pItem->GetAttachment(strBasket);
08373             // -------------------------------------
08374 
08375             int64_t lTransferAmount = 0;
08376 
08377             // Now we have the Contract ID from the basket account,
08378             // we can get a pointer to its asset contract...
08379 
08380             OTIdentifier BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID;
08381 
08382             OTAccount * pBasketAcct = NULL;
08383             OTCleanup<OTAccount> theBasketAcctGuardian;
08384 
08385             bool bLookup = LookupBasketAccountIDByContractID(BASKET_CONTRACT_ID, BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID);
08386             if (!bLookup)
08387             {
08388                 OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: Asset type is not a basket currency.\n");
08389             }
08390             else if (!strBasket.Exists() ||
08391                      !theRequestBasket.LoadContractFromString(strBasket) ||
08392                      !theRequestBasket.VerifySignature(theNym))
08393             {
08394                 OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: Expected verifiable basket object to be attached to exchangeBasket item.\n");
08395             }
08396             else if (theRequestBasket.GetRequestAccountID() != theAccount.GetPurportedAccountID())
08397             {
08398                 OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: User's main account ID according to request basket doesn't match theAccount.\n");
08399             }
08400             else if (false == VerifyTransactionNumber(theNym, theRequestBasket.GetClosingNum()))
08401             {
08402                 OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: Closing number used for User's main account receipt was not available for use...\n");
08403             }
08404             else
08405             {   // Load the basket account and make sure it exists.
08406                 pBasketAcct = OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount(BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID, SERVER_ID);
08407 
08408                 // If the pointer is NULL, that works too. Otherwise it cleans up the object at the end of this function.
08409                 theBasketAcctGuardian.SetCleanupTargetPointer(pBasketAcct);
08410 
08411                 if (NULL == pBasketAcct)
08412                 {
08413                     OTLog::Error("ERROR loading the basket account in OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket\n");
08414                 }
08415                 // Does it verify?
08416                 // I call VerifySignature here since VerifyContractID was already called in LoadExistingAccount().
08417                 else if (!pBasketAcct->VerifySignature(m_nymServer))
08418                 {
08419                     OTLog::Error("ERROR verifying signature on the basket account in OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket\n");
08420                 }
08421                 else
08422                 {
08423                     // Now we get a pointer to its asset contract...
08424                     OTAssetContract * pContract = GetAssetContract(BASKET_CONTRACT_ID);
08425 
08426                     // Now let's load up the actual basket, from the actual asset contract.
08427                     if (pContract &&
08428                         theBasket.LoadContractFromString(pContract->GetBasketInfo()) &&
08429                         theBasket.VerifySignature(m_nymServer) &&
08430                         theBasket.Count() == theRequestBasket.Count() &&
08431                         theBasket.GetMinimumTransfer() == theRequestBasket.GetMinimumTransfer())
08432                     {
08433                         // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08434                         // Let's make sure that the same asset account doesn't appear twice on the request.
08435                         //
08436                         std::set<OTIdentifier> setOfAccounts;
08437                         setOfAccounts.insert(theRequestBasket.GetRequestAccountID());
08438 
08439                         bool bFoundSameAcctTwice = false;
08440 
08441                         for (int32_t i = 0; i < theRequestBasket.Count(); i++)
08442                         {
08443                             BasketItem * pItem = theRequestBasket.At(i);
08444                             OT_ASSERT(NULL != pItem);
08445                             // -------------------------------------
08446                             std::set<OTIdentifier>::iterator it_account = setOfAccounts.find(pItem->SUB_ACCOUNT_ID);
08447 
08448                             if (setOfAccounts.end() != it_account) // The account appears twice!!
08449                             {
08450                                 const OTString strSubID(pItem->SUB_ACCOUNT_ID);
08451                                 OTLog::vError("%s: Failed: Sub-account ID found TWICE on same basket exchange request: %s\n",
08452                                               __FUNCTION__, strSubID.Get());
08453                                 bFoundSameAcctTwice = true;
08454                                 break;
08455                             }
08456                             // -------------------------------------
08457                             setOfAccounts.insert(pItem->SUB_ACCOUNT_ID);
08458                         }
08459                         // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08460                         if (!bFoundSameAcctTwice) // Let's do it!
08461                         {
08462                             // Loop through the request AND the actual basket TOGETHER...
08463                             for (int32_t i = 0; i < theBasket.Count(); i++)
08464                             {
08465                                 BasketItem * pBasketItem    = theBasket.At(i);
08466                                 BasketItem * pRequestItem   = theRequestBasket.At(i); // we already know these are the same length
08467 
08468                                 // if not equal
08469                                 if (!(pBasketItem->SUB_CONTRACT_ID == pRequestItem->SUB_CONTRACT_ID))
08470                                 {
08471                                     OTLog::Error("Error: expected asset type IDs to match in OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket\n");
08472                                     bSuccess = false;
08473                                     break;
08474                                 }
08475                                 // if accounts are equal (should never happen -- why would the user be trying to use the server's account as his own?)
08476                                 // Furthermore, loading both at the same time, with same ID, then saving again, can screw up the balance.
08477                                 //
08478                                 else if (pBasketItem->SUB_ACCOUNT_ID == pRequestItem->SUB_ACCOUNT_ID)
08479                                 {
08480                                     OTLog::Error("Error: VERY strange to have these account ID's match. OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket.\n");
08481                                     bSuccess = false;
08482                                     break;
08483                                 }
08484 
08485                                 else if (false == VerifyTransactionNumber(theNym, pRequestItem->lClosingTransactionNo))
08486                                 {
08487                                     OTLog::Error("Error: Basket sub-currency closing number didn't verify . OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket.\n");
08488                                     bSuccess = false;
08489                                     break;
08490                                 }
08491                                 else // if equal
08492                                 {
08493                                     bSuccess = true;
08494 
08495                                     // --------------------------------------------------------
08496                                     // Load up the two accounts and perform the exchange...
08497                                     OTAccount * pUserAcct   = OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount(pRequestItem->SUB_ACCOUNT_ID, SERVER_ID);
08498 
08499                                     if (NULL == pUserAcct)
08500                                     {
08501                                         OTLog::Error("ERROR loading a user's asset account in OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket\n");
08502                                         bSuccess = false;
08503                                         break;
08504                                     }
08505                                     // --------------------------------------------------------
08506                                     OTAccount * pServerAcct = OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount(pBasketItem->SUB_ACCOUNT_ID, SERVER_ID);
08507 
08508                                     if (NULL == pServerAcct)
08509                                     {
08510                                         OTLog::Error("ERROR loading a basket sub-account in OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket\n");
08511                                         bSuccess = false;
08512                                         break;
08513                                     }
08514                                     // --------------------------------------------------------
08515                                     // Load up the inbox for the user's sub account, so we can drop the receipt.
08516                                     //
08517                                     OTLedger * pSubInbox = pUserAcct->LoadInbox(m_nymServer);
08518 
08519                                     if (NULL == pSubInbox) // || !pSubInbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) OTAccount::Load (above) already verifies.
08520                                     {
08521                                         OTLog::Error("Error loading or verifying sub-inbox in OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket.\n");
08522                                         bSuccess = false;
08523                                         break;
08524                                     }
08525 
08526                                     // I'm preserving these points, to be deleted at the end.
08527                                     // They won't be saved until after ALL debits/credits were successful.
08528                                     // Once ALL exchanges are done, THEN it loops through and saves / deletes
08529                                     // all the accounts.
08530                                     listUserAccounts.push_back(pUserAcct);
08531                                     listServerAccounts.push_back(pServerAcct);
08532                                     listInboxes.push_back(pSubInbox);
08533 
08534                                     // Do they verify?
08535                                     // I call VerifySignature here since VerifyContractID was already called in LoadExistingAccount().
08536                                     if (pUserAcct->GetAssetTypeID() != pBasketItem->SUB_CONTRACT_ID)
08537                                     {
08538                                         OTLog::Error("ERROR verifying asset type on a user's account in OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket\n");
08539                                         bSuccess = false;
08540                                         break;
08541                                     }
08542                                     else if (!pUserAcct->VerifySignature(m_nymServer))
08543                                     {
08544                                         OTLog::Error("ERROR verifying signature on a user's asset account in OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket\n");
08545                                         bSuccess = false;
08546                                         break;
08547                                     }
08548                                     else if (!pServerAcct->VerifySignature(m_nymServer))
08549                                     {
08550                                         OTLog::Error("ERROR verifying signature on a basket sub-account in OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket\n");
08551                                         bSuccess = false;
08552                                         break;
08553                                     }
08554                                     else  // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08555                                     {
08556                                         // the amount being transferred between these two accounts is the minimum transfer amount
08557                                         // for the sub-account on the basket, multiplied by
08558                                         lTransferAmount = (pBasketItem->lMinimumTransferAmount * theRequestBasket.GetTransferMultiple());
08559 
08560     //                                  bSuccess = false; // probably superfluous.
08561 
08562                                         // user is performing exchange IN
08563                                         if (theRequestBasket.GetExchangingIn())
08564                                         {
08565                                             if (pUserAcct->Debit(lTransferAmount))
08566                                             {
08567                                                 if (pServerAcct->Credit(lTransferAmount))
08568                                                     bSuccess = true;
08569                                                 else
08570                                                 {   // the server credit failed.
08571                                                     OTLog::Error(" OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: Failure crediting server acct.\n");
08572 
08573                                                     // Since we debited the user's acct already, let's put that back.
08574                                                     if (false == pUserAcct->Credit(lTransferAmount))
08575                                                         OTLog::Error(" OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: Failure crediting back user "
08576                                                                      "account.\n");
08577                                                     bSuccess = false;
08578                                                     break;
08579                                                 }
08580                                             }
08581                                             else
08582                                             {
08583                                                 OTLog::Output(0, "OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: Unable to Debit user account.\n");
08584                                                 bSuccess = false;
08585                                                 break;
08586                                             }
08587                                         }
08588                                         else // user is peforming exchange OUT
08589                                         {
08590                                             if (pServerAcct->Debit(lTransferAmount))
08591                                             {
08592                                                 if (pUserAcct->Credit(lTransferAmount))
08593                                                     bSuccess = true;
08594                                                 else
08595                                                 {   // the user credit failed.
08596                                                     OTLog::Error(" OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: Failure crediting user acct.\n");
08597 
08598                                                     // Since we debited the server's acct already, let's put that back.
08599                                                     if (false == pServerAcct->Credit(lTransferAmount))
08600                                                         OTLog::Error(" OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: Failure crediting back server "
08601                                                                      "account.\n");
08602                                                     bSuccess = false;
08603                                                     break;
08604                                                 }
08605                                             }
08606                                             else
08607                                             {
08608                                                 OTLog::Output(0, " OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: Unable to Debit server account.\n");
08609                                                 bSuccess = false;
08610                                                 break;
08611                                             }
08612                                         }
08613                                         // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
08614                                         // Drop the receipt -- accounts were debited and credited properly.
08615                                         //
08616                                         if (bSuccess)
08617                                         {   // need to be able to "roll back" if anything inside this block fails.
08618                                             // update: actually does pretty good roll-back as it is. The debits and credits
08619                                             // don't save unless everything is a success.
08620 
08621                                             // Generate new transaction number (for putting the basketReceipt in the exchanger's inbox.)
08622                                             // todo check this generation for failure (can it fail?)
08623                                             int64_t lNewTransactionNumber = 0;
08624 
08625                                             IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lNewTransactionNumber, false); // bStoreTheNumber = false
08626 
08627                                             OTTransaction * pInboxTransaction   = OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(*pSubInbox, OTTransaction::basketReceipt, lNewTransactionNumber);
08628 
08629                                             OTItem * pItemInbox = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(*pInboxTransaction, OTItem::basketReceipt);
08630 
08631                                             // these may be unnecessary, I'll have to check CreateItemFromTransaction. I'll leave em.
08632                                             OT_ASSERT(NULL != pItemInbox);
08633 
08634                                             pItemInbox->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the default.
08635                                             pItemInbox->SetAmount(theRequestBasket.GetExchangingIn() ? lTransferAmount*(-1) : lTransferAmount);
08636 
08637                                             pItemInbox->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08638                                             pItemInbox->SaveContract();
08639 
08640                                             pInboxTransaction->AddItem(*pItemInbox); // Add the inbox item to the inbox transaction, so we can add to the inbox ledger.
08641 
08642                                             pInboxTransaction->SetNumberOfOrigin(*pItem);
08643 
08644                                             // The "exchangeBasket request" OTItem is saved as the "In Reference To" field
08645                                             // on the inbox basketReceipt transaction.
08646                                             //todo put these two together in a method.
08647                                             pInboxTransaction->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo);
08648                                             pInboxTransaction->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum());
08649                                             pInboxTransaction->SetClosingNum(pRequestItem->lClosingTransactionNo); // Here is the number the user wishes to sign-off by accepting this receipt.
08650 
08651                                             // Now we have created a new transaction from the server to the sender's inbox (for a receipt).
08652                                             // Let's sign and save it...
08653                                             pInboxTransaction->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08654                                             pInboxTransaction->SaveContract();
08655 
08656                                             // Here the transaction we just created is actually added to the exchanger's inbox.
08657                                             pSubInbox->AddTransaction(*pInboxTransaction);
08658                                             pInboxTransaction->SaveBoxReceipt(*pSubInbox);
08659                                         }
08660                                     } // User and Server sub-accounts are good. ---------------------------------------
08661                                 } // pBasketItem and pRequestItem are good.
08662                             } // for (loop through basketitems)
08663                             // *****************************************************************************
08664                             // Load up the two main accounts and perform the exchange...
08665                             // (Above we did the sub-accounts for server and user. Now we do the main accounts for server and user.)
08666                             //
08667 
08668                             // At this point, if we have successfully debited / credited the sub-accounts.
08669                             // then we need to debit and credit the user's main basket account and the server's basket issuer account.
08670                             if ((true == bSuccess) && (NULL != pBasketAcct))
08671                             {
08672                                 lTransferAmount =  (theRequestBasket.GetMinimumTransfer() * theRequestBasket.GetTransferMultiple());
08673 
08674                                 // Load up the two accounts and perform the exchange...
08675                                 // user is performing exchange IN
08676                                 if (theRequestBasket.GetExchangingIn())
08677                                 {
08678                                     if (pBasketAcct->Debit(lTransferAmount))
08679                                     {
08680                                         if (theAccount.Credit(lTransferAmount))
08681                                             bSuccess = true;
08682                                         else
08683                                         {
08684                                             OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: Failed crediting user basket account.\n");
08685 
08686                                             if (false == pBasketAcct->Credit(lTransferAmount))
08687                                                 OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: Failed crediting back basket issuer account.\n");
08688 
08689                                             bSuccess = false;
08690                                         }
08691                                     }
08692                                     else
08693                                     {
08694                                         bSuccess = false;
08695                                         OTLog::Output(0, "Unable to Debit basket issuer account, in OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket\n");
08696                                     }
08697                                 }
08698                                 else // user is peforming exchange OUT
08699                                 {
08700                                     if (theAccount.Debit(lTransferAmount))
08701                                     {
08702                                         if (pBasketAcct->Credit(lTransferAmount))
08703                                             bSuccess = true;
08704                                         else
08705                                         {
08706                                             OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: Failed crediting basket issuer account.\n");
08707 
08708                                             if (false == theAccount.Credit(lTransferAmount))
08709                                                 OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket: Failed crediting back user basket account.\n");
08710 
08711                                             bSuccess = false;
08712                                         }
08713                                     }
08714                                     else
08715                                     {
08716                                         bSuccess = false;
08717                                         OTLog::Output(0, "Unable to Debit user basket account in OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket\n");
08718                                     }
08719                                 }
08720 
08721 
08722                                 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
08723                                 // Drop the receipt -- accounts were debited and credited properly.
08724                                 //
08725                                 if (bSuccess)
08726                                 {   // need to be able to "roll back" if anything inside this block fails.
08727                                     // update: actually does pretty good roll-back as it is. The debits and credits
08728                                     // don't save unless everything is a success.
08729 
08730                                     // Generate new transaction number (for putting the basketReceipt in the exchanger's inbox.)
08731                                     // todo check this generation for failure (can it fail?)
08732                                     int64_t lNewTransactionNumber = 0;
08733 
08734                                     IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lNewTransactionNumber, false); // bStoreTheNumber = false
08735 
08736                                     OTTransaction * pInboxTransaction   = OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(*pInbox, OTTransaction::basketReceipt,
08737                                                                                                              lNewTransactionNumber);
08738 
08739                                     OTItem * pItemInbox     = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(*pInboxTransaction, OTItem::basketReceipt);
08740 
08741                                     // these may be unnecessary, I'll have to check CreateItemFromTransaction. I'll leave em.
08742                                     OT_ASSERT(NULL != pItemInbox);
08743 
08744                                     pItemInbox->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the default.
08745                                     pItemInbox->SetAmount(theRequestBasket.GetExchangingIn() ? lTransferAmount : lTransferAmount*(-1));
08746 
08747                                     pItemInbox->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08748                                     pItemInbox->SaveContract();
08749 
08750                                     pInboxTransaction->AddItem(*pItemInbox); // Add the inbox item to the inbox transaction, so we can add to the inbox ledger.
08751 
08752                                     pInboxTransaction->SetNumberOfOrigin(*pItem);
08753 
08754                                     // The exchangeBasket request OTItem is saved as a "in reference to" field,
08755                                     // on the inbox basketReceipt transaction.
08756                                     //todo put these two together in a method.
08757                                     pInboxTransaction->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo);
08758                                     pInboxTransaction->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum());
08759                                     pInboxTransaction->SetClosingNum(theRequestBasket.GetClosingNum()); // So the exchanger can sign-off on this closing num by accepting the basket receipt on his main basket account.
08760 
08761                                     // Now we have created a new transaction from the server to the sender's inbox
08762                                     // Let's sign and save it...
08763                                     pInboxTransaction->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08764                                     pInboxTransaction->SaveContract();
08765 
08766                                     // Here the transaction we just created is actually added to the source acct's inbox.
08767                                     pInbox->AddTransaction(*pInboxTransaction);
08768                                     pInboxTransaction->SaveBoxReceipt(*pInbox);
08769                                 }
08770                             }
08771                             else
08772                             {
08773                                 OTLog::Error("Error loading or verifying user's main basket account in OTServer::NotarizeExchangeBasket\n");
08774                                 bSuccess = false;
08775                             }
08776                             // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08777 
08778 
08779                             // At this point, we have hopefully credited/debited ALL the relevant accounts.
08780                             // So now, let's Save them ALL to disk.. (and clean them up.)
08781                             OTAccount * pAccount = NULL;
08782 
08783                             // empty the list of USER accounts (and save to disk, if everything was successful.)
08784                             while (!listUserAccounts.empty())
08785                             {
08786                                 pAccount = listUserAccounts.front();
08787                                 if (NULL == pAccount) OT_FAIL;
08788                                 listUserAccounts.pop_front();
08789 
08790                                 if (true == bSuccess)
08791                                 {
08792                                     pAccount->ReleaseSignatures();
08793                                     pAccount->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08794                                     pAccount->SaveContract();
08795                                     pAccount->SaveAccount();
08796                                 }
08797 
08798                                 delete pAccount; pAccount=NULL;
08799                             }
08800                             // ---------------------------------------------
08801                             // empty the list of SERVER accounts (and save to disk, if everything was successful.)
08802                             while (!listServerAccounts.empty())
08803                             {
08804                                 pAccount = listServerAccounts.front();
08805                                 if (NULL == pAccount) OT_FAIL;
08806 
08807                                 listServerAccounts.pop_front();
08808 
08809                                 if (true == bSuccess)
08810                                 {
08811                                     pAccount->ReleaseSignatures();
08812                                     pAccount->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08813                                     pAccount->SaveContract();
08814                                     pAccount->SaveAccount();
08815                                 }
08816 
08817                                 delete pAccount; pAccount=NULL;
08818                             }
08819                             // ---------------------------------------------
08820                             // empty the list of inboxes (and save to disk, if everything was successful.)
08821                             while (!listInboxes.empty())
08822                             {
08823                                 OTLedger * pTempInbox = listInboxes.front();
08824                                 if (NULL == pTempInbox) OT_FAIL;
08825                                 listInboxes.pop_front();
08826 
08827                                 if (true == bSuccess)
08828                                 {
08829                                     pTempInbox->ReleaseSignatures();
08830                                     pTempInbox->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08831                                     pTempInbox->SaveContract();
08832                                     pTempInbox->SaveInbox();
08833                                 }
08834 
08835                                 delete pTempInbox; pTempInbox=NULL;
08836                             }
08837                             // ---------------------------------------------
08838                             if (true == bSuccess)
08839                             {
08840                                 pInbox->ReleaseSignatures();
08841                                 pInbox->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08842                                 pInbox->SaveContract();
08843                                 theAccount.SaveInbox(*pInbox);
08844 
08845                                 theAccount.ReleaseSignatures();
08846                                 theAccount.SignContract(m_nymServer);
08847                                 theAccount.SaveContract();
08848                                 theAccount.SaveAccount();
08849 
08850                                 pBasketAcct->ReleaseSignatures();
08851                                 pBasketAcct->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08852                                 pBasketAcct->SaveContract();
08853                                 pBasketAcct->SaveAccount();
08854 
08855                                 // ----------------------------------------------------
08856                                 // Remove my ability to use the "closing" numbers in the future.
08857                                 // (Since I'm using them to do this exchange...)
08858                                 //
08859                                 for (int32_t i = 0; i < theRequestBasket.Count(); i++)
08860                                 {
08861                                     BasketItem * pRequestItem   = theRequestBasket.At(i);
08862 
08863                                     OT_ASSERT(NULL != pRequestItem);
08864 
08865                                     // This just removes the number so I can't USE it.
08866                                     // I'm still RESPONSIBLE for the number until RemoveIssuedNumber() is called.
08867                                     //
08868                                     RemoveTransactionNumber(theNym, pRequestItem->lClosingTransactionNo, false); // bSave=false
08869                                 }
08870                                 RemoveTransactionNumber(theNym, theRequestBasket.GetClosingNum(), true); // bSave=true
08871                                 // ----------------------------------------------------
08872                                 pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the exchangeBasket was successful.
08873 
08874                                 bOutSuccess = true;  // The exchangeBasket was successful.
08875                             }
08876                         } // Let's do it!
08877                     }
08878                     else
08879                     {
08880                         OTLog::Error("Error finding asset contract for basket, or loading the basket from it, or verifying\n"
08881                                      "the signature on that basket, or the request basket didn't match actual basket.\n");
08882                     }
08883                 } // pBasket exists and signature verifies
08884                 // NO need to cleanup pBasketAcct here, since OTCleanup handles it now.
08885             } // theRequestBasket loaded properly.
08886         } // else (balance agreement verified.)
08887     } // Balance Agreement item found.
08888 
08889     // I put this here so it's signed/saved whether the balance agreement itself was successful OR NOT.
08890     pResponseItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08891     pResponseItem->SaveContract();
08892 
08893     pResponseBalanceItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
08894     pResponseBalanceItem->SaveContract();
08895 }
08896 
08897 
08898 
08899 // DONE:  CHANGE THIS INTO A TRANSACTION (see above)
08900 // Use the CLOSING NUMBERS for each member, and for the basket, to put RECEIPTS in their INBOXES!
08901 //
08903 /*
08904 void OTServer::UserCmdExchangeBasket(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
08905 {
08906     // (1) set up member variables
08907     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@exchangeBasket";// reply to exchangeBasket
08908     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
08909 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
08910     msgOut.m_strAssetID     = MsgIn.m_strAssetID;// basket asset type ID
08911     msgOut.m_bBool          = MsgIn.m_bBool;    // exchange in or out?
08912 
08913     const OTIdentifier  USER_ID(theNym), SERVER_ID(m_strServerID),
08914                         SERVER_USER_ID(m_nymServer),
08915                         BASKET_CONTRACT_ID(msgOut.m_strAssetID);
08916 
08917     OTIdentifier BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID;
08918 
08919     // Either way, we need to send the user's command back to him as well.
08920     {
08921         OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn);
08922         msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage);
08923     }
08924 
08925 
08926 
08927 
08928     // Set up some account pointer lists for later...
08929     listOfAccounts  listUserAccounts, listServerAccounts;
08930 
08931     // Here's the request from the user.
08932     OTString strBasket(MsgIn.m_ascPayload);
08933     OTBasket theBasket, theRequestBasket;
08934 
08935     int64_t lTransferAmount = 0;
08936 
08937     // Now we have the Contract ID from the basket account,
08938     // we can get a pointer to its asset contract...
08939 
08940     OTIdentifier BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID;
08941     bool bLookup = LookupBasketAccountIDByContractID(BASKET_CONTRACT_ID, BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID);
08942 
08943     OTAccount * pBasketAcct = NULL;
08944     OTCleanup<OTAccount> theBasketAcctGuardian;
08945 
08946     // if the account we received IS INDEED a basket account, AND
08947     // we can load the request basket from a string, AND verify its signature...
08948     if (bLookup && theRequestBasket.LoadContractFromString(strBasket) && theRequestBasket.VerifySignature(theNym))
08949     {
08950         // Load the basket account and make sure it exists.
08951         pBasketAcct = OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount(BASKET_ACCOUNT_ID, SERVER_ID);
08952 
08953         // If the pointer is NULL, that works too. Otherwise it cleans up the object at the end of this function.
08954         theBasketAcctGuardian.SetCleanupTargetPointer(pBasketAcct);
08955 
08956         if (NULL == pBasketAcct)
08957         {
08958             OTLog::Error("ERROR loading the basket account in OTServer::UserCmdExchangeBasket\n");
08959             msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
08960         }
08961         // Does it verify?
08962         // I call VerifySignature here since VerifyContractID was already called in LoadExistingAccount().
08963         else if (!pBasketAcct->VerifySignature(m_nymServer))
08964         {
08965             OTLog::Error("ERROR verifying signature on the basket account in OTServer::UserCmdExchangeBasket\n");
08966             msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
08967         }
08968         else
08969         {
08970             // Now we get a pointer to its asset contract...
08971             OTAssetContract * pContract = GetAssetContract(BASKET_CONTRACT_ID);
08972 
08973             // Now let's load up the actual basket, from the actual asset contract.
08974             if (pContract &&
08975                 theBasket.LoadContractFromString(pContract->GetBasketInfo()) &&
08976                 theBasket.VerifySignature(m_nymServer) &&
08977                 theBasket.Count() == theRequestBasket.Count() &&
08978                 theBasket.GetMinimumTransfer() == theRequestBasket.GetMinimumTransfer())
08979             {
08980                 // Loop through the request AND the actual basket TOGETHER...
08981                 for (int32_t i = 0; i < theBasket.Count(); i++)
08982                 {
08983                     BasketItem * pBasketItem    = theBasket.At(i);
08984                     BasketItem * pRequestItem   = theRequestBasket.At(i); // we already know these are the same length
08985 
08986                     // if not equal
08987                     if (!(pBasketItem->SUB_CONTRACT_ID == pRequestItem->SUB_CONTRACT_ID))
08988                     {
08989                         OTLog::Error("Error: expected asset type IDs to match in OTServer::UserCmdExchangeBasket\n");
08990                         msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
08991                         break;
08992                     }
08993                     else // if equal
08994                     {
08995                         msgOut.m_bSuccess = true;
08996 
08997                         // Load up the two accounts and perform the exchange...
08998                         OTAccount * pUserAcct   = OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount(pRequestItem->SUB_ACCOUNT_ID, SERVER_ID);
08999 
09000                         if (NULL == pUserAcct)
09001                         {
09002                             OTLog::Error("ERROR loading a user's asset account in OTServer::UserCmdExchangeBasket\n");
09003                             msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
09004                             break;
09005                         }
09006 
09007                         OTAccount * pServerAcct = OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount(pBasketItem->SUB_ACCOUNT_ID, SERVER_ID);
09008 
09009                         if (NULL == pServerAcct)
09010                         {
09011                             OTLog::Error("ERROR loading a basket sub-account in OTServer::UserCmdExchangeBasket\n");
09012                             msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
09013                             break;
09014                         }
09015 
09016                         // I'm preserving these points, to be deleted at the end.
09017                         // They won't be saved until after ALL debits/credits were successful.
09018                         // Once ALL exchanges are done, THEN it loops through and saves / deletes
09019                         // all the accounts.
09020                         listUserAccounts.push_back(pUserAcct);
09021                         listServerAccounts.push_back(pServerAcct);
09022 
09023 
09024                         // Do they verify?
09025                         // I call VerifySignature here since VerifyContractID was already called in LoadExistingAccount().
09026                         if (!(pUserAcct->GetAssetTypeID() == pBasketItem->SUB_CONTRACT_ID))
09027                         {
09028                             OTLog::Error("ERROR verifying asset type on a user's account in OTServer::UserCmdExchangeBasket\n");
09029                             msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
09030                             break;
09031                         }
09032                         else if (!pUserAcct->VerifySignature(m_nymServer))
09033                         {
09034                             OTLog::Error("ERROR verifying signature on a user's asset account in OTServer::UserCmdExchangeBasket\n");
09035                             msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
09036                             break;
09037                         }
09038                         else if (!pServerAcct->VerifySignature(m_nymServer))
09039                         {
09040                             OTLog::Error("ERROR verifying signature on a basket sub-account in OTServer::UserCmdExchangeBasket\n");
09041                             msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
09042                             break;
09043                         }
09044                         else
09045                         {
09046                             // the amount being transferred between these two accounts is the minimum transfer amount
09047                             // for the sub-account on the basket, multiplied by
09048                             lTransferAmount = (pBasketItem->lMinimumTransferAmount * theRequestBasket.GetTransferMultiple());
09049 
09050                             // user is performing exchange IN
09051                             if (msgOut.m_bBool)
09052                             {
09053                                 if (pUserAcct->Debit(lTransferAmount) && pServerAcct->Credit(lTransferAmount))
09054                                 {
09055                                     msgOut.m_bSuccess = true;
09056                                 }
09057                                 else
09058                                 {
09059                                     msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
09060                                     OTLog::Output(0, "Unable to Debit user account, or Credit server account, in OTServer::UserCmdExchangeBasket\n");
09061                                     break;
09062                                 }
09063                             }
09064                             else // user is peforming exchange OUT
09065                             {
09066                                 if (pUserAcct->Credit(lTransferAmount) && pServerAcct->Debit(lTransferAmount))
09067                                 {
09068                                     msgOut.m_bSuccess = true;
09069                                 }
09070                                 else
09071                                 {
09072                                     msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
09073                                     OTLog::Output(0, "Unable to Credit user account, or Debit server account, in OTServer::UserCmdExchangeBasket\n");
09074                                     break;
09075                                 }
09076                             }
09077                         }
09078                     }
09079                 } // for
09080             }
09081             else
09082             {
09083                 OTLog::Error("Error finding asset contract for basket, or loading the basket from it, or verifying\n"
09084                              "the signature on that basket, or the request basket didn't match actual basket.\n");
09085             }
09086         } // pBasket exists and signature verifies
09087 
09088         // *****************************************************************************
09089 
09090         // Load up the two accounts and perform the exchange...
09091         // (Above we did the sub-accounts for server and user. Now we do the main accounts for server and user.)
09092         //
09093         OTAccount * pUserMainAcct   = NULL;
09094         OTCleanup<OTAccount> theUserAcctGuardian;
09095 
09096         // At this point, if we have successfully debited / credited the sub-accounts.
09097         // then we need to debit and credit the user's main basket account and the server's basket issuer account.
09098         if ((true == msgOut.m_bSuccess) && pBasketAcct &&
09099             (pUserMainAcct = OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount(theRequestBasket.GetRequestAccountID(), SERVER_ID)) &&
09100             theUserAcctGuardian.SetCleanupTargetPointer(pUserMainAcct) && // Make sure pUserMainAcct gets cleaned up
09101             pUserMainAcct->VerifySignature(m_nymServer) &&
09102             (pUserMainAcct->GetAssetTypeID() == BASKET_CONTRACT_ID)) // Just make sure the two main basket accts have same currency type
09103         {
09104             lTransferAmount =  (theRequestBasket.GetMinimumTransfer() * theRequestBasket.GetTransferMultiple());
09105 
09106             // Load up the two accounts and perform the exchange...
09107             // user is performing exchange IN
09108             if (msgOut.m_bBool)
09109             {
09110                 if (pUserMainAcct->Credit(lTransferAmount) && pBasketAcct->Debit(lTransferAmount))
09111                 {
09112                     msgOut.m_bSuccess = true;
09113                 }
09114                 else
09115                 {
09116                     msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
09117                     OTLog::Output(0, "Unable to Credit user basket account, or Debit basket issuer account, "
09118                                   "in OTServer::UserCmdExchangeBasket\n");
09119                 }
09120             }
09121             else // user is peforming exchange OUT
09122             {
09123                 if (pUserMainAcct->Debit(lTransferAmount) && pBasketAcct->Credit(lTransferAmount))
09124                 {
09125                     msgOut.m_bSuccess = true;
09126                 }
09127                 else
09128                 {
09129                     msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
09130                     OTLog::Output(0, "Unable to Debit user basket account, or Credit basket issuer account, "
09131                                   "in OTServer::UserCmdExchangeBasket\n");
09132                 }
09133             }
09134         }
09135         else {
09136             OTLog::Error("Error loading or verifying user's main basket account in OTServer::UserCmdExchangeBasket\n");
09137             msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
09138         }
09139 
09140         // At this point, we have hopefully credited/debited ALL the relevant accounts.
09141         // So now, let's Save them ALL to disk.. (and clean them up.)
09142         OTAccount * pAccount = NULL;
09143 
09144         // empty the list of USER accounts (and save to disk, if everything was successful.)
09145         while (!listUserAccounts.empty())
09146         {
09147             pAccount = listUserAccounts.front();
09148             listUserAccounts.pop_front();
09149 
09150             if (true == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
09151             {
09152                 pAccount->ReleaseSignatures();
09153                 pAccount->SignContract(m_nymServer);
09154                 pAccount->SaveContract();
09155                 pAccount->SaveAccount();
09156             }
09157 
09158             delete pAccount; pAccount=NULL;
09159         }
09160 
09161         // empty the list of SERVER accounts (and save to disk, if everything was successful.)
09162         while (!listServerAccounts.empty())
09163         {
09164             pAccount = listServerAccounts.front();
09165             listServerAccounts.pop_front();
09166 
09167             if (true == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
09168             {
09169                 pAccount->ReleaseSignatures();
09170                 pAccount->SignContract(m_nymServer);
09171                 pAccount->SaveContract();
09172                 pAccount->SaveAccount();
09173             }
09174 
09175             delete pAccount; pAccount=NULL;
09176         }
09177 
09178 
09179         if (true == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
09180         {
09181             pBasketAcct->ReleaseSignatures();
09182             pBasketAcct->SignContract(m_nymServer);
09183             pBasketAcct->SaveContract();
09184             pBasketAcct->SaveAccount();
09185 
09186             pUserMainAcct->ReleaseSignatures();
09187             pUserMainAcct->SignContract(m_nymServer);
09188             pUserMainAcct->SaveContract();
09189             pUserMainAcct->SaveAccount();
09190         }
09191 
09192 
09193         // NO need to cleanup pBasketAcct or pUserMainAcct here, since OTCleanup handles it now.
09194     }
09195 
09196     // (2) Sign the Message
09197     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
09198 
09199     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
09200     //
09201     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
09202     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
09203     msgOut.SaveContract();
09204 }
09205 */
09206 
09207 
09208 // ------------------------------------------------------------
09209 
09210 
09211 // DONE:  Make sure a CLOSING TRANSACTION number is provided, and recorded for use later in cron!
09212 
09213 void OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTAccount & theAssetAccount, OTTransaction & tranIn, OTTransaction & tranOut, bool & bOutSuccess)
09214 {
09215     // The outgoing transaction is an "atMarketOffer", that is, "a reply to the marketOffer request"
09216     tranOut.SetType(OTTransaction::atMarketOffer);
09217 
09218     OTItem * pItem          = NULL;
09219     OTItem * pBalanceItem   = NULL;
09220     OTItem * pResponseItem  = NULL;
09221     OTItem * pResponseBalanceItem   = NULL;
09222 
09223     // The incoming transaction may be sent to inboxes and outboxes, and it
09224     // will definitely be bundled in our reply to the user as well. Therefore,
09225     // let's grab it as a string.
09226     OTString strInReferenceTo;
09227     OTString strBalanceItem;
09228 
09229     // Grab the actual server ID from this object, and use it as the server ID here.
09230     const OTIdentifier SERVER_ID(m_strServerID), USER_ID(theNym);
09231     const OTString strUserID(USER_ID);
09232 
09233     pItem           = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::marketOffer);
09234     pBalanceItem    = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::transactionStatement);
09235     // ---------------------
09236     pResponseItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atMarketOffer);
09237     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
09238     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
09239 
09240     pResponseBalanceItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atTransactionStatement);
09241     pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
09242     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseBalanceItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
09243     // ---------------------
09244     if (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_market_offer))
09245     {
09246         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer: User %s cannot do this transaction "
09247                        "(All market offers are disallowed in server.cfg)\n", strUserID.Get());
09248     }
09249     else if (NULL == pBalanceItem)
09250     {
09251         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
09252         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer: Expected transaction statement in trans # %ld: \n\n%s\n\n",
09253                        tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR LOADING TRANSACTION INTO STRING) ");
09254     }
09255     else if (NULL == pItem)
09256     {
09257         OTString strTemp(tranIn);
09258         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer: Expected OTItem::marketOffer in trans# %ld:\n\n%s\n\n",
09259                        tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTemp.Exists() ? strTemp.Get() : " (ERROR LOADING TRANSACTION INTO STRING) ");
09260     }
09261     // For now, there should only be one of these marketOffer items inside the transaction.
09262     // So we treat it that way... I either get it successfully or not.
09263     else
09264     {
09265         // The response item will contain a copy of the request item. So I save it into a string
09266         // here so it can be saved into the "in reference to" field.
09267         pItem->SaveContractRaw(strInReferenceTo);
09268         pBalanceItem->SaveContractRaw(strBalanceItem);
09269 
09270         // ASSET_ACCT_ID is the ID on the "from" Account that was passed in.
09271         // The CURRENCY_ACCT_ID is the ID on the "To" Account. (When doing a transfer, normally 2nd acct is the Payee.)
09272         const OTIdentifier ASSET_ACCT_ID(theAssetAccount), CURRENCY_ACCT_ID(pItem->GetDestinationAcctID());
09273 
09274         // Server response item being added to server response transaction (tranOut)
09275         // They're getting SOME sort of response item.
09276 
09277         pResponseItem->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
09278         pResponseItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
09279 
09280         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceString(strBalanceItem); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
09281         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to pItem and its Owner Transaction.
09282 
09283         // *******************************************************************************************
09284 
09285         if (false == (pBalanceItem->VerifyTransactionStatement(theNym, tranIn))) // bIsRealTransaction = true;
09286         {
09287             OTLog::vOutput(0, "ERROR verifying transaction statement in NotarizeMarketOffer.\n");
09288         }
09289         // *******************************************************************************************
09290         else
09291         {
09292             pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the transaction agreement was successful.
09293 
09294             // Load up the currency account and validate it.
09295             OTAccount * pCurrencyAcct = OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount(CURRENCY_ACCT_ID, SERVER_ID);
09296             OTCleanup<OTAccount> theCurrencyAcctGuardian(pCurrencyAcct); // Now I don't have to worry about deleting pCurrencyAcct.
09297 
09298             // Also load up the Trade from inside the transaction item.
09299             OTString    strOffer;
09300             OTOffer     theOffer;
09301 
09302             OTString    strTrade;
09303             pItem->GetAttachment(strTrade);
09304 
09305             OTTrade * pTrade = new OTTrade();
09306 
09307             OT_ASSERT(NULL != pTrade);
09308 
09309             // First load the Trade up (from the string that was passed in on the transaction item.)
09310             bool bLoadContractFromString = pTrade->LoadContractFromString(strTrade);
09311 
09312             // If failed to load the trade...
09313             if (!bLoadContractFromString)
09314             {
09315                 OTLog::vError("ERROR loading trade from string in OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer:\n%s\n",
09316                               strTrade.Get());
09317             }
09318             // I'm using the operator== because it exists. (Although now I believe != exists also)
09319             // If the ID on the "from" account that was passed in,
09320             // does not match the "Acct From" ID on this transaction item
09321             else if (!(ASSET_ACCT_ID == pItem->GetPurportedAccountID()))
09322             {
09323                 OTLog::Output(0, "Error: Asset account ID on the transaction does not match asset account ID on the transaction item.\n");
09324             }
09325             // ok so the IDs match. Does the currency account exist?
09326             else if (NULL == pCurrencyAcct)
09327             {
09328                 OTLog::Output(0, "ERROR verifying existence of the currency account in OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer\n");
09329             }
09330             else if (!pCurrencyAcct->VerifyContractID())
09331             {
09332                 OTLog::Output(0, "ERROR verifying Contract ID on the currency account in OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer\n");
09333             }
09334             else if (!pCurrencyAcct->VerifyOwner(theNym))
09335             {
09336                 OTLog::Output(0, "ERROR verifying ownership of the currency account in OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer\n");
09337             }
09338             // Are both of the accounts of the same Asset Type?
09339             else if (theAssetAccount.GetAssetTypeID() == pCurrencyAcct->GetAssetTypeID())
09340             {
09341                 OTString    strAssetTypeID(theAssetAccount.GetAssetTypeID()),
09342                 strCurrencyTypeID(pCurrencyAcct->GetAssetTypeID());
09343                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "ERROR - user attempted to trade between identical "
09344                                "asset types in OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer:\n%s\n%s\n",
09345                                strAssetTypeID.Get(),
09346                                strCurrencyTypeID.Get());
09347             }
09348             // Does it verify?
09349             // I call VerifySignature here since VerifyContractID was already called in LoadExistingAccount().
09350             else if (!pCurrencyAcct->VerifySignature(m_nymServer))
09351             {
09352                 OTLog::Output(0, "ERROR verifying signature on the Currency account in OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer\n");
09353             }
09354             else if (!pTrade->VerifySignature(theNym))
09355             {
09356                 OTLog::Output(0, "ERROR verifying signature on the Trade in OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer\n");
09357             }
09358             else if (pTrade->GetTransactionNum() != pItem->GetTransactionNum())
09359             {
09360                 OTLog::Output(0, "ERROR bad transaction number on trade in OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer\n");
09361             }
09362             // The transaction number opens the market offer, but there must also be a closing number for closing it.
09363             else if ((pTrade->GetCountClosingNumbers() < 2) ||
09364                      !VerifyTransactionNumber(theNym, pTrade->GetAssetAcctClosingNum()) || // Verify that it can still be USED
09365                      !VerifyTransactionNumber(theNym, pTrade->GetCurrencyAcctClosingNum())
09366                      )
09367             {
09368                 OTLog::Output(0, "ERROR needed 2 valid closing transaction numbers in OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer\n");
09369             }
09370             else if (pTrade->GetServerID() !=   SERVER_ID)
09371             {
09372                 const OTString strID1(pTrade->GetServerID()), strID2(SERVER_ID);
09373                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer: ERROR wrong Server ID (%s) on trade. Expected: %s\n",
09374                                strID1.Get(), strID2.Get());
09375             }
09376             else if (pTrade->GetSenderUserID() != USER_ID)
09377             {
09378                 const OTString strID1(pTrade->GetSenderUserID()), strID2(USER_ID);
09379                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer: ERROR wrong Nym ID (%s) on trade. Expected: %s\n",
09380                                strID1.Get(), strID2.Get());
09381             }
09382             else if (pTrade->GetAssetID() != theAssetAccount.GetAssetTypeID())
09383             {
09384                 const OTString strAssetID1(pTrade->GetAssetID()), strAssetID2(theAssetAccount.GetAssetTypeID());
09385                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer: ERROR wrong Asset Type ID (%s) on trade. Expected: %s\n",
09386                                strAssetID1.Get(), strAssetID2.Get());
09387             }
09388             else if (pTrade->GetSenderAcctID() != ASSET_ACCT_ID)
09389             {
09390                 const OTString strAcctID1(pTrade->GetSenderAcctID()), strAcctID2(ASSET_ACCT_ID);
09391                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer: ERROR wrong asset Acct ID (%s) on trade. Expected: %s\n",
09392                                strAcctID1.Get(), strAcctID2.Get());
09393             }
09394             else if (pTrade->GetCurrencyID() != pCurrencyAcct->GetAssetTypeID())
09395             {
09396                 const OTString strID1(pTrade->GetCurrencyID()), strID2(pCurrencyAcct->GetAssetTypeID());
09397                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer: ERROR wrong Currency Type ID (%s) on trade. Expected: %s\n",
09398                                strID1.Get(), strID2.Get());
09399             }
09400             else if (pTrade->GetCurrencyAcctID() != CURRENCY_ACCT_ID)
09401             {
09402                 const OTString strID1(pTrade->GetCurrencyAcctID()), strID2(CURRENCY_ACCT_ID);
09403                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer: ERROR wrong Currency Acct ID (%s) on trade. Expected: %s\n",
09404                                strID1.Get(), strID2.Get());
09405             }
09406             // If the Trade successfully verified, but I couldn't get the offer out of it, then it
09407             // actually DIDN'T successfully load still.  :-(
09408             else if (!pTrade->GetOfferString(strOffer))
09409             {
09410                 OTLog::vError("ERROR getting offer string from trade in OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer:\n%s\n",
09411                               strTrade.Get());
09412             }
09413             else if (!theOffer.LoadContractFromString(strOffer))
09414             {
09415                 OTLog::vError("ERROR loading offer from string in OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer:\n%s\n",
09416                               strTrade.Get());
09417             }
09418             // ...And then we use that same Nym to verify the signature on the offer.
09419             else if (!theOffer.VerifySignature(theNym))
09420             {
09421                 OTLog::Error("ERROR verifying offer signature in OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer.\n");
09422             }
09423             else if (!pTrade->VerifyOffer(theOffer))
09424             {
09425                 OTLog::Output(0, "FAILED verifying offer for Trade in OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer\n");
09426             }
09427             else if (theOffer.GetScale() < this->GetMinMarketScale())
09428             {
09429                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer: FAILED verifying Offer, SCALE: %ld. (Minimum is %ld.) \n",
09430                                theOffer.GetScale(), this->GetMinMarketScale());
09431             }
09432             else if (static_cast<int64_t>((theNym.GetSetOpenCronItems().size() / 3)) >= OTCron::GetCronMaxItemsPerNym())
09433             {
09434                 // NOTE:
09435                 // We divided by 3 since this set contains THREE numbers for each active market offer.
09436                 // It's kind of a hack, since it may NOT be three numbers for other cron items such as
09437                 // payment plans and smart contracts. But it's a good enough approximation for now.
09438                 //
09439                 OTLog::Output(0, "OTServer::NotarizeMarketOffer: FAILED adding offer to market: "
09440                               "NYM HAS TOO MANY ACTIVE OFFERS ALREADY. See 'max_items_per_nym' setting in the config file.\n");
09441             }
09442             // At this point I feel pretty confident that the Trade is a valid request from the user.
09443             // -------------------------------------------------
09444             // The top half of this function is oriented around finding the "marketOffer" item (in the "marketOffer"
09445             // transaction) and setting up the response item that will go into the response transaction. It also
09446             // retrieves the Trade object and fully validates it.
09447             //
09448             // Next all we need to do is add it to the market...
09449 
09450 
09451             else
09452             {
09453                 // We don't actually add the trade to a market here. Instead, we add it to the server's Cron object.
09454                 // That object will take care of processing the offer on and off of any market.
09455                 //
09456                 // NOTE: FYI, inside AddCronItem, since this is a new CronItem, a Cron Receipt will
09457                 // be saved with the User's signature on it, containing the Cron Item from the user's
09458                 // original request. After that, the item is stored internally to Cron itself, and
09459                 // signed by the server--and changes over time as cron processes. (The original receipt
09460                 // can always be loaded when necessary.)
09461                 //
09462                 if (m_Cron.AddCronItem(*pTrade, &theNym, true, OTTimeGetCurrentTime())) // bSaveReceipt=true
09463                 {
09464                     //todo need to be able to "roll back" if anything inside this block fails.
09465 
09466                     // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
09467                     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
09468 
09469                     bOutSuccess = true;  // The offer was successfully placed on the market.
09470 
09471                     OTLog::Output(2, "Successfully added Trade to Cron object.\n");
09472 
09473                     // Server side, the Nym stores a list of all open cron item numbers.
