10893     std::set<int64_t> & theSetofCronItemIDs = theNym.GetSetOpenCronItems();
10894 
10895     // If success loading Nymbox, and there are transactions still inside, THEN FAIL!!!
10896     // (Can't delete a Nym with open receipts...)
10897     //
10898     const bool bSuccessLoadNymbox = (theLedger.LoadNymbox() && theLedger.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer));
10899     if (false == bSuccessLoadNymbox)
10900     {
10901         OTLog::Output(3, "Tried to delete Nym, but failed loading or verifying the Nymbox.\n");
10902         msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
10903     }
10904     else if (theLedger.GetTransactionCount() > 0)
10905     {
10906         OTLog::Output(3, "Tried to delete Nym, but there are still receipts in the Nymbox. (Process them first.)\n");
10907         msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
10908     }
10909     // This Nym still has items open on Cron!
10910     //
10911     else if (theSetofCronItemIDs.size() > 0)
10912     {
10913         OTLog::Output(3, "Tried to delete Nym, but there are still open Cron Items. (Close them first.)\n");
10914         msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
10915     }
10916     else if (theNym.GetSetAssetAccounts().size() > 0)
10917     {
10918         OTLog::Output(3, "Tried to delete Nym, but there are still Asset Accounts open for that Nym. (Close them first.)\n");
10919         msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
10920     }
10921     // The Nym has used some of his transaction numbers, but hasn't closed them out yet.
10922     // Close those transactions first.
10923     else if (theNym.GetTransactionNumCount(SERVER_ID) != theNym.GetIssuedNumCount(SERVER_ID))
10924     {
10925         OTLog::Output(3, "Tried to delete Nym, but there are still transactions open for that Nym. (Close them first.)\n");
10926         msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
10927     }
10928     else // SUCCESS!
10929     {
10930         msgOut.m_bSuccess = true;
10931 
10932         // The Nym may have some numbers signed out, but none of them have come through
10933         // and been "used but not closed" yet. (That is, removed from transaction num list but still
10934         // on issued num list.) If they had (i.e. if the previous elseif just above had discovered
10935         // mismatched counts) then we wouldn't be able to delete the Nym until those transactions were
10936         // closed.
10937         // Since we know the counts match perfectly, here we remove all the numbers.
10938         // The client side must know to remove all the numbers as well, when it receives a successful
10939         // reply that the nym was "deleted."
10940         //
10941         while (theNym.GetTransactionNumCount(SERVER_ID) > 0)
10942         {
10943             int64_t lTemp = theNym.GetTransactionNum(SERVER_ID, 0); // index 0
10944             RemoveTransactionNumber(theNym, lTemp, false); // bSave = false
10945         }
10946 
10947         while (theNym.GetIssuedNumCount(SERVER_ID) > 0)
10948         {
10949             int64_t lTemp = theNym.GetIssuedNum(SERVER_ID, 0); // index 0
10950             RemoveIssuedNumber(theNym, lTemp, false); // bSave = false
10951         }
10952         // --------------------------------
10953         //
10954         theNym.MarkForDeletion();   // The nym isn't actually deleted yet, just marked for deletion.
10955         //  It will get cleaned up later, during server maintenance.
10956 
10957         // SAVE the Nym... (now marked for deletion and with all of its transaction numbers removed.)
10958         //
10959         theNym.SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer);
10960     }
10961 
10962     // Send the user's command back to him (success or failure.)
10963     //  if (false == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
10964     {
10965         OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn); // Grab the incoming message in plaintext form
10966         msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage); // Set it into the base64-encoded object on the outgoing message
10967     }
10968 
10969     // (2) Sign the Message
10970     msgOut.SignContract((const OTPseudonym &)m_nymServer);
10971 
10972     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
10973     //
10974     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
10975     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
10976     msgOut.SaveContract();
10977 
10978     // (You are in UserCmdDeleteUser.)
10979 
10980 
10981     // TODO: We may also need to mark the Nymbox, as well as the credential files, as "Marked For Deletion."
10982 
10983 
10984     // *************************************************************
10985     // REPLY NOTICE TO NYMBOX
10986     //
10987     // Now that we signed / saved the reply message...
10988     //
10989     // After specific messages, we drop a notice with a copy of the server's reply
10990     // into the Nymbox.  This way we are GUARANTEED that the Nym will receive and process
10991     // it. (And thus never get out of sync.)
10992     //
10993     if (msgOut.m_bSuccess)
10994     {
10995         const OTString strReplyMessage(msgOut);
10996         const int64_t lReqNum = atol(MsgIn.m_strRequestNum.Get());
10997 
10998         // If it fails, it logs already.
10999         this->DropReplyNoticeToNymbox(SERVER_ID, USER_ID, strReplyMessage, lReqNum,
11000                                       false,   // trans success
11001                                       &theNym);
11002     }
11003 }
11004 
11005 
11006 // the "accountID" on this message will contain the NymID if retrieving a boxreceipt for
11007 // the Nymbox. Otherwise it will contain an AcctID if retrieving a boxreceipt for an Asset Acct.
11008 //
11009 void OTServer::UserCmdGetBoxReceipt(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
11010 {
11011     // (1) set up member variables
11012     msgOut.m_strCommand         = "@getBoxReceipt";         // reply to getBoxReceipt
11013     msgOut.m_strNymID           = MsgIn.m_strNymID;         // UserID
11014 //  msgOut.m_strServerID        = m_strServerID;            // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
11015     msgOut.m_strAcctID          = MsgIn.m_strAcctID;        // the asset account ID (inbox/outbox), or Nym ID (nymbox)
11016     msgOut.m_lTransactionNum    = MsgIn.m_lTransactionNum;  // TransactionNumber for the receipt in the box (unique to the box.)
11017     msgOut.m_lDepth             = MsgIn.m_lDepth;
11018     msgOut.m_bSuccess           = false;
11019 
11020     const OTIdentifier  USER_ID(MsgIn.m_strNymID),
11021                         SERVER_ID(MsgIn.m_strServerID),
11022                         ACCOUNT_ID(MsgIn.m_strAcctID);
11023 
11024     OTLedger * pLedger = NULL;
11025     OTCleanup<OTLedger> theLedgerAngel;
11026 
11027     bool bErrorCondition = false;
11028     bool bSuccessLoading = false;
11029 
11030     switch (MsgIn.m_lDepth)
11031     {
11032         case 0: // Nymbox
11033             if (USER_ID == ACCOUNT_ID)
11034             {
11035                 pLedger = new OTLedger(USER_ID, USER_ID, SERVER_ID);
11036                 OT_ASSERT(NULL != pLedger);
11037                 theLedgerAngel.SetCleanupTarget(*pLedger);
11038                 bSuccessLoading = pLedger->LoadNymbox(); // It's verified using VerifyAccount() below this switch block.
11039             }
11040             else // Inbox / Outbox.
11041             {
11042                 OTLog::vError("OTServer::UserCmdGetBoxReceipt: User requested Nymbox, but failed to provide the "
11043                               "UserID (%s) in the AccountID (%s) field as expected.\n", MsgIn.m_strNymID.Get(),
11044                               MsgIn.m_strAcctID.Get());
11045                 bErrorCondition = true;
11046             }
11047             break;
11048         case 1: // Inbox
11049             if (USER_ID == ACCOUNT_ID)
11050             {
11051                 OTLog::vError("OTServer::UserCmdGetBoxReceipt: User requested Inbox, but erroneously provided the "
11052                               "UserID (%s) in the AccountID (%s) field.\n", MsgIn.m_strNymID.Get(), MsgIn.m_strAcctID.Get());
11053                 bErrorCondition = true;
11054             }
11055             else
11056             {
11057                 pLedger = new OTLedger(USER_ID, ACCOUNT_ID, SERVER_ID);
11058                 OT_ASSERT(NULL != pLedger);
11059                 theLedgerAngel.SetCleanupTarget(*pLedger);
11060                 bSuccessLoading = pLedger->LoadInbox(); // It's verified using VerifyAccount() below this switch block.
11061             }
11062             break;
11063         case 2: // Outbox
11064             if (USER_ID == ACCOUNT_ID)
11065             {
11066                 OTLog::vError("OTServer::UserCmdGetBoxReceipt: User requested Outbox, but erroneously provided the "
11067                               "UserID (%s) in the AccountID (%s) field.\n", MsgIn.m_strNymID.Get(), MsgIn.m_strAcctID.Get());
11068                 bErrorCondition = true;
11069             }
11070             else
11071             {
11072                 pLedger = new OTLedger(USER_ID, ACCOUNT_ID, SERVER_ID);
11073                 OT_ASSERT(NULL != pLedger);
11074                 theLedgerAngel.SetCleanupTarget(*pLedger);
11075                 bSuccessLoading = pLedger->LoadOutbox(); // It's verified using VerifyAccount() below this switch block.
11076             }
11077             break;
11078         default:
11079             OTLog::vError("OTServer::UserCmdGetBoxReceipt: Unknown box type: %ld\n",
11080                           MsgIn.m_lDepth);
11081             bErrorCondition = true;
11082             break;
11083     }
11084     // --------------------------------------------------
11085     // At this point, we have the box loaded. Now let's use it to
11086     // load the appropriate box receipt...
11087 
11088     if (bSuccessLoading                     &&
11089         !bErrorCondition                    &&
11090 //      pLedger->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer) &&  // This call causes all the Box Receipts to be loaded up and we don't need them here, except
11091         pLedger->VerifyContractID()         &&  // for just one, so we're going to VerifyContractID and Signature instead. Then below, we'll
11092         pLedger->VerifySignature(m_nymServer)   // just load the one we actually need.
11093         )
11094     {
11095         OTTransaction * pTransaction = pLedger->GetTransaction(MsgIn.m_lTransactionNum);
11096         if (NULL == pTransaction)
11097         {
11098             OTLog::vError("OTServer::UserCmdGetBoxReceipt: User requested a transaction number "
11099                           "(%ld) that's not in the %s. UserID (%s) and AccountID (%s) FYI.\n",
11100                           MsgIn.m_lTransactionNum,
11101                           (MsgIn.m_lDepth == 0) ? "nymbox" : ((MsgIn.m_lDepth == 1) ? "inbox" : "outbox"), // outbox is 2.
11102                           MsgIn.m_strNymID.Get(), MsgIn.m_strAcctID.Get());
11103             bErrorCondition = true;
11104         }
11105         else
11106         {
11107             pLedger->LoadBoxReceipt(MsgIn.m_lTransactionNum);
11108 
11109             // The above call will replace pTransaction, inside pLedger, with the full version
11110             // (instead of the abbreviated version) of that transaction, meaning that the pTransaction
11111             // pointer is now a bad pointer, if that call was successful.
11112             // Therefore we just call GetTransaction() AGAIN. This way, whether LoadBoxReceipt()
11113             // failed or not (perhaps it's legacy data and is already not abbreviated, and thus the
11114             // LoadBoxReceipt call failed, but that's doesn't mean we're going to fail HERE, now does it?)
11115             //
11116             pTransaction = pLedger->GetTransaction(MsgIn.m_lTransactionNum);
11117 
11118             if ((NULL != pTransaction)              &&
11119                 !pTransaction->IsAbbreviated()      &&
11120                 pTransaction->VerifyContractID()    &&
11121                 pTransaction->VerifySignature(m_nymServer)
11122                 )
11123             {
11124                 // Okay so after finding it, then calling LoadBoxReceipt(), then finding it again,
11125                 // it's definitely not abbreviated by this point. Success!
11126                 // LoadBoxReceipt() already calls VerifyBoxReceipt(), FYI.
11127                 //
11128                 const OTString strBoxReceipt(*pTransaction);
11129                 OT_ASSERT(strBoxReceipt.Exists());
11130 
11131                 msgOut.m_ascPayload.SetString(strBoxReceipt);  // <=================
11132                 msgOut.m_bSuccess = true;
11133 
11134                 OTLog::vOutput(3, "OTServer::UserCmdGetBoxReceipt: Success: User is retrieving the box receipt for transaction number "
11135                                "%ld in the %s for UserID (%s) AccountID (%s).\n",
11136                                MsgIn.m_lTransactionNum, (MsgIn.m_lDepth == 0) ? "nymbox" : ((MsgIn.m_lDepth == 1) ? "inbox" : "outbox"), // outbox is 2.
11137                                MsgIn.m_strNymID.Get(), MsgIn.m_strAcctID.Get());
11138             }
11139             else
11140             {
11141                 OTLog::vError("OTServer::UserCmdGetBoxReceipt: User requested a transaction number (%ld) that's "
11142                               "failing to retrieve from the %s, AFTER calling LoadBoxReceipt(). (Though it worked BEFORE calling it.) "
11143                               "UserID (%s) and AccountID (%s) FYI. IsAbbreviated == %s\n",
11144                               MsgIn.m_lTransactionNum,
11145                               (MsgIn.m_lDepth == 0) ? "nymbox" : ((MsgIn.m_lDepth == 1) ? "inbox" : "outbox"), // outbox is 2.
11146                               MsgIn.m_strNymID.Get(), MsgIn.m_strAcctID.Get(), (NULL == pTransaction) ? "NULL" : (pTransaction->IsAbbreviated()) ? "true" : "false"  );
11147                 bErrorCondition = true;
11148             }
11149         }
11150     }
11151     else
11152     {
11153         OTLog::vError("OTServer::UserCmdGetBoxReceipt: Failed loading or verifying %s. "
11154                       "Transaction (%ld), UserID (%s) and AccountID (%s) FYI.\n",
11155                       (MsgIn.m_lDepth == 0) ? "nymbox" : ((MsgIn.m_lDepth == 1) ? "inbox" : "outbox"), // outbox is 2.
11156                       MsgIn.m_lTransactionNum, MsgIn.m_strNymID.Get(), MsgIn.m_strAcctID.Get());
11157         bErrorCondition = true;
11158     }
11159     // ---------------------------------------------
11160 
11161     // Send the user's command back to him (success or failure.)
11162     //  if (false == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
11163     {
11164         const OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn); // Grab the incoming message in plaintext form
11165         msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage); // Set it into the base64-encoded object on the outgoing message
11166     }
11167 
11168     // (2) Sign the Message
11169     msgOut.SignContract((const OTPseudonym &)m_nymServer);
11170 
11171     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
11172     //
11173     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
11174     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
11175     msgOut.SaveContract();
11176 }
11177 
11178 
11179 
11180 // If the client wants to delete an asset account, the server will allow it...
11181 // ...IF: the Inbox and Outbox are both EMPTY. AND the Balance must be empty as well!
11182 //
11183 void OTServer::UserCmdDeleteAssetAcct(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
11184 {
11185     const char * szFunc = "OTServer::UserCmdDeleteAssetAcct";
11186 
11187     // (1) set up member variables
11188     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@deleteAssetAccount";    // reply to deleteAssetAccount
11189     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID;         // UserID
11190 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
11191     msgOut.m_strAcctID      = MsgIn.m_strAcctID;        // the asset account being deleted.
11192 
11193     const OTIdentifier  USER_ID   (MsgIn.m_strNymID),
11194                         SERVER_ID (MsgIn.m_strServerID),
11195                         ACCOUNT_ID(MsgIn.m_strAcctID);
11196 
11197     OTAccount * pAccount = OTAccount::LoadExistingAccount(ACCOUNT_ID, SERVER_ID);
11198     OTCleanup<OTAccount> theAcctGuardian(pAccount); // This is safe in cases where NULL is returned. No more need to cleanup pAccount.
11199 
11200     if (NULL == pAccount || !pAccount->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer))
11201     {
11202         OTLog::vError("%s: Error loading or verifying account: %s\n",
11203                       szFunc, MsgIn.m_strAcctID.Get());
11204     }
11205     else if (pAccount->GetBalance() != 0)
11206     {
11207         OTLog::vOutput(1, "%s: Failed while trying to delete asset account %s: "
11208                        "Balance must be zero to do this!\n",
11209                        szFunc, MsgIn.m_strAcctID.Get());
11210     }
11211     else
11212     {
11213         OTLedger * pInbox   = pAccount->LoadInbox (m_nymServer);
11214         OTLedger * pOutbox  = pAccount->LoadOutbox(m_nymServer);
11215 
11216         OTCleanup<OTLedger> theInboxAngel(pInbox);
11217         OTCleanup<OTLedger> theOutboxAngel(pOutbox);
11218 
11219         if (NULL == pInbox) // || !pInbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) // NOTE: OTAccount::LoadInbox already verifies.
11220         {
11221             OTLog::vError("%s: Error loading or verifying inbox: %s\n", szFunc, MsgIn.m_strAcctID.Get());
11222         }
11223         else if (NULL == pOutbox) // || !pOutbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) // NOTE: OTAccount::LoadOutbox already verifies.
11224         {
11225             OTLog::vError("%s: Error loading or verifying outbox: %s\n", szFunc, MsgIn.m_strAcctID.Get());
11226         }
11227         else if (pInbox->GetTransactionCount() > 0)
11228         {
11229             OTLog::vOutput(3, "%s: Tried to delete asset account, but there are still "
11230                           "receipts in the Inbox. (Process them first.)\n", szFunc);
11231             msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
11232         }
11233         else if (pOutbox->GetTransactionCount() > 0)
11234         {
11235             OTLog::vOutput(3, "%s: Tried to delete asset account, but there are still "
11236                           "receipts in the Outbox. (Process them first.)\n", szFunc);
11237             msgOut.m_bSuccess = false;
11238         }
11239         else // SUCCESS!
11240         {
11241             msgOut.m_bSuccess = true;
11242 
11243             std::set<std::string> & theAccountSet = theNym.GetSetAssetAccounts();
11244             theAccountSet.erase(MsgIn.m_strAcctID.Get());
11245 
11246             theNym.SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer);
11247             // --------------------------------
11248             OTAssetContract * pContract = GetAssetContract(pAccount->GetAssetTypeID());
11249 
11250             if (NULL == pContract)
11251             {
11252                 const OTString strAssetID(pAccount->GetAssetTypeID());
11253                 OTLog::vError("%s: Error: Unable to get AssetContract for asset type: %s\n",
11254                               szFunc, strAssetID.Get());
11255             }
11256             else if (pContract->IsShares())
11257             {
11258                 // The asset type keeps a list of all accounts for that type.
11259                 // (For shares, not for currencies.)
11260                 //
11261                 const bool bErased = pContract->EraseAccountRecord(pAccount->GetAssetTypeID());
11262                 if (!bErased)
11263                 {
11264                     const OTString strAssetID(pAccount->GetAssetTypeID());
11265                     OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR Erasing Account Record: %s ... Aborting.\n", __FUNCTION__,strAssetID.Get());
11266                     return; //error
11267                 }
11268             }
11269             // -----------------------------------------------
11270             //
11271             pAccount->MarkForDeletion();    // The account isn't actually deleted yet, just marked for deletion.
11272                                             //  It will get cleaned up later, during server maintenance.
11273 
11274             // SAVE the Account... (NOW THAT IT IS MARKED FOR DELETION.)
11275             //
11276             pAccount->ReleaseSignatures();
11277             pAccount->SignContract(m_nymServer);
11278             pAccount->SaveContract();
11279             pAccount->SaveAccount();
11280         }
11281     } // pAccount verifies.
11282     // ----------------------------------------------------
11283 
11284     // Send the user's command back to him (success or failure.)
11285     //  if (false == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
11286     {
11287         OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn); // Grab the incoming message in plaintext form
11288         msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage); // Set it into the base64-encoded object on the outgoing message
11289     }
11290 
11291     // (2) Sign the Message
11292     msgOut.SignContract((const OTPseudonym &)m_nymServer);
11293 
11294     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
11295     //
11296     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
11297     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
11298     msgOut.SaveContract();
11299 
11300     // (You are in UserCmdDeleteAssetAcct.)
11301 
11302     // *************************************************************
11303     // REPLY NOTICE TO NYMBOX
11304     //
11305     // Now that we signed / saved the reply message...
11306     //
11307     // After specific messages, we drop a notice with a copy of the server's reply
11308     // into the Nymbox.  This way we are GUARANTEED that the Nym will receive and process
11309     // it. (And thus never get out of sync.)
11310     //
11311     if (msgOut.m_bSuccess)
11312     {
11313         const OTString strReplyMessage(msgOut);
11314         const int64_t lReqNum = atol(MsgIn.m_strRequestNum.Get());
11315 
11316         // If it fails, it logs already.
11317         this->DropReplyNoticeToNymbox(SERVER_ID, USER_ID, strReplyMessage, lReqNum,
11318                                       false,   // trans success (not a transaction.)
11319                                       &theNym);
11320     }
11321 }
11322 
11323 
11324 
11325 
11326 
11327 void OTServer::UserCmdGetNymbox(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
11328 {
11329     // (1) set up member variables
11330     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@getNymbox"; // reply to getNymbox
11331     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
11332 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
11333 
11334     const
11335     OTIdentifier USER_ID(MsgIn.m_strNymID), SERVER_ID(MsgIn.m_strServerID);
11336     OTIdentifier NYMBOX_HASH;
11337     bool bSavedNymbox = false;
11338 
11339     OTLedger theLedger(USER_ID, USER_ID, SERVER_ID);
11340 
11341     msgOut.m_bSuccess = theLedger.LoadNymbox();
11342     bool bCalculated  = false;
11343 
11344     if (!msgOut.m_bSuccess)
11345         OTLog::Error("OTServer::UserCmdGetNymbox: Failed trying to load Nymbox from storage.\n");
11346     else
11347     {
11348         // We do NOT call VerifyAccount in this function (because we don't need to) and thus we do NOT
11349         // force the box receipts to be loaded here (which happens inside that call.) But we DO verify
11350         // the IDs and the Signature, of course.
11351         //
11352         msgOut.m_bSuccess = (theLedger.VerifyContractID() && theLedger.VerifySignature(m_nymServer));
11353 
11354         // If we loaded old data in this file... (when whole receipts were stored in boxes.)
11355         //
11356         if (msgOut.m_bSuccess && theLedger.LoadedLegacyData())  // (which automatically saves the box receipt as the old data is loaded...)
11357         {
11358 //          msgOut.m_bSuccess = theLedger.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer);   // Then Verify, which forces a LoadBoxReceipts... (
11359 
11360             theLedger.ReleaseSignatures();              // UPDATE: We do NOT force the loading here, since they aren't needed.
11361             theLedger.SignContract(m_nymServer);        // Waste of resources. Instead, we recognize that it was old data, and so
11362             theLedger.SaveContract();                   // we gracefully re-save in the new format, so it won't repeatedly be
11363             theLedger.SaveNymbox(&NYMBOX_HASH);         // loaded over and over again in the large filesize.
11364 
11365             bSavedNymbox = true;
11366         }
11367         // ----------------------------------------------
11368         if (!msgOut.m_bSuccess)
11369             OTLog::Error("OTServer::UserCmdGetNymbox: Verification failed on Nymbox after loading.\n");
11370     }
11371 
11372     if (true == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
11373     {
11374         // extract the ledger in ascii-armored form on the outgoing message
11375         OTString strPayload(theLedger); // first grab it in plaintext string form
11376         msgOut.m_ascPayload.SetString(strPayload);  // now the outgoing message has the nymbox ledger in its payload in base64 form.
11377     }
11378     // Send the user's command back to him if failure.
11379     else
11380     {
11381         OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn); // Grab the incoming message in plaintext form
11382         msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage); // Set it into the base64-encoded object on the outgoing message
11383     }
11384     // -------------------------
11385 
11386     if (bSavedNymbox)
11387     {
11388         // Todo: make objects (like nyms) "saveable", and ability to get "dirty". (To prevent multiple
11389         // redundant saves.)
11390         theNym.SetNymboxHashServerSide(NYMBOX_HASH);    // Save the hash onto the Nym
11391         theNym.SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer);
11392 
11393         NYMBOX_HASH.GetString(msgOut.m_strNymboxHash);  // Get the hash onto the message
11394     }
11395     else if (true == msgOut.m_bSuccess)
11396     {
11397         bCalculated = theLedger.CalculateNymboxHash(NYMBOX_HASH);
11398 
11399         theNym.SetNymboxHashServerSide(NYMBOX_HASH);    // Save the hash onto the Nym
11400         theNym.SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer);
11401 
11402         NYMBOX_HASH.GetString(msgOut.m_strNymboxHash);  // Get the hash onto the message
11403     }
11404     else
11405     {
11406         OTIdentifier EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH;
11407         if (theNym.GetNymboxHashServerSide(SERVER_ID, EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH)) // if hash exists already for nym...
11408             EXISTING_NYMBOX_HASH.GetString(msgOut.m_strNymboxHash);          // ...then set it onto the message.
11409     }
11410     // -------------------------
11411 
11412     // (2) Sign the Message
11413     msgOut.SignContract((const OTPseudonym &)m_nymServer); // todo const_cast
11414 
11415     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
11416     //
11417     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
11418     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
11419     msgOut.SaveContract();
11420 }
11421 
11422 
11423 
11424 
11425 
11426 
11427 void OTServer::UserCmdProcessNymbox(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
11428 {
11429     // (1) set up member variables
11430     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@processNymbox"; // reply to processNymbox
11431     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
11432 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
11433 
11434     const OTIdentifier  USER_ID(msgOut.m_strNymID),
11435                         SERVER_ID(m_strServerID),
11436                         SERVER_USER_ID(m_nymServer);
11437 
11438     OTLedger theLedger(USER_ID, USER_ID, SERVER_ID);    // These are ledgers used as messages. The one we received
11439                                                         // and the one we're sending back.
11440     OTLedger * pResponseLedger = OTLedger::GenerateLedger(SERVER_USER_ID, USER_ID, SERVER_ID, OTLedger::message, false); // bCreateFile=false
11441     OTCleanup<OTLedger> theRespLedgerGuardian(pResponseLedger);
11442 
11443     // Grab the string (containing the request ledger) out of ascii-armored form.
11444     OTString strLedger(MsgIn.m_ascPayload);
11445 
11446     bool bTransSuccess = false;
11447 
11448     // --------------------------
11449     const
11450     OTIdentifier  theMsgNymboxHash(MsgIn.m_strNymboxHash);    // theMsgNymboxHash is the hash sent by the client side
11451     OTIdentifier  theSrvrNymboxHash;
11452 
11453     bool bGotNymboxHashServerSide = theNym.GetNymboxHashServerSide(SERVER_ID, theSrvrNymboxHash);
11454 
11455     if (bGotNymboxHashServerSide)  // theSrvrNymboxHash is the hash stored on the server side
11456         theSrvrNymboxHash.GetString(msgOut.m_strNymboxHash);
11457     else {
11458         OTLog::vOutput(1,"%s: We cannot obtain server side nymbox hash, will continue.\n",__FUNCTION__);
11459     }
11460 
11461     const bool bGotNymboxHashClientSide = MsgIn.m_strNymboxHash.Exists();
11462 
11463     if (!bGotNymboxHashClientSide) {
11464         OTLog::vOutput(1, "%s: We don't have a client side nymbox hash, will continue\n", __FUNCTION__);
11465     }
11466 
11467     if (bGotNymboxHashServerSide && bGotNymboxHashClientSide)
11468         if (theMsgNymboxHash != theSrvrNymboxHash) {
11469             OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: The server and client nymbox hashes missmatch! rejecting message.\n", __FUNCTION__);
11470             goto send_message;
11471         }
11472 
11473 
11474     // theLedger contains a single transaction from the client, with an item inside
11475     // for each inbox transaction the client wants to accept or reject.
11476     // Let's see if we can load it from the string that came in the message...
11477     //
11478     msgOut.m_bSuccess = theLedger.LoadContractFromString(strLedger);
11479     if (msgOut.m_bSuccess) // Yes, that is an assignment operator.
11480     {
11481         // In this case we need to process the transaction items from the ledger
11482         // and create a corresponding transaction where each of the new items
11483         // contains the answer to the transaction item sent.
11484         // Then we send that new "response ledger" back to the user in MsgOut.Payload
11485         // as an @processNymbox message.
11486 
11487         if (theLedger.GetTransactionCount() == 0)
11488         {
11489             OTTransaction * pTranResponse =
11490                 OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(*pResponseLedger,
11491                                                OTTransaction::error_state,
11492                                                0);
11493             pTranResponse->SignContract(m_nymServer);
11494             pTranResponse->SaveContract();
11495 
11496             // Add the response transaction to the response ledger.
11497             // That will go into the response message and be sent back to the client.
11498             pResponseLedger->AddTransaction(*pTranResponse);
11499         }
11500         FOR_EACH(mapOfTransactions, theLedger.GetTransactionMap())
11501         {
11502             OTTransaction * pTransaction = (*it).second;
11503             OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pTransaction, "NULL transaction pointer in OTServer::UserCmdProcessNymbox\n");
11504 
11505             // for each transaction in the ledger, we create a transaction response and add
11506             // that to the response ledger.
11507             OTTransaction * pTranResponse =
11508                 OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(*pResponseLedger,
11509                                                    OTTransaction::error_state,
11510                                                    pTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
11511 
11512             // Add the response transaction to the response ledger.
11513             // That will go into the response message and be sent back to the client.
11514             pResponseLedger->AddTransaction(*pTranResponse);
11515 
11516             // Now let's make sure the response transaction has a copy of the transaction
11517             // it is responding to.
11518             //
11519 //          OTString strResponseTo;
11520 //          pTransaction->SaveContract(strResponseTo);
11521 //          pTranResponse->m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(strResponseTo);
11522             //
11523             // I commented out the above because we are keeping too many copies.
11524             // Message contains a copy of the message it's responding to.
11525             // Then each transaction contains a copy of the transaction responding to...
11526             // Then each ITEM in each transaction contains a copy of each item it's responding to.
11527             //
11528             // Therefore, for the "processNymbox" message, I have decided (for now) to have
11529             // the extra copy in the items themselves, and in the overall message, but not in the
11530             // transactions. Thus, the above is commented out.
11531 
11532 
11533             // It should always return something. Success, or failure, that goes into pTranResponse.
11534             // I don't think there's need for more return value than that. The user has gotten deep
11535             // enough that they deserve SOME sort of response.
11536             //
11537             // This function also SIGNS the transaction, so there is no need to sign it after this.
11538             // There's also no point to change it after this, unless you plan to sign it twice.
11539             NotarizeProcessNymbox(theNym, *pTransaction, *pTranResponse, bTransSuccess);
11540 
11541             pTranResponse = NULL; // at this point, the ledger now "owns" the response, and will handle deleting it.
11542         }
11543 
11544         // DONE (Notices go to Nymbox now): should consider saving a copy of the response
11545         // ledger here on the server.
11546         // Until the user signs off of the responses, maybe the user didn't receive them.
11547         // The server should be able to re-send them until confirmation, then delete them.
11548         // So might want to consider a SAVE TO FILE here of that ledger we're sending out...
11549     }
11550     else
11551     {
11552         OTLog::Error("ERROR loading ledger from message in OTServer::UserCmdProcessNymbox\n");
11553     }
11554 
11555 send_message:
11556 
11557     // sign the ledger
11558     pResponseLedger->SignContract(m_nymServer);
11559     pResponseLedger->SaveContract();
11560     // extract the ledger in ascii-armored form
11561     OTString strPayload(*pResponseLedger);
11562     // now the outgoing message has the response ledger in its payload.
11563     msgOut.m_ascPayload.SetString(strPayload);
11564 
11565     // todo: consider commenting this out since the transaction reply items already include a copy
11566     // of the original client communication that the server is responding to. No point beating a
11567     // dead horse.
11568     //
11569     // Send the user's command back to him as well.
11570     {
11571         OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn);
11572         msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage);
11573     }
11574 
11575     // -------------------------------------------------------
11576     // UPDATE NYMBOX HASH IN OUTGOING MESSAGE
11577     //
11578     // We already grabbed the server's NymboxHash near the top of this function,
11579     // and attached it to the outgoing reply message.
11580     //
11581     // However, the above block may have CHANGED this hash! Therefore, we grab it
11582     // AGAIN, just in case. This way a failed message will receive the old hash,
11583     // and a successful message will receive the new hash.
11584     //
11585     bGotNymboxHashServerSide = theNym.GetNymboxHashServerSide(SERVER_ID, theSrvrNymboxHash);
11586     if (bGotNymboxHashServerSide)  // theSrvrNymboxHash is the hash stored on the server side
11587         theSrvrNymboxHash.GetString(msgOut.m_strNymboxHash);
11588     // -------------------------------------------------------
11589 
11590     // (2) Sign the Message
11591     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
11592 
11593     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
11594     //
11595     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
11596     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
11597     msgOut.SaveContract();
11598 
11599 
11600     // (You are in UserCmdProcessNymbox.)
11601 
11602     // *************************************************************
11603     // REPLY NOTICE TO NYMBOX
11604     //
11605     // Now that we signed / saved the reply message...
11606     //
11607     // After specific messages, we drop a notice with a copy of the server's reply
11608     // into the Nymbox.  This way we are GUARANTEED that the Nym will receive and process
11609     // it. (And thus never get out of sync.)
11610     //
11611     if (msgOut.m_bSuccess)
11612     {
11613         const OTString strReplyMessage(msgOut);
11614         const int64_t lReqNum = atol(MsgIn.m_strRequestNum.Get());
11615 
11616         // If it fails, it logs already.
11617         this->DropReplyNoticeToNymbox(SERVER_ID, USER_ID, strReplyMessage, lReqNum,    // (We don't want to update the NymboxHash on the Nym, here in processNymbox, at least, not at this current point AFTER the reply message has already been signed.)
11618                                       bTransSuccess);
11619 //      this->DropReplyNoticeToNymbox(SERVER_ID, USER_ID, strReplyMessage, lReqNum, bTransSuccess, &theNym); // Only pass theNym if you want it to contain the LATEST hash. (Some messages don't.)
11620     }
11621 }
11622 
11623 
11624 
11625 
11626 
11632 //
11633 // The processNymbox TRANSACTION has a series of TRANSACTION ITEMS. One is the transaction
11634 // statement (which is like a balance agreement, except there's no balance, since there's no
11635 // asset account.) The rest are *items* IN REFERENCE TO some *transaction* in my Nymbox (signing
11636 // to accept it.) At this point you can't really reject Nymbox receipts, just like you can't
11637 // reject inbox receipts. Why not? Haven't coded it yet. So your items on your processNymbox
11638 // transaction can only accept things (notices, new transaction numbers,
11639 //
11640 //
11641 //
11642 void OTServer::NotarizeProcessNymbox(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTTransaction & tranIn, OTTransaction & tranOut, bool & bOutSuccess)
11643 {
11644     // The outgoing transaction is an "atProcessNymbox", that is, "a reply to the process nymbox request"
11645     tranOut.SetType(OTTransaction::atProcessNymbox);
11646     // -------------------------------------------------------------------
11647     OTItem * pItem          = NULL;
11648     OTItem * pBalanceItem   = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::transactionStatement);
11649     OTItem * pResponseItem  = NULL;
11650     OTItem * pResponseBalanceItem   = NULL;
11651 
11652     // Grab the actual server ID from this object, and use it as the server ID here.
11653     const OTIdentifier SERVER_ID(m_strServerID), USER_ID(theNym);
11654     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
11655     OTPseudonym theTempNym;
11656 
11657     OTLedger theNymbox(USER_ID, USER_ID, SERVER_ID);
11658     OTString strNymID(USER_ID);
11659 
11660     bool bSuccessLoadingNymbox  = theNymbox.LoadNymbox();
11661 
11662     if (true == bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
11663         bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = theNymbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer); // make sure it's all good.
11664     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
11665     pResponseBalanceItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atTransactionStatement);
11666     pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
11667     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseBalanceItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
11668     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
11669     bool           bNymboxHashRegenerated = false;
11670     OTIdentifier   NYMBOX_HASH; // In case the Nymbox hash is updated, we will have the updated version here.
11671     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
11672     if (false == bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
11673     {
11674         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: Failed loading or verifying Nymbox for user:\n%s\n",
11675                       __FUNCTION__, strNymID.Get());
11676     }
11677     else if (NULL == pBalanceItem)
11678     {
11679         const OTString strTransaction(tranIn);
11680         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::%s: No Transaction Agreement item found on this transaction %ld (required):\n\n%s\n\n",
11681                        __FUNCTION__, tranIn.GetTransactionNum(), strTransaction.Get());
11682     }
11683     else
11684     {
11685         OTString strBalanceItem;
11686 
11687         pBalanceItem->SaveContractRaw(strBalanceItem);
11688 
11689         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceString(strBalanceItem); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
11690         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceToNum(pBalanceItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to tranIn's balance agreement
11691 
11692         // The incoming transaction accepts various messages and transaction numbers.
11693         // So when it's all finished, my list of transaction numbers will be higher.
11694         //
11695         // I would like to not even process the whole giant loop below,
11696         // if I can verify here now that the transaction agreement is wrong.
11697         //
11698         // Thus I will actually loop through the acceptTransaction items in tranIn, and then for each one, I'll
11699         // lookup the ACTUAL transaction in the nymbox, and get its ACTUAL value. (And store them all up on a temp nym.)
11700         //
11701         // The ones being accepted will therefore be added to my Nym, so the Transaction Statement will be signed
11702         // as if that is already the case. (So they'll match.)
11703         //
11704         // I need to add them all to the Nym, verify the transaction statement, and then remove them again.
11705         // (which is why I stored them on a temp Nym :-) Then if it succeeds for real, at the bottom of this function,
11706         // I'll go ahead and add them properly (so it adds them to both lists.)
11707         //
11708 
11709         bool bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = true;
11710 
11711         FOR_EACH(listOfItems, tranIn.GetItemList())
11712         {
11713             pItem = *it;
11714             OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pItem, "Pointer should not have been NULL.");
11715 
11716             if (pItem->GetType() == OTItem::acceptTransaction)
11717             {
11718                 OTTransaction * pTransaction = theNymbox.GetTransaction(pItem->GetReferenceToNum());
11719 
11720                 if ((NULL != pTransaction) && (pTransaction->GetType() == OTTransaction::blank)) // The user is referencing a blank in the nymbox, which indeed is actually there.
11721                 {
11722                     bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = true;
11723 
11724                     OTNumList listNumbersNymbox, listNumbersUserItem;
11725 
11726                     pItem->GetNumList(listNumbersUserItem);
11727                     pTransaction->GetNumList(listNumbersNymbox);
11728 
11729                     // MAKE SURE THEY MATCH. (Otherwise user could be signing numbers that differ from the
11730                     // actual ones in the Nymbox.)
11731                     //
11732                     if (false == listNumbersNymbox.Verify(listNumbersUserItem))
11733                         OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeProcessNymbox: Failed verifying: The numbers on the actual blank "
11734                                      "transaction in the nymbox do not match the list of numbers sent over by the user.\n");
11735                     // ------------------------------------------
11736                     else    // INSTEAD of merely adding the TRANSACTION NUMBER of the blank to the Nym,
11737                     {       // we actually add an entire list of numbers retrieved from the blank, including
11738                             // its main number.
11739                         std::set<int64_t> theNumbers;
11740                         listNumbersNymbox.Output(theNumbers);
11741 
11742                         // Looping through the transaction numbers on the Nymbox blank transaction.
11743                         // (There's probably 20 of them.)
11744                         //
11745                         FOR_EACH(std::set<int64_t>, theNumbers)
11746                         {
11747                             const int64_t lTransactionNumber = *it;
11748                             // -----------------------------------------------
11749                             // (We don't add it if it's already there.)
11750                             //
11751                             if (false == theNym.VerifyIssuedNum(m_strServerID, lTransactionNumber))
11752                             {
11753                                 theNym.AddIssuedNum(m_strServerID, lTransactionNumber);
11754                                 theTempNym.AddIssuedNum(m_strServerID, lTransactionNumber); // so I can remove from theNym after VerifyTransactionStatement call
11755                             }
11756                             else
11757                                 OTLog::vError("OTServer::NotarizeProcessNymbox: tried to add an issued trans# (%ld) to a nym who "
11758                                               "ALREADY had that number...\n", lTransactionNumber);
11759                         }
11760                     }
11761                     // ------------------------------------------
11762                 }
11763                 else
11764                 {
11765                     bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = false;
11766                     break;
11767                 }
11768             }
11769         }
11770 
11771 
11772         // NOTICE: We're adding up all the new transaction numbers being added. (OTItem::acceptTransaction)...
11773         // but we're NOT bothering with the ones being REMOVED (OTItem::acceptFinalReceipt) here in NotarizeProecessNymbox.
11774         // Why not? BECAUSE THEY WERE ALREADY REMOVED. They were removed when the Cron Item expired, or was canceled.
11775         // The finalReceipt notice that went into the Nymbox was ONLY A COURTESY -- the NUMBER was ALREADY REMOVED.
11776         // Thus, we don't need to remove it now, although we DO need to add the new transaction numbers (acceptTransaction).
11777         //
11778         // (Of course, I will still remove the finalReceipt from the Nymbox. I just don't have to juggle any
11779         // transaction numbers on the NYM as a result of this.)
11780         //
11781         // ------------------------------------------
11782 
11783         if (false == bSuccessFindingAllTransactions)
11784         {
11785             OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: transactions in processNymbox message do not match actual nymbox.\n", __FUNCTION__);
11786 
11787             // Remove all issued nums from theNym that are stored on theTempNym HERE.
11788             for (int32_t i = 0; i < theTempNym.GetIssuedNumCount(SERVER_ID); i++)
11789             {
11790                 int64_t lTemp = theTempNym.GetIssuedNum(SERVER_ID, i);
11791                 theNym.RemoveIssuedNum(m_strServerID, lTemp);
11792             }
11793         }
11794         // (else true == success finding all transaction...)
11795         //
11796         // **********************************************************************************
11797         // VERIFY TRANSACTION STATEMENT!
11798         //
11799         else if (false == pBalanceItem->VerifyTransactionStatement(theNym, tranIn, false)) // bIsRealTransaction=false (since we're doing Nymbox) // <========
11800         {
11801             OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: ERROR verifying transaction statement.\n", __FUNCTION__);
11802 
11803             // Remove all issued nums from theNym that are stored on theTempNym HERE.
11804             for (int32_t i = 0; i < theTempNym.GetIssuedNumCount(SERVER_ID); i++)
11805             {
11806                 int64_t lTemp = theTempNym.GetIssuedNum(SERVER_ID, i);
11807                 theNym.RemoveIssuedNum(m_strServerID, lTemp);
11808             }
11809         }
11810         // **********************************************************************************
11811 
11812         else // TRANSACTION AGREEMENT WAS SUCCESSFUL.......
11813         {
11814             // Remove all issued nums from theNym that are stored on theTempNym HERE.
11815             for (int32_t i = 0; i < theTempNym.GetIssuedNumCount(SERVER_ID); i++)
11816             {
11817                 int64_t lTemp = theTempNym.GetIssuedNum(SERVER_ID, i);
11818                 theNym.RemoveIssuedNum(m_strServerID, lTemp);
11819             }
11820 
11821             pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the transaction statement was successful.
11822 
11823             // --------------------------------------------------------------------
11824 
11825             // THE ABOVE LOOP WAS JUST A TEST RUN
11826             //
11827             // (TO **VERIFY TRANSACTION STATEMENT** BEFORE WE BOTHERED TO RUN THIS LOOP BELOW...)
11828             // (AND ALSO SO WE COULD GET THE LIST OF NUMBERS FOR THE STATEMENT ONTO TEMP NYM.)
11829 
11830             // loop through the items that make up the incoming transaction, and add them
11831             // to the Nym, and remove them from the Nymbox, as appropriate.
11832             //
11833             FOR_EACH(listOfItems, tranIn.GetItemList())
11834             {
11835                 pItem = *it;
11836                 OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pItem, "Pointer should not have been NULL.");
11837 
11838                 // We already handled this one (if we're even in this block in the first place.)
11839                 //
11840                 if (OTItem::transactionStatement == pItem->GetType())
11841                 {
11842                     continue;
11843                 }
11844 
11845                 // If the client sent an accept item then let's process it.
11846                 if (
11847                     (OTItem::request == pItem->GetStatus())
11848                     &&
11849                     (
11850                      (OTItem::acceptFinalReceipt== pItem->GetType()) || // Clearing out a finalReceipt notice.
11851                      (OTItem::acceptTransaction == pItem->GetType()) || // Accepting new transaction number.
11852                      (OTItem::acceptMessage     == pItem->GetType()) || // Accepted message.
11853                      (OTItem::acceptNotice      == pItem->GetType())    // Accepted server notification.
11854                     )
11855                    )
11856                 {
11857                     OTString strInReferenceTo;
11858 
11859                     // The response item will contain a copy of the "accept" request.
11860                     // So I'm just setting aside a copy now for those purposes later.
11861                     pItem->SaveContractRaw(strInReferenceTo);
11862 
11863                     OTItem::itemType theReplyItemType;
11864                     switch (pItem->GetType())
11865                     {
11866                         case OTItem::acceptFinalReceipt:
11867                             theReplyItemType = OTItem::atAcceptFinalReceipt;
11868                             break;
11869                         case OTItem::acceptTransaction:
11870                             theReplyItemType = OTItem::atAcceptTransaction;
11871                             break;
11872                         case OTItem::acceptMessage:
11873                             theReplyItemType = OTItem::atAcceptMessage;
11874                             break;
11875                         case OTItem::acceptNotice:
11876                             theReplyItemType = OTItem::atAcceptNotice;
11877                             break;
11878                         default:
11879                             OTLog::Error("Should never happen.\n");
11880                             theReplyItemType = OTItem::error_state; // should never happen based on above 'if' statement.
11881                             continue;                                   // saving this anyway just cause it's cleaner.
11882                     }
11883 
11884 
11885                     // Server response item being added to server response transaction (tranOut)
11886                     // They're getting SOME sort of response item.
11887 
11888                     pResponseItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, theReplyItemType);
11889                     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
11890                     pResponseItem->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
11891 //                  pResponseItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This was just 0 every time, since Nymbox needs no transaction numbers.
11892                     pResponseItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetReferenceToNum()); // So the reference was useless. I'm hoping to change it to this and make sure nothing breaks.
11893                                                                                   // ReferenceNum actually means you can match it up against the request items, and also, that is where THEY store it.
11894                     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
11895 
11896 
11897                     // *******************************************************************************************
11898 
11899 
11900                     OTTransaction * pServerTransaction = NULL;
11901 
11902                     if (
11903                              (NULL != (pServerTransaction = theNymbox.GetTransaction(pItem->GetReferenceToNum())))
11904                              &&
11905                              (
11906                               (OTTransaction::finalReceipt      == pServerTransaction->GetType()) ||    // finalReceipt (notice that an opening num was closed.)
11907                               (OTTransaction::blank             == pServerTransaction->GetType()) ||    // new transaction number waiting to be picked up.
11908                               (OTTransaction::message           == pServerTransaction->GetType()) ||    // message in the nymbox
11909                               (OTTransaction::replyNotice       == pServerTransaction->GetType()) ||    // replyNotice containing a server reply to a previous request. (Some replies are so important, this is used to make sure users get them.)
11910                               (OTTransaction::successNotice     == pServerTransaction->GetType()) ||    // successNotice that you signed out a transaction#.
11911                               (OTTransaction::notice            == pServerTransaction->GetType()) ||    // server notification, in the nymbox
11912                               (OTTransaction::instrumentNotice  == pServerTransaction->GetType())       // A financial instrument sent from another user. (Nymbox=>PaymentInbox)
11913                              )
11914                        )
11915                     {
11916                         // the accept item will come with the transaction number that
11917                         // it's referring to. So we'll just look up that transaction
11918                         // in the nymbox, and now that it's been accepted, we'll process it.
11919 
11920                         // At this point, pItem points to the client's attempt to accept pServerTransaction
11921                         // and pServerTransaction is the server's created transaction in my nymbox that might
11922                         // have a message or transaction number on it I might find useful.
11923 
11924 
11925                         // What are we doing in this code?
11926                         //
11927                         // I need to accept various items that are sitting in my nymbox, such as:
11928                         //
11929                         // -- transaction numbers waiting to be accepted (they cannot be rejected.)
11930                         //
11931                         // -- messages waiting to be accepted (they cannot be rejected.)
11932                         //
11933 
11934                         // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
11935 
11936                         // The below block only executes for ACCEPTING a MESSAGE
11937                         if (
11938                             (OTItem::acceptMessage  == pItem->GetType())
11939                             &&
11940                             (OTTransaction::message == pServerTransaction->GetType())
11941                             )
11942                         {
11943                             // pItem contains the current user's attempt to accept the
11944                             // ['message'] located in pServerTransaction.
11945                             // Now we have the user's item and the item he is trying to accept.
11946                             pServerTransaction->DeleteBoxReceipt(theNymbox); // faster.
11947 //                          theNymbox.  DeleteBoxReceipt(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
11948                             theNymbox.  RemoveTransaction(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
11949 
11950                             theNymbox.  ReleaseSignatures();
11951                             theNymbox.  SignContract(m_nymServer);
11952                             theNymbox.  SaveContract();
11953                             theNymbox.  SaveNymbox();
11954 
11955                             // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
11956                             pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
11957                         }// its type is OTItem::aacceptMessage
11958 
11959 
11960                         // The below block only executes for ACCEPTING a NOTICE
11961                         else if (
11962                                  (OTItem::acceptNotice  == pItem->GetType())
11963                                  &&
11964                                  (
11965                                   (OTTransaction::notice            == pServerTransaction->GetType()) ||
11966                                   (OTTransaction::replyNotice       == pServerTransaction->GetType()) ||
11967                                   (OTTransaction::successNotice     == pServerTransaction->GetType()) ||
11968                                   (OTTransaction::instrumentNotice  == pServerTransaction->GetType())
11969                                   )
11970                                  )
11971                         {
11972                             // pItem contains the current user's attempt to accept the
11973                             // ['notice'] or replyNotice or successNotice or instrumentNotice
11974                             // located in pServerTransaction.
11975                             // Now we have the user's item and the item he is trying to accept.
11976 
11977                             pServerTransaction->DeleteBoxReceipt(theNymbox); // faster.
11978 //                          theNymbox.  DeleteBoxReceipt(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
11979                             theNymbox.  RemoveTransaction(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
11980 
11981                             theNymbox.  ReleaseSignatures();
11982                             theNymbox.  SignContract(m_nymServer);
11983                             theNymbox.  SaveContract();
11984                             theNymbox.  SaveNymbox();
11985 
11986                             // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
11987                             pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
11988 
11989                         }// its type is OTItem::acceptNotice
11990 
11991 
11992                         // The below block only executes for ACCEPTING a TRANSACTION NUMBER
11993                         // It also places a success notice into the Nymbox, to solve sync issues.
11994                         // (We'll make SURE the client got the notice! Probably should do this
11995                         // for cash withdrawals as well...)
11996                         else if (
11997                                  (OTItem::acceptTransaction == pItem->GetType())
11998                                  &&
11999                                  (OTTransaction::blank == pServerTransaction->GetType())
12000                                 )
12001                         {
12002                             // -----------------------------------------------
12003                             // Add the success notice to the Nymbox, so if the Nym fails to see the server reply, he can still get his
12004                             // transaction # later, from the notice, instead of going out of sync.
12005                             //
12006                             int64_t lSuccessNoticeTransNum=0;
12007                             bool bGotNextTransNum = IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lSuccessNoticeTransNum, false); // bool bStoreTheNumber = false
12008 
12009                             if (!bGotNextTransNum)
12010                             {
12011                                 lSuccessNoticeTransNum = 0;
12012                                 OTLog::Error("Error getting next transaction number in OTServer::NotarizeProcessNymbox for OTTransaction::blank (for the successNotice)\n");
12013                             }
12014                             else
12015                             {
12016                                 // Drop SUCCESS NOTICE in the Nymbox
12017                                 //
12018                                 OTTransaction * pSuccessNotice = OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(theNymbox, OTTransaction::successNotice, lSuccessNoticeTransNum);
12019 
12020                                 if (NULL != pSuccessNotice) // The above has an OT_ASSERT within, but I just like to check my pointers.
12021                                 {
12022                                     // If I accepted blank trans#10, then this successNotice is in reference to #10.
12023                                     //
12024                                     pSuccessNotice->    SetReferenceToNum(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
12025 
12026                                     // Contains a copy of the OTItem where I actually accepted the blank transaction #.
12027                                     // (which generated the notice in the first place...)
12028                                     //
12029                                     pSuccessNotice->    SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo);
12030 
12031                                     OTNumList theOutput;
12032                                     pServerTransaction->GetNumList(theOutput); // now theOutput contains the numlist from the server-side nymbox's copy of the blank. (containing 20 transaction #s)
12033 
12034                                     pSuccessNotice->AddNumbersToTransaction(theOutput); // Now we add those numbers to the success notice. That way client can add those numbers to his issued and transaction lists.
12035 
12036                                     pSuccessNotice->    SignContract(m_nymServer);
12037                                     pSuccessNotice->    SaveContract();
12038 
12039                                     theNymbox.AddTransaction(*pSuccessNotice); // Add the successNotice to the nymbox. It takes ownership.
12040 
12041                                     pSuccessNotice->SaveBoxReceipt(theNymbox);
12042                                 }
12043                             }
12044                             // -----------------------------------------------
12045                             // pItem contains the current user's attempt to accept the
12046                             // transaction number located in pServerTransaction.
12047                             // Now we have the user's item and the item he is trying to accept.
12048 
12049                             // Here we remove the blank transaction that was just accepted.
12050                             //
12051                             pServerTransaction->DeleteBoxReceipt(theNymbox); // faster.
12052 //                          theNymbox.  DeleteBoxReceipt(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
12053                             theNymbox.  RemoveTransaction(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
12054 
12055                             theNymbox.  ReleaseSignatures();
12056                             theNymbox.  SignContract(m_nymServer);
12057                             theNymbox.  SaveContract();
12058                             theNymbox.  SaveNymbox(&NYMBOX_HASH);
12059 
12060                             bNymboxHashRegenerated = true;
12061 
12062                             // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
12063                             pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
12064                         }
12065 
12066                         // The below block only executes for CLEARING a finalReceipt
12067                         // (an OPENING TRANSACTION NUMBER was already removed), and this was
12068                         // a notice that that had occurred. The client has seen the notice and is
12069                         // now clearing it from the box.
12070                         else if (
12071                                  (OTItem::acceptFinalReceipt == pItem->GetType())
12072                                  &&
12073                                  (OTTransaction::finalReceipt == pServerTransaction->GetType())
12074                                  )
12075                         {
12076                             // pItem contains the current user's attempt to clear the
12077                             // finalReceipt located in pServerTransaction.
12078                             // Now we have the user's item and the item he is trying to accept.
12079 
12080                             pServerTransaction->DeleteBoxReceipt(theNymbox); // faster.
12081 //                          theNymbox.  DeleteBoxReceipt(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
12082                             theNymbox.  RemoveTransaction(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
12083 
12084                             theNymbox.  ReleaseSignatures();
12085                             theNymbox.  SignContract(m_nymServer);
12086                             theNymbox.  SaveContract();
12087                             theNymbox.  SaveNymbox(&NYMBOX_HASH);
12088 
12089                             bNymboxHashRegenerated = true;
12090 
12091                             // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
12092                             pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
12093                         }
12094                     }
12095                     else
12096                     {
12097                         OTLog::vError("Error finding original Nymbox transaction that client is trying to accept: %ld\n",
12098                                       pItem->GetReferenceToNum());
12099                     }
12100 
12101                     // sign the response item before sending it back (it's already been added to the transaction above)
12102                     // Now, whether it was rejection or acknowledgement, it is set properly and it is signed, and it
12103                     // is owned by the transaction, who will take it from here.
12104                     pResponseItem->ReleaseSignatures();
12105                     pResponseItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
12106                     pResponseItem->SaveContract();
12107                 }
12108                 else
12109                 {
12110                     const int32_t nStatus   = pItem->GetStatus();
12111                     OTString strItemType;
12112                     pItem->GetTypeString(strItemType);
12113 
12114                     OTLog::vError("Error, unexpected item type (%s) and/or status (%d) in OTServer::NotarizeProcessNymbox\n",
12115                                  strItemType.Get(), nStatus);
12116                 } // if type == ACCEPT (only)
12117             } // for each item
12118 
12119 
12120         } // else (balance agreement verified.)
12121     } // Balance Agreement item found.
12122 
12123     // ----------------------------------------
12124     pResponseBalanceItem->ReleaseSignatures();
12125     pResponseBalanceItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
12126     pResponseBalanceItem->SaveContract();
12127     // ----------------------------------------
12128     tranOut.ReleaseSignatures();
12129     tranOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
12130     tranOut.SaveContract();
12131     // ----------------------------------------
12132 
12133     if (bNymboxHashRegenerated)
12134     {
12135         theNym.SetNymboxHashServerSide(NYMBOX_HASH); // server-side
12136         theNym.SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer); // todo: make objects like nym saveable and dirty-able, so they are only saved once and not multiple times redundantly.
12137     }
12138     // ----------------------------------------
12139 
12140     OTString strPath;
12141 
12142     // On the server side, response will only have chance to succeed if balance agreement succeeds first.
12143     // Therefore, you will never see successful response but failed balance, since it would stop at the
12144     // balance and response itself would remain failed with no chance of changing.
12145     //
12146     // Thus, "success" must be when balance succeeded and transaction succeeded,
12147     // and "failure" must be when balance succeeded but transaction failed.
12148     //
12149     // If NEITHER succeeded, then there is no point recording it to a file, now is there?
12150 
12151     if ((NULL != pResponseBalanceItem) && (OTItem::acknowledgement == pResponseBalanceItem->GetStatus()))
12152     {
12153         if (tranOut.GetSuccess())
12154         {
12155             // Transaction agreement was a success, AND process nymbox was a success.
12156             // Therefore, add any new issued numbers to theNym, and save.
12157 
12158             theNym.HarvestIssuedNumbers(SERVER_ID, m_nymServer, theTempNym, true); // bSave=true
12159 
12160             bOutSuccess = true;     // the processNymbox was successful.
12161 
12162             strPath.Format((char*)"%s.success", strNymID.Get());
12163         }
12164         else
12165             strPath.Format((char*)"%s.fail", strNymID.Get());
12166 
12167         const char * szFoldername = OTFolders::Receipt().Get();
12168 
12169         tranOut.SaveContract(szFoldername, strPath.Get());
12170     }
12171 }
12172 
12173 
12174 
12175 
12176 
12177 
12178 void OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTMessage & MsgIn, OTMessage & msgOut)
12179 {
12180     // (1) set up member variables
12181     msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@processInbox";  // reply to processInbox
12182     msgOut.m_strNymID       = MsgIn.m_strNymID; // UserID
12183 //  msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;    // This is already set in ProcessUserCommand.
12184     msgOut.m_strAcctID      = MsgIn.m_strAcctID;    // The Account ID in question
12185 
12186     const OTIdentifier  USER_ID(msgOut.m_strNymID),
12187                         ACCOUNT_ID(MsgIn.m_strAcctID),
12188                         SERVER_ID(m_strServerID),
12189                         SERVER_USER_ID(m_nymServer);
12190 
12191     OTLedger theLedger(USER_ID, ACCOUNT_ID, SERVER_ID);         // These are ledgers used as messages. The one we received,
12192                                                                 // and the one we're sending back.
12193     OTLedger * pResponseLedger = OTLedger::GenerateLedger(SERVER_USER_ID, ACCOUNT_ID, SERVER_ID, OTLedger::message, false); // bCreateFile=false
12194     OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pResponseLedger, "OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox: ASSERT: NULL != pResponseLedger");
12195     OTCleanup<OTLedger> theRespLedgerGuardian(*pResponseLedger);
12196 
12197     OTTransaction * pTranResponse = NULL;
12198 
12199     //---------------------------------------------------
12200     // Grab the string (containing the request ledger) out of ascii-armored form.
12201     OTString strLedger(MsgIn.m_ascPayload);
12202 
12203     bool bTransSuccess = false;
12204     // ------------------------------------------------------------
12205     const
12206     OTIdentifier  theMsgNymboxHash(MsgIn.m_strNymboxHash);    // theMsgNymboxHash is the hash sent by the client side
12207     OTIdentifier  theSrvrNymboxHash;
12208 
12209     bool bGotNymboxHashServerSide = theNym.GetNymboxHashServerSide(SERVER_ID, theSrvrNymboxHash);
12210 
12211     if (bGotNymboxHashServerSide)  // theSrvrNymboxHash is the hash stored on the server side
12212         theSrvrNymboxHash.GetString(msgOut.m_strNymboxHash);
12213     else {
12214         OTLog::vOutput(1,"%s: We cannot obtain server side nymbox hash, will continue.\n",__FUNCTION__);
12215     }
12216 
12217     const bool bGotNymboxHashClientSide = MsgIn.m_strNymboxHash.Exists();
12218 
12219     if (!bGotNymboxHashClientSide) {
12220         OTLog::vOutput(1, "%s: We don't have a client side nymbox hash, will continue\n", __FUNCTION__);
12221     }
12222 
12223     if (bGotNymboxHashServerSide && bGotNymboxHashClientSide)
12224         if (theMsgNymboxHash != theSrvrNymboxHash) {
12225             OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: The server and client nymbox hashes missmatch! rejecting message.\n", __FUNCTION__);
12226             goto send_message;
12227         }
12228 
12229     // theLedger contains a single transaction from the client, with an item inside
12230     // for each inbox transaction the client wants to accept or reject.
12231     // Let's see if we can load it from the string that came in the message...
12232     msgOut.m_bSuccess = theLedger.LoadContractFromString(strLedger);
12233     if (msgOut.m_bSuccess)
12234     {
12235         OTAccount theAccount(USER_ID, ACCOUNT_ID, SERVER_ID);
12236 
12237         // Make sure the "from" account even exists...
12238         if (!theAccount.LoadContract())
12239         {
12240             const OTString strAcctID(ACCOUNT_ID);
12241             OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox: Failed loading account: %s\n",
12242                            strAcctID.Get());
12243         }
12244         // Make sure the account isn't marked for deletion.
12245         else if (theAccount.IsMarkedForDeletion())
12246         {
12247             OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox: Failed attempt to use an Asset account that was marked for deletion.\n");
12248         }
12249         // Make sure the Account ID loaded from the file matches the one we just set and used as the filename.
12250         else if (!theAccount.VerifyContractID())
12251         {
12252             // this should never happen. How did the wrong ID get into the account file, if the right
12253             // ID is on the filename itself? and vice versa.
12254             OTLog::Error("Error verifying account ID in OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox\n");
12255         }
12256         // Make sure the nymID loaded up in the account as its actual owner matches the nym who was
12257         // passed in to this function requesting a transaction on this account... otherwise any asshole
12258         // could do transactions on your account, no?
12259         else if (!theAccount.VerifyOwner(theNym))
12260         {
12261             OTLog::vOutput(0, "Failed verifying account ownership in OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox\n");
12262         }
12263         // Make sure I, the server, have signed this file.
12264         else if (!theAccount.VerifySignature(m_nymServer))
12265         {
12266             OTLog::Error("Error verifying server signature on account in OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox\n");
12267         }
12268         // No need to call VerifyAccount() here since the above calls go above and beyond that method.
12269 
12270         else
12271         {
12272             // In this case we need to process the transaction items from the ledger
12273             // and create a corresponding transaction where each of the new items
12274             // contains the answer to the transaction item sent.
12275             // Then we send that new "response ledger" back to the user in MsgOut.Payload
12276             // as an @processInbox message.
12277 
12278             OTTransaction * pTransaction    = theLedger.GetTransaction(OTTransaction::processInbox);
12279 
12280             if (NULL == pTransaction) // I'm assuming there's only one in the ledger (for now anyways..)
12281             {
12282                 OTLog::Error("Expected processInbox transaction in OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox\n");
12283             }
12284             else
12285             {
12286                 const int64_t lTransactionNumber = pTransaction->GetTransactionNum();
12287 
12288                 // ---------------------------
12289                 // We create a transaction response and add that to the response ledger...
12290                 //
12291                 pTranResponse =
12292                     OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(*pResponseLedger, OTTransaction::error_state, lTransactionNumber);
12293                 OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pTranResponse, "OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox: NULL != pTranResponse");
12294 
12295                 // Add the response transaction to the response ledger.
12296                 // That will go into the response message and be sent back to the client.
12297                 pResponseLedger->AddTransaction(*pTranResponse);
12298 
12299                 //---------------------------------------------------
12300                 if (!VerifyTransactionNumber(theNym, lTransactionNumber))
12301                 {
