12302                     // The user may not submit a transaction using a number he's already used before.
12303                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox: Error verifying transaction num %ld for Nym %s\n",
12304                                    lTransactionNumber, msgOut.m_strNymID.Get());
12305                 }
12306 
12307                 // The items' acct and server ID were already checked in VerifyContractID() when they were loaded.
12308                 // Now this checks a little deeper, to verify ownership, signatures, and transaction number
12309                 // on each item.  That way those things don't have to be checked for security over and over
12310                 // again in the subsequent calls.
12311                 //
12312                 else if (!pTransaction->VerifyItems(theNym))
12313                 {
12314                     OTLog::Output(0, "Error verifying transaction items OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox\n");
12315                 }
12316 
12317                 // any other security stuff?
12318                 // Todo do I need to verify the server ID here as well?
12319                 else
12320                 {
12321                     // We don't want any transaction number being used twice.
12322                     // (The number, at this point, is STILL issued to the user, who is still responsible
12323                     // for that number and must continue signing for it. All this means here is that the
12324                     // user no longer has the number on his AVAILABLE list. Removal from issued list happens separately.)
12325                     //
12326                     if (false == RemoveTransactionNumber(theNym, lTransactionNumber, true)) //bSave=true
12327                     {
12328                         OTLog::Error("Error removing transaction number (as available) from user nym in OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox\n");
12329                     }
12330 
12331                     // -------------------------------------------------------------------
12332 
12333                     else
12334                     {
12335                         OTLog::Output(2, "UserCmdProcessInbox type: Process Inbox\n");
12336 
12337                         NotarizeProcessInbox(theNym, theAccount, *pTransaction, *pTranResponse, bTransSuccess);
12338                         // ------------------------------------------
12339                         // Where appropriate, remove a transaction number from my issued list
12340                         // (the list of numbers I must sign for in every balance agreement.)
12341 
12342                         if (false == RemoveIssuedNumber(theNym, lTransactionNumber, true)) //bSave=true
12343                         {
12344                             OTLog::vError("%s: Error removing issued number from user nym.\n", __FUNCTION__);
12345                         }
12346                     }
12347                 }
12348             } // if pTransaction not NULL
12349 
12350             // DONE: should consider saving a copy of the response ledger here on the server.
12351             // Until the user signs off of the responses, maybe the user didn't receive them.
12352             // The server should be able to re-send them until confirmation, then delete them.
12353             // So might want to consider a SAVE TO FILE here of that ledger we're sending out...
12354             // UPDATE this is done now: notices go to the Nymbox.
12355         }
12356     }
12357     else
12358     {
12359         OTLog::Error("ERROR loading ledger from message in OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox\n");
12360     }
12361     // ----------------------------------------
12362 
12363 send_message:
12364 
12365 
12366     if (NULL == pTranResponse)
12367     {
12368         pTranResponse =
12369             OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(*pResponseLedger, OTTransaction::error_state, 0);
12370         OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pTranResponse, "OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox 2: NULL != pTranResponse");
12371 
12372         // Add the response transaction to the response ledger.
12373         // That will go into the response message and be sent back to the client.
12374         pResponseLedger->AddTransaction(*pTranResponse);
12375     }
12376 
12377     // sign the outoing transaction
12378     OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pTranResponse, "OTServer::UserCmdProcessInbox 3: NULL != pTranResponse");
12379 
12380     pTranResponse->ReleaseSignatures();
12381     pTranResponse->SignContract(m_nymServer);
12382     pTranResponse->SaveContract();   // don't forget to save (to internal raw file member)
12383 
12384     // sign the ledger
12385     pResponseLedger->SignContract(m_nymServer);
12386     pResponseLedger->SaveContract();
12387     // extract the ledger in ascii-armored form
12388     OTString strPayload(*pResponseLedger);
12389     // now the outgoing message has the response ledger in its payload.
12390     msgOut.m_ascPayload.SetString(strPayload);
12391 
12392     // todo: consider commenting this out since the transaction reply items already include a copy
12393     // of the original client communication that the server is responding to. No point beating a
12394     // dead horse.
12395     //
12396     // Send the user's command back to him as well.
12397     {
12398         OTString tempInMessage(MsgIn);
12399         msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage);
12400     }
12401 
12402     // -------------------------------------------------------
12403     // UPDATE NYMBOX HASH IN OUTGOING MESSAGE
12404     //
12405     // We already grabbed the server's NymboxHash near the top of this function,
12406     // and attached it to the outgoing reply message.
12407     //
12408     // However, the above block may have CHANGED this hash! Therefore, we grab it
12409     // AGAIN, just in case. This way a failed message will receive the old hash,
12410     // and a successful message will receive the new hash.
12411     //
12412     bGotNymboxHashServerSide = theNym.GetNymboxHashServerSide(SERVER_ID, theSrvrNymboxHash);
12413     if (bGotNymboxHashServerSide)  // theSrvrNymboxHash is the hash stored on the server side
12414         theSrvrNymboxHash.GetString(msgOut.m_strNymboxHash);
12415     // -------------------------------------------------------
12416 
12417     // (2) Sign the Message
12418     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
12419 
12420     // (3) Save the Message (with signatures and all, back to its internal member m_strRawFile.)
12421     //
12422     // FYI, SaveContract takes m_xmlUnsigned and wraps it with the signatures and ------- BEGIN  bookends
12423     // If you don't pass a string in, then SaveContract saves the new version to its member, m_strRawFile
12424     msgOut.SaveContract();
12425 
12426     // (You are in UserCmdProcessInbox.)
12427 
12428     // *************************************************************
12429     // REPLY NOTICE TO NYMBOX
12430     //
12431     // Now that we signed / saved the reply message...
12432     //
12433     // After specific messages, we drop a notice with a copy of the server's reply
12434     // into the Nymbox.  This way we are GUARANTEED that the Nym will receive and process
12435     // it. (And thus never get out of sync.)
12436     //
12437     if (msgOut.m_bSuccess)
12438     {
12439         const OTString strReplyMessage(msgOut);
12440         const int64_t lReqNum = atol(MsgIn.m_strRequestNum.Get());
12441 
12442         // If it fails, it logs already.
12443         this->DropReplyNoticeToNymbox(SERVER_ID, USER_ID, strReplyMessage, lReqNum, // We don't want to update the Nym's copy here in processInbox (I don't think.)
12444                                       bTransSuccess);
12445 //      this->DropReplyNoticeToNymbox(SERVER_ID, USER_ID, strReplyMessage, lReqNum, bTransSuccess, &theNym);
12446     }
12447 }
12448 
12449 
12450 
12456 void OTServer::NotarizeProcessInbox(OTPseudonym & theNym, OTAccount & theAccount, OTTransaction & tranIn, OTTransaction & tranOut, bool & bOutSuccess)
12457 {
12458     // The outgoing transaction is an "atProcessInbox", that is, "a reply to the process inbox request"
12459     tranOut.SetType(OTTransaction::atProcessInbox);
12460 
12461     OTItem * pItem          = NULL;
12462     OTItem * pBalanceItem   = tranIn.GetItem(OTItem::balanceStatement);
12463     OTItem * pResponseItem  = NULL;
12464     OTItem * pResponseBalanceItem   = NULL;
12465 
12466     // The incoming transaction may be sent to inboxes and outboxes, and it
12467     // will probably be bundled in our reply to the user as well. Therefore,
12468     // let's grab it as a string.
12469     OTString strInReferenceTo;
12470     OTString strBalanceItem;
12471 
12472     // Grab the actual server ID from this object, and use it as the server ID here.
12473     const OTIdentifier  SERVER_ID(m_strServerID),   ACCOUNT_ID(theAccount),
12474                         USER_ID(theNym);
12475 
12476     const OTString strUserID(USER_ID);
12477 
12478     OTPseudonym theTempNym, theTempClosingNumNym;
12479     // --------------------------------------------------------------
12480     OTLedger * pInbox   = theAccount.LoadInbox(m_nymServer);
12481     OTLedger * pOutbox  = theAccount.LoadOutbox(m_nymServer);
12482 
12483     OTCleanup<OTLedger> theInboxAngel(pInbox);
12484     OTCleanup<OTLedger> theOutboxAngel(pOutbox);
12485     // --------------------------------------------------------------
12486     pResponseBalanceItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, OTItem::atBalanceStatement);
12487     pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
12488     tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseBalanceItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
12489     // --------------------------------------------------------------
12490     if (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(strUserID.Get(), __transact_process_inbox))
12491     {
12492         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: User %s cannot do this transaction (All \"process inbox\" "
12493                        "transactions are disallowed in server.cfg)\n", __FUNCTION__, strUserID.Get());
12494     }
12495     else if (NULL == pBalanceItem)
12496     {
12497         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: No Balance Agreement item found on this transaction.\n",
12498                        __FUNCTION__);
12499     }
12500     else if (NULL == pInbox)// || !pInbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) already verified in OTAccount::LoadInbox()
12501     {
12502         OTLog::vError("%s: Error loading or verifying inbox.\n", __FUNCTION__);
12503     }
12504     else if (NULL == pOutbox)// || !pOutbox->VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)) already verified in OTAccount::LoadOutbox()
12505     {
12506         OTLog::vError("%s: Error loading or verifying outbox.\n", __FUNCTION__);
12507     }
12508     else
12509     {
12510         pBalanceItem->SaveContractRaw(strBalanceItem);
12511 
12512         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceString(strBalanceItem); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
12513         pResponseBalanceItem->SetReferenceToNum(pBalanceItem->GetTransactionNum()); // This response item is IN RESPONSE to tranIn's balance agreement
12514         pResponseBalanceItem->SetNumberOfOrigin(*pBalanceItem);
12515 
12516 //        OTString strAccountIDBLAH(ACCOUNT_ID);
12517 //        OTLog::vError("OTServer::NotarizeProcessInbox ==========> ENTERING LOOP ------ (Loaded "
12518 //                      "Inbox for ACCOUNT ID): %s.\n ==========> Inbox Receipt Count: %d \n",
12519 //                      strAccountIDBLAH.Get(), pInbox->GetTransactionCount());
12520 
12521         // -----------------------------------------------------------
12522         // This transaction accepts various incoming pending transfers.
12523         // So when it's all done, my balance will be higher.
12524         // AND pending inbox items will be removed from my inbox.
12525         //
12526         // I would like to not even process the whole giant loop below,
12527         // if I can verify here now that the balance agreement is wrong.
12528         //
12529         // Thus I will actually loop through the acceptPending items in tranIn, and then for each one, I'll
12530         // lookup the ACTUAL transaction in the inbox, and get its ACTUAL value. (And total them all up.)
12531         //
12532         // The total of those, (WITHOUT the user having to tell me what it will be, since I'm looking them all up),
12533         // should equal the difference in the account balance! Meaning the current balance plus that total will be
12534         // the expected NEW balance, according to this balance agreement -- if it wants to be approved, that is.
12535         //
12536         //
12537 
12538         std::list<int64_t> theListOfInboxReceiptsBeingRemoved;
12539 //      std::set<int64_t>  setOfRefNumsProcessed; // To make sure each inbox item refers to a different number. (If two of them refer to the same number, that's bad and is not allowed. You can't process the same inbox item twice simultaneously! Or even at all.)
12540 
12541         bool bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = true;
12542         int64_t lTotalBeingAccepted = 0;
12543 
12544         FOR_EACH_IT(listOfItems, tranIn.GetItemList(), it_bigloop)
12545         {
12546 //          OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeProcessInbox: TOP OF LOOP (of the item list on the incoming transaction) \n");
12547 //
12548 //          OTLog::vError("OTServer::NotarizeProcessInbox ==========> =======> Inbox Receipt Count: %d \n",
12549 //                        pInbox->GetTransactionCount());
12550 
12551             pItem = *it_bigloop;
12552             OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pItem, "Pointer should not have been NULL.");
12553             // -----------------------------------------------------
12554             OTTransaction * pServerTransaction = NULL;
12555 
12556             switch (pItem->GetType())
12557             {
12558                 case OTItem::balanceStatement:
12559 //                  OTLog::Output(1, "OTServer::NotarizeProcessInbox: (This item is a balance statement... SKIPPING IT.)\n\n"); // temp remove
12560                     pServerTransaction = NULL;
12561                     continue;
12562 
12563                 case OTItem::acceptCronReceipt:
12564                 case OTItem::acceptFinalReceipt:
12565                 case OTItem::acceptBasketReceipt:
12566                     //---------
12567                 case OTItem::disputeCronReceipt:
12568                 case OTItem::disputeFinalReceipt:
12569                 case OTItem::disputeBasketReceipt:
12570 //
12571 //                  OTLog::vOutput(1, "OTServer::NotarizeProcessInbox: Checking server-side inbox for expected CRON receipt: %ld... \n",
12572 //                                 pItem->GetReferenceToNum()); // temp remove
12573                     // ---------------------------------------------------------------
12574                     // NOTE: Turns out, it's normal to have multiple receipts in reference to the same thing.
12575                     // For example, I might have two transfer receipts that are both in reference to the same notarizeInbox.
12576 //                    {
12577 //
12578 //                        std::set<int64_t>::iterator it_ref = setOfRefNumsProcessed.find(pItem->GetReferenceToNum()); // It had BETTER not be on this list already!
12579 //
12580 //                        if (setOfRefNumsProcessed.end() != it_ref) // It's already there!! (Bad.)
12581 //                        {
12582 //                            OTLog::vError("%s: 1. Bad input from client: This request already contains an item in reference to receipt %ld, yet here's "
12583 //                                          "ANOTHER item in reference to the same number! (Failure.)\n", __FUNCTION__, pItem->GetReferenceToNum());
12584 //                            bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = false;
12585 //                            break;
12586 //                        }
12587 //                        else
12588 //                            setOfRefNumsProcessed.insert(pItem->GetReferenceToNum());
12589 //                    }
12590                     // ---------------------------------------------------------------
12591                     pServerTransaction = pInbox->GetTransaction(pItem->GetReferenceToNum());
12592                     break;
12593 
12594                 case OTItem::acceptPending:         // Accept an incoming (pending) transfer.
12595                 case OTItem::acceptItemReceipt:     // Accept a chequeReceipt, voucherReceipt, or transferReceipt.
12596                     //---------
12597                 case OTItem::rejectPending:
12598                 case OTItem::disputeItemReceipt:
12599 
12600 //                  OTLog::vOutput(1, "OTServer::NotarizeProcessInbox: Checking server-side inbox for receipt pending (IN REF TO): %ld... \n",
12601 //                                 pItem->GetReferenceToNum()); // temp remove
12602                     // ---------------------------------------------------------------
12603                     // NOTE: Turns out, it's normal to have multiple receipts in reference to the same thing.
12604                     // For example, I might have two transfer receipts that are both in reference to the same notarizeInbox.
12605 //                    {
12606 //
12607 //                        std::set<int64_t>::iterator it_ref = setOfRefNumsProcessed.find(pItem->GetReferenceToNum()); // It had BETTER not be on this list already!
12608 //
12609 //                        if (setOfRefNumsProcessed.end() != it_ref) // It's already there!! (Bad.)
12610 //                        {
12611 //                            OTLog::vError("%s: 1. Bad input from client: This request already contains an item in reference to receipt %ld, yet here's "
12612 //                                          "ANOTHER item in reference to the same number! (Failure.)\n", __FUNCTION__, pItem->GetReferenceToNum());
12613 //                            bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = false;
12614 //                            break;
12615 //                        }
12616 //                        else
12617 //                            setOfRefNumsProcessed.insert(pItem->GetReferenceToNum());
12618 //                    }
12619                     // ---------------------------------------------------------------
12620 
12621                     pServerTransaction = pInbox->GetTransaction(pItem->GetReferenceToNum());
12622                     break;
12623 
12624                 default:
12625                 {
12626                     OTString strItemType;
12627                     pItem->GetTypeString(strItemType);
12628                     int32_t nItemType = pItem->GetType();
12629 
12630                     pServerTransaction = NULL;
12631                     bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = false;
12632 
12633                     OTLog::vError("%s: Wrong item type: %s (%d).\n", __FUNCTION__,
12634                                   strItemType.Exists() ? strItemType.Get() : "", nItemType);
12635                     break;
12636                 }
12637             }
12638             // -------------------------------------------------------
12639             if (NULL == pServerTransaction)
12640             {
12641                 const OTString strAccountID(ACCOUNT_ID);
12642                 OTLog::vError("%s: Unable to find or process inbox transaction being accepted by user: %s for account: %s\n",
12643                               __FUNCTION__, strUserID.Get(), strAccountID.Get());
12644                 bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = false;
12645                 break; // for
12646             }
12647             else if (pServerTransaction->GetReceiptAmount() != pItem->GetAmount())
12648             {
12649                 OTLog::vError("%s: Receipt amounts don't match: %ld and %ld. Nym: %s\n", __FUNCTION__,
12650                               pServerTransaction->GetReceiptAmount(), pItem->GetAmount(), strUserID.Get());
12651                 bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = false;
12652                 break; // for
12653             }
12654 
12655             // BELOW THIS POINT, WE KNOW THAT pServerTransaction was FOUND (and validated.)
12656             // *****************************************************************************
12657 
12658             switch (pItem->GetType())
12659             {
12660                 case OTItem::acceptCronReceipt:
12661                     bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = true;
12662                     break;
12663                 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
12664                 case OTItem::acceptFinalReceipt:
12665                     bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = true;
12666 
12667                     // Need to ERROR OUT here, if the number of cron receipts (related to
12668                     // this finalReceipt) in the inbox isn't equal to the number being accepted
12669                     // in this processInbox transaction. (You can't close the final receipt unless
12670                     // you close all the others as well.)
12671                     //
12672 
12673 
12674                     // IN THIS CASE: If user is accepting a finalReceipt, that means all the OTHER receipts related to it
12675                     // (sharing the same "in reference to") must ALSO be cleared from the inbox along with it! That's the
12676                     // whole point of the finalReceipt -- to make sure all related receipts are cleared, when IT is.
12677                     //
12678                     // So let's see if the number of related receipts on this process inbox (tranIn) matches
12679                     // the number of related receipts in the actual inbox (pInbox), as found by the finalReceipt's
12680                     // (pServerTransaction) "in reference to" value, which should be the same as on the related receipts.
12681 
12682                     // (Below) tranIn is the processInbox transaction. Each item on it is "in ref to" a DIFFERENT receipt,
12683                     // even though, if they are marketReceipts, all of THOSE receipts are "in ref to" the original transaction#.
12684                     // I need to loop through all items on tranIn (processInbox request)
12685                     // For each, look it up on the inbox. (Each item will be "in reference to" the original transaction.)
12686                     // ONCE THE INBOX RECEIPT IS FOUND, if *IT* is "in reference to" pServerTransaction->GetReferenceToNum(),
12687                     // Then increment the count for the transaction.  COMPARE *THAT* to theInbox.GetCount and we're golden!!
12688                 {
12689 //                  int32_t nRefCount = 0; // Using std::set here instead of a simple int32_t. (To prevent duplicates.)
12690                     std::set<int64_t> setOfRefNumbers; // we'll store them here, and disallow duplicates, to make sure they are all unique IDs (no repeats.)
12691 
12692                     FOR_EACH(listOfItems, tranIn.GetItemList())
12693                     {
12694                         OTItem * pItemPointer = *it;
12695                         OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pItemPointer, "Pointer should not have been NULL.");
12696 
12697                         OTTransaction * pTransPointer = pInbox->GetTransaction(pItemPointer->GetReferenceToNum());
12698 
12699                         if ((NULL != pTransPointer) &&
12700                             (pTransPointer->GetReferenceToNum() == pServerTransaction->GetReferenceToNum()))
12701                         {
12702 //                          nRefCount++;
12703                             // std::set doesn't allow duplicates.
12704                             setOfRefNumbers.insert(pItemPointer->GetReferenceToNum());
12705                         }
12706                     } // for
12707                     // -------------------
12708 
12709                     if ( pInbox->GetTransactionCountInRefTo(pServerTransaction->GetReferenceToNum()) !=
12710                          static_cast<int32_t>(setOfRefNumbers.size()) )
12711                     {
12712                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: User tried to close a finalReceipt, "
12713                                        "without also closing all related receipts. (Those that share the IN REF TO number.)\n",
12714                                        __FUNCTION__);
12715                         bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = false;
12716                         break;
12717                     }
12718                     // Upon success, these numbers will be removed from the Nym's additional record of "cron item IDs".
12719                     //
12720                     // -------------------------------------------------------------------
12721 
12722                     // Server side stores a list of open cron items on each Nym.
12723                     // The closing transaction number on the final receipt SHOULD be on that list.
12724                     //
12725                     std::set<int64_t> & theIDSet = theNym.GetSetOpenCronItems();
12726 
12727                     std::set<int64_t>::iterator theSetIT = theIDSet.find(pServerTransaction->GetClosingNum());
12728 
12729                     // If we FOUND it on the Nym, then we add it to the list to be removed from Nym's open cron items.
12730                     // (If it wasn't there before, then we wouldn't want to "re-add" it, now would we?)
12731                     //
12732                     if (theIDSet.end() != theSetIT) // FOUND IT!
12733                         theTempClosingNumNym.AddIssuedNum(m_strServerID, pServerTransaction->GetClosingNum()); // Schedule to remove GetClosingNum() from server-side list of Nym's open cron items. (By adding it to theTempClosingNumNym.)
12734                     else
12735                         OTLog::vOutput(1, "%s: expected to find pServerTransaction->GetClosingNum() (%ld) on Nym's (%s) "
12736                                        "list of open cron items. (Maybe he didn't see the notice in his Nymbox yet.)\n",
12737                                        __FUNCTION__, pServerTransaction->GetClosingNum(), strUserID.Get());
12738                     // else error log.
12739                 }
12740 
12741                 // ---- COUNT is correct and closing num is on list of open cron items. (FINAL RECEIPT FALLS THROUGH HERE!!! no break) ------------------------
12742 
12743                 case OTItem::acceptBasketReceipt:
12744                     // IF it's actually there on theNym, then schedule it for removal.
12745                     // (Otherwise we'd end up improperly re-adding it.)
12746                     //
12747                     if (theNym.VerifyIssuedNum(m_strServerID, pServerTransaction->GetClosingNum()))
12748                         theTempNym.AddIssuedNum(m_strServerID, pServerTransaction->GetClosingNum());
12749                     else
12750                     {
12751                         bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = false;
12752 
12753                         OTLog::vError("%s: basket or final receipt, trying to 'remove' an issued "
12754                                       "number (%ld) that already wasn't on Nym's issued list. (So what is this in the inbox, "
12755                                       "then?)\n", __FUNCTION__, pServerTransaction->GetClosingNum());
12756                     }
12757 
12758                     break;
12759                 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12760                 case OTItem::acceptPending:
12761                     // IF I'm accepting a pending transfer, then add the amount to my counter of total amount being accepted.
12762                     //
12763                     lTotalBeingAccepted += pServerTransaction->GetReceiptAmount();
12764                     bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = true;
12765                     break;
12766                 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12767                 case OTItem::acceptItemReceipt:
12768                     bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = true;
12769                 {
12770                     // If I'm accepting an item receipt (which will remove my responsibility for that item) then add it
12771                     // to the temp Nym (which is a list of transaction numbers that will be removed from my responsibility if
12772                     // all is successful.)  Also remove all the Temp Nym numbers from theNym, so we can verify the Balance
12773                     // Statement AS IF they were already removed.
12774                     //
12775                     // What number do I remove here? the user is accepting a transfer receipt, which
12776                     // is in reference to the recipient's acceptPending. THAT item is in reference to
12777                     // my original transfer (or contains a cheque with my original number.) (THAT's the # I need.)
12778                     //
12779                     OTString strOriginalItem;
12780                     pServerTransaction->GetReferenceString(strOriginalItem);
12781 
12782                     OTItem * pOriginalItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromString(strOriginalItem, SERVER_ID, pServerTransaction->GetReferenceToNum());
12783                     OTCleanup<OTItem> theOrigItemGuardian(pOriginalItem); // So I don't have to clean it up later. No memory leaks.
12784 
12785                     if (NULL != pOriginalItem)
12786                     {
12787                         // If pOriginalItem is acceptPending, that means the client is accepting the transfer receipt from the server, (from his inbox),
12788                         // which has the recipient's acceptance inside of the client's transfer as the original item. This means the transfer that
12789                         // the client originally sent is now finally closed!
12790                         //
12791                         // If it's a depositCheque, that means the client is accepting the cheque receipt from the server, (from his inbox)
12792                         // which has the recipient's deposit inside of it as the original item. This means that the cheque that
12793                         // the client originally wrote is now finally closed!
12794                         //
12795                         // In both cases, the "original item" itself is not from the client, but from the recipient! Therefore,
12796                         // the number on that item is useless for removing numbers from the client's list of issued numbers.
12797                         // Rather, I need to load that original cheque, or pending transfer, from WITHIN the original item,
12798                         // in order to get THAT number, to remove it from the client's issued list. (Whether for real, or for
12799                         // setting up dummy data in order to verify the balance agreement.) *sigh*
12800                         //
12801                         if (OTItem::depositCheque == pOriginalItem->GetType()) // client is accepting a cheque receipt, which has a depositCheque (from the recipient) as the original item within.
12802                         {
12803                             // Get the cheque from the Item and load it up into a Cheque object.
12804                             OTString strCheque;
12805                             pOriginalItem->GetAttachment(strCheque);
12806 
12807                             OTCheque theCheque; // allocated on the stack :-)
12808 
12809                             if (false == ((strCheque.GetLength() > 2) &&
12810                                           theCheque.LoadContractFromString(strCheque)))
12811                             {
12812                                 OTLog::vError("%s: ERROR loading cheque from string:\n%s\n",
12813                                               __FUNCTION__, strCheque.Get());
12814                                 bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = false;
12815                             }
12816                             else    // Since the client wrote the cheque, and he is now accepting the cheque receipt, he can be cleared for that transaction number...
12817                             {
12818                                 // IF it's actually there on theNym, then schedule it for removal.
12819                                 // (Otherwise we'd end up improperly re-adding it.)
12820                                 //
12821                                 if (theNym.VerifyIssuedNum (m_strServerID, theCheque.GetTransactionNum()))
12822                                     theTempNym.AddIssuedNum(m_strServerID, theCheque.GetTransactionNum());
12823                                 else
12824                                 {
12825                                     bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = false;
12826 
12827                                     OTLog::vError("%s: cheque receipt, trying to 'remove' an issued "
12828                                                   "number (%ld) that already wasn't on Nym's issued list. (So what is this in the inbox, "
12829                                                   "then?)\n", __FUNCTION__, theCheque.GetTransactionNum());
12830                                 }
12831                             }
12832                         }
12833                         // client is accepting a transfer receipt, which has an acceptPending from the recipient as the original item within,
12834                         else if (OTItem::acceptPending == pOriginalItem->GetType()) // (which is in reference to the client's outoing original transfer.)
12835                         {
12836                             // IF it's actually there on theNym, then schedule it for removal.
12837                             // (Otherwise we'd end up improperly re-adding it.)
12838                             //
12839                             if (theNym. VerifyIssuedNum(m_strServerID, pOriginalItem->GetNumberOfOrigin()))
12840                                 theTempNym.AddIssuedNum(m_strServerID, pOriginalItem->GetNumberOfOrigin());
12841                             else
12842                             {
12843                                 bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = false;
12844 
12845                                 OTLog::vError("%s: transfer receipt, trying to 'remove' an issued "
12846                                               "number (%ld) that already wasn't on Nym's issued list. (So what is this in the inbox, "
12847                                               "then?)\n", __FUNCTION__, pOriginalItem->GetReferenceToNum());
12848                             }
12849                         }
12850                         else
12851                         {
12852                             OTString strOriginalItemType;
12853                             pOriginalItem->GetTypeString(strOriginalItemType);
12854                             OTLog::vError("%s: Original item has wrong type, while accepting item receipt:\n%s\n",
12855                                           __FUNCTION__, strOriginalItemType.Get());
12856                             bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = false;
12857                         }
12858                     }
12859                     else
12860                     {
12861                         OTLog::vError("%s: Unable to load original item from string while accepting item receipt:\n%s\n",
12862                                       __FUNCTION__, strOriginalItem.Get());
12863                         bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = false;
12864                     }
12865                 } // pItem is acceptItemReceipt --------------------
12866 
12867                     break;
12868                 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
12869                 default:
12870                     OTLog::Error("Wrong item type in OTServer::NotarizeProcessInbox. (2nd notice.)\n");
12871                     bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = false;
12872                     break;
12873             } // switch --------------------------------------------
12874 
12875 
12876             // I'll also go ahead and remove each transaction from pInbox, and pass said inbox into the VerifyBalanceAgreement call...
12877             // (So it can simulate as if the inbox was already processed, and the total is already calculated, and if it succeeds,
12878             // then we can allow the giant loop below to do it all for real.)
12879             // (I'm not saving this copy of the inbox anyway--there's another one below.)
12880             //
12881             if (bSuccessFindingAllTransactions)
12882             {
12883                 // WE'RE REMOVING THE TRANSACTIONS FROM AN INBOX COPY, IN ORDER TO VERIFY THE
12884                 // BALANCE AGREEMENT (WITH THAT INBOX COPY SET UP AS THOUGH THE TRANSACTION HAD
12885                 // ALREADY BEEN A SUCCESS.)
12886                 // I'm not ACTUALLY removing though, until AFTER the loop (in case the rest of the
12887                 // loop needs the data still, in that inbox.) So we save in a list, and remove AFTER the loop.
12888                 //
12889                 theListOfInboxReceiptsBeingRemoved.push_back(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
12890             }
12891             else // If there was an error above, then we don't want to keep looping. We want the below error block.
12892                 break;
12893             // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
12894         } // for loop (list of "process inbox" items)
12895 
12896         // ***************************************************************************
12897 
12898 //      OTLog::Error("OTServer::NotarizeProcessInbox   BELOW THE LOOP===> ABout to call VERIFY BALANCE STATEMENT \n");
12899 
12900         if (false == bSuccessFindingAllTransactions)
12901         {
12902             OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: transactions in processInbox message do not match actual inbox.\n", __FUNCTION__);
12903         }
12904         else
12905         {   // Remove certain receipts (determined in the big loop above) from the inbox copy,
12906             // to see if it will verify in the balance agreement.
12907             //
12908             while (!theListOfInboxReceiptsBeingRemoved.empty())
12909             {
12910                 int64_t lTemp = theListOfInboxReceiptsBeingRemoved.front();
12911                 theListOfInboxReceiptsBeingRemoved.pop_front();
12912 
12913                 // Notice I don't call DeleteBoxReceipt(lTemp) here like I normally would when calling
12914                 // RemoveTransaction(lTemp), since this is only a copy of my inbox and not the real thing.
12915                 //
12916                 if (false == pInbox->RemoveTransaction(lTemp))    // <================
12917                    OTLog::vError("%s: Failed removing receipt from Inbox copy: %ld \n"
12918                                  "Meaning the client probably has an old copy of his inbox. "
12919                                  "We don't even see the receipt that he still thinks he has.\n",
12920                                  __FUNCTION__, lTemp);
12921             }
12922             // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12923             // Remove certain issued numbers (determined in the big loop above) from the Nym,
12924             // to see if it will verify in the balance agreement (we'll re-add them after.)
12925             // Also, we're ONLY removing these because we verified above that they were really there.
12926             // Otherwise it'd be pretty stupid to "re-add" them, eh?
12927             //
12928             for (int32_t i = 0; i < theTempNym.GetIssuedNumCount(SERVER_ID); i++)
12929             {
12930                 int64_t lTemp = theTempNym.GetIssuedNum(SERVER_ID, i);
12931                 theNym.RemoveIssuedNum(m_strServerID, lTemp);
12932             }
12933 
12934             // **********************************************************************
12935             // FINALLY after all that setup, we can do the balance agreement!!
12936             //
12937             const bool bVerifiedBalanceStatement = pBalanceItem->VerifyBalanceStatement(lTotalBeingAccepted,  // <========================
12938                                                                                   theNym,
12939                                                                                   *pInbox,
12940                                                                                   *pOutbox,
12941                                                                                   theAccount,
12942                                                                                   tranIn);
12943             // **********************************************************************
12944 
12945             // Here, add all the issued nums back (that had been temporarily removed from theNym) that were stored on theTempNym for safe-keeping.
12946             for (int32_t i = 0; i < theTempNym.GetIssuedNumCount(SERVER_ID); i++)
12947             {
12948                 int64_t lTemp = theTempNym.GetIssuedNum(SERVER_ID, i);
12949                 theNym.AddIssuedNum(m_strServerID, lTemp);
12950             }
12951             // (They are removed for real at the bottom of this function, IF everything is successful between now and then.)
12952 
12953             // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12954 
12955             if (false == bVerifiedBalanceStatement)
12956             {
12957                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::NotarizeProcessInbox: ERROR verifying balance statement for transaction %ld.\n",
12958                                tranIn.GetTransactionNum());
12959             }
12960 
12961             else // BALANCE AGREEMENT WAS SUCCESSFUL.......
12962             {
12963                 pResponseBalanceItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement); // the transaction agreement was successful.
12964 
12965                 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
12966 
12967                 // THE ABOVE LOOP WAS JUST A TEST RUN
12968                 //
12969                 // (TO VERIFY BALANCE AGREEMENT BEFORE WE BOTHERED TO RUN THIS LOOP BELOW...)
12970 
12971                 // loop through the items that make up the incoming transaction
12972                 //
12973                 FOR_EACH_IT(listOfItems, tranIn.GetItemList(), it_bigloop_two)
12974                 {
12975                     pItem = *it_bigloop_two;
12976                     OT_ASSERT_MSG(NULL != pItem, "Pointer should not have been NULL.");
12977 
12978                     // We already handled this one (if we're even in this block in the first place.)
12979                     //
12980                     if (OTItem::balanceStatement == pItem->GetType())
12981                     {
12982                         continue;
12983                     }
12984 
12985                     // If the client sent an accept item, (or reject/dispute) then let's process it.
12986                     if (
12987                         (OTItem::request    == pItem->GetStatus())
12988                         &&
12989                         (
12990                          (OTItem::acceptCronReceipt     == pItem->GetType()) || // Accepting notice of market trade or payment processing. (Original in Cron Receipt.)
12991 //                       (OTItem::disputeCronReceipt    == pItem->GetType()) || // Disputing said notice.  With Cron receipts, original is stored as an OTCronItem...
12992                          (OTItem::acceptItemReceipt     == pItem->GetType()) || // Accepted item receipt (cheque, transfer)
12993 //                       (OTItem::disputeItemReceipt    == pItem->GetType()) || // Disputing said notice.
12994                          (OTItem::acceptPending         == pItem->GetType()) || // Accepting notice of pending transfer
12995 //                       (OTItem::rejectPending         == pItem->GetType()) || // With pending, the Original is stored in OTItem pOriginalItem...
12996                          (OTItem::acceptFinalReceipt    == pItem->GetType()) || // Accepting finalReceipt
12997 //                       (OTItem::disputeFinalReceipt   == pItem->GetType()) || // Disputing finalReceipt.
12998                          (OTItem::acceptBasketReceipt   == pItem->GetType())    // Accepting basketReceipt
12999 //                       (OTItem::disputeBasketReceipt  == pItem->GetType())    // Disputing basketReceipt.
13000                          )
13001                         )
13002                     {
13003                         // The response item will contain a copy of the "accept" request.
13004                         // So I'm just setting aside a copy now for those purposes later.
13005                         strInReferenceTo.Release();
13006                         pItem->SaveContractRaw(strInReferenceTo);
13007 
13008                         OTItem::itemType theReplyItemType;
13009                         switch (pItem->GetType())
13010                         {
13011                             case OTItem::acceptPending:
13012                                 theReplyItemType = OTItem::atAcceptPending;
13013                                 break;
13014                             case OTItem::rejectPending:
13015                                 theReplyItemType = OTItem::atRejectPending;
13016                                 break;
13017                             case OTItem::acceptCronReceipt:
13018                                 theReplyItemType = OTItem::atAcceptCronReceipt;
13019                                 break;
13020                             case OTItem::disputeCronReceipt:
13021                                 theReplyItemType = OTItem::atDisputeCronReceipt;
13022                                 break;
13023                             case OTItem::acceptItemReceipt:
13024                                 theReplyItemType = OTItem::atAcceptItemReceipt;
13025                                 break;
13026                             case OTItem::disputeItemReceipt:
13027                                 theReplyItemType = OTItem::atDisputeItemReceipt;
13028                                 break;
13029                             case OTItem::acceptFinalReceipt:
13030                                 theReplyItemType = OTItem::atAcceptFinalReceipt;
13031                                 break;
13032                             case OTItem::disputeFinalReceipt:
13033                                 theReplyItemType = OTItem::atDisputeFinalReceipt;
13034                                 break;
13035                             case OTItem::acceptBasketReceipt:
13036                                 theReplyItemType = OTItem::atAcceptBasketReceipt;
13037                                 break;
13038                             case OTItem::disputeBasketReceipt:
13039                                 theReplyItemType = OTItem::atDisputeBasketReceipt;
13040                                 break;
13041                             default:
13042                                 OTLog::Error("Should never happen.\n");
13043                                 theReplyItemType = OTItem::error_state; // should never happen based on above 'if' statement.
13044                                 break;                                  // saving this anyway just cause it's cleaner.
13045                         }
13046 
13047 
13048                         // Server response item being added to server response transaction (tranOut)
13049                         // They're getting SOME sort of response item.
13050 
13051                         pResponseItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromTransaction(tranOut, theReplyItemType);
13052                         pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::rejection); // the default.
13053                         pResponseItem->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo); // the response item carries a copy of what it's responding to.
13054                         pResponseItem->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum());
13055                         pResponseItem->SetNumberOfOrigin(*pItem);
13056 
13057                         tranOut.AddItem(*pResponseItem); // the Transaction's destructor will cleanup the item. It "owns" it now.
13058 
13059 
13060                         // Need to load the Inbox first, in order to look up the transaction that
13061                         // the client is accepting. This is possible because the client has included
13062                         // the transaction number.  I'll just look it up in his inbox and then
13063                         // process it.
13064                         // theAcctID is the ID on the client Account that was passed in.
13065                         OTLedger theInbox(USER_ID, ACCOUNT_ID, SERVER_ID);
13066 
13067                         OTTransaction * pServerTransaction = NULL;
13068 
13069                         if (false == theInbox.LoadInbox())
13070                         {
13071                             OTLog::Error("Error loading inbox during processInbox\n");
13072                         }
13073                         else if (false == theInbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer))
13074                         {
13075                             OTLog::Error("Error verifying inbox during processInbox\n");
13076                         }
13077                         // --------------------------------------------------------------
13078                         //
13079                         // Warning! In the case of a OTTransaction::paymentReceipt or OTTransaction::marketReceipt,
13080                         // the "in reference to" string will NOT contain an OTItem at all, but an OTPaymentPlan or
13081                         // an OTTrade!! Also, a paymentReceipt might be for a smart contract, in which case there's
13082                         // a smartcontract inside, instead of a payment plan! I handle these cases first, here:
13083                         //
13084                         //
13085                         else if (  // MARKET RECEIPT, or PAYMENT RECEIPT.....
13086                                  (
13087                                   (OTItem::acceptCronReceipt == pItem->GetType())// This is checked above, but just keeping this safe.
13088                                   )                                             // especially in case this block moves or is used elsewhere.
13089                                  &&
13090                                  (NULL != (pServerTransaction = theInbox.GetTransaction(pItem->GetReferenceToNum())))
13091                                  &&
13092                                  (
13093                                   (OTTransaction::paymentReceipt== pServerTransaction->GetType()) ||
13094                                   (OTTransaction::marketReceipt == pServerTransaction->GetType())
13095                                   )
13096                                  )
13097                         {
13098                             // pItem contains the current user's attempt to accept the Receipt
13099                             // represented by pServerTransaction. Therefore we have the user's
13100                             // item AND the receipt he is trying to accept.
13101 
13102                             pServerTransaction->DeleteBoxReceipt(theInbox); // faster.
13103 //                          theInbox.   DeleteBoxReceipt(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
13104                             theInbox.   RemoveTransaction(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
13105 
13106                             theInbox.   ReleaseSignatures();
13107                             theInbox.   SignContract(m_nymServer);
13108                             theInbox.   SaveContract();
13109                             theAccount. SaveInbox(theInbox);
13110                             theAccount. ReleaseSignatures();
13111                             theAccount. SignContract(m_nymServer);
13112                             theAccount. SaveContract();
13113                             theAccount. SaveAccount();
13114 
13115                             // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
13116                             pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
13117                         }
13118                         // -----------------------------------------------------------------
13119 
13120                         else if ( // FINAL RECEIPT
13121                                  (
13122                                   (OTItem::acceptFinalReceipt == pItem->GetType())// This is checked above, but just keeping this safe.
13123                                   )                                             // especially in case this block moves or is used elsewhere.
13124                                  &&
13125                                  (NULL != (pServerTransaction = theInbox.GetTransaction(pItem->GetReferenceToNum())))
13126                                  &&
13127                                  (
13128                                   (OTTransaction::finalReceipt == pServerTransaction->GetType())
13129                                   )
13130                                  )
13131                         {
13132                             // pItem contains the current user's attempt to accept the Receipt
13133                             // represented by pServerTransaction. Therefore we have the user's
13134                             // item AND the receipt he is trying to accept.
13135 
13136                             pServerTransaction->DeleteBoxReceipt(theInbox); // faster.
13137 //                          theInbox.   DeleteBoxReceipt(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
13138                             theInbox.   RemoveTransaction(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
13139 
13140                             theInbox.   ReleaseSignatures();
13141                             theInbox.   SignContract(m_nymServer);
13142                             theInbox.   SaveContract();
13143                             theAccount. SaveInbox(theInbox);
13144                             theAccount. ReleaseSignatures();
13145                             theAccount. SignContract(m_nymServer);
13146                             theAccount. SaveContract();
13147                             theAccount. SaveAccount();
13148 
13149                             // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
13150                             pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
13151                         }
13152 
13153                         // -----------------------------------------------------------------
13154 
13155                         else if ( // BASKET RECEIPT
13156                                  (
13157                                   (OTItem::acceptBasketReceipt == pItem->GetType())// This is checked above, but just keeping this safe.
13158                                   )                                             // especially in case this block moves or is used elsewhere.
13159                                  &&
13160                                  (NULL != (pServerTransaction = theInbox.GetTransaction(pItem->GetReferenceToNum())))
13161                                  &&
13162                                  (
13163                                   (OTTransaction::basketReceipt == pServerTransaction->GetType())
13164                                   )
13165                                  )
13166                         {
13167                             // pItem contains the current user's attempt to accept the Receipt
13168                             // represented by pServerTransaction. Therefore we have the user's
13169                             // item AND the receipt he is trying to accept.
13170 
13171                             pServerTransaction->DeleteBoxReceipt(theInbox); // faster.
13172 //                          theInbox.   DeleteBoxReceipt(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
13173                             theInbox.   RemoveTransaction(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
13174 
13175                             theInbox.   ReleaseSignatures();
13176                             theInbox.   SignContract(m_nymServer);
13177                             theInbox.   SaveContract();
13178                             theAccount. SaveInbox(theInbox);
13179                             theAccount. ReleaseSignatures();
13180                             theAccount. SignContract(m_nymServer);
13181                             theAccount. SaveContract();
13182                             theAccount. SaveAccount();
13183 
13184                             // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
13185                             pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
13186                         }
13187 
13188                         // -----------------------------------------------------------------
13189                         // Careful here.  I'm looking up the original transaction number (1, say) which is stored
13190                         // in my inbox as a "in reference to" on transaction number 41. (Which is a pending transaction
13191                         // or receipt
13192                         // that the server created in my inbox, and only REFERS to the original transaction, but is not
13193                         // the original transaction in and of itself.)
13194                         //
13195                         // In other words, in this case below, I am looking for the transaction in the Inbox
13196                         // that REFERS to the same transaction that the accept item REFERS to. That process, necessary
13197                         // for pending transactions and cheque receipts, is NOT the case above, with receipts from cron.
13198                         else if ( (
13199                                    (OTItem::acceptItemReceipt   == pItem->GetType())    // acceptItemReceipt includes checkReceipt and transferReceipts.
13200 //                                   (OTItem::rejectItemReceipt == pItem->GetType())
13201                                    || (OTItem::acceptPending    == pItem->GetType())    // acceptPending includes checkReceipts. Because they are
13202 //                                      (OTItem::rejectPending  == pItem->GetType())    // stored/loaded similarly, not like the above Cron Receipts.
13203                                    )
13204                                  &&
13205                                  (NULL != (pServerTransaction = theInbox.GetTransaction(pItem->GetReferenceToNum())))
13206                                  &&
13207                                  (
13208                                   (OTTransaction::pending         == pServerTransaction->GetType()) || // pending transfer.
13209                                   (OTTransaction::transferReceipt == pServerTransaction->GetType()) || // transfer receipt.
13210                                   (OTTransaction::voucherReceipt  == pServerTransaction->GetType()) || // voucher receipt.
13211                                   (OTTransaction::chequeReceipt   == pServerTransaction->GetType())    // cheque receipt is down here in the pending section,
13212                                   )                                                                    // because this is where an OTItem is loaded up (since it
13213                                  )                                                                     // originated with a deposit transaction, not a cron receipt.)
13214                         {
13215 
13216 //                            if (theInbox.GetTransactionCountInRefTo(pItem->GetReferenceToNum()) > 1)
13217 //                                OTLog::vError("%s: WARNING 2: There are MULTIPLE receipts 'in reference to' %ld. (It will return the first one...)\n",
13218 //                                              __FUNCTION__, pItem->GetReferenceToNum());
13219 
13220                             // The accept item will come with the transaction number that
13221                             // it's referring to. So we'll just look up that transaction
13222                             // in the inbox, and now that it's been accepted, we'll process it.
13223 
13224                             // At this point, pItem points to the client's attempt to accept pServerTransaction
13225                             // and pServerTransaction is the server's created transaction in my inbox that contains
13226                             // the original item (from the sender) as the "referenced to" object. So let's extract
13227                             // it.
13228                             OTString strOriginalItem;
13229                             pServerTransaction->GetReferenceString(strOriginalItem);
13230 
13231                             OTItem * pOriginalItem = OTItem::CreateItemFromString(strOriginalItem, SERVER_ID, pServerTransaction->GetReferenceToNum());
13232                             OTCleanup<OTItem> theOrigItemGuardian(pOriginalItem); // So I don't have to clean it up later. No memory leaks.
13233 
13234                             if (NULL != pOriginalItem)
13235                             {
13236 
13237                                 // What are we doing in this code?
13238                                 //
13239                                 // I need to accept various items that are sitting in my inbox, such as:
13240                                 //
13241                                 // -- transfers waiting to be accepted (or rejected.)
13242                                 //
13243                                 // -- cheque deposit receipts waiting to be accepted (they cannot be rejected.)
13244                                 //
13245                                 // -- transfer receipts waiting to be accepted (they cannot be rejected.)
13246 
13247                                 //
13248                                 // ONLY in the case of pending transfers also do I need to mess around with my account,
13249                                 // and the sender's inbox and outbox. In the other cases, I merely need to remove
13250                                 // the item from my inbox.
13251                                 // Although when 'accepting the reject', I do need to take the money back into
13252                                 // my inbox...
13253 
13254 
13255 
13256                                 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
13257 
13258 
13259                                 // The depositCheque request OTItem is saved as a "in reference to" field
13260                                 // on the inbox chequeReceipt transaction.
13261 
13262                                 // Therefore, if I am processing an acceptPending item from the client,
13263                                 // for accepting a chequeReceipt Transaction that's in his inbox, and
13264                                 // the original item (that the receipt is for) is a depositCheque,
13265                                 // then I can go ahead and clear it from his inbox.
13266 
13267 
13268                                 // The below block only executes for ACCEPTING a CHEQUE deposit receipt, or
13269                                 // for 'Accepting an ACCEPT.'
13270                                 //
13271                                 // I can't 'Accept a REJECT' without also transferring the rejected money back into
13272                                 // my own account. And that means fiddling with my account, and that means it will
13273                                 // be in a different block of code than this one.
13274                                 //
13275                                 // Whereas with accepting a cheque deposit receipt, or accepting an accepted transfer notice,
13276                                 // in both of those cases, my account balance doesn't change at all. I just need to accept
13277                                 // those notices in order to get them out of my inbox. So that's the simplest case, and it's
13278                                 // handled by THIS block of code:
13279                                 //
13280                                 if (
13281                                     (OTItem::acceptItemReceipt  == pItem->GetType())
13282                                     &&
13283                                     (
13284                                      (
13285                                       (OTTransaction::transferReceipt   == pServerTransaction->GetType()) &&
13286                                       (OTItem::acceptPending            == pOriginalItem->GetType())
13287                                       )
13288                                         ||
13289                                       (
13290                                           ( (OTTransaction::chequeReceipt   == pServerTransaction->GetType()) ||
13291                                             (OTTransaction::voucherReceipt  == pServerTransaction->GetType()) )
13292                                             &&
13293                                           (OTItem::depositCheque            == pOriginalItem->GetType())
13294                                       )
13295                                      )
13296                                     )
13297                                 {   // (The funds are already paid out...)
13298                                     // pItem contains the current user's attempt to accept the
13299                                     // ['depositCheque' OR 'acceptPending'] located in theOriginalItem.
13300                                     // Now we have the user's item and the item he is trying to accept.
13301 
13302                                     pServerTransaction->DeleteBoxReceipt(theInbox); // faster.
13303 //                                  theInbox.   DeleteBoxReceipt(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
13304                                     theInbox.   RemoveTransaction(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
13305                                     // ----------------------------------
13306                                     theInbox.   ReleaseSignatures();
13307                                     theInbox.   SignContract(m_nymServer);
13308                                     theInbox.   SaveContract();
13309                                     // ----------------------------------
13310                                     theAccount. SaveInbox(theInbox);
13311                                     theAccount. ReleaseSignatures();
13312                                     theAccount. SignContract(m_nymServer);
13313                                     theAccount. SaveContract();
13314                                     theAccount. SaveAccount();
13315 
13316                                     // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
13317                                     pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
13318 
13319                                     // Don't I need to remove from responsibility list?
13320                                     // No, because that is done at the bottom of the function.
13321                                     //
13322                                 }// its type is OTItem::acceptPending or OTItem::depositCheque
13323 
13324 
13325 
13326                                 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
13327 
13328                                 // TODO: 'Accept a REJECT' -- NEED TO PERFORM THE TRANSFER OF FUNDS BACK TO THE SENDER'S ACCOUNT WHEN TRANSFER IS REJECTED.
13329 
13330                                 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
13331 
13332                                 // The below block only executes for ACCEPTING a TRANSFER
13333 
13334                                 else if (
13335                                          (OTTransaction::pending == pServerTransaction->GetType())
13336                                          &&
13337                                          (OTItem::transfer == pOriginalItem->GetType())
13338                                          )
13339                                 {
13340                                     // pItem contains the current user's attempt to accept the transfer located in theOriginalItem.
13341                                     // Now we have both items.
13342                                     OTIdentifier IDFromAccount(pOriginalItem->GetPurportedAccountID());
13343                                     OTIdentifier IDToAccount(pOriginalItem->GetDestinationAcctID());
13344 
13345                                     // I'm using the operator== because it exists.
13346                                     // If the ID on the "To" account from the original transaction does not
13347                                     // match the Acct ID of the client trying to accept the transaction...
13348                                     if (!(ACCOUNT_ID == IDToAccount))
13349                                     {
13350                                         OTLog::Error("Error: Destination account ID on the transaction does not match account ID of client transaction item.\n");
13351                                     }
13352 
13353                                     // -------------------------------------------------------------------
13354 
13355                                     // The 'from' outbox is loaded to remove the outgoing transfer, since it has been accepted.
13356                                     // The 'from' inbox is loaded in order to put a notice of this acceptance for the sender's records.
13357                                     OTLedger    theFromOutbox(IDFromAccount, SERVER_ID),    // Sender's *OUTBOX*
13358                                                 theFromInbox(IDFromAccount, SERVER_ID);     // Sender's *INBOX*
13359 
13360                                     bool bSuccessLoadingInbox   = theFromInbox.LoadInbox();
13361                                     bool bSuccessLoadingOutbox  = theFromOutbox.LoadOutbox();
13362 
13363                                     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
13364 
13365                                     // THE FROM INBOX -- We are adding an item here (acceptance of transfer),
13366                                     // so we will create this inbox if we have to, so we can add that record to it.
13367 
13368                                     if (true == bSuccessLoadingInbox)
13369                                         bSuccessLoadingInbox    = theFromInbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer);
13370                                     else
13371                                         OTLog::Error("ERROR missing 'from' inbox in OTServer::NotarizeProcessInbox.\n");
13372 //                                  else
13373 //                                        bSuccessLoadingInbox  = theFromInbox.GenerateLedger(IDFromAccount, SERVER_ID, OTLedger::inbox, true); // bGenerateFile=true
13374                                     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
13375                                     // THE FROM OUTBOX -- We are removing an item, so this outbox SHOULD already exist.
13376 
13377                                     if (true == bSuccessLoadingOutbox)
13378                                         bSuccessLoadingOutbox   = theFromOutbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer);
13379                                     else // If it does not already exist, that is an error condition. For now, log and fail.
13380                                         OTLog::Error("ERROR missing 'from' outbox in OTServer::NotarizeProcessInbox.\n");
13381                                     // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
13382                                     if (false == bSuccessLoadingInbox || false == bSuccessLoadingOutbox)
13383                                     {
13384                                         OTLog::Error("ERROR loading 'from' inbox or outbox in OTServer::NotarizeProcessInbox.\n");
13385                                     }
13386                                     else
13387                                     {
13388                                         // Generate a new transaction number for the sender's inbox (to notice him of acceptance.)
13389                                         int64_t lNewTransactionNumber = 0;
13390                                         IssueNextTransactionNumber(m_nymServer, lNewTransactionNumber, false); // bStoreTheNumber = false
13391 
13392                                         // Generate a new transaction... (to notice the sender of acceptance.)
13393                                         OTTransaction * pInboxTransaction   = OTTransaction::GenerateTransaction(theFromInbox,
13394                                                                                                                  OTTransaction::transferReceipt,
13395                                                                                                                  lNewTransactionNumber);
13396 
13397                                         if (NULL == pInboxTransaction) OT_FAIL;
13398 
13399                                         // Here we give the sender (by dropping into his inbox) a copy of my acceptItem (for
13400                                         // his transfer), including the transaction number of my acceptance of his transfer.
13401                                         //
13402                                         pInboxTransaction->SetReferenceString(strInReferenceTo);
13403                                         pInboxTransaction->SetReferenceToNum(pItem->GetTransactionNum());   // Right now this has the 'accept the transfer' transaction number.
13404                                         // It could be changed to the original transaction number, as a better
13405                                         // receipt for the original sender. TODO? Decisions....
13406 
13407                                         pInboxTransaction->SetNumberOfOrigin(*pItem);
13408 
13409                                         // Now we have created a new transaction from the server to the sender's inbox
13410                                         // Let's sign it and add to his inbox.
13411                                         pInboxTransaction->ReleaseSignatures();
13412                                         pInboxTransaction->SignContract(m_nymServer);
13413                                         pInboxTransaction->SaveContract();
13414 
13415                                         // At this point I have theInbox ledger, theFromOutbox ledger, theFromINBOX ledger,
13416                                         // and theAccount.  So I should remove the appropriate item from each ledger, and
13417                                         // add the acceptance to the sender's inbox, and credit the account....
13418 
13419                                         // First try to credit the amount to the account...
13420                                         if (theAccount.Credit(pOriginalItem->GetAmount()))
13421                                         {
13422                                             // Add a transfer receipt to the sender's inbox, containing the "accept" transaction as the ref string.
13423                                             // (to notify him that his transfer was accepted; once he accepts it, the trans# can be removed from his issued list.)
13424                                             //
13425                                             theFromInbox.   AddTransaction(*pInboxTransaction);
13426 
13427                                             // The original item carries the transaction number that the original
13428                                             // sender used to generate the transfer in the first place. This is the number
13429                                             // by which that transaction is available in the sender's outbox.
13430                                             //
13431                                             // Then ANOTHER transaction was created, by the server, in order to put
13432                                             // a pending transfer into the recipient's inbox. This has its own transaction
13433                                             // number, generated by the server at that time.
13434                                             //
13435                                             // So we remove the original transfer from the sender's outbox using the
13436                                             // transaction number on the original item, and we remove the pending transfer
13437                                             // from the recipient's inbox using the transaction number from the pending
13438                                             // transaction.
13439 
13440                                             // UPDATE: These two transactions correspond to each other, so I am now creating
13441                                             // them with the same transaction number. As you can see, this makes them easy
13442                                             // to remove as well.
13443 
13444                                             pServerTransaction->DeleteBoxReceipt(theFromOutbox); // faster.
13445 //                                          theFromOutbox.  DeleteBoxReceipt(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
13446                                             theFromOutbox.  RemoveTransaction(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
13447 
13448                                             pServerTransaction->DeleteBoxReceipt(theInbox); // faster.
13449 //                                          theInbox.       DeleteBoxReceipt(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
13450                                             theInbox.       RemoveTransaction(pServerTransaction->GetTransactionNum());
13451 
13452                                             // NOTICE BTW, warning: Notice that the box receipts are marked for deletion
13453                                             // the instant they are removed from their respective boxes. Meanwhile, the client
