13454                                             // may not have actually DOWNLOADED those box receipts. Once they are ACTUALLY
13455                                             // deleted, then client will never have the chance. It's assumed that client doesn't
13456                                             // care, since the receipts are already out of his box.
13457 
13458                                             // ----------------------------------------------
13459 
13460                                             theFromInbox.   ReleaseSignatures();
13461                                             theFromOutbox.  ReleaseSignatures();
13462 
13463                                             theFromInbox.   SignContract(m_nymServer);
13464                                             theFromOutbox.  SignContract(m_nymServer);
13465 
13466                                             theFromInbox.   SaveContract();
13467                                             theFromOutbox.  SaveContract();
13468 
13469                                             theFromInbox.   SaveInbox();
13470                                             theFromOutbox.  SaveOutbox();
13471                                             // ----------------------------------------
13472 
13473                                             // Release any signatures that were there before (Old ones won't
13474                                             // verify anymore anyway, since the content has changed.)
13475                                             theInbox.       ReleaseSignatures();
13476                                             theInbox.       SignContract(m_nymServer);
13477                                             theInbox.       SaveContract();
13478                                             theAccount.     SaveInbox(theInbox);
13479                                             theAccount.     ReleaseSignatures();
13480                                             theAccount.     SignContract(m_nymServer);
13481                                             theAccount.     SaveContract();
13482                                             theAccount.     SaveAccount();
13483 
13484 
13485                                             // Now we can set the response item as an acknowledgement instead of the default (rejection)
13486                                             // otherwise, if we never entered this block, then it would still be set to rejection, and the
13487                                             // new items would never have been added to the inbox/outboxes, and those files, along with
13488                                             // the account file, would never have had their signatures released, or been re-signed or
13489                                             // re-saved back to file.  The debit failed, so all of those other actions would fail also.
13490                                             // BUT... if the message comes back with acknowledgement--then all of these actions must have
13491                                             // happened, and here is the server's signature to prove it.
13492                                             // Otherwise you get no items and no signature. Just a rejection item in the response transaction.
13493                                             pResponseItem->SetStatus(OTItem::acknowledgement);
13494 
13495                                             // This goes with the call above to theFromInbox.AddTransaction().
13496                                             // Adding a receipt to any box, for real, requires saving the box receipt
13497                                             // as well. (Which is stored in a separate file.)
13498                                             //
13499                                             pInboxTransaction->SaveBoxReceipt(theFromInbox);
13500                                         }
13501                                         else
13502                                         {
13503                                             delete pInboxTransaction; pInboxTransaction = NULL;
13504                                             OTLog::Error("Unable to credit account in OTServer::NotarizeProcessInbox.\n");
13505                                         }
13506                                     } // outbox was successfully loaded
13507                                 }// its type is OTItem::transfer
13508                             }// loaded original item from string
13509                             else
13510                             {
13511                                 OTLog::Error("Error loading original item from inbox transaction.\n");
13512                             }
13513                         }
13514                         else
13515                         {
13516                             OTLog::vError("Error finding original receipt or transfer that client is trying to accept: %ld\n",
13517                                           pItem->GetReferenceToNum());
13518                         }
13519 
13520                         // sign the response item before sending it back (it's already been added to the transaction above)
13521                         // Now, whether it was rejection or acknowledgement, it is set properly and it is signed, and it
13522                         // is owned by the transaction, who will take it from here.
13523                         pResponseItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
13524                         pResponseItem->SaveContract();
13525                     }
13526                     else
13527                     {
13528                         OTString strItemType;
13529                         pItem->GetTypeString(strItemType);
13530 
13531                         OTLog::vError("OTServer::%s: Error, unexpected OTItem::itemType: %s\n",
13532                                       __FUNCTION__, strItemType.Get());
13533                     } // if type == ACCEPT, REJECT, DISPUTE
13534                 } // for LOOP (each item)
13535             } // else (balance agreement verified.)
13536         } // else bSuccessFindingAllTransactions = true
13537     } // Balance Agreement item found.
13538 
13539     // I put this here so it's signed/saved whether the balance agreement itself was successful OR NOT.
13540     // (Or whether it even existed or not.)
13541     //
13542     pResponseBalanceItem->ReleaseSignatures();
13543     pResponseBalanceItem->SignContract(m_nymServer);
13544     pResponseBalanceItem->SaveContract();
13545     // -------------------------------------------------
13546     tranOut.ReleaseSignatures();
13547     tranOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
13548     tranOut.SaveContract();
13549     // -------------------------------------------------
13550     OTString strPath; // SAVE THE RECEIPT TO LOCAL STORAGE (for dispute resolution.)
13551 
13552     // On the server side, response will only have chance to succeed if balance agreement succeeds first.
13553     // Therefore, you will never see successful response but failed balance, since it would stop at the
13554     // balance and response itself would remain failed with no chance of changing.
13555     //
13556     // Thus, "success" must be when balance succeeded and transaction succeeded,
13557     // and "failure" must be when balance succeeded but transaction failed.
13558     //
13559     // If NEITHER succeeded, then there is no point recording it to a file, now is there?
13560 
13561     const OTString strAcctID(ACCOUNT_ID);
13562 
13563     if (tranOut.GetSuccess())
13564     {
13565         // Balance agreement was a success, AND process inbox was a success.
13566         // Therefore, remove any relevant issued numbers from theNym (those he's
13567         // now officially no longer responsible for), and save.
13568         //
13569         for (int32_t i = 0; i < theTempNym.GetIssuedNumCount(SERVER_ID); i++)
13570         {
13571             int64_t lTemp = theTempNym.GetIssuedNum(SERVER_ID, i);
13572             theNym.RemoveIssuedNum(m_nymServer, m_strServerID, lTemp, false); // bSave = false (saved below)
13573         }
13574         //-------------------------------------------
13575         // The Nym (server side) stores a list of all opening and closing cron #s.
13576         // So when the number is released from the Nym, we also take it off that list.
13577         //
13578         std::set<int64_t> & theIDSet = theNym.GetSetOpenCronItems();
13579         for (int32_t i = 0; i < theTempClosingNumNym.GetIssuedNumCount(SERVER_ID); i++)
13580         {
13581             int64_t lTemp = theTempClosingNumNym.GetIssuedNum(SERVER_ID, i);
13582             theIDSet.erase(lTemp); // now it's erased from within the Nym.
13583         }
13584         theNym.SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer);
13585         //-------------------------------------------
13586         bOutSuccess = true;     // the processInbox was successful.
13587         //-------------------------------------------
13588         strPath.Format((char*)"%s.success", strAcctID.Get());
13589     }
13590     else
13591         strPath.Format((char*)"%s.fail", strAcctID.Get());
13592 
13593     const char * szFoldername = OTFolders::Receipt().Get();
13594 
13595     // Save the receipt. (My outgoing transaction including the client's signed request that triggered it.)
13596     tranOut.SaveContract(szFoldername, strPath.Get());
13597 }
13598 
13599 
13600 
13601 
13602 
13603 bool OTServer::ValidateServerIDfromUser(OTString & strServerID)
13604 {
13605     static bool bFirstTime = true;
13606 
13607     if (bFirstTime)
13608     {
13609         bFirstTime=false;
13610 
13611         // This part is now done when the server XML file is first loaded
13612 //      if (!m_nymServer.Loadx509CertAndPrivateKey())
13613 //      {
13614 //          OTLog::Error("Error loading server certificate and keys.\n");
13615 //      }
13616 //      else {
13617 //          OTLog::Error("Success loading server certificate and keys.\n");
13618 //      }
13619 
13620         //TODO..  Notice after calling Loadx509CertAndPrivateKey, I do not call
13621         // VerifyPseudonym immediately after, like the client does. That's because
13622         // the client's ID is a hash of his public key, so that function compares
13623         // the two.
13624         //
13625         // But the server ID is a hash of the SERVER CONTRACT. Which will NOT match
13626         // the hash of the server public key.
13627         //
13628         // Ideally the server will load the contract, and then EXTRACT the public key
13629         // from the contract, and then use it to verify the signature on the contract,
13630         // and THEN hash the contract, to get the ServerID,
13631 
13632         // Here's basically what I need to add:  m_ServerContract
13633         //
13634         // ServerContract.SetFilename("server contract file")
13635         // ServerContract.LoadContract()
13636         // ServerContract.VerifyContractID()
13637         // if (success)
13638         //    ServerContract.VerifySignature(m_nymServer);
13639         // if (success)
13640         //    SUCCESS LOADING SERVER CERTIFICATES AND KEYS.
13641     }
13642 
13643     if (m_strServerID == strServerID)
13644     {
13645         return true;
13646     }
13647 
13648     return false;
13649 }
13650 
13651 
13652 
13653 
13654 
13655 bool OTServer::ProcessUserCommand(OTMessage & theMessage,
13656                                   OTMessage & msgOut,
13657                                   OTClientConnection * pConnection/*=NULL*/,
13658                                   OTPseudonym * pNym/*=NULL*/) // this function will create the Nym if it's not passed in. We pass it in so the caller has the option to query things about the Nym (like if it actually exists.)
13659 {
13660     msgOut.m_strRequestNum.Set(theMessage.m_strRequestNum); // to prevent replay attacks.
13661 
13662     /*
13663      p_Config->SetOption_bool("permissions", "admin_server_locked",     __admin_server_locked);
13664      */
13665     // ---------------------------------------------
13666     if ((true == OTServer::__admin_server_locked) &&    // IF (the OT Server is in "lock down" mode)
13667         ((OTServer::GetOverrideNymID().size() <= 0) ||  // AND (there's no Override Nym ID listed --OR-- the Override Nym ID doesn't
13668          (0 != OTServer::GetOverrideNymID().compare((theMessage.m_strNymID.Get())))))   // match the Nym's ID who sent this message)
13669     {
13670         OTLog::vOutput(0, "OTServer::ProcessUserCommand: Nym %s: failed attempt to message the server, while server is in **LOCK DOWN MODE**.\n",
13671                        theMessage.m_strNymID.Get());
13672         return false;
13673     }
13674     // ----------------------------------------------
13675 
13676     // Validate the server ID, to keep users from intercepting a valid requst
13677     // and sending it to the wrong server.
13678     if (false == ValidateServerIDfromUser(theMessage.m_strServerID))
13679     {
13680         OTLog::Error("OTServer::ProcessUserCommand: Invalid server ID sent in command request.\n");
13681         return false;
13682     }
13683     else
13684     {
13685         OTLog::Output(4, "Received valid Server ID with command request.\n");
13686     }
13687     // ----------------------------------------------
13688     // NYM WAS PASSED IN
13689     //
13690     OTPseudonym theNym(theMessage.m_strNymID);
13691 
13692     if (NULL == pNym)
13693         pNym = &theNym; // If one wasn't passed in, we'll use the one constructed here. (One line up.)
13694     else if (!pNym->CompareID(theNym))
13695     {
13696         OTString strTempNymID;
13697         pNym->GetIdentifier(strTempNymID);
13698         OTLog::vError("OTServer::ProcessUserCommand: NymID on the optional Nym passed in (%s) "
13699                       "does NOT match the NymID on theMessage (%s). (Returning false.)\n",
13700                       strTempNymID.Get(), theMessage.m_strNymID.Get());
13701         return false;
13702     }
13703     // ----------------------------------------------
13704     // NYM IS ACTUALLY SERVER
13705 
13706     // For special cases where the Nym sending the transaction has the same public key as
13707     // the server itself. (IE it IS the server Nym, then we'd want to use the already-loaded
13708     // server nym object instead of loading a fresh one, so the two don't overwrite each other.)
13709     //
13710     const bool bNymIsServerNym = (m_strServerUserID.Compare(theMessage.m_strNymID) ? true : false);
13711 //  OTPseudonym * pNym = &theNym; // this is now done higher up in this function.
13712 
13713     if (bNymIsServerNym)
13714         pNym = &m_nymServer;
13715 
13716     //**********************************************************************************************
13717 
13718     // This command is special because the User sent his public key, not just his ID.
13719     // We have to verify the two together.
13720     //
13721     // At this point the user doesn't even have an account, so there is no public key
13722     // to look up from the database.
13723     //
13724     // If the ServerID in the reply matches the ID calculated from the Server Contract,
13725     // that means the user, without asking for the server's public key, can just extract
13726     // the public key from the contract from which the serverID was first calculated. (The
13727     // ID is a hash of the contract.)
13728     //
13729     // In other words, the user reads a contract. It's signed. The signature is verified
13730     // by a public key that is embedded in the contract. If the server, a URL also embedded in
13731     // the contract, acknowledges the ServerID, then the user can encrypt everything to the
13732     // public key in the contract, without asking the server for a copy of that key.
13733     //
13734     // Only the private key who signed that contract will be able to read the communications from
13735     // the user.
13736     //
13737     // I definitely have to build in an option for x509 certs to be used in lieu of public keys.
13738     // Otherwise the key is not ever revokable -- yet it's in a contract!  What is the issuer supposed
13739     // to do if that key is stolen? Make a public announcement?
13740     //
13741     // UPDATE ONE-LINE NOTE: THE TRUE SOLUTION TO THIS WHOLE ISSUE IS:   *** NAMECOIN ***
13742     // (Now continuing back to my old comments from 18 months ago...)
13743     //
13744     // In such a case, the issuer would have to put a "check this URL to make sure contract still good"
13745     // variable into the contract so that the users have the chance to make sure the contract is still
13746     // good and the contract's private key hasn't been stolen. Well guess what? That's what x509 does.
13747     // Therefore the appropriate solution is for the server to support x509s, and to look up the authority
13748     // and verify certs, so that users have recourse in the event their private key is stolen. (They can
13749     // just use their Cert to issue a new public key, which the transaction server would be smart enough
13750     // to use, once the certificate authority signs off on it. (Since the user uses an x509 from a
13751     // specific authority, then I can trust that whatever that authority says, that user wanted it to say.)
13752     // Without knowing the authority itself, I can now trust it because the user has asked me to trust it.
13753     // Fair enough!
13754     //
13755     // Similarly a user should be able to use his x509 Cert instead of his public key, and the server
13756     // should verify that cert whenever it's used to make sure it's up to date.  This takes the
13757     // problem off of the user's hands by way of a trusted authority.
13758     //
13759     // In fact this transaction server is really just a transaction VERIFIER. It's just another form
13760     // of trusted 3rd party. Just like Verisign is an authority who ceritifies an identity, so this
13761     // server is an authority who certifies a transaction. It's like a timestamping server. In fact
13762     // it should have timestamping built in as one of the functions.
13763     //
13764     // Transactions do not actually occur on the server, per se. They occur between the USERS.
13765     // All the server does it certify that the numbers are correct. It's like accounting software.
13766     // Ultimately the users are the ones making a transaction, and they are the ones who are
13767     // responsible to back up their promises in real life and potentially in court. All the software
13768     // does is CERTIFY that the users DID make certain agreements at certain times, and digitally sign
13769     // those certifications.
13770     //
13771     // Thus, this server is very similar to Verisign. It is a trusted 3rd party who users can trust
13772     // to authenticate their transactions. Instead of authenticating certifications like Verisign does,
13773     // it authenticates transactions.
13774     //
13775     // UPDATE: May not want x509's after all, since it provides an opening for governments to
13776     // serve warrants on the authority site and switch certs whenever they want to (BAD THING!)
13777     //
13778     OTString strMsgNymID;
13779     pNym->GetIdentifier(strMsgNymID);
13780 
13781     if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("checkServerID"))
13782     {
13783         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received a checkServerID message. Nym: %s ...\n", strMsgNymID.Get());
13784         // ------------------------------------------------------------
13785         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_check_server_id);
13786         /*
13787          #define OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(BOOL_VAR_NAME) \
13788         { \
13789             const char * pNymAllowedIDStr   = theMessage.m_strNymID.Get(); \
13790             const char * pActionNameStr     = theMessage.m_strCommand.Get(); \
13791             \
13792             if (false == NYM_IS_ALLOWED(pNymAllowedIDStr, (BOOL_VAR_NAME))) \
13793             { \
13794                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "Nym %s attempted an action (%s), but based on server configuration, he's not allowed.\n", \
13795                                pNymAllowedIDStr, pActionNameStr); \
13796                 return false; \
13797             } \
13798         }
13799         */
13800         // ------------------------------------------------------------
13801         OTAsymmetricKey * pNymAuthentKey = OTAsymmetricKey::KeyFactory();
13802         OTAsymmetricKey * pNymEncryptKey = OTAsymmetricKey::KeyFactory();
13803         // ------------------------------------------------------------
13804         OT_ASSERT(NULL != pNymAuthentKey);
13805         OT_ASSERT(NULL != pNymEncryptKey);
13806         // ------------------------------------------------------------
13807         OTCleanup<OTAsymmetricKey> theAuthKeyAngel(pNymAuthentKey);
13808         OTCleanup<OTAsymmetricKey> theEncrKeyAngel(pNymEncryptKey);
13809         // ------------------------------------------------------------
13810         OTAsymmetricKey & nymAuthentKey    = *pNymAuthentKey;
13811         OTAsymmetricKey & nymEncryptionKey = *pNymEncryptKey;
13812         // ------------------------------------------------------------
13813         const bool bIfNymPublicKey =
13814                 (nymAuthentKey   .SetPublicKey(theMessage.m_strNymPublicKey, true/*bEscaped*/) &&
13815                  nymEncryptionKey.SetPublicKey(theMessage.m_strNymID2,       true/*bEscaped*/));
13816 
13817         if (bIfNymPublicKey)
13818         {
13819             if (theMessage.VerifyWithKey(nymAuthentKey)) // Not all contracts are signed with the authentication key, but messages are.
13820             {
13821                 OTLog::Output(3, "Signature verified! The message WAS signed by "
13822                         "the Private Authentication Key inside the message.\n");
13823 
13824                 // This is only for verified Nyms, (and we're verified in here!) We do this so that
13825                 // we have the option later to encrypt the replies back to the client...(using the
13826                 // client's public key that we set here.)
13827                 if (NULL != pConnection)
13828                     pConnection->SetPublicKey(theMessage.m_strNymID2); // theMessage.m_strNymID2 contains the public encryption key for sending an encrypted reply.
13829 
13830                 UserCmdCheckServerID(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
13831                 return true;
13832             }
13833             else
13834             {
13835                 OTLog::Output(0, "checkServerID: Signature verification failed!\n");
13836                 return false;
13837             }
13838         }
13839         else
13840         {
13841             OTLog::Error("Failure reading Nym's signing and/or encryption keys from message.\n");
13842             return false;
13843         }
13844     }
13845 
13846     // The below block is now COMPLETE. (For credentials new system.)
13847     //
13848     // Next, make sure the client side is properly forming the new version of this message,
13849     // and make sure it creates credentials when necessary, if they don't already exist
13850     // (Since this new server version ONLY accepts credentials, and not old-style public keys.)
13851     //
13852     // This command is also special because again, the User sent his public key, not just his ID.
13853     // We have to verify the two together.
13854     // UPDATE: now the Nym sends not a public key, but a full set of credentials along with
13855     // a list of credential IDs. You load the list of credential IDs as if you are loading the Nym
13856     // from a string. (It's like a nym that only contains the credential parts.) Then in the process
13857     // of loading the Nym, it will load the credentials from the mapOfStrings.
13858     //
13859     else if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("createUserAccount"))
13860     {
13861         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received a createUserAccount message. Nym: %s ...\n", strMsgNymID.Get());
13862         // ------------------------------------------------------------
13863         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_create_user_acct);
13864         // ------------------------------------------------------------
13865         if (bNymIsServerNym)
13866         {
13867             OTLog::Output(0, "**** Sorry, the server Nym is forbidden from using "
13868                           "the createUserAccount message as a client. "
13869                           "PLEASE REMOVE THAT NYM FROM YOUR WALLET!! Create a fresh Nym to use. ***\n");
13870             return false;
13871         }
13872         // ------------------------------------------------------------
13873         // First try to get Credentials, if there are any.
13874         //
13875         OTASCIIArmor & ascArmor  = theMessage.m_ascPayload;  // credentialList  (New style! Credentials.)
13876         OTASCIIArmor & ascArmor2 = theMessage.m_ascPayload2; // credentials
13877         // -----------------------------------------------------
13878         const bool bHasCredentials = (ascArmor.Exists() && ascArmor2.Exists());
13879         // -------------------------------------------------
13880         if (bHasCredentials) // New style of doing things, for Nym keys. Credentials!
13881         {
13882             // -------------------------------------------------
13883             // credentialList
13884             //
13885             OTString strCredentialList(ascArmor);
13886 
13887             if (strCredentialList.Exists())
13888             {
13889                 OTDB::Storable  * pStorable = OTDB::DecodeObject(OTDB::STORED_OBJ_STRING_MAP, ascArmor2.Get());
13890                 OTCleanup<OTDB::Storable> theStorableAngel(pStorable); // It will definitely be cleaned up.
13891                 OTDB::StringMap * pMap = (NULL == pStorable) ? NULL : dynamic_cast<OTDB::StringMap *>(pStorable);
13892                 if (NULL == pMap)
13893                     OTLog::vOutput(0, "%s: @createUserAccount: Failed decoding StringMap object.\n", __FUNCTION__);
13894                 // ----------------------------------------
13895                 else
13896                 {
13897                     mapOfStrings & theMap = pMap->the_map;
13898                     // ----------------------------------------
13899                     // NOTE: This action may very well be a malicious attacker saving a false
13900                     // credential list and a false set of credentials under a certain Nym ID!
13901                     // However, a Nym is always verified after loading, before being used for
13902                     // anything. (AND MUST BE.) And that includes before being saved to disk.
13903                     //
13904                     // DILEMMA at this point was, I don't want to save the credentials into the
13905                     // actual folder locations BEFORE they have been verified...
13906                     // SO I had to add "LoadFromString" functions to OTCredential (which I have done.)
13907                     // So now I should be able to continue here, load the credentials up from string,
13908                     // verify them, and if verified, THEN save them to disk...
13909                     // OTPseudonym::LoadFromString now allows you to load credentials from the map passed
13910                     // in (from the message) versus just reading them from local storage.
13911                     //
13912                     if (false == pNym->LoadFromString(strCredentialList, &theMap))
13913                     {
13914                         OTLog::vError("%s: @createUserAccount: Failure loading nym %s "
13915                                       "from credential string.\n",
13916                                       __FUNCTION__, theMessage.m_strNymID.Get());
13917                     }
13918                     // Now that the Nym has been loaded up from the message parameters,
13919                     // including the list of credential IDs, and the map containing the
13920                     // credentials themselves, let's try to Verify the pseudonym. If we
13921                     // verify, then we're safe to save the credentials to storage.
13922                     //
13923                     else if (false == pNym->VerifyPseudonym())
13924                     {
13925                         OTLog::vError("%s: @createUserAccount: Loaded nym %s "
13926                                       "from credentials, but then it failed verifying.\n",
13927                                       __FUNCTION__, theMessage.m_strNymID.Get());
13928                     }
13929                     else// Okay, we loaded the Nym up from the credentials in the message, AND
13930                     {   // verified the Nym (including the credentials.)
13931                         // So let's save it to local storage...
13932                         //
13933 
13934                         OTLog::Output(3, "Pseudonym verified!\n");
13935                         // -------------------------------------------------------------
13936                         // Okay, now that the Nym is verified, let's verify the message itself...
13937                         //
13938                         if (false == theMessage.VerifySignature(*pNym)) // FYI, OTMessage overrides VerifySignature with VerifySigAuthent.
13939                         {                                               // (Because we use authentication keys, not signing keys, for messages.)
13940                             OTLog::Output(0, "@createUserAccount: Authentication signature -- verification failed!\n");
13941                             return false;
13942                         }
13943                         else
13944                         {
13945                             OTLog::Output(3, "Signature verified! The message WAS signed by "
13946                                           "the Nym\'s private authentication key.\n");
13947                             // ---------------------------------------------------------------
13948                             // SAVE the credentials to local storage, now that things are verified.
13949                             //
13950                             std::string str_nym_id = theMessage.m_strNymID.Get();
13951                             OTString strFilename;
13952                             strFilename.Format("%s.cred", str_nym_id.c_str());
13953 
13954                             bool     bStoredList = false;
13955                             OTString strOutput;
13956 
13957                             if (ascArmor.Exists() &&
13958                                 ascArmor.WriteArmoredString(strOutput, "CREDENTIAL LIST") && // bEscaped=false by default.
13959                                 strOutput.Exists())
13960                                 bStoredList = OTDB::StorePlainString(strOutput.Get(),
13961                                                                      OTFolders::Pubcred().Get(),
13962                                                                      strFilename.Get());
13963                             if (!bStoredList)
13964                                 OTLog::vError("%s: @createUserAccount: Failed trying to armor or store: %s\n",
13965                                               __FUNCTION__, strFilename.Get());
13966                             // -------------------------------------------------
13967                             else // IF the list saved, then we save the credentials themselves...
13968                             {
13969                                 OTLog::vOutput(1, "@createUserAccount: Success saving public credential list for Nym: %s\n",
13970                                                str_nym_id.c_str());
13971                                 // ----------------------------------------
13972                                 FOR_EACH(mapOfStrings, theMap)
13973                                 {
13974                                     std::string str_cred_id = (*it).first;
13975                                     OTString    strCredential((*it).second);
13976                                     // ------------------------------------------
13977                                     bool bStoredCredential = false;
13978                                     strOutput.Release();
13979                                     OTASCIIArmor ascLoopArmor(strCredential);
13980                                     if (ascLoopArmor.Exists() &&
13981                                         ascLoopArmor.WriteArmoredString(strOutput, "CREDENTIAL") && // bEscaped=false by default.
13982                                         strOutput.Exists())
13983                                         bStoredCredential = OTDB::StorePlainString(strOutput.Get(),
13984                                                                                    OTFolders::Pubcred().Get(),
13985                                                                                    str_nym_id,
13986                                                                                    str_cred_id);
13987                                     if (!bStoredCredential)
13988                                         OTLog::vError("%s: @createUserAccount: Failed trying to store credential %s for nym %s.\n",
13989                                                       __FUNCTION__, str_cred_id.c_str(), str_nym_id.c_str());
13990                                     else
13991                                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "@createUserAccount: Success saving public credential ID: %s\n",
13992                                                        str_cred_id.c_str());
13993                                 } //FOR_EACH
13994                             } // else (bStoredList)
13995                             // ---------------------------------------------------------------
13996                             // Make sure we are encrypting the message we send back, if possible.
13997                             //
13998                             OTString          strPublicEncrKey, strPublicSignKey;
13999                             OTAsymmetricKey & thePublicEncrKey = (OTAsymmetricKey &)pNym->GetPublicEncrKey(); // todo cast
14000                             OTAsymmetricKey & thePublicSignKey = (OTAsymmetricKey &)pNym->GetPublicSignKey(); // todo cast
14001 
14002                             thePublicEncrKey.GetPublicKey(strPublicEncrKey, false); // bEscaped=true by default
14003                             thePublicSignKey.GetPublicKey(strPublicSignKey, false); // bEscaped=true by default
14004 
14005                             // We also (for now) set the Nym's keypair (which is being phased out entirely,
14006                             // and being replaced with credentials.)
14007                             //
14008                             if (strPublicSignKey.Exists())
14009                                 pNym->SetPublicKey(strPublicSignKey, false); // bEscaped=true by default
14010 
14011                             // This is only for verified Nyms, (and we're verified in here!) We do this so that
14012                             // we have the option later to encrypt the replies back to the client...(using the
14013                             // client's public key that we set here.)
14014                             if (strPublicEncrKey.Exists() && (NULL != pConnection))
14015                                 pConnection->SetPublicKey(thePublicEncrKey);
14016                             // ---------------------------------------------------------------
14017                             // Look up the NymID and see if it's already a valid user account.
14018                             //
14019                             // If it is, then we can't very well create it twice, can we?
14020                             //
14021                             // UPDATE: Actually we should, in such cases, just return true with
14022                             // a copy of the Nymfile. Helps prevent sync errors, and gives people
14023                             // a way to grab the server's copy of their nymfile, if they need it.
14024                             //
14025                             OTLog::Output(0, "Verifying account doesn't already exist... "
14026                                           "(IGNORE ANY ERRORS, IMMEDIATELY BELOW, ABOUT FAILURE OPENING FILES)\n");
14027 
14028                             // Prepare to send success or failure back to user.
14029                             // (1) set up member variables
14030                             msgOut.m_strCommand     = "@createUserAccount";     // reply to createUserAccount
14031                             msgOut.m_strNymID       = theMessage.m_strNymID;    // UserID
14032                             msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;            // ServerID, a hash of the server contract.
14033                             msgOut.m_bSuccess       = false;
14034 
14035                             // already done, top of this function.
14036 //                          msgOut.m_strRequestNum.Set(theMessage.m_strRequestNum); // to prevent replay attacks.
14037 
14038                             // We send the user's message back to him, ascii-armored,
14039                             // as part of our response.
14040                             OTString tempInMessage;
14041                             theMessage.SaveContractRaw(tempInMessage);
14042                             msgOut.m_ascInReferenceTo.SetString(tempInMessage);
14043 
14044                             bool bLoadedSignedNymfile = pNym->LoadSignedNymfile(m_nymServer);
14045 
14046                             // He ALREADY exists. We'll set success to true, and send him a copy of his own nymfile.
14047                             // (Signature is verified already anyway, by this point.)
14048                             //
14049                             if (bLoadedSignedNymfile &&
14050                                 (false == pNym->IsMarkedForDeletion()))
14051                             {
14052                                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "(Allowed in order to prevent sync issues) "
14053                                                "==> User is registering nym that already exists: %s\n",
14054                                                theMessage.m_strNymID.Get());
14055 
14056                                 OTString strNymContents;
14057                                 pNym->SavePseudonym(strNymContents);
14058                                 // ------------------------
14059                                 OTIdentifier theNewNymID, SERVER_ID(m_strServerID);
14060                                 pNym->GetIdentifier(theNewNymID);
14061                                 // ------------------------------------
14062                                 OTLedger     theNymbox(theNewNymID, theNewNymID, SERVER_ID);
14063                                 // ------------------------------------
14064                                 bool bSuccessLoadingNymbox  = theNymbox.LoadNymbox();
14065 
14066                                 if (true == bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
14067                                     bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = (theNymbox.VerifyContractID() && theNymbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer));
14068 //                                  bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = (theNymbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)); // (No need here to load all the Box Receipts)
14069                                 else
14070                                 {
14071                                     bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = theNymbox.GenerateLedger(theNewNymID, SERVER_ID, OTLedger::nymbox, true); // bGenerateFile=true
14072 
14073                                     if (bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
14074                                     {
14075                                         bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = theNymbox.SignContract(m_nymServer);
14076 
14077                                         if (bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
14078                                         {
14079                                             bSuccessLoadingNymbox = theNymbox.SaveContract();
14080 
14081                                             if (bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
14082                                                 bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = theNymbox.SaveNymbox();
14083                                         }
14084                                     }
14085                                 }
14086                                 // -----------------------------------------------------
14087                                 // by this point, the nymbox DEFINITELY exists -- or not. (generation might have failed, or verification.)
14088                                 //
14089                                 if (false == bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
14090                                 {
14091                                     OTLog::vError("Error during user account re-registration. Failed verifying or generating nymbox for user: %s\n",
14092                                                   theMessage.m_strNymID.Get());
14093                                 }
14094                                 // -----------------------------------------------------
14095                                 msgOut.m_ascPayload.SetString(strNymContents);
14096                                 msgOut.m_bSuccess   = bSuccessLoadingNymbox;
14097                                 msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
14098                                 msgOut.SaveContract();
14099                                 return true;
14100                             }
14101                             // --------------------------------------
14102                             else
14103 //                               ((pNym->IsMarkedForDeletion()      &&  (true == bLoadedPublicKey)) ||  // We allow people to resurrect deleted Nyms.
14105 //                                (false == bLoadedPublicKey))                                          // can still buy usage credits.
14106                             {
14107                                 if (pNym->IsMarkedForDeletion())
14108                                     pNym->MarkAsUndeleted();
14109 
14110                                 // Good -- this means the account doesn't already exist.
14111                                 // Let's create it.
14112 
14113                                 msgOut.m_bSuccess = theMessage.SaveContract(OTFolders::UserAcct().Get(), theMessage.m_strNymID.Get());
14114 
14115                                 // First we save the createUserAccount message in the accounts folder...
14116                                 if (msgOut.m_bSuccess)
14117                                 {
14118                                     OTLog::Output(0, "Success saving new user account verification file.\n");
14119 
14120                                     OTIdentifier theNewNymID, SERVER_ID(m_strServerID);
14121                                     pNym->GetIdentifier(theNewNymID);
14122                                     // ------------------------------------
14123                                     OTLedger     theNymbox(theNewNymID, theNewNymID, SERVER_ID);
14124                                     // ------------------------------------
14125                                     bool bSuccessLoadingNymbox  = theNymbox.LoadNymbox();
14126 
14127                                     if (true == bSuccessLoadingNymbox) // that's strange, this user didn't exist... but maybe I allow people to drop notes anyway, so then the nymbox might already exist, with usage tokens and messages inside....
14128                                         bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = (theNymbox.VerifyContractID() && theNymbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer));
14129 //                                      bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = (theNymbox.VerifyAccount(m_nymServer)); // (No need here to load all the Box Receipts)
14130                                     else
14131                                     {
14132                                         bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = theNymbox.GenerateLedger(theNewNymID, SERVER_ID, OTLedger::nymbox, true); // bGenerateFile=true
14133                                         if (bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
14134                                         {
14135                                             bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = theNymbox.SignContract(m_nymServer);
14136                                             if (bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
14137                                             {
14138                                                 bSuccessLoadingNymbox = theNymbox.SaveContract();
14139 
14140                                                 if (bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
14141                                                     bSuccessLoadingNymbox   = theNymbox.SaveNymbox();
14142                                             }
14143                                         }
14144                                     }
14145                                     // -----------------------------------------------------
14146                                     // by this point, the nymbox DEFINITELY exists -- or not. (generation might have failed, or verification.)
14147 
14148                                     if (false == bSuccessLoadingNymbox)
14149                                     {
14150                                         OTLog::vError("Error during user account registration. Failed verifying or generating nymbox for user: %s\n",
14151                                                       theMessage.m_strNymID.Get());
14152                                     }
14153                                     // Either we loaded it up (it already existed) or we didn't, in which case we should
14154                                     // save it now (to create it.)
14155                                     //
14156                                     else if (bLoadedSignedNymfile || pNym->SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer))
14157                                     {
14158                                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "Success creating new Nym. (User account fully created.)\n");
14159 
14160                                         OTString strNymContents;
14161                                         pNym->SavePseudonym(strNymContents);
14162                                         // ------------------
14163                                         msgOut.m_ascPayload.SetString(strNymContents);
14164                                         msgOut.m_bSuccess = true;
14165                                         msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
14166                                         msgOut.SaveContract();
14167                                         return true;
14168                                     }
14169                                     else
14170                                     {
14171                                         msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
14172                                         msgOut.SaveContract();
14173                                         return true;
14174                                     }
14175                                 }
14176                                 else
14177                                 {
14178                                     OTLog::Error("Error saving new user account verification file.\n");
14179                                     msgOut.SignContract(m_nymServer);
14180                                     msgOut.SaveContract();
14181                                     return true;
14182                                 }
14183                             }
14184                             // -------------
14185                             return true;
14186                         }
14187                     } // Success loading and verifying the Nym based on his credentials.
14188                 } // Success decoding the map of credentials from the message.
14189                 // -------------------------------------
14190             } // credential list exists, after base64-decoding.
14191         } // Has Credentials.
14192     }
14193     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
14194     // Look up the NymID and see if it's a valid user account.
14195     //
14196     // If we didn't receive a public key (above)
14197     // Or read one from our files (below)
14198     // ... then we'd have no way of validating the requests.
14199     //
14200     // If it is, then we read the public key from that Pseudonym and use it to verify any
14201     // requests bearing that NymID.
14202     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
14203     if (!bNymIsServerNym                      &&
14204         (false == pNym->LoadPublicKey())   // && // Old style. (Deprecated, but fine for now since it calls LoadCredentials.)
14205        )
14206     {
14207         OTLog::vError("Failure loading public credentials for Nym: %s\n", theMessage.m_strNymID.Get());
14208         return false;
14209     }
14210     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
14211     if (!bNymIsServerNym && pNym->IsMarkedForDeletion())
14212     {
14213         OTLog::vOutput(0, "(Failed) attempt by client to use a deleted Nym: %s\n",
14214                        theMessage.m_strNymID.Get());
14215         return false;
14216     }
14217     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
14218     // Okay, the file was read into memory and Public Key was successfully extracted!
14219     // Next, let's use that public key to verify (1) the NymID and (2) the signature
14220     // on the message that we're processing.
14221 
14222     if (pNym->VerifyPseudonym())
14223     {
14224         OTLog::Output(3, "Pseudonym verified!\n");
14225 
14226         // So far so good. Now let's see if the signature matches...
14227         if (theMessage.VerifySignature(*pNym))
14228         {
14229             OTLog::Output(3, "Signature verified! The message WAS signed by "
14230                     "the Nym\'s private key.\n");
14231 
14232             // Get the public key from pNym, and set it into the connection.
14233             // This is only for verified Nyms, (and we're verified in here!) We do this so that
14234             // we have the option later to encrypt the replies back to the client...(using the
14235             // client's public key that we set here.)
14236             if (NULL != pConnection)
14237                 pConnection->SetPublicKey(pNym->GetPublicEncrKey());
14238 
14239             // Now we might as well load up the rest of the Nym.
14240             // Notice I use the || to only load the nymfile if it's NOT the server Nym.
14241             if (bNymIsServerNym || pNym->LoadSignedNymfile(m_nymServer))
14242             {
14243                 OTLog::Output(2,  "Successfully loaded Nymfile into memory.\n");
14244 
14245                 // *****************************************************************************
14246                 // ENTERING THE INNER SANCTUM OF SECURITY. If the user got all the way to here,
14247                 // Then he has passed multiple levels of security, and all commands below will
14248                 // assume the Nym is secure, validated, and loaded into memory for use.
14249                 //
14250                 // But still need to verify the Request Number for all other commands except
14251                 // Get Request Number itself...
14252                 // *****************************************************************************
14253 
14254                 // Request numbers start at 100 (currently). (Since certain special messages USE 1 already...
14255                 // Such as messages that occur before requestnumbers are possible, like CreateUserAccount.)
14256                 //
14257                 int64_t lRequestNumber = 0;
14258 
14259                 if (false == pNym->GetCurrentRequestNum(m_strServerID, lRequestNumber))
14260                 {
14261                     OTLog::Output(0, "Nym file request number doesn't exist. Apparently first-ever request to server--but everything checks out. "
14262                             "(Shouldn't this request number have been created already when the NymFile was first created???????\n");
14263                     // FIRST TIME!  This account has never before made a single request to this server.
14264                     // The above call always succeeds unless the number just isn't there for that server.
14265                     // Therefore, since it's the first time, we'll create it now:
14266                     pNym->IncrementRequestNum(m_nymServer, m_strServerID);
14267 
14268                     // Call it again so that lRequestNumber is set to 1 also
14269                     if (pNym->GetCurrentRequestNum(m_strServerID, lRequestNumber))
14270                     {
14271                         OTLog::Output(0, "Created first request number in Nym file, apparently first-ever request. "
14272                                 "(Shouldn't this have been created already when the NymFile was first created???????\n");
14273                     }
14274                     else
14275                     {
14276                         OTLog::Error("ERROR creating first request number in Nym file.\n");
14277                         return false;
14278                     }
14279                 }
14280 
14281                 // At this point, I now have the current request number for this nym in lRequestNumber
14282                 // Let's compare it to the one that was sent in the message... (This prevents attackers
14283                 // from repeat-sending intercepted messages to the server.)
14284                 if (false == theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("getRequest"))        // IF it's NOT a getRequest CMD, (therefore requires a request number)
14285                 {
14286                     if (lRequestNumber != atol(theMessage.m_strRequestNum.Get()))  // AND the request number attached does not match what we just read out of the file...
14287                     {
14288                         OTLog::vOutput(0, "Request number sent in this message %ld does not match the one in the file! (%ld)\n",
14289                                 atol(theMessage.m_strRequestNum.Get()), lRequestNumber);
14290                         return false;
14291                     }
14292                     else // it's not a getRequest CMD, and the request number sent DOES match what we read out of the file!!
14293                     {
14294                         // USAGE CREDITS...
14295                         // Since (just below) we IncrementRequestNum() and therefore save the Nym,
14296                         // I figured it's a good spot to do our Usage Credits code, so we don't have
14297                         // to save twice.
14298                         // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
14299                         if ((true == OTServer::__admin_usage_credits) &&    // IF (the OT Server is in "require usage credits" mode)
14300                             (pNym->GetUsageCredits() >= 0 ) &&              // AND the User isn't magically FREE from having to use usage credits (-1 is a get-out-of-jail-free-card.)
14301                             ((OTServer::GetOverrideNymID().size() <= 0) ||  // AND (there's no Override Nym ID listed --OR-- the Override Nym ID doesn't
14302                              (0 != OTServer::GetOverrideNymID().compare((theMessage.m_strNymID.Get())))))   // match the Nym's ID who sent this message)
14303                         {
14304                             const int64_t & lUsageCredits = pNym->GetUsageCredits();
14305 
14306                             if (0 == lUsageCredits) // If the User has ZERO USAGE CREDITS LEFT. (Too bad, even 1 would have squeezed him by here.)
14307                             {
14308                                 OTLog::vOutput(0, "Nym %s: ALL OUT of Usage Credits, while server is in **REQUIRE USAGE CREDITS MODE**!\n",
14309                                                theMessage.m_strNymID.Get());
14310                                 return false;
14311                             }
14312 
14313                             const int64_t lUsageFinal = (lUsageCredits-1);
14314                             pNym->SetUsageCredits(lUsageFinal);
14315                         }
14316                         // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
14317 
14318                         OTLog::vOutput(3, "Request number sent in this message %ld DOES match the one in the file!\n", lRequestNumber);
14319 
14320                         // At this point, it is some OTHER command (besides getRequest)
14321                         // AND the request number verifies, so we're going to increment
14322                         // the number, and let the command process.
14323                         pNym->IncrementRequestNum(m_nymServer, m_strServerID);
14324 
14325                         // *****************************************************************************
14326                         // **INSIDE** THE INNER SANCTUM OF SECURITY. If the user got all the way to here,
14327                         // Then he has passed multiple levels of security, and all commands below will
14328                         // assume the Nym is secure, validated, and loaded into memory for use. They can
14329                         // also assume that the request number has been verified on this message.
14330                         // EVERYTHING checks out.
14331                         // *****************************************************************************
14332 
14333                         // NO RETURN HERE!!!! ON PURPOSE!!!!
14334                     }
14335 
14336                 }
14337                 else  // If you entered this else, that means it IS a getRequest command
14338                       // So we allow it to go through without verifying this step, and without incrementing the counter.
14339                 {
14340                     //pNym->IncrementRequestNum(m_strServerID); // commented out cause this is the one case where we DON'T increment this number.
14341                                                            // We allow the user to get the number, we DON'T increment it, and now the user
14342                                                            // can send it on his next request for some other command, and it will verify
14343                                                            // properly. This prevents repeat messages.
14344 
14345                     // NO RETURN HERE!!!! ON PURPOSE!!!!
14346                 }
14347 
14348 
14349                 // At this point, we KNOW that it is EITHER a GetRequest command, which doesn't require a request number,
14350                 // OR it was some other command, but the request number they sent in the command MATCHES the one that we
14351                 // just read out of the file.
14352 
14353                 // Therefore, we can process ALL messages below this
14354                 // point KNOWING that the Nym is properly verified in all ways.
14355                 // No messages need to worry about verifying the Nym, or about
14356                 // dealing with the Request Number. It's all handled in here.
14357 
14358             }
14359             else
14360             {
14361                 OTLog::vError("Error loading Nymfile: %s\n", theMessage.m_strNymID.Get());
14362                 return false;
14363             }
14364         }
14365         else
14366         {
14367             OTLog::Output(0, "Signature verification failed!\n");
14368             return false;
14369         }
14370     }
14371     else
14372     {
14373         OTLog::Output(0, "Pseudonym failed to verify. Hash of public key doesn't match "
14374                 "Nym ID that was sent.\n");
14375         return false;
14376     }
14377 
14378 
14379     // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
14380 
14381 
14382     // If you made it down this far, that means the Pseudonym verifies! The message is legit.
14383     //
14384     // (Server ID was good, NymID is a valid hash of User's public key, and the Signature on
14385     // the message was signed by the user's private key.)
14386     //
14387     // Now we can process the message.
14388     //
14389     // All the commands below here, it is assumed that the user account exists and is
14390     // referenceable via pNym. (An OTPseudonym object.)
14391     //
14392     // ALL commands below can assume the Nym is real, and that the NymID and Public Key are
14393     // available for use -- and that they verify -- without having to check again and again.
14394 
14395     // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
14396 
14397     // ACKNOWLEDGMENTS OF REPLIES ALREADY RECEIVED (FOR OPTIMIZATION.)
14398 
14399     // On the client side, whenever the client is DEFINITELY made aware of the existence of a
14400     // server reply, he adds its request number to this list, which is sent along with all client-side
14401     // requests to the server.
14402     // The server reads the list on the incoming client message (and it uses these same functions
14403     // to store its own internal list.) If the # already appears on its internal list, then it does
14404     // nothing. Otherwise, it loads up the Nymbox and removes the replyNotice, and then adds the #
14405     // to its internal list.
14406     // For any numbers on the internal list but NOT on the client's list, the server removes from
14407     // the internal list. (The client removed them when it saw the server's internal list, which the
14408     // server sends with its replies.)
14409     //
14410     // This entire protocol, densely described, is unnecessary for OT to function, but is great for
14411     // optimization, as it enables OT to avoid downloading all Box Receipts containing replyNotices,
14412     // as long as the original reply was properly received when the request was originally sent (which
14413     // is MOST of the time...)
14414     // Thus we can eliminate most replyNotice downloads, and likely a large % of box receipt downloads
14415     // as well.
14416     //
14417 
14418     const OTIdentifier SERVER_ID(m_strServerID);
14419 
14420     // The server reads the list of acknowledged replies from the incoming client message...
14421     //
14422     bool bIsDirtyNym    = false; // if we add any acknowledged replies to the server-side list, we will want to save (at the end.)
14423     bool bIsDirtyNymbox = false; // if we remove any replyNotices from the Nymbox, then we will want to save the Nymbox (at the end.)
14424 
14425     std::set<int64_t> numlist_ack_reply;
14426     if (theMessage.m_AcknowledgedReplies.Output(numlist_ack_reply)) // returns false if the numlist was empty.
14427     {
14428         // Load Nymbox
14429         //
14430         OTLedger theNymbox(pNym->GetConstID(), pNym->GetConstID(), SERVER_ID);
14431 
14432         if (theNymbox.LoadNymbox() && theNymbox.VerifySignature(m_nymServer))
14433         {
14434             FOR_EACH(std::set<int64_t>, numlist_ack_reply)
14435             {
14436                 const int64_t lRequestNum = *it;
14437                 // ----------------------------
14438                 // If the # already appears on its internal list, then it does nothing. (It must have already done
14439                 // whatever it needed to do, since it already has the number recorded as acknowledged.)
14440                 //
14441                 // Otherwise, if the # does NOT already appear on server's internal list, then it loads up the
14442                 // Nymbox and removes the replyNotice, and then adds the # to its internal list for safe-keeping.
14443                 //
14444                 if (false == pNym->VerifyAcknowledgedNum(m_strServerID, lRequestNum))
14445                 {
14446                     // Verify whether a replyNotice exists in the Nymbox, with that lRequestNum
14447                     //
14448                     OTTransaction * pReplyNotice = theNymbox.GetReplyNotice(lRequestNum);
14449 
14450                     if (NULL != pReplyNotice)
14451                     {
14452                         // If so, remove it...
14453                         //
14454                         const bool bDeleted = pReplyNotice->DeleteBoxReceipt(theNymbox);
14455                         const bool bRemoved = theNymbox.RemoveTransaction(pReplyNotice->GetTransactionNum()); // deletes
14456                         pReplyNotice = NULL;
14457                         // (pReplyNotice is deleted, below this point, automatically by the above Remove call.)
14458 
14459                         if (!bDeleted || !bRemoved)
14460                             OTLog::Error("OTServer::ProcessUserCommand: Failed trying to delete a box receipt, or "
14461                                          "while removing its stub from the Nymbox.\n");
14462 
14463                         // ...and add lRequestNum to server's acknowledgment list. (So this can't happen twice with same #.)
14464                         //
14465                         if (pNym->AddAcknowledgedNum(m_strServerID, lRequestNum)) // doesn't save (here).
14466                             bIsDirtyNym    = true; // So we don't have to save EACH iteration, but instead just once at the bottom.
14467 
14468                         if (bRemoved)
14469                             bIsDirtyNymbox = true; // So we don't have to save EACH iteration, but instead just once at the bottom.
14470                     }
14471                 } // If server didn't already have a record of this acknowledged request #.
14472             } // FOR_EACH
14473             // --------------------------
14474 
14475             if (bIsDirtyNymbox)
14476             {
14477                 theNymbox.ReleaseSignatures();
14478                 theNymbox.SignContract(m_nymServer);
14479                 theNymbox.SaveContract();
14480                 theNymbox.SaveNymbox();
14481             }
14482         } // If nymbox loaded and verified.
14483     }
14484     // ------------------------------------
14485 
14486     // For any numbers on the server's internal list but NOT on the client's list, the server removes from
14487     // the internal list. (Because the client must have seen my acknowledgment and thus removed the number
14488     // from its own list, so the server doesn't need to display it anymore.)
14489     //
14490     // Thus: iterate through the server's list of numbers, and see if each is on the client's list. If not,
14491     // then remove it from my own (server's) internal list as well.
14492     //
14493     OTNumList numlist_to_remove; // a temp variable where we will put the numbers "to be removed" (so we can remove them all at once, after the loop.)
14494     const int32_t nAcknowledgedNumCount = pNym->GetAcknowledgedNumCount(SERVER_ID);
14495 
14496     if (nAcknowledgedNumCount > 0)
14497     {
14498         for (int32_t i = 0; i < nAcknowledgedNumCount; i++)
14499         {
14500             const int64_t lAcknowledgedNum = pNym->GetAcknowledgedNum(SERVER_ID, i); // index
14501 
14502             // For any numbers on the server's internal list but NOT on the client's list (according
14503             // to the incoming message) the server removes them from its internal list. (If the client
14504             // is done with them, then so is the server.)
14505             //
14506             if (false == theMessage.m_AcknowledgedReplies.Verify(lAcknowledgedNum))
14507             {
14508                 numlist_to_remove.Add(lAcknowledgedNum);
14509             }
14510         } // for
14511         // ---------------------------------
14512         if (numlist_to_remove.Count() > 0)
14513         {
14514             std::set<int64_t> set_server_ack;
14515             // -----------------------------------
14516             if (numlist_to_remove.Output(set_server_ack))
14517                 FOR_EACH(std::set<int64_t>, set_server_ack)
14518                 {
14519                     const int64_t lRequestNum = *it;
14520                     // --------------------------
14521                     if (pNym->RemoveAcknowledgedNum(m_nymServer, m_strServerID, lRequestNum, false)) // bSave=false
14522                         bIsDirtyNym = true;
14523                 }
14524         }
14525     } // if there are server-side ack numbers that could potentially be removed, if client's message doesn't list them.
14526     // -------------------------------------------
14527 
14528     if (bIsDirtyNym)
14529     {
14530         pNym->SaveSignedNymfile(m_nymServer); // we save here.
14531     }
14532 
14533     // Note: in the ultimate future, we wouldn't even save the Nym down here, but we'll let the entire message process
14534     // and then save the Nym at the end.
14535     // Then again -- you'd still want to know if the Nym was locked, at each "save attempt" along the way. Because even
14536     // though the Nym might not actually save at each of those signposts, it should still CANCEL OUT IF IT WOULD FAIL TRYING.
14537     // Of course we still only want to save the Nym once, but we still want each step along the way -- each vital step that
14538     // would normally have saved each time -- to know whether or not it will actually work, and if not, to fail the message
14539     // AT THAT POINT and not somewhere much later, at the bottom, after all kinds of other processing has been done.
14540     //
14541     // Therefore in the new version we will probably still "Save" the Nym at each critical point, but INTERNALLY, it won't
14542     // actually save until the bottom. BUT, even though it won't actually save, it will still know if the TIMESTAMP IS WITHIN
14543     // VALID RANGE (each time), and it will still know that it has definitely locked the resource (which happens the first time)
14544     // and it will still want to set the resource as dirty, internally, even when it doesn't save it right away, because otherwise
14545     // it wouldn't know to save it later, either.
14546 
14547     msgOut.m_strServerID    = m_strServerID;
14548     msgOut.SetAcknowledgments(*pNym); // Must be called AFTER msgOut.m_strServerID is already set. (It uses it.)
14549 
14550     // ****************************************************************************************************
14551 
14552 
14553     if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("getRequest")) // This command is special because it's the only one that doesn't require a request number.
14554                                                        // All of the other commands, below, will fail above if the proper request number isn't included
14555                                                        // in the message.  They will already have failed by this point if they didn't verify.
14556     {
14557         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received a getRequest message. Nym: %s ...\n", strMsgNymID.Get());
14558 
14559         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14560         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_get_request);
14561         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14562 
14563         UserCmdGetRequest(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
14564 
14565         return true;
14566     }
14567     else if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("getTransactionNum"))
14568     {
14569         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received a getTransactionNum message. Nym: %s ...\n", strMsgNymID.Get());
14570 
14571         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14572         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_get_trans_num);
14573         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14574 
14575         UserCmdGetTransactionNum(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
14576 
14577         return true;
14578     }
14579     else if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("checkUser"))
14580     {
14581         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received a checkUser message. Nym: %s ...\n", strMsgNymID.Get());
14582 
14583         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14584         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_check_user);
14585         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14586 
14587         UserCmdCheckUser(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
14588 
14589         return true;
14590     }
14591     else if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("sendUserMessage"))
14592     {
14593         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received a sendUserMessage message. Nym: %s ...\n", strMsgNymID.Get());
14594 
14595         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14596         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_send_message);
14597         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14598 
14599         UserCmdSendUserMessage(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
14600 
14601         return true;
14602     }
14603     else if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("sendUserInstrument"))
14604     {
14605         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received a sendUserInstrument message. Nym: %s ...\n", strMsgNymID.Get());
14606 
14607         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14608         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_send_message);
14609         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14610 
14611         UserCmdSendUserInstrument(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
14612 
14613         return true;
14614     }
14615     else if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("deleteUserAccount"))
14616     {
14617         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received a deleteUserAccount message. Nym: %s ...\n", strMsgNymID.Get());
14618 
14619         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14620         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_del_user_acct);
14621         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14622 
14623         UserCmdDeleteUser(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
14624 
14625         return true;
14626     }
14627     else if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("deleteAssetAccount"))
14628     {
14629         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received a deleteAssetAccount message. Nym: %s ...\n", strMsgNymID.Get());
14630 
14631         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14632         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_del_asset_acct);
14633         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14634 
14635         UserCmdDeleteAssetAcct(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
14636 
14637         return true;
14638     }
14639     else if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("createAccount"))
14640     {
14641         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received a createAccount message. Nym: %s ...\n", strMsgNymID.Get());
14642 
14643         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14644         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_create_asset_acct);
14645         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14646 
14647         UserCmdCreateAccount(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
14648 
14649         return true;
14650     }
14651     else if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("issueAssetType"))
14652     {
14653         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received an issueAssetType message. Nym: %s ...\n", strMsgNymID.Get());
14654 
14655         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14656         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_issue_asset);
14657         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14658 
14659         UserCmdIssueAssetType(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
14660 
14661         return true;
14662     }
14663     else if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("issueBasket"))
14664     {
14665         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received an issueBasket message. Nym: %s ...\n", strMsgNymID.Get());
14666 
14667         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14668         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_issue_basket);
14669         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14670 
14671         UserCmdIssueBasket(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
14672 
14673         return true;
14674     }
14675     else if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("notarizeTransactions"))
14676     {
14677         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received a notarizeTransactions message.  Acct: %s Nym: %s  ...\n",
14678                        theMessage.m_strAcctID.Get(), strMsgNymID.Get());
14679 
14680         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14681         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_notarize_transaction);
14682         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14683 
14684         UserCmdNotarizeTransactions(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
14685 
14686         return true;
14687     }
14688     else if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("getNymbox"))
14689     {
14690         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received a getNymbox message. Nym: %s ...\n", strMsgNymID.Get());
14691 
14692         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14693         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_get_nymbox);
14694         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14695 
14696         UserCmdGetNymbox(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
14697 
14698         return true;
14699     }
14700     else if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("getBoxReceipt"))
14701     {
14702         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received a getBoxReceipt message. Nym: %s ...\n", strMsgNymID.Get());
14703 
14704         bool bRunIt = true;
14705         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14706         if (0 == theMessage.m_lDepth)
14707             OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_get_nymbox)
14708         else if (1 == theMessage.m_lDepth)
14709             OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_get_inbox)
14710         else if (2 == theMessage.m_lDepth)
14711             OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_get_outbox)
14712         else
14713             bRunIt = false;
14714         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14715 
14716         if (bRunIt)
14717             UserCmdGetBoxReceipt(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
14718 
14719         return true;
14720     }
14721     else if (theMessage.m_strCommand.Compare("getInbox"))
14722     {
14723         OTLog::vOutput(0, "\n==> Received a getInbox message.  Acct: %s Nym: %s  ...\n",
14724                        theMessage.m_strAcctID.Get(), strMsgNymID.Get());
14725 
14726         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14727         OT_ENFORCE_PERMISSION_MSG(__cmd_get_inbox);
14728         // ------------------------------------------------------------
14729 
14730         UserCmdGetInbox(*pNym, theMessage, msgOut);
14731 
14732         return true;
14733     }
